Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and contemporary rooms”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: The best part of the room is the recliner. It was a great added touch to a guestroom and made for a great workstation. The room was very spacious. I highly recommend going to the roof top bar for a drink as it offers a fantastic view of Chicago. There was nothing disappointing about this property.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay just got better”
Reviews.Author: mrzimmer
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I came back to Affinia Chiciago in Feb 2012, we booked our reservation on line. One thing that we asked for was another Great view of the City and a beartiful room. We got there and we were booked on the back side of the hotel... Heading up to our room our bellhop suggested if we werent happy with the room that they would make it right and they would fix it, and of -course he was right. Had a wonderful room upgrade for almost nothing and enjoyed the atmosphere of the Hotel and the City. Everyone from the Vallet parking to the bellhop was great!! Hotel was beautiful and the price was right! Will continue to return to this Hotel for the foreseeable future! Thanks Affinia Chicago!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mazzieg
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and really enjoyed the stay. Lots of space in the room, really helpful and friendly staff ( including tips on how to get to Wrigley Field from the handyman in the lift!), close to shopping on the mile, lots of places to eat nearby, enjoyed room service too. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, clean and reasonable fare”
Reviews.Author: JHD_1999
Reviews.Content: Was my 5th time in Chicago, 2th at the Affinia (last time also). What say about staff, i ask for a early check-in and i received plus a upgrade of the room that i booked. I need a late ckeck-out they gave to me 3 more hours with no charge. Location is perfect, near Hancok Tower, steps from Michigan Avenue, 10 min walking to Navy Pier, with plenty of options to eat and buy. Room was always clean early, well done. Bed is confortable. “Top notch!” how is a title in one of reviews bellow, with no luxury. Definitely i'm going return.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL I'VE STAYED IN ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: gatesy150
Reviews.Content: Having had a year or so our, travelling all over USA, I have been to 15 or so different places, and can say The Affinia is THE BEST HOTEL I HAVE STAYED IN ! Real quality, good staff, modern, clean, excellent location just off of the magnificent mile where all the shops and eating places are. The only thing The Affinia lacks is a pool, but I like sightseeing when I go away, so it didn't bother me ( can go to local swimming pool when i'm at home !). Right next door is Gino's pizza, check it out - lovely food ! Just down the road is the tourist information centre to get all the local maps and coupons etc, and right outside of there is a stop to get on one of the guided tourist buses Chicago in itself is a beautiful place to go - make a visit to the Navy Pier, and The Chicago Cubs baseball stadium, Wrigley Field, for a guided tour around the place, thats really cool.

Reviews.Title: “Happy we picked Affinity!”
Reviews.Author: flipflop12
Reviews.Content: I always check tripadvisor when booking a hotel and once again I was not disappointed. My daughter and I just returned from a two night stay. The front desk was always friendly and extremly helpful. Prior to arriving I was sent a couple of emails from the manager with any requests I may have. They were able to accomodate each one. The room was extremly clean and well appointed. Beds and linens were of high quality. Never had a problem with having to wait for the elevator as others have posted. Enjoyed the complimentary coffee in the lobby. Great location to shopping. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay overall”
Reviews.Author: Charles S
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in a suite at the Affinia and we have been thoroughly pleased both times. Very attentive staff, beautiful, large rooms with clever touches (the tv swivels so you can watch it in bed or in the living room). Restaurant was excellent as well. The bar is a nice place to have a drink on a upper floor with a nice view of Chicago. Excellent location right around the corner from the Hancock in the heart of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: susan w
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Affinia many times. The rooms are clean and the location fabulous. We were however disappointed that they charge daily for internet access (what can it cost them to provide this amenity). We stayed 3 nights, and to our disappointment they did not provide complimentary lobby coffee on the weekends (they do provide weekdays). (Do weekend guests not enjoy coffee?) That should have not been a major inconvenience as theydo have a coffee machine in the room (so so coffee) , however, it was our luck that the coffee packets were not provided our last day. Housekeeping forgot to leave some. A three block walk to Dunkin Donuts solved our problem. Oh well, the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with Affinia Chicago”
Reviews.Author: amlc01
Reviews.Content: Thanks Affinia Chicago for a fabulous weekend! We stayed at the Affinia for 3 nights for a "girls' getaway" with my mom, daughter and friends. The hotel staff is absolutely wonderful and were quick to accomodate our every request. The hotel is very convenient to shopping on Michigan Ave, great restaurants and tourist sites such as the John Hancock Observatory. We even walked to Navy Pier. We ate at the C-House twice for breakfast and were very pleased. Service was great and so was the food. The front desk staff and bellmen are very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be staying there again. Oh...and thanks for the Gino's "golden" ticket!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZED AGAIN !!!”
Reviews.Author: Genny8675309
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Affinia Chicago, and just like last time, FRIENDLY STAFF, BEAUTIFUL ROOM, EXCELLENT PRICE AND THE RESTAURANT IS THE SAME ! I can go on and on about the hotel luxurious guest rooms, but this time I'd like to address the staff again. Joelle who works at the front doors was among my favourites, he actually remembered us from when we visited in JUNE !!! He must see a thousand people a day ! He wold say things like " do you need a cab mister Rocky ?" or " Hello Miss Genny, how was your day" when we would return to the hotel. Andre at the front desk is again, a favourite of mine, he recommended the wings at Timothy O'Tooles last visit and was again as friendly this visit, he even went to the back to get us an umbrella before we went out one rainy evening ! There was another gentleman working the front door this time and I failed to get his name , but he was also SO friendly, high fiving us and getting really excited when we returned from the Bulls game. It is unheard of, in my opinion, for employees of a hotel to be SO personable !! Annie was also at the hotel again this time, working nights, so we got to see her both night, same sweet and friendly Annie !! I hope I'm not forgetting anyone, but incase I have, you should know that even the staff we encountered on the elevators would ask us how we were, how we were enjoying Chicago and even recommend places we should go ! OH !! A waitress in the C House Restaurant at the hotel was the same, she went out of her way to google maps for us, write us directions , and recommend places around the city ! We will ABSOLUTELY be staying at the AFFINIA every time we return to Chicago !!! Thanks again for a wonderful, memorable visit !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price less than a block from Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: BMW_KY
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Affinia Chicago, with the last being four years ago. The hotel has undergone a nice renovation since my last stay. I stayed in the Queen Studio Suite which is much larger than you are likely to find for a similar price this close to Michigan Avenue. Bed was very comfortable and pillow menu is a nice touch. A couple of things that were slightly disappointing: 1) water pressure was poor due to the fact you had to turn almost all the way to hot to get a warm shower 2) the exercise room, while nice, only had one fully functional treadmill (among the three in the room). The comfort, location and amenities were well worth the price paid (Travelzoo special). Overall I would recommend the property with the caveat that you can book for less than $200/night. Tip: If you need parking and won't be taking your vehicle in and out during your stay I would avoid the $52/night valet and park in public garage nearby. I found one for $28 for 24 hours only three blocks away and saved almost $50 for my two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Affinia”
Reviews.Author: camperchic
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for the birth of my grand-daughter & needed a place very close to Prentice Hospital. I got an excellent rate because my daughter was at the hospital next door. This was only a 2 minute walk. It was a 5 minute walk to the Michigan Ave. stores. The Affinia was next door to a very good pizza place. I had a snack at the hotel bar & it was very good. I felt very safe in this area even though I was alone. I would come back here again. I highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmycomms
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay. From the moment we arrived and were upgraded to a studio suite I was impressed - by the service, location, and facilities. Probably the best-value hotel we have ever stayed at, given how nice and central it is to many downtown sights. Highly recommended. The one minor drawback was the long wait for the elevators. This large building is served by just two cars.

Reviews.Title: “Love everything about it.”
Reviews.Author: Fionna A
Reviews.Content: Prime location, great hotel, spacious clean and modern room, very nice spacious bathroom and great proffesional service. I will come back again for sure and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Str33t4134
Reviews.Content: First time staying at an Affinia. Had little things that made it unique to most hotels. Not the best place i have stayed but was good for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “great rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: Oplacesyoullgo
Reviews.Content: Our room was tiny and seemed to filter absolutely no noise from the halls, other rooms or outdoors. The location is terrific and having Gino's next door was great. That said, similar location, less stylish but cheaper and bigger rooms was the wyndam which was quiet once the door closed. Rooftop bar was excellent as was the food in the restaurant downstairs where we had lunch. We had booked dinner at the restaurant but cancelled as it seemed empty all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely nothing to complain about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: brentofwisc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything that you would expect for the price, class and location. Parking is impossible unless you use the hotel's, the rooms are very quiet even though being in the middle of the city, and the service is professional, prompt, and complete. There isn't anything awe-inspiring about this hotel, but you get what you expect.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Januarybride01
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the W, but on our last trip to Chicago we went for lunch at Gino's East and found the Affinia next door. I looked inside and it looked trendy and was in an excellent location. So for this trip, the price per night at the W was double the price of Affinia - and at Affinia we got a Junior Suite which was PERFECT for a couple with a 5 year old in tow. The staff knew my name and greeted me with a "Welcome back Mrs. XYZ" everytime we returned to the hotel. The room service breakfast was OK at best and the drinks at the C House were overpriced (we paid more there than we did at the Penninsula Bar for the same single malt scotches), but those are my only "semi" complaints. We were in room 2701 which was right next to the elevators - yes, we saw that and thought OH NO - but I have to say that there was NO noise at all from the elevators or the hallway. I will most certainly recommend this properties to friends. The location is absolutely outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Two star for the hotel, one (zero, if possible) for the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: lovebossa
Reviews.Content: This is rather an old review for our stay in June. My mother was visiting me in the U.S., and we have decided to spend a few nights in Chicago. We really like Elysian, but wanted to be low-budget this time, so I chose junior-suite at Affinia. Overall my impression is that the hotel had a potential of being a cool quality hotel, but lack of professionalism in their service made us determine not going back. I have received much better service at 2-star hotel or even at B&B. The property is relatively well-kept. Yes, this is not a 5-star hotel, so the furniture in the room is on a cheaper side (the bed is comfortable). But the service was 1 star. If I could, I prefer 0 star. The front desk staff greeted us friendly, but the lady who took care of us was just irresponsible. Yes, they could handle the reservation but nothing more than that - just like some of the reviewers have mentioned. One of the front desk staff suggested dinner cruise, and we were thrilled about the suggestion, and we asked her to make the rservation. She promised me that she would leave a voicemail. Nothing happened. I called the front desk, no note. I went to the front desk next morning, they had no idea. I came back to the hotel (just to find her) in the afternoon, and all she told me was just to go to Navy Pier. I didn't imagine that I had to ask her to give me more details. That was just unprofessional. And yes, no word of apology. The lack of professionalism did not end here. We have decided to go to C-House. The food was not superb, but it was okay. Having eaten food in other countries, we felt that Marcus' food was just overrated. What really surprised us was the unprofessional server. His job was minimum, and he did not come back to the table (even for the check) until we had to call the manager of the restaurant. We thought that the hotel should know about it, and sent an email. The response was just a quick email saying that they will let the GM know. I seriously wondered how come these people are working in the service industry. It is natural to have these mis-haps in the hotels, I think. At the same time, the way the hotel responds to mis-haps will change the customer's perception of the hotel 180 degrees. Just a card with a few pieces of candy would have made us enjoy this property. Yet, this did not happen at this hotel. Not again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Chicago weekend”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Affinia, a last moment decision, this weekend, had a delightful time. Was greeted with a smile, the room was very nice. The bed was comfortable. Had a view of the Hancock tower,nice and the back of buildings, not too nice, but that is what you get for a view with a hotel facing North and South in Chicago! The property is very nice, the C-House restaurant was wonderful, home made ice cream to die for. C View, the roof top bar, has some some nice views, a small, but nice bar. Location is wonderful, close to Michigan Ave, everything on the "mag" mile. Two drawbacks, some of the other guests, were alittle loud Saturday night, a lot of parties, and it was hot, the heat was turned up too high in the building. Besides that, a very nice place to stay in Chicago, at a good price, and with a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location for Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SASTravelGuru
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Affinia over the holidays and this boutique hotel is a hidden gem, wonderfully located right off the Magnificient Mile. I grew up in Chicago so I never stayed downtown and this was the PERFECT CHOICE because the hotel walking distance from shopping, food, etc. The room (with sitting area) was quite spacious and the view from the room was nice too. Although the bathroom was small, it was functional. No problems with noise or anything. Overall a fantastic boutique hotel! Also, I have a few MUST HAVE food recommendations: 1) enjoy breakfast at YOLK, a diner about 5 minute cab ride from Affinia. We really enjoyed bacon stuffed waffles, as well as the banana nut french toast. Most folks say be prepared for a wait, but we were lucky and had no wait. 2) GARRETTS POPCORN! Enjoy the Chicago Mix of cheese & caramel. The line looks long, but don't be intimidated...it's worth the effort to taste fresh made popcorn...I grew up on this stuff and DELICIOUS is all I can say. There's a location about two blocks away from Affinia. 3) CHICAGO STYLE HOTDOG: Yummy! You can get one on the street or go to "Foodlife" in the Water Tower to grab a Chicago Hotdog. 4) GIORDANO'S: Deep Dish Stuffed Pizza. My personal favorite is sausage with onions & peppers. It takes about 35-40 minutes for the pizza to cook so don't be in too much of a rush when you go there. Gino's East is right next door to Affinia, but I'm a Giordano's fan, which is literally one block away from the hotel. Alright, hope you enjoy my windy city! Have fun :)

Reviews.Title: “Superb Michigan Avenue choice”
Reviews.Author: mjb358
Reviews.Content: The Affinia is a wonderfully located hotel, less than 1 block east of north Michigan Avenue. The lobby is minimalist, but this isn't a problem if you don't like hanging out in lobbies. I don't. The staff couldn't have been friendlier. Very pleasant dealings with all of them. C-House is a great in-house restaurant, and I highly recommend it when dining in the neighborhood. The ground floor lounge area is especially appealing. Our room on the 23rd floor was in great shape, and quiet. Wonderful view of the Hancock Tower. This is becoming my favorite downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fenmen
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location...a block from the Miracle Mile, the Lookingglass Theater, the Museum of Contemporary Art. A 25 minute walk, or short cab or bus ride right to the Art Institute of Chicago. I had no qualms about walking by myself to and from the theater. There were others doing the same thing. The hotel rooms (especially with 2 beds) are large, well lit, great mirror, new granite bathrooms with a huge shower. Avoid the Executive rooms - even though I had paid for one, I switched to the room I've just described because the former was shabby. The staff is cordial and helpful - the desk people couldn't be nicer or more accomodating. One odd thing is the absence, most of the time I was there, of a doorman. The desk will immediately call someone to bring your bags to the room so it was no big deal but I thought I should mention it if you care about such things. The C-Restaurant. I'd skip dinner but the breakfast and lunch are excellent and quite reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MeganAl
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean, large rooms, ideal location and always at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “A decent choice in a good location”
Reviews.Author: RunCatchKiss
Reviews.Content: For location, the Affinia Chicago can't be beat. They're only a half-block off the Magnificent Mile, so for those in for shopping, this is an ideal choice. The hotel itself is good; not spectacular, but a solid choice. The rooms are clean, modern, and a good size. The restaurant is decent, and reasonably priced. The staff were friendly, and did accommodate my early check in, which is always appreciated. My main gripe was the noise in the daytime; not likely a problem for most, but since I had an early morning flight and was trying to nap, the constant honking, whistling and sirens was a little bothersome. I'm accustomed to noise in the city, but single-paned glass and a low floor do not make for a restful nap. At night, I'm pleased to report, the street traffic dies down considerably and I heard very little.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Close to Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: dumont82
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a deal on Travel Zoo for a two night, three day getaway between Christmas and New Year's Eve to celebrate my birthday. The hotel was in a great location, the staff were friendly, parking was easy and our Junior Suite was fantastic. We felt like rockstars in on our city vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but spoiled impression in the end”
Reviews.Author: samppa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location and also seems to be affordable. The view from the hotel rooms can be magnificient provided you get a room closer to the top. Unfortunately, the service was during some occasions poor. Breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was for a fee, but that could possibly be related to the type of accommodation (with/without breakfast). The hotel staff was rude and imposing. On one occasion I was waiting for my friend downstairs in the lobby. The receptionist started to interrogate me about the purpose of my waiting and needless to say the questioning was done rather rudely. One night I was awakened by persistent knocking on the door. As it turned out, one of the hotel personnel brought back the laundry but mistakened the room! As a result, night sleep ruined. But the other night I was again forced to wake up at night because someone came to fix the safe! After I checked-out and came back home, I realized that my credit card was charged additional $6. There was no explanation for what I was charged. I never touched the minibar. Somehow I have a feeling that either a cleaner took something from the minibar or the money was simply taken very arbitrarily. It is a too small amount of money to actively fight for, but this was really the last drop that spoiled all my impression about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Claudia37209
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of location and easy access to Lakeshore Drive from the freeway. It was half a block from the 'magnificant mile', wonderful restaurants and easy walking to everything you want, especially for dropping shopping bags off, on the way to other stores. The Hotel was clean, everyone was helpful and pleasant, and early check-in was a perfect perk.

Reviews.Title: “Great November trip”
Reviews.Author: Renee A
Reviews.Content: The Affinia's location is perfect for visitors who want to experience the Magnificant Mile and downtown Chicago. It is a short walk to Michigan Avenue and Water Tower Place. The rooms are spacious and luxurious. Beds are comfortable and the sheets are terrific. The bathrooms are sizable and well-appointed. The thing I like best about the Affinia (I've now stayed there twice) is the service. The staff are extremely friendly, accommodating, and always eager to assist guest during their stay. We've stayed there as a family (2 adults, 3 children) and a couple (2 adults) and have enjoyed both experiences tremendously! Make sure you sign up for their rewards program--the perks are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place on the Mile!”
Reviews.Author: OceanBound73
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay. I came for the weekend as a girls getaway with my sisters. The hotel staff was very kind and accommodating. We had a 2-king bed junior suite - the room was very long and not really conducive to visiting, but it was very clean and comfortable. The parking was outrageous at $50 per day but that's Chicago I suppose. Would recommend this hotel - it is just 1/2 a block off of Michigan Ave and right next door to Gino's East Pizza.Great place and reasonable price for 4 people, 2 king beds, especially. That is hard to find in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a great location”
Reviews.Author: JoBlue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights on a recent visit to Chicago. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise. The staff on the front desk were most helpful during our stay - they let us have a late check-out, found us a blues club to go to and even printed out our boarding passes on the last day. Impressive and friendly service. Our room had a magnificent view from the 8th floor and we slept in the most comfortable bed ever. Minor criticisms were that the room had not been configured very sensibly so that we had a rather small bathroom. Also, the huge windows were not double-glazed. Very environmentally unsound! We had the heating on quite high to make up for this. Very wasteful of resources!They also let in the sound of sirens as ambulances sped to the nearby hospital. I did not find this a problem this but my partner had to resort to earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: m0dfather101
Reviews.Content: The staff make this hotel. Nothing is too much trouble. My only gripe is that wi-fi is charged, this is just not acceptable in a hotel of this quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff BUT too close to hospital emergency room!”
Reviews.Author: mdsonic
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful and wonderful staff but the bottom line for me was that it was impossible to sleep through the night because the noise of the ambulance sirens continued throughout the night. For THREE consecutive nights. There was simply inadequate soundproofing - even 14 floors above the street (OK - 13 floors as there is no 13th floor). I hesitate to write this review but I rely on Trip Advisor reviews when traveling, and had I been warned about the ambulance sirens, I would have chosen to stay elsewhere. If you are a sound sleeper and noise is not an issue then it is a lovely hotel and excellent value. Conveniently located. Wonderful staff. But quiet is a key priority for me so I would not stay here again. :(

Reviews.Title: “Decadent but very good location”
Reviews.Author: Desde_Babia
Reviews.Content: I was so thrill to experience the Affinia style, a group of boutique hotels in USA, that my first experience at the hotel in Chicago was disappointing. The room was not perfectly clean, and furniture had many little damages and spots. The impression was more of a motel outside a city than a boutique-hotel in a fashionable area of Chicago. Front desk service -by the contrary- was very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kelwez
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights from the 15th September 2011. The service from check-in to check-out was outstanding. We were given room 2605 on the 26th floor, which was huge and clean. The location of the hotel is fantastic, just a minutes walk from the Mag Mile, you are also next door to a pizza place (we didn't try it) but was always very busy. My only niggle would be the noise from the street which we could hear slightly, I did hate to think how noisy this might have been on lower floors considering we were at the top. If we went back to Chicago then we would not hesitate to stay here again. We used the train from the airport to the hotel ,which was ok, but we had 3 heavy suitcases and the stop was a good 10 minutes away, we decided to get a transfer back to the airport which was much easier!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and a lot more!”
Reviews.Author: Jewelwatt
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy a relaxing stay in the city a couple of times a year and when I want to do things in the North Michigan Avenue area, I stay at the Affinia. I book a studio suite because I love the feeling of staying in an apartment verses a standard hotel room. In the studio suite you get a queen size bed, a large dresser, a huge LCD TV, a sitting area with sofa, coffee table and great reclining chair, an elevated 'office' area with huge desk, and a standard hotel refrigerator with an assortment of pricey goodies and an extra shelf to put your own cans of soda and snacks. The bathroom is a bit smallish and the power outlet was placed in such a way as to force you to stand sandwiched between the vanity and the toilet to use the hair dryer but that was really the only inconvenience. I loved having a tub! My main complaint with every Affinia I've stayed in (NYC and Chicago) is the lack of good lighting in the sitting area. There was only one table lamp and no overhead light. Another complaint, as other reviewers have mentioned; WiFi costs $9.99 for a 24-hour block. Just as a contrast, a hotel we booked during the summer (Affinia was booked solid that weekend) that you can see from the Affinia had a complimentary MAC computer in the room with free WiFi!!! I travel a great deal all over the world and have rarely stayed in a hotel, city or otherwise, that has charged me for WiFi in the recent past. So Affinia, if you're reading this; FREE WIFI would be an awesome plus for your guests! When I arrived for my three-night stay, the temperature in my room read 67 degrees even though someone had set the thermostat at 80. I turned the thermostat up and the temperature went down to 65. I called the front desk and Peter gave me a trick to try and said to give it some time and if things didn't warm up, I should give him a call back. Half an hour later, the temperature had dropped to 64. I was just reaching for the phone when Peter called me back, chiding me for waiting so long while I was slowly freezing to death in my room. He immediately sent up someone from maintenance, and soon I was basking in warmth. The fan cycles on and off if you have it on the auto setting. One reviewer said this kept him awake but if you set the fan to "On" vs. "Auto", the fan will blow continuously which keeps the room at a more even temperature too. Also, the windows do not provide a great deal of insulation and since I was at the Affinia during an Arctic blast, the only way to maintain warmth throughout the room was to keep the curtains pulled down which blocked the view but left the room really cozy. My husband and I enjoyed a drink in the C-View Lounge which at this time of year is a quiet and relaxing spot to unwind. If you are staying around the time of this review, try the Pumpkin Pie - vodka with pureed pumpkin and Frangelica whipped cream. It is amazing!!! My favorite part of staying at the Affinia is friendly doorman Joel who has a politician's knack for names! Being greeted by name makes the Affinia feel like coming home!

Reviews.Title: “i expected better”
Reviews.Author: sahmed76
Reviews.Content: so i was in town for an interview and stayed here overnight, my expectations were rather high which might be way i came away unsatisfied. I used to live 2 blocks over and often dropped by their rooftop bar with friends for happy hour or before dinner. the location is obviously stellar -- steps away from michigan avenue. the hotel overall is very sleek, modern and beautiful. imagine my surprise when the room i got was dark, small and not at all updated. It was clean, big tv, and the windows aren't insulated well so you hear everything on the street. (again i lived close so i know how it should sound and this was really loud!) but the worst were the elevators. i waited 15 minutes (thought seriously of negotiating 24 flights of stairs in my high heels with my carry on luggage)....i understand there was a conference in town but still, it was ridiculous how slow the elevator was at 8 am. the reason to stay here is location, location, location. the rooms are an afterthought.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start to a good stay”
Reviews.Author: CE-CMtrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. I booked a room with 2 king beds via their website about 5 months before our stay. On arrival I was told they didn't have the room I booked available?! I asked how that was possible considering I booked months ago. I was then questioned how I made the booking, travel agent etc? I had the confirmation email from the hotel. The girl behind the desk didn't seem to care that the room we had booked was not available. She offered us another room for one night then we could move to the room we had booked. I wasn't impressed with this service and more importantly wasn't impressed with her 'oh well' attitude. I asked what compensation she could offer and also that we were not paying for a room we weren't getting. She offered us free breakfast which equated to $30. Big deal. When we eventually got the room we booked we were very happy. HUGE room and HUGE bathroom. Beds were very comfy and warm. It is noisy as it's close to the hospitals so lots of sirens. Location is excellent. Heater was noisy but we found we didn't need it on during the night, the bed's were warm enough.

Reviews.Title: “Dec 2011.”
Reviews.Author: Macdjm
Reviews.Content: Here on business this week Room is comfortable although noisy. Between the street noise and the room air system clicking on every hour or so sleep is difficult. Brought my iPad and was disappointed at the daily 995 charge. Had some difficulty logging on which made working online in my room a chore. I've stayed in equal quality hotels with free wifi. Also missed having a bath. But all in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganized Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: JEL-CT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Affinia for two nights on business. I was shocked at how poorly the front desk handled my check-in and reservation. First couldn't find my reservation. Then refused to give me the negotiated group rate I was entitled to. WiFi code they gave me did not work. Took 24 hours for the mess to be straightened out and even then, no apology. Room was adequate, but overall experience was not. Also, as noted by others, elevator service was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and spacious comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: sdcdd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a spacious comfortable suite which we got for an excellent rate online. Just off the magnificent mile, this hotel is in easy walking distance from all key tourist locations aswell as public transport. One big drawback for us was internet access. The system in the room didn't work and rates in the business centre were prohibitively high. This made researching and booking tourist activities, not to mention making contact with people, complicated and expensive. Visiting during the hottest time in the summer, we were very grateful to night staff who helped us out with our research one night as we researched air-conditioned outlet malls for the following day.

Reviews.Title: “first time,great time.”
Reviews.Author: wilkiePortsmouth
Reviews.Content: first time in Chicago, booked the hotel through price-line, got the train from airport,no probs, got a little lost on exit and walk to hotel in the rain, check in,great, got free upgrade to suite, a really nice touch, suite was great, probs with time diff though, so up and out early, one disappointment tho, on calling for cab, to take us to a station with lifts , on way back to the airport, he tried to rip us off by saying the trains was delayed, so he wanted to take us, then he took us to a station with stairs and no lifts, by the way he was not American, but not the hotels fault. great hotel, in great location, with good staff.

Reviews.Title: “stylish rooms, super location”
Reviews.Author: BJaneH
Reviews.Content: One block off Michigan Ave, handy to the LookingGlass Theater, Museum of Contemporary Art and shopping. The staff couldn't be more helpful, with good directions and suggestions. The rooms are modern and sleek but with amenities like coffee makers, and there are deals under $150 a night. The attached restaurant, CHouse, is a gem, serving upscale food in a gorgeous room

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ross7979
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, right of magnificent mile, can walk to most places, near good shopping. Hotel is clean and tidy. Rooms are good size, really best value for money, breakfast is good, top floor bar is good. Next to a great pizza place too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jtileston
Reviews.Content: I just spent four nights at the Affinia - I'd stayed here about four years ago when they were being renovated and liked the location and modern boutique feel of the the hotel. This time around I realized they must have upgraded me last time due to the renovations, because I had a lovely suite with living room, and this time the room was quite small, though pleasant. The bed was very comfortable and came with a pillow menu, though it must have been a "California" since my husbands feet hung off the end - warning to tall travelers. And the height of enlightenment? I ordered a YOGA MAT delivered to my room so I could practice! I was here for art events, so appreciated the proximity to the MCA (around the corner!) and the relatively easy jaunts to the Art Institute or gallery districts. Not that I didn't shop a little :-) Main complaint is that they charge $9.95 a DAY for wi-fi access if you don't have a laptop that plugs in - I had travelled with my ipad instead. Drat. But really, if four bucks at Starbucks gets me free wifi, shouldn't Affinia get with the program and make this standard for all hotel guests? (Withholding one star for that!) We did have a discussion about whether the fuschia foil wall paper in the bathroom was actually self-aware avant-garde kitsch, or just tacky. (My husband, also an artist, thought they would need a few other objects or touches with the same attitude to get away with it, a la Kelly Wearstler, so voted for tacky). Also, I LOVED the C-Spot restaurant affiliated with the hotel - will review that separately - and ate breakfast there regularly as well as lunch and dinner. all of which were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not”
Reviews.Author: LA-Business-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expectations were high due to stellar Tripadvisor ratings? The hotel is in a converted apartment building, which means elevators are fewer than you'd expect in a hotel, so waiting for the elevator often took several minutes. Walked into the room and there was a substantial stain on the carpet right in front of the door to welcome me. Other than that the room was ok, with the exception of the fact that there is not really a desk or work area. There was one tiny desk with so much stuff on that I had to move things off and stack them up to make room for my laptop. Bathroom was well appointed. Bed was fresh and clean. I had a problem with the hot water. At night when brushing my teeth, I let it run for a while and still got no hot water. Finally I gave up and brushed with cold water. And in the shower, the hottest I could make it was pretty warm, but certainly not hot. The staff was efficient, but not friendly (with the exception of the doormen and bellmen who were very friendly and helpful.) Also had a terrible breakfast experience. I waited a long time to sit, even though many tables were open. Then I sat and had nobody come over for approximately 10 minutes. Finally ordered but did not get the drink I ordered for perhaps 10 more minutes. A woman then came to my table and poured coffee, and I asked her why as I had not ordered coffee. She said the manager asked her to do it. Which I think means that the manager knew I hadn't been served but instead of coming over and talking to me about it, decided that I wanted coffee and put someone else up to it? The rest if more of the same so I'll spare your time and end here. Would not stay at this property again. It was ok, but there are lots of great hotels in the Navy Pier area.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia Chicago nice hotel but not that close to Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: PAMomanddaughter
Reviews.Content: I took my brother and his wife to a night at the Affinia to celebrate his birthday. We were going to the Chicago Shakespeare theater and I looked for hotels near Navy Pier. Though it's the official hotel of NP, it's not the closest hotel. I had tried for a room at the Sheraton (booked) and thought about the W, but this was only a bit away from there, so I thought we might be able to walk there. On a less windy, warmer evening, I think it would have been ok, but we ended up taking a cab each way. So don't stay here if you want to walk to Navy Pier, at least unless it's warm enough and you want to do the walk. However, for a nice hotel right next to the water tower and Michigan Ave, it was a very good quality stay. My brother and his wife had a king size bed, get robes and slippers. I had a queen and a sitting area, but no robe and slippers. Still it was very clean, looked pretty new, very comfortable bed, good quality toiletries, in room coffee pot and in room minibar well stocked. Wifi is not free, I didn't end up using it. The hotel is essentially next door to Northwestern med school's hospital and the windows do NOT mask the noise, so being Friday night, there were many ambulances driving by. Even on the 25th floor, that was very loud (but being really tired, I slept well). My brother was on the other side, it didn't seem to bother them as much. Workout room is not so easy to find, no signs on the floor where it is, but it's pretty nice with all the equipment kept up and about 3 of each kind of equipment piece, so plenty for everyone, as well as weight machines and free weights. The bar is quite small and even though it's on the roof, not too much of a view though in the summer when their terrace is open, it's probably pretty nice and much bigger. Plenty of choices in terms of drinks as it is fully stocked and the bar staff was very nice. The restaurant attached is a Marcus Samuelsson restaurant, and we only had breakfast there but it was quite good. Wanted to try dinner, as he's definitely a well-known and respected chef, so I'd guess it is really good. Gino's East pizzeria is right next door too. Having grown up and gone to medical school in Chicago, I can tell you Gino's pizza is worth the wait! All in all, this was a pretty nice location and I'd come back. Yes the parking is expensive but you can self park around the corner for a lot less. I'd just suggest if you stay here ask for a room away from the hospital side. Otherwise, very nice place, nice staff, and good value. Overall, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Return Trip to Affinia”
Reviews.Author: TouringLawyer
Reviews.Content: Returned for second time to Affinia for a shopping and theater weekend. As noted last year, the hotel is a boutique style property with pleasant rooms decorated in modern (W-ish) style. The hotel is in a great location just off Michigan Avenue. Unlike many boutique hotels which value attitude over service, the Affinia has friendly staff--from the front desk to the roof top bar. Given the prices of hotels around the Magnificent Mile, the Affinia is a welcome and most pleasant bargain. Happily, the business center now has a boarding pass printer (addressing one of my few concerns last year).

Reviews.Title: “Boy do I miss Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Travis B
Reviews.Content: I recently flew back up north to visit with family and I stayed at Affinia this time and I must say how happy I was with my choice in hotel. The staff at Affinia was top notch. The room was even larger then they had described and being so close to the magic mile of shopping made my wife incredibly happy. I will most certainly be back to Chi town, and will most certainly be staying at Affinia again.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia rates amongst the best yet.”
Reviews.Author: Glenkeen1995
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Scotland late saturday evening, we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. We hadn't notified the Hotel. On arrived baggage was quickly taken care off and the young lady at reception quickly checked us in. we were given a room on the 4th Floor with a view straight down the street, above reception, wow, no issues there. The room was fantastic, every little thing was taken care off, a fantastic bed and the shower well prepare to be showered.. You now every one complains about the wi-fi, we commented at our departure and the girl removed the charge from our bill, fantastic, all i said was it was slow. We found CHICAGO to be the most stunning city we have visited and certainly would return again. Would we use the "AFFINIA" of course we would, and i hope you do to. Great staff, great hotel and a brilliant location. Thanks Affinia.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location, but terrible wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: facls
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in the Affinia Manhattan in mid 2009 and really liked it, so when I went to Chicago for the first time last month I booked the Affinia Chicago. The room is excellent, spacious, clean, great bed, plenty of room for luggage. The bathroom is also very good. The staff, though certainly efficient, was a bit cold, with a couple of exceptions. I found the people in Chicago to be very friendly and good humoured, so the staff's attitude stood out a bit. Location is excellent, right across the Mag Mile. Gino's East is next door and there's a nice place for breakfast called Corner Bakery nearby. There's only one issue, and a major one, that I feel Affinia has to change: its wi-fi. Before we got to Chicago, we traveled the West Coast and stayed in quite a few hotels, most of them nowhere near the quality of Affinia, and they all offered wi-fi in the rate. All of them, including the ones that were basically motels. At the Affinia Chicago, you have to pay an extra US$ 9.99 per day per device, meaning you have to pay double if you and your wife want to access the internet on each others smartphones/laptops. On top of that, the wi-fi connection is an AT&T service, so you have to input your credit card information in an website instead of the hotel including this in their bill. So it's not only expensive, but inconvenient. This is 2011, Affinia. Wi-fi is now a basic hotel service. Time to move on with the times. The hotel itself is great, and if wi-fi is not an issue with you I would definitely recommend the Affinia. As for myself, next time I'm in Chicago I'll consider the Affinia, but I'll also look for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kshelton64
Reviews.Content: We were able to get this room for half price through Expedia. I still paid as much as the Microtel we stayed at two nights previous. I was excited to be staying so close to the Magnificant Mile and all that is Chicago. My first disappointment was the parking. The hotel charges $49 a day for parking. We were able to get it directly across the street for $40. Once at the room, I was impressed with the layout. However, upon further examination I realized that there was no microwave and I had to unload the alcohol from the fridge so I could put in a couple cans of pop. There was no fan in the bathroom, water spots and cracks on the ceiling, and the bathtub tile needed re-grouted. When I bathed I found a yellow spot on my towel. The coffee maker makes coffee, but has no way to keep it warm and as I mentioned before, there's no microwave. The continental breakfast for two is $24 more AND Internet is an additional $10. The final problem I found with the room was when I found the heating/air conditioning unit the filter was completely clogged. Luckily I'm not sensitive to dust. I found this hotel completely unacceptable. My husband says that this is common in large cities. I'm sorry, but I expect MORE from an establishment on the Magnificent Mile, not less.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Larklight
Reviews.Content: Lovely suite - very spacious. There was a seating area and a bedroom. The TV swings round between the two (very clever). The bathroom makes clever use of a small space and was very dramatic (red walls - a great antidote to the usual bland white hotel bathrooms). The restaurant was good as was the roof top bar. Very central location - good base for exploring the city. Staff were very friendly and helpful. In fact, it was some of the best customer service I've ever had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: 2soujourn
Reviews.Content: Considering the rate I got for this hotel I didn't have high expectations. I was surprised at just how nice it was. The hotel is clean, the rooms are spacious and current in design. The bathrooms are well lighted and included a make up mirror. The staff was exceptional. It wasn't just one or two special staff members...it was all of them. The location is great for shopping and or walking/running. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful Chicago Trip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachvacationgirl
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago every fall break with my daughter, sister in law and neices. We absolutely love the Affinia. We had a suite which was perfect for us. The girls had their own t.v. and us adults had ours. The beds are wonderful and so comfortable. Very clean, great staff, great location(right off of Mag. Mile).

Reviews.Title: “Great first time experience in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ldr74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Chicago for the first time and found a great deal to stay at the Affinia Chicago. The room we stayed in was newly remodeled and always cleaned in the most impecable way. After a long day of traveling, the check-in clerk offered us a pass to Geno's next door and we were able to walk in past the line. (a + for sure!) We had a great view of some nearby buildings. We visited the rooftop lounge and had some delicious drinks. Since we mostly spent time touring the city, we definitely didnt spend much time in the room. The staff were courteous, friendly and very helpful when we needed assistance. The hotel is located near the Water Tower so there was great shopping nearby. Chicago is a beautiful city with lots of history-cant wait to visit again. The ONLY drawback was that parking was ridiculously expensive...thankfully, we didnt need a car for our whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not so windy city”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller000
Reviews.Content: My family and I were lucky enough to visit Chicago during the recent hot spell. Arrived at the Affinia not in the best of moods after standing in line at US Passport control for 3 hours. Mood soon improved with the friendly greeting and efficient registration. I had asked for two rooms close to each other but this was not possible for the first night.However,this was soon put right from night two onwards Two guys at reception,sorry I can't recall the names,made us feel very welcome each day. Rooms were large and beds very comfortable. Location of hotel is excellent with shops and lakeside all within easy walking distance. Superb city Chicago,and the Affinia is definitely the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Affinia from the perspective of a (very jetlagged) family”
Reviews.Author: Annika73
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (parents, girls 5 and 10) booked our stay at Affinia about 6 months before our flight overseas as we found an incredibly good offer on galahotels.com. I was very excited and sent an email to the hotel asking about family packages, car rental places, suggestions for a family vacation etc. No answer for 4 months despite forwarding my email to the same and several different addresses. I finally looked up the address of the hotel manager who replied promptly, apologising and promising tickets to Navy Pier for our family. Next I read on tripadvisor about something called e-upgrade and again sent an email inquiry. This time the reply came only a few days later, informing us that an upgrade to a studio suite was possible at 40usd/ night. Booked that as had read so many good things about the suites on tripadvisor and asked for a quiet room with a view. All this was delivered. After a nine hour long flight (and another 2 hours spent in airport immigration line) the 30-minute cab drive ( at about 40 usd) was a breeze. Our room was ready for us and it really was just as big and comfortable as everyone had said. At check-in we were also straight away given tickets to the attractions and the children's museum at Navy Pier, just as the manager had promised. In order not to wake up jetlagged and hungry, we ordered a large deep dish pizza from Gino's (very easy, we walked in past the line, ordered the pizza and picked it up 45-50 min later). This did the trick and when we woke up at 2 am we were only jetlagged, not hungry :-). It was then that we really appreciated the size of the room! That morning we wanted to try out Lou Mitchell's breakfast place I had seen someone mention here (a tip for other suffering from jetlag, it opens at 5.30 except on SUN at 7 am). With children, however, it was definitely more than a 20-minute walk, (I would say closer to 40), but definitely worth it for the experience!) On the other days we went to the corner bakery which you can almost see when you come out of the hotel. It was very very good with children and also offers great lunch and dinner. Many people suggested Walgreens for snacks and drinks, but if you are like us travelling with children you might like to check out Dominick's (very close on 255 east grand avenue) for an impressive selection and lower prices. Make sure you ask for the courtesy card at the cashier, it really saves a lot of money (that can then be used for other shopping, the Disney store is just around the corner - so is the Hershey signature store which is a must visit with kids!) The hotel staff was nice and polite, but perhaps a bit detached. The only thing about the room was that there was a noticeable layer of dust in the bathroom, which was surprising as it seemed so well kept otherwise. So, yes, not perfect but close to it. We would definitely stay there another time too. A few general tips for families, especially the ones that travel from overseas or anywhere where there is a time difference issue...we had planned quite a program for our days in Chicago, but noticed that we didn't do half of it because of jetlag. The children loved Navy Pier and the ferris Wheel was definitely worth it. The children's museum had something both our 5-year-old and our 10-year-old enjoyed (us parents enjoyed Garrett's pop corn most of all). The Bean and Millenium park were fun and we got great pictures by it. But we learned that we need to plan more time next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ClaytonO
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at Affinia. The hotel is modern and spotless, and the staff were very helpful and courteous. Our room was excellent, we even got an upgrade upon checking in. It had a great view and was very spaceous, much more than we needed. The hotel also had a rooftop bar which was nice for a few evening drinks. The location was perfect for us. Everything we needed was within walking distance: one block to the shopping of the Magnificent Mile, great pizza joints, historic buildings and only a a few minutes to the subway and lake. Overall i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: KezzinDorset
Reviews.Content: This was to be the start of our honeymoon and so I took care of which hotel was going to be the beginning of our Route 66 adventure. I booked this hotel on the strength of the TA reviews and I was not disappointed at all. We were greeted very warmly by the check in supervisor and were checked into our room with ease. The room it self was very spacious, the bed was lovely and big, comfortable and with a choice of pillows my new husband was in love!! The bathroom was not huge but the shower was wonderful, the best thing for us after a long flight. The view was incredible and we could not wait to get out and enjoy the city. We went to the John Hancock tower for the views which is within 10 minutes stroll. The whole city is accessible easily from here and it is mostly flat so it is easy to do. All staff members we saw / spoke to were very nice and seemed happy with their work. We didnâ€™t spend any time in the bar downstairs and so I cannot comment on that but if it was the same standard as the rest of the hotel you wonâ€™t be disappointed. I would highly recommend Chicago as a city and the Affinia as a great place to spend your nights while you are there.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith8171
Reviews.Content: My hubby booked this hotel for my girlfriend and I for a "girls shopping weekend" for my 40th birthday.Apparently, he booked it through Priceline, and we were reserved a room with only one bed. I found this out when I called The Affinia to confirm my reservation.I was told that a request for 2 beds would be put in, but all of the Priceline rooms with 2 double beds in them were already booked.Plus, she told me it would be an extra $25 per nite to get a room with 2 beds. When we arrived at 8am ( check in was 3pm), I was told that not only were we able to check in early, they"upgraded" my girlfriend and myself to a room with 2 beds for no additional charge! The room was fabulous! Very modern. The beds were sooo comfortable with tons of pillows( they actually were better than my own bed at home!!). The bathroom had this cool red foil wallpaper, tons of plush towels ( this was the 1st hotel where not only did I have to call for extra towels- there were actually towels we didn't use because there were so many of them!). Our thermostat wasn't working, so we called to have maintenance come up. He arrived in less than 5 min after I called the front desk. Very nice guy- asked us if we needed anything, did we need help with directions. The front desk was very friendly ( I read the reviews that said the front desk was rude but we didn't experience that at all). If you eat next door at Geno's pizza, allow for 45 min for the pizza to be made, and a long line. But, if you stop by the desk at the hotel and tell them you're going next door to Geno's to eat, they give you a card that lets you" jump to the front of the line", plus you get free breadsticks.Not a bad deal! The Affinia is in a superb location. Not even a block from the " Magnificent Mile"- nice to be able to stop back during the day to drop off shopping bags! If I was to go to Chicago again, I'd definitely stay at The Affinia.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Room Size”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: The hotel really has two things going for it, the size of its suites and its location. The location was great right off Michigan Ave and next to a Ginos Pizza. You can really walk from anywhere you need to go and Walgreens is right around the corner. The JR Suite on a high floor had a nice view and was very large. The room had really nice amenities and everything was what would be expected for a 4 star hotel. I paid around 225 a night for a JR suite which was a good deal. The bathrooms are very small for a 700 sq foot suite, I mean they are arm length width and depth. The service was extremely hit or miss. When I first checked in the bellhop was so nice, maybe he was too nice because the check in woman seemed cold and detached. The bellhops really are 5* employees, should probably fire a few counter supervisors and replace them with a bellhop. Also, the housekeeping was super friendly, just good friendly and nice people. The requests I made on myaffinia were met and was a really really nice touch. The staff even brought me shaving cream and razors which was really appreciated. The c-view lounge was awesome and the staff and feeling of the place was really fun. The front counter staff seemed to me to be overworked and friendly about 40% of the time, the rest of the time there was no smile or hello. It could be they were short staffed or something and the Marathon swamped them. I went to the counter the day before I checked out and said " I am checking out tomorrow...." the girl finished my sentence for me with " no late check outs we can hold your bag" Well that is awesome but I was wondering about getting a taxi to the airport. This experience cemented the front counter experience as well below average. I would recommend the hotel only if you got a sub 200 price or a 225 range for the junior suite. Don't get me wrong its a real nice hotel, however with as many hotels as Chicago has its just a price game.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Meg S
Reviews.Content: I was unfortunately disappointed in my stay with Affinia in Chicago. The best things about this hotel were LOCATION and Victor, the bellhop. The rooms were so/so, modern but nothing super impressive. Staff was not welcoming (besides Victor) and they did not have the things I had asked for on My Affinia. Why have the program if you're not going to follow it? I had to ask for the BYOB kit a total of 3 times before it was brought up to my room. I really don't feel I got my money's worth, and will search elsewhere for a place to stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The whole Chicago has excellent service-attitude”
Reviews.Author: Ripatti
Reviews.Content: Studied a week in Chicago with a friend a stayed in Affinia. First visit to Chicago and itÂ´was fantastic. I donÂ´t find the words to describe the friendliness of the staff in hotel. I had my "homework" not done, and a receptionist Rossio and bellboy Victor helped me a lot to finish my assignment. Wonderful persons - both of them and also every single person from staff with whom we had chance to chat with. I stayed in Single room called Studio and it was huge to the standards IÂ´ve experienced in USA. So go for it, if you need space to your ego. Maybe Affinia Dumont, NY can beat them some day.:) Location was excellent; we run every morning by the beach of Lake Michigan and Affinia was just few hundred meters from the beach, Did some shopping as well and shops we needed (clothes, shoes, Apple etc.) were just 2-5 blocks away. If you want to taste the famous Chicago deep-pan-pizza, the one and only GinoÂ´s is 15 meters from the front door! We studied at UniChicago Booth and it took 10 minutes to walk there. Amazing! Alltogether this Affinia is just great hotel with great staff. ItÂ´s worth staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia Surpassed Expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Stephen N
Reviews.Content: Steve, Andre and Peter were some of the most helpful and kindest hotel staff I have encountered. This hotel has a great location, right next to some of the best dining experiences in the city. Cabs, convention center buses... are easily accessed. The staff mentioned will gladly give you some great local references for things to do and where to eat. They will even give you an express pass to the front of the line at World Famous Gino's East....right next door! Very clean, very helpful....this was a GREAT first time Chicago visit. Hint: If need a ride to and from airport, take a taxi if you have more than one person...shuttles charge per person - but if you are solo take the Go Shuttle by baggage claim.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, clean, convenient, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: oonda
Reviews.Content: We arrived in CHI this summer during the 100 degree heat wave that wouldn't break. Within moments of arriving at the Affinia, the car hop was out to park our car (Trust me, pay the fee to have them park your car--quick and friendly service is so worth it!). I have stayed at a variety of places around CHI town over the years both as a tourist and on business, but the Affinia has become my favorite. Once in the lobby, we relaxed, after the frazzled drive in from Ann Arbor, MI. Check-in was a breeze, and within minutes, we were in our modern, clean, zen-like, suite. It felt more like coming home than to an impersonal hotel room. I have also stayed at this hotel alone, and whether you are in a standard room, or in a larger suite, the bathroom has plenty of space and is well-organized to accommodate your things. Part of the amenities are nice Philosophy products. If you've forgotten something though, they can get it for you. The bedding and pillows (choose from the pillow menu) are super comfortable, fresh and hypoallergenic, and each room has a sitting area, with comfy chairs or a sofa. What's so nice about this hotel is that it's peaceful, central, yet just a skip off the main fray of MI avenue, still accessible to everything on foot--the lake, Miracle Mile shopping, and my favorite, the Museum of Contemporary Art, just around the corner. Every Tuesday in front of the museum from late Spring to Fall is a lovely Farmer's Market, full of flowers, fresh produce, and plenty of grab-and-go cuisine. Although never a lack of things to do in this city, I recommend the jazz concerts at aforementioned museum. Schedule can be found online, or just ask the concierge. The concierge at the Affinia, is extremely helpful and the staff make you truly feel like welcomed guests, so if you need anything from directions, maps, an extra pillow or spa service, don't be afraid to ask. It's very common to see guests coming in the front door with bags and packages from afternoon-long shopping sprees along Michigan Avenue, If you need help navigating to your room with packages, the bell hop is on it. You are within blocks of some wonderful restaurants, and hoppin' Gino's East Pizza is next door, but I also recommend the C-view restaurant right at the Affinia-- wonderful fresh and beautifully presented cuisine. This under-stated boutique hotel has it all. In my experience, the Affinia name is one you can rely onI I have also stayed at Affinia Gardens in NYC, and had an excellent experience there as well. Enjoy Chicago. It's a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: carol51054
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Chicago staying at the Affinia. Had to write and say what a fantastic hotel this is. Location was perfect just off the Magnificent Mile and the quality and staff were great. One special mention is for Annie one of the receptionists, she was really helpful, and very friendly. Thank you Annie for making our stay special

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For First Timers”
Reviews.Author: plays88keys
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago with three girlfriends to celebrate a milestone birthday. None of us had ever been to Chicago before, but I have had previous experiences staying with Affinia in New York, so decided that would be a good place to start. I never had to look anywhere else, because the hotel had exactly what we needed: a suite with two king beds, ensuring that all four of us would have a good night's rest and plenty of room to spread out. The room was enormous, as was the bathroom. My only complaints were that the bathroom, while luxe and containing one of the most amazing showers I've ever seen, did not have a tub, which two of us could have used for soaking some sore muscles. We also discovered on the first morning that the suite was only set up for two guests - there were not enough towels, glasses, coffee cups, etc.., and the pillows we had chosen from the pillow menu when making reservations had not been placed in the room. A stop at the front desk took care of the shortage issues, and we had excellent service and amenities for the rest of our stay. One day it poured buckets of rain outside, so we were delighted to discover you could borrow umbrellas from the front desk. The location was perfect for newbies wanting to explore the downtown core of Chicago - we walked to many of our destinations, and when we needed a taxi, they were easy to get right in front of the hotel. We were on the 7th floor, in the front, and had absolutely no issues with noise from the street below. Affinia is my favorite chain, and I can't wait to revisit Affinia Chicago in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, friendly staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pete-Nnen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Affinia Chicago with my wife for 5 nights at the end of a road trip and couldn't have asked for a better place to end 3 weeks in the southern states. The staff...were very helpful from the moment we checked in to the when we checked out. Not just the reception staff but the door men were very friendly and recommending places to eat and things to see as well. The room...was huge! We had a 1 bed studio which had a raised office area, a sunken lounge with sofa-bed and reclining chair, etc and then a king bed, a dressing area and a nice bathroom. We did have a problem with water leaking through the ceiling from the room above and we got moved from the 16th floor to the 25th floor. The location...perfect! Just off the Magnificent Mile and next to Gino's Pizza (which you have to try). It is easy to get either the CTA (El) which is a couple of blocks away on chicago or the bus which can be picked up on the magnificent mile to most places. Overall...excellent staff, excellent room and excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: violetvale
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a weekend trip, chose the hotel based on two good stays at the Affinia Gardens NYC. The staff at the front desk on check-in--Peter and Simon--were the most friendly and helpful staff I've met so far in my travels. When they heard it was my first trip to Chicago they loaded me up with maps, advice on what to see based on my interests, and in the evenings when I returned the hotel they'd ask how my day was and what I saw. Very genuine and helpful. I booked the smallest room type, but was told on check-in that there was an issue and that I would be upgraded to a suite--exciting! The room was spotless and nicely decorated--photos of Chicago landmarks on the walls, a cool burnt orange-y wall covering in the bathroom that made the room glow peachy-pink. Affinia hotels win for highest density of electrical outlets in a room (e.g. 10 outlets in a 10 ft sq area around the bed) and most mirrors in a room--very practical. An assortment of Philosophy toiletries are provided, they are: green tea lotion (thick, nice as hand lotion), lime blossom shampoo and body soap, and blackberry musk conditioner (smells good). My room at the front of the hotel overlooked Superior and St Clair and was very quiet at night and there were controls in the room to adjust the room temperature precisely. There's a business center on the 2nd floor with 2 computers where you can print your boarding pass. No free wifi, alas. The location is great--about 3 blocks from the Chicago-Red Line station and half a block from Michigan Avenue. Gino's East pizza is right next door. Overall, I was very happy with my stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Bachlorette Party”
Reviews.Author: beachchick07
Reviews.Content: I went with my best friend and a large group of girls to the Affinia in Chicago. The rooms were spacious (we had four girls to a room). The bathrooms were well adorned and had a large enough mirror and counter area for two or three girls to get ready at once. The staff was great, the brought a mini fridge up for us to store our "essentials" in. The beds were very comfy and large enough for two. The lobby area is amazing and we even saw Coolio one day! The location is down a side street off of Michigan, so you are close to restuarants, shopping and bars. It was never hard for us to get a cab, as the doormen were extremely ready and willing to run to Michigan Ave. and get us a cab. Overall great stay and the bride to be had an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & fantastic restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Elapela
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with perfect location, great service and a really good restaurant. The skybar is also nice.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: mptynman
Reviews.Content: this hotel is centrally located to great shopping and restaurants around Michigan Ave. It was just a block from the train system to Wrigley Field. The staff was very accommodating and the facilities were first rate.

Reviews.Title: “A small slice of luxury”
Reviews.Author: TravelCHI_08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia to enjoy a night downtown. From the moment we booked our stay, we had communications with the hotel. The pillow selection really blew us away - just knowing attention to detail was being paid even before we arrived on the property. Our room was magnificent and quite comfortable. We enjoyed some late night drinks on the roof which is a to-die-for location and view. The location of the hotel overall is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt have been better”
Reviews.Author: Jambo43
Reviews.Content: Not long back from 5 days in Chicago staying at the Affinia. We had a fantastic stay in a Junior Suite room one level below the roof top bar with a stunning view. Also very glad we paid a little bit extra for the room upgrade as it give plenty of room to relax. The Hotel is ideally located for shopping and is an easy walk from the metro if coming in from the airport. It is also ideally located for Hancock tower, water place, ticket office and Lake Michigan. Millenium Park is a 10 minute walk and if going there for a concert ask the hotel for thier wine cooler and hamper pack.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and close to shopping Nirvana”
Reviews.Author: Boomer046
Reviews.Content: Blown off-itinerary by Hurricane Irene, we made an unscheduled soft landing at Affinia Chicago. A really, really pleasant hotel, just off the Magnificent Mile and with a sunny rooftop bar furnished with couches to fall into with drink in hand for a spot of people-watching after a hard day's shopping. Deeply comfortable beds and thoroughly professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarJulDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the 1st week in August. Lovely hotel, very helpful staff who gave us great service. Great location just off Michigan Ave and close to all the sights and shops. Rooms are really spacious and very well equipped. You can also get their experience kits, which include keep fit and information on tourist walks around chicago. Would recommend this hotel highly

Reviews.Title: “Ship-shape hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Jenny B
Reviews.Content: Good value for 4-star boutique hotel. Well-appointed room with skyscraper experience on 24th floor. Spacious room with chic bathroom but no hooks for handtowels or places to put toilet bags. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Negative side: no free wi-fi which would put me off staying there again. Roof top bar was closed off due to booking every evening. Careful, we saw one cockroach in bathroom. Maybe our fault because we had some food in trash can.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not-so-great room”
Reviews.Author: josudore
Reviews.Content: We had a suite on one of the top floors -- it was nice and clean, but there seemed to have been a water issue before our stay -- the ceiling was water-stained and it smelled just a bit musty. Other than that, it was a good stay -- staff very friendly and really good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DavidCarpenter
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service, comfortable rooms, right on the Miracle Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want and more”
Reviews.Author: wondermomToronto
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Affinia, the location is amazing, its very central almost in the middle of the magnificant mile shopping. Its less than a block in from the magnificant mile(micigan ave). Everything is in walking distance to where you would want to go. The rooms are large and comfortable. Coffee maker, lots of storage and large washroom. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the soap products lovely. And this room had to be designed by a woman because there must be a dozen electrical outlets everywhere you would want one. Mirrors galore, makes it incredibly easy to do your make up while someone is still in the washroom. And very quiet, hallways, you can hear sirens from the hospital across the street but not at all bothersome. We will surely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Magnificent Mile Location”
Reviews.Author: cabntqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when it was the Fitzpatrick several times, fell in love with the smallness of the place back then. The service is still great and you can't beat the location. Right next door to Gino's East!! The rooms have been given a much needed update and are modern and cheery. Everyone is very friendly, we'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to work with”
Reviews.Author: SoftwareSales
Reviews.Content: I was looking for hotel rooms for 16 people as well as meeting space and meals for three days. Their group sales manager was a true pleasure to work with - very professional, accommodating to our requests and very customer-oriented. We'll be doing business with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff”
Reviews.Author: erthquakechicken
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our "babymoon," yeah I didn't know this was a thing either...great location being right downtown about a block or two from Michigan Avenue and right next door to Gino's. Really, like the modern feel and layout of the room. Had dinner at the hotel restaurant and it was fantastic. I had swordfish for the first time and it was amazing. Had no idea fish could taste like that. Wife had the pork chops and they did not disappoint. Hats off to the Top Chef Master.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: NickpHugehs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights at the end of August 11 and were expecting it to be really nice having read the reviews and were not disappointed. It's a lovely clean modern hotel. We got a really good rate via Expedia so werenâ€™t too surprised when we were given a room on the 6th floor overlooking the delivery area of the surrounding buildings, we were woken twice by the beeping of reversing delivery lorries.The room itself was fantastic and we had a view of most of one side of the John Hancock building which more than made up for it. The outside bar on the 29th floor was a bit disappointing, pretty expensive and I had to ask the waitress to clean my table, we only had one drink so perhaps we called at a bad time? I most definitely will stay here again and would have no problem if we were in the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, roomy hotel if you can get a bargain rate”
Reviews.Author: BostonElsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia because of a 50% deal which had to be prepaid with no cancellation/refunds. The junior suite was very spacious although the furniture was a bit of a jumble. Waits for elevators. Had to pay for everything extra - high rates for Internet, $6 water, 75 USA today, spa fees ridiculous. Coffee provided in lobby until 10 only on weekdays. The location was great for sightseeing, but there aren't many restaurant options within walking distance - Gino's East next door if you like deep dish pizza (we don't) and Marcus Samuelsson's C-Chop in the hotel itself didn't seem like a very happening place - I'd find a place closer to the river next time. I do have to commend them, though, for refunding a night's lodging when we had to come in a day late due to Hurricane Irene, although the people at the desk questioned it a bit on checkout (I had called the day before we were to check in after rebooking my canceled flight hoping for an upgrade and was told we'd be refunded despite the non refundable booking). Also, it's a pet friendly hotel - nice to see dogs in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “THE FINE AFFINIA!!!”
Reviews.Author: nvr2mchtrvl4me
