Reviews.Content: My BFF and I stayed here from Aug 28th-31st in celebration of my birthday. First and foremost, it is the Gen Manager and staff that make this hotel top-notch. Some major hotel chains can learn a lot in public relationsr from this fine hotel. Our entire stay was a gratifying experience. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable. The beds were awesome, and the bath very spacious. Secondly, the location is perfect as others have stated. EMS vehicle's siren noise can be bothersome since hospital is nearby. We will definitely return. Highly recommend!! E Andrews

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: gmgirl
Reviews.Content: Great experience at the Affinia. We were able to check in early - 10:00am - our studio suite was ready and waiting. We we walked into our room we were very nicely surprised. We did not expect a suite. Since I used Name Your Own Price on Priceline, I expected a standard room. Nothing was standard. It was fun and modern. Wonderfully furnished. Great view. Comfortable bed. Super pillows. Friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: kathy c
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Chicago, we had no idea where to stay, what to see, etc. Found Affinia on Travelzoo and just took our chances. Pictures looked great and an upgrade to a junior suite for 125.00 almost sounded too good to be true. It was everything we had hoped it would be!! The location was awesome! And we were greeted with a wonderful welcome everytime we entered the door - Dexter was exceptional and always put a smile on our faces. The desk staff were just as great and sooooo accomodating. Annie was terrific!!! She was so much fun and always asked how our day was and FULL of suggestions - Loved her! She was the one we got to know the most, but they were all so nice!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: bears013
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Affina just one night it was walking distance to House Of Blues we had tickets for a concert. the hotel was a little run down the carpet was old and stained the wall paper in the bathroom was peeling the elevators were very slow the staff was not real friendly. we had a queen suite it was not worth $350.00

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ginny C
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every minute of our trip. The help at the hotel couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Annie, Dora were so pleasant and informative. The bellhops always had smiles for us!! Our suite was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. Our favorite pillow was the signature on the bed. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Gorgeous - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: spad96
Reviews.Content: First off, this is not the type of hotel I normally stay in. I usually stay in budget motels but wanted to spoil myself in Chicago and that is exactly what I got. The hotel inside is gorgeous, the room was stylish, clean and very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and clean. I got a great rate on Travelzoo, but would consider paying the premium to stay in this perfect location again. Walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, Chicago Red "L" stop, and anywhere else you want to go downtown Chicago. Parking is pricing anywhere in the city, but if you look around you can find some cheaper locations not far from this hotel. Overall I loved it and can't wait to go back to Chicago! Plus, they had a deal with Gino's East next door to by-pass the line and get a free appetizer.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, convenient and overall a nice little gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brashsassy
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, the staff outstanding and the modern decor refreshing. Yes this space is shared with residents, but that's half the fun. Seeing folks come and go walking their dogs, or stopping to chat with the doorman - it adds to the charm of this mod Chicago boutique hotel. It was a perfect location for us, within blocks of shops, restaurants and major landmarks along Michigan Ave. The rooms were spacious, the bathrooms not so much - but the suite we had was a great space. We stepped down from the entry into the living room, and the bedroom was set off to the left. Huge windows offered downtown views and sounds - which our 6 year old found facinating. We will be back for sure during warmer weather when we can explore the city more.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious suite with great view!”
Reviews.Author: uskern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Hotel for 3 days and we really loved it! The staff was nice and we got a suite on the 14th floor with a great view. The hotel is near to the lake and to downtown. We often had breakfast on the shore. The room was spacious we coffee- and teamaker-facilities, a big flatscreen-tv and a comfy bed. The only down-part on this hotel is it's proximity to several hospitals. During the day we heard a siren every ten minutes or so. But we slept well! The fitness center is small but well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: JoBugger
Reviews.Content: We had a few choices in our price range and very glad that we stayed at Affinia. Location: Location was very good for what we wanted to do/ see. Close to the Water tower place, Hancock tower and Michigan ave shops. Short walk from the red line subway and a 15-20 min walk to Navy pier. Also close to the hop on/off bus tour stop which we used. Service: Check in & out was quick and easy. Front desk staff were very polite and friendly. Room: The executive guest room was larger and nicer than we expected. It was very neat and clean. It was good to have a separate bedroom and lounge area. The room even had a small workstation. Wi-fi was included in the rate; some hotels charge $15-20 per 24 hrs. We booked the room only rate since there are so many cafes and restaurants nearby. I think it is good value for money and great hotel, location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Alfredo V
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday night and were greeted by Victor who took our car and luggage and then Rocio at the Front Desk. She was outstanding. She arranged for a room move the next day since all that was left was a room on the 8th floor and I just felt like been higher up. Judging from experience at any other hotel, the following day the staff would not have had a clue about our request to move, but they did here, and they had already blocked a couple of rooms at a higher floor for me to choose from. This was a very pleasant interaction. Due to my background in the Hospitality industry, I inspected both rooms and I was very pleased to find them extremely clean, very well appointed and with great amenities. The bed is so comfortable that it made it difficult for me to want to get up in the morning. My only complaint would be that the A/C could not be set to a low fan setting. or perhaps I did not know how to use the digital thermostat. The sofa was comfortable and the recliner was the "icing on the cake". The staff is very friendly and made us feel recognized and special. Well done! The gentleman with the beard who works at the Front Desk is an outstanding individual. Not only does he work very long hours, but he keeps the place running smoothly. He was very quick at paying attention to details, always alert and observant. He is an asset to the hotel. Last but not least, I have to commend their Concierge. I have come across a few good ones and right now he is at the top of my list. He is knowledgeable, attentive, distinctive and friendly. Superb! I will return to this hotel the next time I visit Chicago due to the great service, the convenient location (walking distance from anything!) and comfortable rooms. I will recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: smw033
Reviews.Content: It was overall a nice hotel, and a great location. Our air conditioner worked great the 1st day, and then when we got back in about 1am, we noticed the temp had went up on the thermostat, by the morning, it was HOT in the room. I called at 10am before we left for the day, but when we came back the drop off some stuff around 3, it was even HOTTER! No one had came, I called back down to the front desk and sternly asked for it to be fixed, then a guy came right up and removed a filthy filter, and tinkered around with some other things, it worked again after that. Against my better judgement, I ordered breakfast one morining from room servce, NOT GOOD and pricey, but I blame myself for that one. Also, there are no ice machines on the floors with a bucket in your room, you have to call room service if you ever need ice. When I went to check out, I saw that I had been charged for stuff from the minibar that I had never used (who does?). The women checking us out removed that right away, no problem. However, I came acroos a "service charge" for the room service breakfast equalling over 30% of the total bill. What is this? I asked. The lady told me that "a service charge of 30 to 35% is automatically charged to every room service bill" What? That can't be right! After I continued to question this charge, she called the food and beverage manager, and he kindly cleared this up for me ( I had tipped on my card, and I thought I did cash), but the point is, the lady checking us out just totally made something up to try and appease me because she was uncomfortable with me questioning the charges!!! I did not appreciate that at all. I don't know if we will stay here next time or not, there is so much to choose from in the area...

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: pgbDublin
Reviews.Content: Near Water Tower, just of Michigan Avenue. Well served by buses. Spotlessly clean rooms & bathrooms. Great A/C. Good exercise room. A bit of noise though - from rooms across the narrow corridor and on the corridor itself. The doors seem to be thin and make an awful racket when being closed. Difficult to park out front when dropping off bags. No free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Will henceforth be my hotel of choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Nikki L
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Wyndham when I'm in Chicago for work, but due to my repeated inability to control the A/C in their rooms, decided to try the Affinia. I have a new fave - at the same price! The bed was comfy and the overall room was nice and much more user-friendly than many (full-length mirror, well-lit bathroom, plenty of hangers in closet, etc). Love the roof deck for evening drinks. My only gripe was in getting a shower cap. First I asked at the front desk; he kindly said he'd have one sent right up. Didn't come. So an hour later I called guest services. They said they'd send one up. Never came. Finally, the next morning, I called again. This time it came, about 15 minutes later. Not sure what the issue was there. Otherwise the staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful. Overall, a stellar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large clean rooms, staff could use more attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: ChiroDoc
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location right off the Magnificent Mile Large, modern, clean rooms Friendly, eager to please staff Business centre allows free boarding pass printing Cons: Noise from the adjacent hospital Staff need to pay more attention to detail Thin walls, noise in the hallways No free WiFi We recently returned from a week long vacation in Chicago and stayed at the Affinia. We were pleased with the rate we obtained from Hotels.com and looked forward to our stay. The Affinia looks like it was an older/building or hotel that has been recently renovated. The lobby is spacious and modern in appearance. Although we arrived early, we able to check in early, a convenience that is much appreciated when traveling with a small child. Unfortunately, the amenities I had called ahead to request, were not ready for us. It did take several calls to the front desk for these items to be delivered. Nevertheless, the staff were very friendly and always eager to please. Our room was pleasantly large, something rather uncommon in downtown Chicago. The location is great, just off the Magnificent Mile. You're within walking distance to shops, restaurants and many downtown tourist sites. The Affinia also has a weekend shuttle that runs directly to the Navy Pier for those who are interested. We did have a few negatives during our stay. The noise from the adjacent hospital/ambulances can be quite annoying throughout the evening. My wife is a light sleeper and she had difficulty falling asleep. Additionally, the walls do not insulate noise well. We did have several nights where other guests were returning to their rooms rather late at night. Their conversation was clearly heard and did wake us up on these occasions. WiFi is also an additional charge. As most hotels in the US often offer it for free, we were a little annoyed at this inconvenience. Lastly, we did have the concierge make dinner reservations for us at a local restaurant. Unfortunately, they made they for the week after the day we wanted! We did not discover this until we arrived at the restaurant. Despite the negatives outlined above, we were quite pleased with our stay at the the Affinia. We will likely consider this hotel again for future stays in Chicago. Greater attention to detail by the staff and complimentary WiFi are the only thing keeping me from giving the Affinia a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot praise this hotel highly enough.”
Reviews.Author: Riddleguy
Reviews.Content: Arrived there after Ã  long flight from Europe, Ã  train into town and Ã  50min walk, so we were exhausted. When we opened the bedroom door we liked the room but were disappointed with the view, said so to rÃ©ception who immÃ©diately apologized and changed us to Ã  room on the 27th floor. We loved our 8 night stay there, the staff, the room, the view, the bed, everything about it was great. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average room.”
Reviews.Author: eisette
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal for sightseeing, dining,and discovering the city. Rooms (we had two rooms in different parts of the hotel)are average in size, decor is nothing to write home about, quite noisy both on the third floor AND on the sixteenth floor, from the outside bustle of the city AND from other guests inside, bed was good but our comforter was bad due to too many washes, bathroom was just OK with very shallow bathtub/shower. room was well cleaned everyday. Concierge was very helpful when he was there, front desk staff was willing to help but unable to,in his absence.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel. Won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: Tripn2691
Reviews.Content: I thought I picked a hotel in a great location. And it was relative to nearness to Michigan Ave and good restaurants. However, within minutes of checking into our room we become very aware we next to a major medical center that has ambulances arriving all day and all night. I now know every type of different siren in Chicago. Perhaps there are rooms where the noise is not so obvious, but I made the mistake of booking an upgraded room (at an upgraded cost) with extra large king beds so my teenage sons could be comfortable. Apparently, those rooms are all on the side of the hotel facing the street. Hotel offered a smaller room with smaller beds not facing the street but not until our 2nd day when we were out of the hotel the whole day. So if you don't mind ambulence noise, whistles blowing to call cabs, noisy air conditioners, and rooms without room darkening curtains, this might be a good hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perect position and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Spankita
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good position on the Magnificent Mile, the rooms are all spacious and confortable. The personnel is very professional and the hotel manager helpful to solve problems. We suggest to stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie_from_Mtl
Reviews.Content: We were travelling from Montreal, Canada for a 3 nights/4 days trip. We purshased a package deal with HauteLook with a discounted rate. When we check in, we had to argue and challenge the hotel as they had us at a much higher rate in their system. After a few minutes of back and forth, they found the document that explained it all, and all was cleared. That was the only little glitch of our stay. The cleaning crew was very nice and effective, the concierge and ladies at reception were very helpful and nice. They helped us make the most out of our stay and even recommended us a little restaurant called RJ Grunts near Lincoln Park which was very good and very friendly. Worth the little detour. Location was great, 2 seconds from Magnificient Mile (on Tiffanny's corner!!) and 5 minutes walk from John Hancock building and THE BEACH!!! They also provided a trolley that brought us directly to Navy Pier (which is a must with chlidren). Had a great time, looking forward to my next trip in beautiful Chicago. (PS: did u know the city gets the sidewalks cleaned every morning??)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and convenient to downtown activities.”
Reviews.Author: anglophile58
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago, and I definitely want to go back. The Affinia Hotel was a good choice especially since we were able to park our car and walk everywhere. It is around one block off the "magnificent mile" near shopping and restaurants. Very close to the Navy Pier if you are into that sort of entertainment. The staff is very helpful and friendly, and we were very appreciative of Andre who got us reservations for dinner the first afternoon we got there. The restaurant and bar in the hotel is good but slightly pricey. I reserved our room through the Affinia website. They were only able to guarantee a standard room at that point, but they have an "e-upgrade" where you pay a lower price for a room upgrade if it's available. We got an upgrade to a "junior suite" which was very nice and on the 19th floor....nice view. Room was clean and comfortable. There is a big hospital next door and I was a little concerned about the ambulances, but they honestly did not disturb our sleep at all. Beds are quite comfortable. There is valet parking, but we did not use it as there is a huge parking deck right across the street (where they probably park the cars). The valet parking is $49/day.......they don't even charge that much in Honolulu! My only complaint is that they did not have free internet which surprises me since they seemed to have a lot of business folks there. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and people”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler14
Reviews.Content: The Affinia Chicago is a boutique style hotel close to the shopping and restaurants on Michigan Avenue. My stay there was very nice and exceeded my expectations for an urban hotel at this price. The room was very comfortable and had great light from the large windows and well-placed lamps. The room and bathroom were exceptionally clean. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. Every single person I encountered--front desk, housekeeping, conceirge--smiled at me and seemed concerned about making my stay pleasant. I would certainly stay here again. One thing the hotel should improve: the wireless Internet connection, which was very slow. An ethernet cable is provided so you can use a wired connection, but that doesn't help iPads. Overall, though, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The PERFECT Chicago location, loved this hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Komives51410
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an extended weekend in July. What a great hotel! We cannot say enough good things about it!! We got a great deal on the room, so for the price and location we could not have found anything better:) The hotel is right off the magnificant mile and about 4 blocks to the beach. So glad we stayed here!! Thanks Affinia.... Oh!! and it's right next door to one of the famous pizza places!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect price point for a Fabulous 40th Surprise Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Brazoo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a downtown Chicago hotel close to Michigan Ave and the river area with lots of shopping and dining options to take my wife down for the weekend on a surprise 40th birthday party trip with another couple in early March 2011. As a Starwood Preferred member I was originally thinking about one of those facilities (Sheraton or the W) and was in active negotiations for a deal until Travelzooâ€™s weekly Top 20 deals hit my inbox and Affina was the feature hotel that fit our dates. This trip was used to help reveal her real gift â€“ a 20 day trip to Thailand we will take in a few months. As always, I wanted to know what I was getting myself into before I decided on this hotel over the W and turned to trusty positive Tripadvisor reviews before locking into the deal and found it was a very well run facility. Through other reviews I was able to find the GMâ€™s email (Claudia Eggspuhler) on one of her responses and reached out to her personally to ensure we were going to have the perfect weekend for this monumental occasion. The hotel sends out a 5 day confirmation letter complete with weather forecast for you stay map and the ability to enhance your stay with various in room purchase. I opted for rose petals ($25) and small cupcake dessert ($9) delivered to the room while we would be out for the celebratory 40th birthday meal as just one more nice surprise for my wife. Not only was it perfect and the concierge nailed it as the pictures shows but it also was on the house and not part of my final bill which as great of Affina. Thanks again. We ended up getting a 1 bedroom studio suite with a queen bed and it was very spacious. Our rate including tax for 2 nights was only $229 and later when I found out it also happened to be the weekend Chicago celebrates St Patâ€™s Day (Sat the 12th this yr) I thought it was an exception value. Affina will run a lot of deals it seems but you could easily pay about $700+ for a 2 night stay most weekends in the same level of accommodations. The other couple just had the basic room which was still roomy for big city standards but lacked a separate living room and desk area and our rate for that deal was only $10/night more. The hotel is right next to the famous Ginoâ€™s East deep dish pizza joint where we would have dinner the first night of our stay (separate review). Upon arrival the staff was great to great us and had recognized the occasion and wished by wife a happy birthday and made some great dinner suggestions for us during our stay. The elevators up to the room were small and slow but that was my only knock on this place. When you first enter the studio suite you will find an executive desk and then you step down into your living room and adjoining open bedroom area. Loved the swivel flat screen TV that you could watch from either the living room or bedroom area. There was a very large dorm room fridge area but no microwave in the room for use. It is a very urban chic decorative feel to it. One of the coolest options for our stay was the personal selection of pillows (6 of them) that you could try each night during your stay. My wife selected the Swedish memory foam but I tried the buckwheat and thought I wouldnâ€™t like it but it was so good that on the 2nd night she switched and got one to. The other couple picked up the sound pillow and plugged in their ipodâ€™s and raved about them as well. We were out on the town for most of our stay but we did go up to the C-view which I guess is highly rated roof top bar. It was a small lounge with a great city view. A bit stuffy for my liking more so from the clientele whom seemed to be more upscale and dressed up in evening gowns compared to our smart causal attire for a relaxing weekend. Drinks were pretty strong but expensive so we stayed for only a few and moved on to a local bar for the rest of the evening. Room Tip: I always ask for a very quiet room far away from elevators, stairs, maid closets and ice machines on a higher floor. Claudia ensured that is what we got. Overall â€“ Had a great stay, no issues with anything and a very nice level of service is this boutique feel of a hotel. Would easily consider this hotel again if I am in town and can get a special rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: livinlife0624
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! We enjoyed our long weekend at this very pleasant and well-kept hotel. The staff was friendly and very helpful answering our many questions about the city (first time visit). The suite was amazing and offered a very comfortable living area, desk, vanity and beautiful bathroom. The only negative was being awoken by the sounds of the ambulances arriving at the hospital situated only a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JerseymamaOcean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in late July, before our trip up to Kohler, Wisconsin. The Affinia is close to good shopping and sightseeing (walking distance to the John Hancock building). Buses are close by to visit downtown - Millenium Park, etc. Room was very clean and comfortable. We had a problem with our lock and they were very accommodating and professional in getting it fixed quickly. Since I had read prior reviews about the noise level, I did request a higher room. You can definitely hear traffic and sirens, but I came equipped with ear plugs. Ate in the restaurant downstairs for breakfast and it was very good. Overall, a good visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location...”
Reviews.Author: SVSAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during a business trip. Great location, right next to Michigan Ave. The rooms were spacious with nice decor, the bed was very comfortable, and the shower had good pressure. A few minor issues: - Location next to hospital, ambulance sirens can be noisy at night - No full length mirror in the room, only the one above the sink in the bathroom - There is no practical space for the luggage rack, I had to shift the desk to make room - All treadmills had sweat stains one day, but had been cleaned up by the next day Overall, its a great place and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Cubahell
Reviews.Content: We chose theis hotel as we couldn't book the Wyndham nearby. We were not disapointed and I would now stay here on my visits to Chicago n the future. It has a great location for the stores and eating out. The hotel its self is nicely styled and we were upgraded to a suite for a small addtional payment, which was well worth the extra money. Large rooms and comfatable beds even a choice of pillows. Hotels own restaurant was good for food but many choices a short walk away or cab ride. We loved the location and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: buntward
Reviews.Content: nice hotel but right beside a very busy hospital and ambulance drivers dont feel the need to turn off sirens even when there's no traffic at night. Rooms are very nice and very spacious. Staff are lovely and very helpful. Should include earplugs with the toiletries, save you having to buy them yourself. It wouldn't stop me from staying in hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “super location and generous bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: ecantwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia for a long week end. The location is wonderful, just off the magnificent mile. Our room size was extremely generous. The hotel was very clean and well kept. the decor was contemporary and tasteful. The staff were helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, good location and vibe”
Reviews.Author: Krazykow
Reviews.Content: Had stayed in 3 different rooms over 3 different nights. Great location and minutes from the lake (for those who enjoy a nice run) and corner bakery (for those who like their morning latte). Clean and comfy rooms with philosophy brand amenities. Awesome beds. Wish there could be free wifi but price was reasonable as is. Service was OK, but not great. A recommend for visitors and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, modern and great location”
Reviews.Author: rancheroAlbany_Ny
Reviews.Content: I met my sister here for a weekend get away and was impressed with the modern, elegant and spacious rooms, the friendly staff and convenient location. Be sure to request the complimentary "Walking Tour" experience kit chocked filled with the best maps, guidebooks and flash card walking tours of Chicago. The kit even includes an ipod with pre-loaded walking tour. Since the hotel is close to Millenium Park and Lake Shore Drive there are lots of great walks. We walked along Lake Shore Drive, through the Gold Coast and Old Town to the Lincoln Park Neighborhood filled with great boutiques, cafes and other shops. I highly recommend the Affinia. Their "pillow menu" allows you to request a special pillow of your choice. Nice touch! Also the C-View restuarant is excellent. While it hasn't made any of the restaurant picks in Chicago, we had dinner their one night and it was one of the best meals we had in Chicago. I liked it better than the Spiaggia Cafe. Prices are better as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: frodosmom208
Reviews.Content: Great service, fabulous location, friendly bellmen and valet. Clean, comfortable room. Was warned it is very near hospital but on 29th floor there was no problem. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Price - Awesome City”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddylev
Reviews.Content: went out to Chicago with 2 of my buddies for St Patty's day. Stayed at Affinia Chicago. Hotel is fantastic. Had previously stayed at The Allerton Hotel, which turns out is around the corner. Also a fantastic hotel. Location, Location, Location, WITH LUXURY. Our room was very trendy, beds were comfortable, large. You are steps to Mag Mile, a quick cab ride to Rush/Division for the nightlife, walking distance to all the good steakhouses, a quick cab ride to Wrigleyville which is awesome. Lincoln Park is about a $15.00 cab ride. Everything is in reach at this centrally located hotel. I did not eat at the restaurant but it looked very good. Highly recommend this hotel. I was the first of my group to arrive, and I was allowed to check in at 8am! Thats just too good to be true!

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: pembydarabbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Chicago for 4 nights starting on the 8th of July. Unfortunately we were quite disappointed with the hotel. The rooms are small, dull, and the hotel staff aren't especially helpful. We had a roll-away bed in our room which was a suite (we had originally booked a room with two double beds and we had planned to place a roll-away bed there but when we go to the front desk they said that there was a fire hazard and this was illegal so we had to upgrade to a suite), and it was quite cramped and the air conditioning was very noisy. We didn't get the chance to eat in the hotel restaurant, but from what we saw the food did look nice but overpriced. Although this has nothing to do with the hotel, one word of warning: Get dinner at around 5pm, because the custom in Chicago is to queue up outside a restaurant for around 45 mins until a table becomes available. We found this custom highly irritating, and on our first night we ended up not eating until around 11pm- this didn't go down well! Another option is to make a reservation for a table. Some of the restaurants we ate in included Gino's East Pizzeria (nice enough food, after 5pm the lines outside start to build up however so get there early), and a restaurant just up the road that served Mexican food ( we booked a table the night before). If you are looking for places to eat breakfast, definitely go to Lou Mitchell's, they are really friendly and the food is brilliant. It's about a 20 minute walk away though. Einstein Bagels also do a very reasonably priced breakfast- a bagel and a coffee is around 4 dollars. Overall, we were quite disappointed with the Affinia, we expected better quality of service and nicer rooms. The rooms are well equipped however- hairdryer, iron, ironing board etc. Oh, and one other piece of advice: use public transport as much as possible in Chicago! Although, using the train coming to and from the airport was really awkward with massive suitcases, so to be honest you're better off coughing up the 50 or sixty dollars for a taxi if you want a pleasant journey.

Reviews.Title: “Back in a flash.....”
Reviews.Author: Siriusone
Reviews.Content: Stopped for one night on the way to the midwest. We loved the Affinia Chicago. Located just off Magnificient mile within walking distance to shopping, Navy Pier and many sights. The room was extremely roomy, clean, comfortable and very quiet as our room faced out to the street. Loved the orange foil bathroom walls. The staff were very accomodating and helpful especially Pedro in the lobby (thanks for the umbrella on a rainy day) and Dora at the front desk (for arranging our Segway tour). We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hblanke
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat: one block off Michigan Avenue and two blocks from a plethora of places to eat and shop. There is a parking ramp directly across the street. Our room was large and comfortable; there is no bathtub, but the shower is large. There is a coffee maker in the room, but you have to get ice from room service. I was worried about noise, but our room had a radio with a "white noise" setting. I would definitly choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Eclass215
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Taste of Chicago festivites during 4th of July weekend. It was a great location for shopping and eating. We walked the whole magnificent mile and back! There's a pizza restaurant right next door and the staff at the hotel is very friendly. I couldn't check in early, but that was fine since I knew I would get there much earlier than the stated check-in time. The room was comfy, clean, and stylish. I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: pleasnttrvls
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Affinia with my two boys (12, 9) this summer -- but they are very well-versed in the ways of the city as we visit my family in Chicago once or twice a year. If you are looking for true "kid-friendly" -- kitchenette, kid-specific amenities, places to roam and play, then this is not Disney by any stretch. If you are looking for a contemporary, sophisticated boutique downtown experience with a luxurious amount of room for a Michigan Avenue location, then this is the place! We arrived about midnight and were checked in and brought up by the loveliest gentleman, who also fixed our pullout bed since most of the staff had gone home. We were,of course, starving, and he showed us a great website grub.com that shows all the places open at that hour. When he found out we were ready for big juicy burgers he recommended Ranalli's -- their food was delivered piping hot to our door within 35 minutes! He was a real life-saver. (?Andre was his name.) No criticism for daytime staff, nor accolades. I would not want to take away business from the valets, but there are garages within a two block radius that are 15.00 less per day, but no "in and out." Sleek hip design, Ipod/MP3 docking stations,ate at C-House when it opened years ago (great oysters then) but did not go this time. Great base for EVERYTHING that is fun about Chicago - walk, bike, drive, taxi to anything from this spot. One suggestion to hotel -- PLEASE update the exercise dvd in your fitness package -- Billy Blanks Tae Bo? Come on! (Luckily I do like his workout...)And don't bother with bottled water - Chicago water is the most delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great locations, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Atlrich
Reviews.Content: Affinia Chicago is a welcomed change from the shoebox-sized rooms at most of the downtown hotels. Location is perfect and the staff is very friendly and helpful and make this property feel like a small boutique property. The hotel restaurant is first class property overseen by a celebrity chef and Gino's East is right next door if you prefer a pizza! The only downside is slow elevator service during peak hours with only 2 elevators going to the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and friendly/amazing location”
Reviews.Author: travelmom113
Reviews.Content: The Affinia is a great, reasonably priced choice on the Magnificent Mile. Our room was perfectly clean and the layout made the most of the space--it was not large but did not feel cramped. Most important, the bed was extremely comfortable. The front desk staff was very friendly and welcomed us by name each time we re-entered the hotel. Based on other reviews, we requested a south-facing room on a high floor and were not bothered by noise from ambulances coming into the nearby hospital. We booked the hotel and flight as a package on Priceline and ended up paying just over $100/night, which is a STEAL for this location. Chicago is a beautiful city with lots to do. We'll never forget the cupcakes we had at Twisted Bakery in Old Town and especially at Molly's in Lincoln Park! Seriously, these are worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: taccoleo
Reviews.Content: We found an excellent deal for the Affinia, so after reading all of the positive reviews, we decided to book our stay here. We are so glad we did! It was a nice little boutique hotel just a block off the Magnificent Mile. We were greeted immediately upon our taxi's arrival and at check-in. The room was nice, clean and spacious. I don't know much about Chicago, but we thought it was the perfect location to get anywhere very quickly. We could shop on the Magnificent Mile in one minute or walk just a few minutes and be at the water. Cabs to get just about anywhere were just a few dollars. Highly recommend this hotel, especially if you can find it at a great rate!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, good location - but extras are expensive!”
Reviews.Author: MortenNygard
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for two nights beginning of July, and arrived by car. The hotel was easy to find (with GPS), but there is practicall no parking in front. We had to hurry getting our stuff out of the car, and have the valet take care of it. Valet parking is $49 a night, and that is quite expensive I would say. Efficient, though, as the car was ready when we needed it - only had to give 5-10 minutes notice. We didn't use any of the hotel's facilities, we only enjoyed the comfort and cleanliness of the rooms and the good location. Easy walk downtown and towards the Navy Pier. Conveniently located in the Magnificient Mile area. Extras like breakfast, wi-fi, parking, etc., are expensive. We got a good deal for the room rate, however, so the total cost was not all that bad.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthElvis
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in we were treated with kindness as it was my birthday we were given an upgrade for no cost. The staff were all friendly and helpfull the room was exellent location was very conveinient and nothing was too much trouble. This is a really nice hotel with plenty of shops, eateries close by and efficient and courteous staff. Ask steve for anything and it is done. Thanks for the good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: IslandofCalfia
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel with excellent service and stellar location. I took a trip with my family to Chicago this summer. We stayed in the junior suite, which is perfect for 3 people without spending an ungodly amount of money. There was plenty of space for all of us and our belongings. The hotel is two blocks from the lake and one block from the activity of Michigan Ave. Great restaurants nearby and walking distance to just about everything but the Sears Tower. The only downside is that you are a few blocks from Northwestern University Hospital so you will be hearing ambulances often â€“ so bring earplugs. We, however, live in LA near UCLA hospital so this was nothing new. Service, location, and price otherwise made up for this minor drawback.

Reviews.Title: “The Great, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: cmupensfanAZ
Reviews.Content: The Great - The Bad and the Ugly - The Great - The location is great! We go to Chicago every summer for a little romantic vacation and this hotel has the best location we have ever stayed at! We had a jr suite which was very nice the room had a great view and it was nice to be able to move around and not be cramped in a small room. The housecleaning staff were amazing, every day the room was cleaned as if it was our first day and they were always super nice and helpful when asked questions or they would great us ever morning with a smile and hello. They did move us up from the 8th floor to a much higher up room for a better view with no questions or trouble. That is where the good ends. The Bad - The hotel is across the street from a major hospital so the sirens are pretty loud and if you are a light sleeper I suggest that you bring ear plugs or a small sound machine. If you aren't use to city noises I would suggest that you request as high a room as you can get. The room comes with a stocked mini fridge that was never cool and in our first warm was actually blowing out hot air. Staff beyond the housekeepers and the room service delivery people could have cared less if we were there or not. The Ugly - We noticed on day one that if you did not look like you had money or that you didn't have your car valet parked you would be ignored by just about everyone. I asked other guests if they were treated the same way and yes they were, so it wasn't just us. No one ever offered to get us a cab in our 5 days we were there. One morning I went out and it was pouring down rain and not even then did they offer to get me a cab, but another person came out dressed a little nicer and the bellmen were falling all over themselves to get that person a cab. Then it got really ugly on our last day. I wore a University of Notre Dame t-shirt and one of the bellmen asked me about my shirt, and once they found out that my fiancÃ© is currently attending the University of Notre Dame to obtain her PhD, the bellmen started falling all over themselves to serve us MUCH better. It was amazing! They couldn't do enough to serve the couple they had been ignoring for the first 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbarie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Union Station before check in time, we called to see if we could keep our luggage there, and they said yes. After we got to the place since we booked it with Priceline.com we only got a one bed. I asked if a double bed was avilable and it was. I assumed the view would be little and it was a perfect view. This is a 4 star hotel!!!!! One bad part was the eattery down stairs....

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: RoubaixRider
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Affinia was the perfect choice for my first visit to Chicago. Traveling solo, this was a great location just off Mag.Mile, an easy walk to Water Tower, Hancock Bldg., Lakeshore, Navy Pier, restaurants, bus lines to everywhere. The staff is very helpful and friendly (they kept asking if I was enjoying my birthday trip!). My room was well-appointed (but I wish I had a tub), looked out over E Superior, and was a bit susceptible to city noise (not a big problem), great rooftop bar. Comfy bed (you choose the type of pillow!). What was really sweet was the availability of a walking kit consisting of an Apple iPod downloaded with tours, map, walking guides! They really cater to the needs of the guest. The great price from Hotwire coupled with TripAdvisor reviews highly influenced my decision to stay here and I was not disappointed

Reviews.Title: “A perfect pick for us!”
Reviews.Author: dusty100
Reviews.Content: We met up with another family at a halfway point in our summer journey and both of us chose to stay at the Affinia in Chicago. I had heard great things about this boutique hotel and neither of our families were disappointed. Rates were better than the big chains I checked out. Location was prime-less than a block from the best part of Michigan Ave. The valet /bellman was very accommodating and opened a big umbrella as we got out of car in the rain. Lobby small but trendy. Although quite busy with visitors, the check in staff under the expert guidance of a professional looking young manager named Steve, was friendly, professional, and extremely helpful in answering questions about our hotel needs, restaurants and places to see during our short stay. We had a choice of pillows for our bed. When we opened the door to our room, it was a Wow factor.There was the sound of waterfall and birds playing in our room. The king bed was incredible, a great modern headboard and a mattress that was amazing. There was a flat screen TV which swiveled from the bed area over to the sofa in the sitting area. It provided a lot of stations along with movies, kids programming, gaming, and digital radio. The room was modern and comfy. Liked that there was a dressing table area outside of bathroom. Everything was sparkling clean which I really liked. When I made a call to housekeeping to open/prepare the extra sofabed, they came in less than 10 minutes. We did not order a room service meal so can't comment on that, but we had breakfast in hotel next morning-typical fare with attentive service. Easy check out, again with very friendly staff. I definitely put this hotel on my recommend list.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: GreeceStars
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Affinia. The hotel was right in the heart of the Magnificent Mile, about a third of a mile from the subway. The room was beautiful, quiet, spacious, and clean, and they provided some extra services not normally provided (yoga mats and DVD). The room could have been lit a little better, but overall I'd give it a 4.5 out of 5 - pretty great. We also found a great price for it, well under the $200 a night you'd expect. Next time I might stay inside the loop just to see something different, but the Mag mile was a great spot as far as lots of restaurant choices and big stores.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Itchy_English_Feet
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Affinia and would definitely recommend it. The location is fantastic â€“ we walked everywhere from the Magnificent Mile and John Hancock Centre to Navy Pier and Millennium Park. There are also lots of buses nearby, which we used to go to Lincoln Park, the Shedd Aquarium and other places. The room we were given was on the 24th floor, so we didnâ€™t really notice much noise. It wasnâ€™t anything special, and the decor could probably have done with some updating, but it had a big, comfortable bed, flat screen tv, nice bathroom, tea/coffee making facilities and wireless internet, so everything we needed. The hotel staff were extremely friendly. Always on hand to point us in the direction of restaurants, shops etc. They also helped us print our boarding passes for our flight when the printers in the business centre didnâ€™t work. We went to the rooftop bar one night and had a glass of bubbly. Sure, itâ€™s a bit expensive, but it was worth it to sit outside at sunset sipping a glass of champagne while admiring the Chicago skyline. If we go back to Chicago, weâ€™ll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and even better location”
Reviews.Author: Iwannabetraveling23
Reviews.Content: Just spent five days at the Affinia and had a great time. Located right next to Gino's East and steps from the Magnificent Mile, the Affinia will be on my list next time when I visit my favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtb5927
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel in the heart of Chicago. It is directly adjacent to Gino's East Pizzeria (more on this later), and only a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile and Lake Michigan. Upon arrival our room had not been cleaned from the previous guest, so the lady at the front desk had housekeeping put a "rush" on the room and offered to store our bags (for free) so we could go explore the city. She then proceeded to ask us what our plans were. Being famished from a long day of travel, we told her we were headed out for a famous deep dish pizza from Gino's next door. She (I don't remember her name) then handed us a coupon to use at Gino and said, "Use this to skip the line." This came in very handy, because the line was an hour long! We skipped the line, were seated immediately and enjoyed a delicious pizza and free bread sticks (via the coupon) and a few beers. Before we were even finished eating, the front desk called us to say that our room was ready. So we finished eating, grabbed our bags, and went up to the room. The room was amazing and huge (2 king beds). Even with 2 king beds there was a sitting area and a desk. The bathroom was gorgeous. The floors, shower and sink were all marble and very clean. That night we enjoyed a wonderful night's sleep in very comfortable beds. The next morning we used the in room coffee maker, but did not have enough mugs or coffee for everyone in the room. We called the front desk and within 5 minutes more mugs and coffee packets were brought up. Now that's service! We headed out for the day and passed the maid in hallway who greeted us with a friendly nod. When we returned for the night we found our room as neat and tidy as it had been the day before. All in all this hotel is great. We didn't stay long, but we enjoyed our stay greatly. The Affinia has awesome roof top bar and and restaurant off the lobby. While both are a little pricey, it is Chicago and their prices are not extraordinary. A few things we didn't like: Loud sirens in the middle of the night: You'll find this in any city and this is not fault of the hotel. This more for light sleepers more than anyone. Mini-bar refrigerator was not cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: pdxcrash
Reviews.Content: After looking at over 20 downtown Chicago hotels, we were pleasantly surprised to find the Affinia. If you're willing to pre-pay your room in advance, you can find great deals. We got the Jr. Suite and were very happy with the room. It's big, clean and comfortable. The view from the 26th floor is not too bad either. I have but one complaint that I feel patrons should be aware of. Through no fault of the Affinia's, they are but a block or so away from a very busy hospital. What this means is, you are serenaded by the sirens of ambulances day and night.. The night part was a bit more annoying. Would I stay here again in spite of this? Absolutely. The room, staff, roof-top lounge and everything in between is worth coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “Everything that a hotel should be.”
Reviews.Author: bluearmyMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets everything right. The staff are friendly and dealt with every request quickly with detailed information. The rooms were fantastic with comfortable beds and excellent bathrooms. The location is great for shopping, a short walk to Navy Pier and close to the subway on the redline. I would recommend this hotel to any one going to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “We Couldn't Be Happier With Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: teacher91
Reviews.Content: The Mr. & I stayed in the Affinia from June 24th - July 1st. We couldn't have been happier with our stay. Annie greeted us warmly on our arrival and cheerfully stored our bags when we weren't able to check in right away. This set the tone for what was to be a wonderful stay. We were thrilled with our corner room on the 21st floor (room 2103)! We appreciated the 'split level' arrangement of the room. The closet, bathroom, and bar area were on the top level with the bed and dresser on the lower level. The bed was extremely comfortable and as I'm a night time reader I loved the reading lamps that were attached to the headboard on both sides. The hotel is well located for sight seeing, shopping and eating, but if walking isn't your thing, the Affinia was just minutes from a Red Line or a bus stop. If you plan to eat at Gino's East, don't forget to ask the front desk for 'priority passes' which allows you to skip the more than likely long line waiting for a table. In addition to Annie, I must brag on all the staff particularly Peter who was helpful when we wanted to book a Chicago Architecture Tour and the super friendly front door staff. We always got a nice greeting whenever we left or came back. If we make it back to Chicago, we will definitely book the Affinia again. It was a delightful home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Best 4 star value”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyTwp
Reviews.Content: Location the Best (one block off Michigan Ave. & Chicago Ave.) Outstanding Front Desk Annie & Dona and anyone who worked the reception and concierge desk as well as the bellhops were always ready to help. The hotel was ready with our room when we arrived, the room was clean and quiet. Don't forget the C-View rooftop bar one of the best in the city. Read my review of the C-House restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in an awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: tribbie1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Chicago for a special girls only trip to Chicago (with my mom, me and my daughter). What a fantastic hotel! The location is GREAT - just off of Michigan Avenue - and within walking distance to many attractions (the American Girl Store, Hancock Tower, Watertower, etc.) The staff was so helpful - giving tips on what to do (despite not ideal weather) and ideas on how to best get around town. In addition, the hotel has a free shuttle to/from Navy Pier. Our stay there far exceeded my expectations. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat! We had a junior suite - and it had more room than I've ever had at a hotel. I give Affinia Chicago a big two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Good, well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: john_ivycottage
Reviews.Content: The room was very well-appointed. The bed was comfortable with good feather and down pillows. There was an excellent walk-in shower. The hotel is well-located for central Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Already recommended to family and friends!”
Reviews.Author: blelac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! We were able to stay on the 16th floor with great city views. The room was very chic and definitely worth the price. The cleaning staff was superb and extremely efficient and friendly when meeting them in the hallways. All staff was helpful and the C-View Rooftop bar was a nice addition. We didn't have a car so parking was not an issue but at $50 for 24 hours did seem expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan!”
Reviews.Author: Jawz008
Reviews.Content: We brought our two kids (10yrs) to Chicago to see the big city as part of a 4 stop family vacation just a couple days ago. The good: The door men were great. Very nice and always remembered our names, it was a nice touch. The room was killer especially the view from the 28th floor. The location is perfect, Affinia is 1 block from Magnificent mile and 5 blocks from Navy Pier. The Bad: The check in was ok but not friendly. Everyone has a bad day...i get it! After pounding the pavement and visiting the museums etc etc. We came back tired and ready to call it a night just to find out the 29th floor is a night club. We didn't believe it would be bad thinking that the hotel would be insulated well enough to put a club on the top floor. Not a chance!! The music shook our room like a 16 yr old in a car with a new sound system. I called down at 10pm to see what could be done and I was told it would be going on till midnight. No offer to move rooms or anything. I had a 3 hr drive in the morning and this sucked! At midnight it did finally stop. The next morning I got to check out with the same lovely lady who earlier checked us in...again not a happy camper. She asked how my stay was and when i told her the party killed me the night before she couldn't care less. I felt like the question was all lip service We won't go back or ever recommend this place to anyone. Stay where your appreciated! The 3 hotels we stayed at before this one were a fraction the cost, people were nicer and the rooms more spacious. Also, If your over 5' tall you won't fit on these beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: imafloridacracker
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at an Affinia property but definitely won't be our last. A very high-service boutique hotel that fits our needs very well. We were upgraded to a very large room that could almost fit Junior Suite size. One of those properties where everyone seems to know your name and anxious to be helpful. Great downtown location near the Magnificent Mile and awesome eateries. We walked most everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: macman2
Reviews.Content: The Affinia Chicago sits right between Northwestern Medical Center and the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Avenue). We found that its proximity to Water Tower Place and other shopping meccas (Saks Fifth Avenue, Neiman Marcus) makes this a shoppers paradise hotel or a great place if you are visiting the medical center. The room was very clean, modern decor and with very comfortable beds. We had the wheel chair accessible room and even the chrome handle bars sparkled. The bathroom was really big. I knocked off a point because wireless internet cost $10 a day and there is no pool. But we like the hotel and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but be prepared to pay for everything”
Reviews.Author: khenaro
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Near the magnificent mile, walk distance to Navi Pier, Loop. One change from O'Hare airport if you use metro - one hour overall. In the hotel - roomy, clean, safe. Nice open bar on the top. The room is well-decorated and cozy. You should pay for anything extra. Including internet. 10 USD per day! Even bottle of still water is not included to the over-200dollars price. And if they take care of allergic guests and offer hyper-allergenic pillows - how could they leave the dust on lamps and alarm clock?

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT! CANT WAIT TO RETURN!”
Reviews.Author: LeighHolford
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Affinia last year when we visited Chicago and this was the only hotel which we considered when booking again. We certainly were not disappointed. We booked the Junior suite and were situated on the 22nd floor, with great views of the city. The rooms were large and light, the bed massive and the room has plenty of room for storage etc. The location is just perfect, pretty much central to all major attractions and just one block from North Michigan Avenue (Magnificent Mile) shopping. All members of staff are great and are always friendly and willing to help. We visited the C-House restaurant for breakfast and the C-View bar while staying at the hotel and enjoyed both. I really love the city and upon my return there will be only one hotel on my wish list. If the hotel was full then I would rather move my vacation than stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: fivebell
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a quick girls weekend, and were lucky enough to get a great deal on this hotel through Hotwire. Everything about this hotel was fantastic, from the location to the room to the friendly staff. There was never a time when we entered the lobby that we weren't greeted, and the folks working there were always so friendly and genuine! Peter at the front desk was a gem, and found us a great place for an Italian meal, calling ahead to make sure that we had a table outside that was waiting for us when we arrived. He also supplied us with coupons for shopping and great ideas for places to go. The room was wonderful, and the bed was so comfortable. The pillow menu was amazing, as was the spacious bathroom with the built-in vanity and lighted makeup mirror. The location of this hotel is about a block off Michigan Avenue, which was just what we were looking for. Also, don't miss the rooftop bar - while the drinks weren't inexpensive, the atmosphere and the view were spectacular! This hotel was a gem, and we'll definitely be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Camaro485
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a friend's birthday, got a great deal by bidding on the room. The staff was courteous and it was only blocks from the subway and Michigan Ave shopping. It is also right next to my favorite pizzeria, Gino's East. Only complaint is they did not have a pool.

Reviews.Title: “FLAWLESS”
Reviews.Author: Smile12333
Reviews.Content: Affinia blew my mind, when you search for hotels online, it is tough to try and understand exactly what a hotel looks like or the feel of it, or whereit is in comparison to everyhting else to want to go see or do. Affinia had me covered, we went down for Lollapalooza and I could not have been more happy. We were not right next door to the park, but we were a 3 minute cab ride away, we were a 1/2 a blcok away from Michigan avenue. On our corner it was Neiman Marcus and Victoria Secret. We were steps away fromt he John Hancock, delicious cafe's resturants and everything we wanted. The staff was amazing, so incredibly helpful and nice, I loved walking by them int he mornings , they made my day. Our room was amazing, absolutley perfect, the design is so modern and gorgeous, spacious and the pillows were amazing, don't forget that they have a pillow menu. They brought us gifts and treats daily to use while we stayed int he hotel, we recieved gourmet cupcakes just to welcome us to the hotel. We could not have asked for a more amazing hotel. Thank you Affinia Staff, we miss you :)

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, FRIENDLY, BEAUTIFUL !”
Reviews.Author: Genny8675309
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I checked into the Affinia on Tuesday July 7 based on other reviews on Trip Advisor. I cannot BEGIN to tell you what a wonderful experience we had, JUST IN THE HOTEL ! This hotel treats it's guests as if you are at a 5 star resort in Mexico ! I've never met friendlier staff or more accomodating staff ! Specifically Annie, Damien and Andre were my favourites among every other staff member employed there ! Everytime my boyfriend and I returned to the hotel from our MANY chicago adventures, they would ask " how was the double decker? Did you find that store you were looking for " " what did you buy today " " what are you doing tonight ? " It was like coming home to a bunch of really friendly and nice roommates ! The rooms themselves and the entire hotel are breathtaking. HUGE rooms ( we stayed in a studio suite 1 ) and it was amazing ! Clean, Fresh, Modern, Comfortable !! OUr room was 1001 and it was right beside the elevator, I did not hear that elevator even ONCE, we slept like babies the entire night ! The Restaurant staff is also extremely friendly and they remembered us each time, using specifics from an earlier visit as conversation starters ! The best part ? THE FOOD IS FANTASTIC !!! I recommend the Almond French Toast for breakfast ! I had not even ONE issue with this hotel, I loved every part of it, and every minute of it . I plan to go back to Chicago in the very near future, and will absolutely be staying at The Affinia. The location is prime, parking is a breeze, and there are several restaurants near by ! Mag Mile is a one minute walk to the end of the block !! One of the staff who works at the Affinia, ( I wish I knew his name ) recommended Timothy O'Toole's Pub for a late night snack on a Tuesday ( 11:30 pm ) for hot wings ...and I'll tell you, those wings were the best I'd ever had ! I know that there are many hotel choices in Chicago, but I can assure you as someone who travels frequently, if it weren't for the staff at this hotel, I don't know if our trip would have been as enjoyable ! They really gave Chicago a great name, and The Manager ( who I also met, very friendly and happy gentleman ) should be very proud of the staff he's chosen ! Have a great time in Chicago, and I strongly recommend you make your trip worthwhile and choose the Affinia !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: apollo12
Reviews.Content: Arrived feeling verry dishevelled after a delayed rail journey to be greated by very friendly & welcoming staff who ran through the hotel ammenities on arrival. Loved the pillow menu & made use of it on our 2nd night. Room was very spacious, made even more so by the fact we were asigned a disabled access room which gave us a massive well equipped bathroom. Plenty of TV chanels to browse through & air con that worked well. Windows could have been better soundproofed as we were woken quite early by delivery vans outside. The mini bar is overpriced but there is a Walgreens about a 5-10 min walk away which is a lot cheaper. Used the restaurant the following morning for breakfast & regretted it as the sausage patties contained so much chilli that i was ill within 15 mins of getting to my room. Did not bother to complain to the restaurant but would have like to have been told beforehand in order to choose a differnt breakfast item. The following day we found a great bakery less than 2 blocks away which suited us a lot better. Staff gave us the wrong information on getting to a museum & suggested we take a cab. Thankfully we had been given some information from another website which got us there for a fraction of the cost. They were very helpful in providing maps & allowing us to store our bags after checkout. The location is great for exploring the Magnificent mile & it's a short walk to the subway staions, Navy Pier & the John Hancock building. Would stay there again but not our 1st choice of hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Unable to honor booking - didn't bother to call me until I arrived”
Reviews.Author: DRAJW
Reviews.Content: Booked for a conference at this hotel back in September and arrived last week expectant given good reviews. Called the week before to confirm my stay. Arrived hot and tired only to be told by the desk that they were full and that I would have to walk 2 blocks down the road to different and inferior hotel. They didn't try and call me before I arrived despite having all my contact details. They didn't offer to upgrade me. On the plus side they offered to reimburse me for 1 nights accommodation (small hand clap for their recognition of poor service) But seriously, they can't take conference bookings if they can't keep conference bookings. Also the manager still has not replied to my email. I guess they don't care. So, it may be a nice hotel, but I will never book there again if they are this unreliable. Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and definitely worth a return visit”
Reviews.Author: Affiniaiamay2011
Reviews.Content: Peters the concierge was excellent and very helpful. We enjoyed our stay immensely. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: genievre
Reviews.Content: Great location, but a few things very annoying: breakfast poor, long waits for the elevators, sluggish room service (took me 24 hours and three phone calls to have a wine glass delivered to my room). I won't be back if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Two_Way_Yo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Chicago for a weekend and our first trip to the city. Everything about the hotel is as advertised on the website. My wife loved the location due to easy access to Michigan Avenue shopping. What made the hotel exceptional was the Concierge, Peter. His willingness to give recommendations and opinions about the best places to go and things to do are sadly missing qualities in most hotel concierge booths. This service with a smile is what makes this hotel stand out and we will make sure to come back on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look for more, stay at Affinia.”
Reviews.Author: EricCR2
Reviews.Content: As many of you, I had checked many hotels around Chicago, and I was skeptical about reserving at Affinia, and if it was going to be a good hotel (I'm peaky..). Well, my stay was absolutely superb. The hotel room was excellent (I think I was upgrated because the room was very big), the decoration and condition was at it has to be. The lobby is not great but I don't spent time there anyway. The location is wonderfull. The staff was helpfull and always had good attitude. The rate was great considering the high quality. So in less words, reserve with confidence. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Service could use improvements.”
Reviews.Author: uscballer9
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I feel the best Affinia Chicago has going is its location. Steps away from Magnificent Mile. Hancock Observatory and Millennium Park are within walking distance. Lincoln Park Zoo and Navy Pier are a short bus ride away. Everything is at your doorstep whether it's ATM's, convenient stores, restaurants and shops. Gino's East, famous for their deep dish pizza is right next door. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Housekeepers were friendly and always says hello. Front Desk staffs were inconsistent with service as I encountered. Sometimes helpful, uninterested and unaccommodating. Had a little incident where they made me feel like they wont let me check in unless I fix this problem myself when they could have been a little more accommodating. I was in shock and disbelief. This is my second stay at two different Affinia Hotels and had a similar problem with Front Desk staffs. So that led me to believe it's not my problem, but perhaps their policies? Would I stay here again? I probably would just because of its location. But if you're the manager is that the sale pitch you want to give to your customer, "we offer bad service, but perfectly located?"

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, let down by charging for Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: JimmyDevine
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at this hotel, as part of a party of 78, in town for a restaurant study tour and to attend the NRA show. Service was first class, especially the concierge and door staff, who could seem to make a cab appear by magic. Rooms were huge, with great facilities and the most comfortable bed I have ever had in a hotel room. Mini bar pricing and on demand tv charges were high, but that's just par for the course and acceptable, what was not acceptable was the very high cost for Wi-Fi, at $9.95 per 24 hours, this would be outrageous in most places, but the fact it was for AT&T, made it even more of a headache, as it was patchy and unreliable. The excuse that the hotel is only matching other hotels practices in charging for Wi-Fi is not an excuse, for modern travellers, this is the last legal theft, and should be part of the room cost, just like power and water. This added cost means I have reduced the hotel score to 4/5, but make no mistake, for service, comfort, location and welcome, this Chicago Hotel will take some beating! See you next year ( sort out the Wi-Fi!!)

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel next to Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Henning55
Reviews.Content: Our second time at Affinia, and definately not the last. Can't wait to come back! The hotel is ideally situated close to everything in Chicago. Spacious clean rooms and extremely helpful staff made our stay memorable. When we extended our stay for one night, the front desk staff arranged that we could stay in our room, even though it was booked. Thanks Anne, Dora and Yolanda - and everybody at Affinia. We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: chicago_was_fun
Reviews.Content: Great location; pretty rooms; comfortable beds. Peter was so helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Affinia Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mnree7
Reviews.Content: This Affinia is in a prime location right off MIchigan Avenue. There are restaurants and cafes right near it so you don't have to cross the crowds on that busy shopping street unless you want to. The front desk were very welcoming and the room was great. I had a drink in the fancy bar/restaurant downstairs and really liked it. I have stayed in many hotels in Chicago and can recommend this one if you are looking to be near Michigan Avenue. The red line is a reasonable walk away and that will take you to the Loop or MiIlennium Park. Otherwise, you can walk to the river in about 10 minutes and get there on your own.

Reviews.Title: “This one's a keeper”
Reviews.Author: Jessep666
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Jazzy Affinia! Check In: A breeze! Genuinly pleasant staff to deal with, more than willing to help you out with any info you need in a very polite and friendly manner. Rooms: Bigger than I had expected for a city hotel. Beds Uber comfy and choice of pillows a great touch. With a full length mirror ladies!! Helpful brochures etc.. when you arrive , nice flat screen too. Bathroom : Wowza. Great size. Spotlessly clean with lovely products included. Felt like a movie star everytime I looked in the mirror with the lights round it! (Classy, not tacky.) Shower / enclosed wet room big enough for a small party. Very few rooms per floor gave the feeling of being somewhere very special :) Ginos east nextdoor great for lunch - mere seconds from the mag mile and a reasonable walk to the subway. Overall, my clients will be hearing about this one.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was unbelievable ...friendly, knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: janmitch
Reviews.Content: The location of the Affinia was excellent (next door to Gino's Pizza), however, the staff offered the best customer service I have experienced in years. From the men greeting you at the door to the women behind the desk they were on task 24 hours a day. The 29th floor rooftop lounge was tremendous overlooking the city. Affinia should be extremely proud of their establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular! Home Away From Home (only cooler...)”
Reviews.Author: LoriDavis33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia for a weekend in the city. Walking distance to the Lake and Shopping. Service was great. Really enjoyed the roof-top bar--gorgeous views and comfortable lounge atmosphere. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel49534
Reviews.Content: Really nice staff, beds were super comfy, 1/2 block off Michigan Ave and 2 blocks from American Girl Store. Location doesn't get any better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located hotel near Water Tower Place”
Reviews.Author: travelerj317
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a few days & wanted a hotel near Water Tower Place. My room at the Affinia was very spacious & comfortable. It was near public transportation & shopping. Their were many restaurants within a few block radius. All of the Affinia employees were very courteous & able to answer my questions. This was my 2nd stay at the hotel & I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel that enhanced our stay in Chicago by 100%”
Reviews.Author: Ray024
Reviews.Content: We travelled from the UK to stay at the Affinia Chicago at the beginning of May, and before we travelled we knew nothing about the hotel. It turned out to be fabulous - clean, modern, well-furnished, thoroughly serviced, and in an excellent location for shops, Magnificent Mile, the lake, tours, buses and trains. The staff of the hotel were really great, and nothing was too much trouble for them. Everyone smiled, whether they were bar staff, waiters, reception staff or room maids. Especially helpful were the staff on reception - I can't remember all of them, but certainly Steve, Andre, Kara and Peter were great. Somehow they seemed to know our questions before we'd asked them, and knew exactly what we were looking for and pointed us in the right direction. Ray Palmer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice jewel!”
Reviews.Author: montestl
Reviews.Content: We booked 10 rooms on Priceline not knowing what we were gonna get. WOW... not your small stuffy Chicago room that we have all stayed in before. Walk into your room and your met with a good size desk/ work area. To the left is a large bathroom. (Which is the size of some other places whole room) to the right is a sunken (3 steps) bed room area. Some rooms have 2 full and others had a king with a pull out sofa. Key to a good night sleep is 6 differant pillows to pick from. A must is the roof top bar! If you have any questions ask Victor at the front door.

Reviews.Title: “holy cow...what a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: flizzer
Reviews.Content: stayed with 2 of my kids and their families--they put us all on one floor which was wonderful....my son had an amazing city view and my dtr & I had a view of the hancock....the room was fab....little touches like a nightlight that popped on in the closet when you walked by & gorgeous roller shade that really blocked the sun....a "pillow menu" that included an i pod pillow....great staff that made us feel right at home....a beautiful bar with a great view... bonus is Ginos east is right next door...michigan ave is 1 blk away.... not one complaint!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, comfortable and contemporary!And well-located.”
Reviews.Author: elaine33939
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Friendly staff, nice modern lobby and rooms, lovely breakfasts, feel of a small boutique hotel. Best for us was the handicapped room and bathroom. The room was large and the walk-in shower was equipped with excellent seat and grab-bars. The separate bathtub also had several grab-bars. We visit family in Chicago a few times each year, and this is the best hotel we've stayed in. Will definitely return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: JuliaUstinov
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel - one of three we stayed in during a convoluted business/pleasure trip to Chicago. It is half a block to the best part of Magnificent Mile. It has a hip, cheerful, unpretentious lobby and reception desk. Our room was a delight on the 20th floor. You step down from the entry/bath area to a cozy bed/sitting area. Our room seemed to hover over the streetscape below and an iconic skyscraper at the end of the block made a lovely scene at night. The room was comfortable and fun though the silver headboard and metallic pink wallpaper in the bathroom may not be so cool in a year or so. The elevators, as noted, are slow but not frustratingly so. It is next to a big medical center. We could hear the ambulances in the day but at night they seem to keep the sound down or they don`t use the sirens because we slept well - no noise. The staff were very helpful. Thanks to Jeremy for recommending the architectural boat tour and dinner at nearby Coco Paza Cafe - both were nearby and highlights of the trip. We were also able to walk from here to the foodie mecca- Frontera Grill which was a peak dining experience - not to be missed and well worth the ("no reservations for small parties") wait. The rooftop bar is very cool. Literally can't wait to go back to friendly Chicago and this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location”
