Reviews.Author: TravelPad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Checking in was straightforward and we soon found our way to the 25th floor on the express lift with a view of the John Hancock building from our room. The rooms are very spacious with a range of pillows, large bed and blinds to shut all day light out. The bathroom was clean and you had the option of having a bath here as well as a shower. Coffee facilities were also provided but unfortunately there are no tea facilities. I would recommend that all tea drinkers should bring their own supply of tea when coming to the states as itâ€™s not in abundance here and is expensive. If bringing your own travel kettle, be aware of the difference in voltage here. The American system runs on 110 volts unlike the English 240 volts so an additional adaptor is needed. There was also a large TV in the room at the end of a very comfortable bed. One thing I found slightly annoying (especially after staying at many hotels and motels across the country) was being asked to pay for Wi-Fi. We didnâ€™t take this option up and had stayed at better and cheaper places where this was free. You should bear this in mind if you have a smart phone or use a laptop. The location of the hotel is also pretty good, quite central to everything. There is also a very popular pizza restaurant next door (Ginoâ€™s East). So popular in fact that people queue up outside to eat there. We spoke to the helpful person at the reception of the hotel who gave us a â€˜guest passâ€™ to jump the queue (well, it was raining and cold that night). Once in youâ€™ll be dealt with quite quickly, just bear in mind that the meals here are very large. We were advised against ordering what we ordered on account of the amount of food that would be coming. Suffice to say we left very full indeed (and had to leave some). Across the road from the front of the hotel is a â€˜pubâ€™ called the Elephant and Castle. This is very similar to a Wetherspoons pub not only in the choice of beer it sells but also the sort of food. Not brilliant but does the job if hungry and you donâ€™t fancy going to a restaurant. There is also a bar on the top floor of the hotel which we visited, but on reflection I would say youâ€™re better off going to the Signature Bar of the John Hancock building rather than this. There was hardly anyone there the night we went and the views were nothing special (and the drinks were pricey). In the John Hancock on the other hand, the drinks are still pricey, but the bar is very lively and the views much, much better (and itâ€™s only a 5 minute walk away). Generally speaking this is a pretty decent hotel, the staff helpful and in a good location. Bad points are the lack of free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: Pourvous
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated if you are a good walker as parks and museum are at about an hour walk. But the city is so nice to discover that it should not be a problem. Furthermore, being almost in the Magnificent mile stores, shopping would be a blast in the event of a rainy day. Although we could ear every foot step from the corridors, the hotel was quiet and offers an impeccable clean and quiet room. Would it be the same in a high season when the rooms are all occupied ?..that would be to see. Rooms was a fair to small size, and bathroom was the typical '50 size. The bed were extremely confortable, we slept like babies. Our room was on the lower floors, on the back side of the hotel. The restaurant was a disapointment. You can skip it. The roof top bar is a full bar, and of course, offers a great view of the surroundings. Staff is friendly but the concierge outsides ( often more then one of them) are really more busy talking amongst themselves then anything else. Shouldn't they open doors, greet the clientele, stand straight beside their desk......... These small flaws should not stop you from booking there....unless it is a very busy season where noise could be an issue. WIFI is available but did not work well at all. I would certainly use cable internet if I had a choice. ( IPad does not allow cable internet)

Reviews.Title: “The Best Mother's Day/30th Wedding Anniversary Day Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: mikhjianrn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of Chicago; walking distance to all the great shopping and sightseeing that this city has to offer (right outside the front door of the hotel). Right next door to Neiman Marcus, two blocks from the John Hancock Tower (loved the Cheesecake Factory inside) and wonderful Gino's Restaurant outside the door. The most friendly and accommodating staff from the people at the Front Desk to maintenance man. Would defiantly look forward to my next stay with Affinia in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected surprise!”
Reviews.Author: cassidy528
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute thru priceline, my husband and I made this a spontaneous trip on our way back to St. Louis from Milwaukee. Got a great price $111 (incl taxes) and thought for sure we'd get stuck in a bottom floor room that was crappy. We were put on the 22nd floor at the end of the hall in a king bed that was really nice! It's a great location and the hotel staff was very helpful when we were looking for places to go in a short period of time. Everything was very clean also. We had to request them to bring us ice as well as a hair dryer, but both requests were filled promptly. My only complaint was the fee to valet park $49!!! It was $10 cheaper to park at the public garage right down the street and next time we would do that...we were just so frazzled by the time we got there, figured that would be easier and it was only $10 right? NO...by the time you ended up tipping all the people with thier hands out it was at least another $15-$20 (driver, guy that takes your bags out, etc) Try the pizza place next door if you want some authentic Chicago deep dish pizza! Awesome! We would definately stay here again though, especially if we were able to get this rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: inwhites
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip in Chicago and the location of the hotel is very convenient. It is just a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile and the John Hancock Tower where you can start a double decker tour. The hotel staff was awesome. The receptionists were very accommodating, very helpful and friendly. They never failed to greet us with a smile. The bellmen were also great. They always opened the door for us and hailed a cab in no time. Our room was really nice and the housekeeping did a good job. It was so nice to get back to the hotel to see things so clean and organized. They did things more than what was expected of them. Staying at Affinia Hotel made our Chicago trip more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The service & staff and my stay was "even" - consistently excellent!”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripHappy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a conference for Northwestern U. in downtown Chicago. The word that comes to mind is "even" as everything about my stay was consistently excellent, the room, the staff and the service. The location is great, less than a block off of Michigan avenue. The building is older, but has been remodeled - take a look at their website, it's just what the rooms look like.The room was very comfortable, the room service was diligent, and the front desk staff were all great. Peter, on the front desk, was especially helpful, recommending and helping with dinner reservations for each night, so I had wonderful meals for my six night stay. Staff like Peter really go a long way towards making your stay comfortable and helping you to experience the best of the city. I look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “We were short sheeted.”
Reviews.Author: Elh4572
Reviews.Content: Seiously, I woke up in the morning to realize that my feet were on the bare mattress, not a sheet. The only coffee available in the room was decaf. The room was small but comfortable with a unique style. When we needed a cab in the morning, the bellman had to run a different hotel to get it.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable staff practices”
Reviews.Author: canadiancook
Reviews.Content: Went for a girls getaway and loved the location of this hotel - great for shopping and access to exceptional restaurants. Unfortunately, we were cut off at the roof top bar along with another group our last night because of a wedding party that showed up and had a friend on the bar staff - they wanted the place to themselves - very unprofessional. The front lobby staff was very accomadating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jeanssis
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Affinia, great service and nice staff. It is in a great location for shopping and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Affinia”
Reviews.Author: lolaottawa
Reviews.Content: This is our second experience at the Affinia, the first being the Affinia Shelburne. The main difference between the two is the level of service. I called the hotel to arrange for a number of excusions (bus/trolley tour and river architecture tour) and everything was ready when we got there. The hotel staff also made restaurant recommendations and proceeded with reservations. All of the staff was wonderful and most helpful and friendly - they went out of their way to make your stay a pleasant one. We ordered room service one evening when my husbnd wasn't feeling well and the food was excellent as was the service. I highly recommend this hotel./

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: Yzubery
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Affinia Hotel for 7 nights in 2 rooms. It started with the warmest welcome by Andre and Peter and continued during the whole week. They were always cheerful and welcome us with a smile, they suggested the best attractions and restaurants. The sevice and stuff are the best we ever had even in more luxirious hotels. The food at the hotel restaurant is the best we had during the whole week. It is perfectly located for shoping and site seeing. We will stay at Affinia Hotel in Chicago again. Thank you for making our vacation a huge success.

Reviews.Title: “Girls' Dreams Come True”
Reviews.Author: travelingal03
Reviews.Content: Our stay was definately a dream come true for our family! The location is ideal for all of the shopping on Michigan Avenue, especially the American Girl Place!! As soon as we walked in and saw the American Girl doll, my girls couldn't contain their excitement! The staff was so welcoming and made us feel right at home! The room was perfect and the view, simply breathtaking!! We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: MichiganDOs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at Affinia Chicago. The rooms are large and the staff extremely helpful. I will stay here on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Service was outstanding! The entire team could not have helped us any more, unless they tucked us in at night. So acc”
Reviews.Author: Katerfitzroy
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! Dora from the front desk team was exceptional! Thank you all for a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Find - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AnotherStop
Reviews.Content: A wonderful find with a great location just off Michigan Ave. Small lobby, no wasted space. The rooms are spotless and spacious with all the ammenities you need. We had lunch in the restaurant and a room service breakfast. Both were great. As nice as the hotel is, the real stars are the hotel staff, always pleasant, helpful and ready with great suggestions. Peter at the front desk was especially helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay if you get it at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Bueller555
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to get an $89/night rate for 6 nights. Let's start off with all the positives: + Great location. Half a block of Michigan Ave and adjacent to Gino's East. + Always friendly front door staff. + Pleasant and professional front desk staff. + Rooms are clean and bedding is nice with no gross comforter on the beds. + Taller folks will like that the shower heads on their tubs are probably placed at about 6' 4". My wife couldn't reach the shower head to adjust it. + Large windows that can open a little to let some air in. + The room size compares favorably to some of the NYC hotels that I've used. + The hotel location is a bit far from the subway station, but very convenient for buses. Chicago parking rates are insanely high, so public transit and taxi are the way to go when visiting. + Calls to the front desk were answered promptly and courteously and our requests for items were promptly delivered. + The pillow menu is a nice feature. Now the not so good: - As previously mentioned in other posts, the air conditioning/heating system is loud. Not a constant flow unit, but turns on and off as the room temperature changes. We had to turn off the a/c because the noise affected out sleep. - Housekeeping had one bad day when they forgot to replace out tissue box and left behind a pillowcase and dust rag in the room. No other housekeeping issues except for that one day. - I had thought that the neighbors were allowing their doors to slam behind them, but I later realized that the door locking mechanism is just really loud. The doors auto-deadbolt when you close the door and while it gives you added safety, it makes a loud "clack" no matter how gently you close the door. - Windows are old and allowed a lot of cold air to penetrate. There is a big temperature difference near the windows when the shades are open. - Only two elevators so it might get busy during checkout. - Neither of us cared for the bathroom products. We didn't like the olive oil soap and the shampoo that was provided. - No business center to print out your boarding pass, although the front desk was nice enough to let me use their computer for this purpose. While this is over-the-top nice, it just feels awkward. - In this day and age, charging $10 for wifi seems a bit chintzy. I'm a little torn. If I could get a similar rate in the future, I would have no problem in recommending the Affinia, but if I had to pay anywhere near the normal rate, I would have second thoughts. As far as my experience went, I recommend the Affinia, although, making a few more changes would make the experience a lot more outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, service, location and overall great stay!”
Reviews.Author: chimichanga8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at Affinia Chicago. We thought the rooms were very clean, had enough room for the two of us, and the king size bed was very comfortable. Customer service at the front desk was great, and they were very friendly and helpful. Chicago is a very large city, so it is convenient to get a 1 or 3 day bus/metro pass to get around. Luckily we had our laptop to find exact directions to where we were going by public transit. Another tip is go when it's warm, cause when its cold its cold! Overall a very great stay, and enjoyable trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: Marlene_kernahan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia for two nights, mid-week. We booked through Expedia and got an excellent rate. We had requested adjoining rooms, but that request was not processed. We were instead given rooms on the same floor. We had Kara helping us, and she was fabulous - she was very patient and accommodating and kept a sense of humour through the whole check-in process. The staff is very friendly, always greeting us with a smile. We also had questions about restaurants and local bars and they gave us excellent suggestions. We also were given priority seating at Gino's, despite a huge line up, thanks to one of the staff at the Affinia. The parking is $80 for two days, at the parking garage across the street. The rooms are fabulous. We had a huge double King, and our view was of St. Clair Street., The room was spotless and spacious. The beds are probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The bathroom was huge and the lighted mirror was a great touch! The linens were top-notch. Some of the reviews mention the street noise and drafty windows. The windows are single-pane, not sure why, and were a bit drafty but it wasn't terrible, despite having chilly windy weather. As far as the street noise, yes we did hear sirens and car horns (we were on the 5th floor), but we kept the fan going on our heating/air conditioning unit and barely heard the street noise. Overall, we were very impressed with the service and attention we received. We also thought the rooms were fabulous and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Brs79
Reviews.Content: Sadly I only stayed for one night, but the hotel is super nice, the staff is super friendly and the price is more than worth it. The location is the best, you don't need any kind of transportation to go shopping, dining or just walk around Michigan Avenue, N. Rush, etc... The room was very nice, very clean, loved the bathroom with metallic wallpaper. Next time it will definitely be my #1 option.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel; Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Carole72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at the Affinia Chicago. The location was great--convenient to Michigan Ave, shopping, restaurants. Our room on 14th floor overlooked East Superior St; only noise we heard during night was ambulance going to hospital across the street--if you are a very light sleeper, this might not be the location for you, but it didn't bother us. Room and bathroom were super clean; nice amenities in bathroom. Front desk and door staff were friendly and helpful. Even printed out our boarding passes the day before we left. The only thing missing was some information in our room which would have mentioned if breakfast was available in adjoining restaurant and informing us of coffee service in the lobby. We didn't know about the coffee service until we were checking out our last day. The bed was very comfortable, plenty of hot water in the shower, and the heat control was easy to operate. For breakfast we liked the Corner Bakery (a chain, but has good hot breakfast as well as yummy cinnamon rolls and lunch items) located two blocks straight up the street as you go out the front door of the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JillianL87
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely pleased with our stay at the Affinia in Chicago. The location was great! It was just steps to shops on Michigan Ave. We used the parking garage across the street and was very convenient. It was only $40 to park from approx. 2pm on a Monday to 12 noon on Tuesday. I think that is a great deal for Chicago. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I called the front desk when we were parking, to see if we could check in early. It was 2pm and generally check-in isnt until 3pm. The gentleman that answered was very friendly and seemed like he was happy to be at work. When i asked about checking in an hour early, he said "no problem! absolutely, can't wait to see you!" I thought that to be above and beyond in customer service. Our room was located on the 11th floor, a little less than half way up. We were in the Junior Suite, which felt like an apartment. It was fabulous! Very roomy, clean, and an excellent view. It was located right off the elevator and was tucked away from other rooms. It felt like we had the floor to ourselves. The noise level outside was minimal. I was comfortable the entire time we stayed there. I wish we would have stayed more than one night, but we were only in town for a Cubs game. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone who is in town for anything. Super close to shopping, museums, restaurants, and even the "L" it took only about 20 mins to get to Wrigley Field from our room. We are already planning our next trip to Affinia. Thanks for making out stay WONDERFUL!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Dharmabum87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Affinia for the second time in less than a year. The first time around I gave it 4 stars. This time, only 3. I'm not sure if I would stay there again. The pros: the location is good -- right off Michigan Avenue and near the Lake; the place was reasonably priced $150 a night; the room service breakfast was great (fresh and hot and timely); it's relatively clean. These are all good things and make this a solid hotel. But, the Cons: the elevators are soooo slow. you have to add 6-7 minutes to your commute time both coming and going. this was a problem last time which I attributed to the rooftop bar, but this time the bar was closed and it was just as bad. it rained most of my trip and upon one excursion out, I asked the valet if they had umbrellas. He pointed me to the front desk. As I walked inside, the bell captain asked what I needed. I said an umbrella (one of which he had in his hand). He told me they were located in the mini bar. I said, don't you have any to borrow? He said, no, they cost $10 in the mini bar. I said, the guy outside said you had some at the front desk (and I pointed out the valet). The bell captain said he's just the valet, I'm the bell captain and we don't have umbrellas. I left into the rain. I've stayed at hotels all over the world. Every luxury hotel has umbrellas that you may borrow if it's raining. This irked me. Also, the front desk friendliness is very inconsistent. The lady that checked me in didn't say welcome back or ask me if I had any questions about the hotel or anything. She just asked for my credit card and gave me a room key. Meanwhile, the guy checking in the guest right next to me asked the guy if he had questions, pointed out the gym, talked about the restaurant, etc. Finally, the noise from the street is a real issue. I pointed this out last time too. This time I was on a higher floor --17, and could still hear the ambulances (the hotel is right across from NW hospital). So in the end, I'm not sure. Definitely won't stay if it's supposed to rain. For the money, it was a good deal but I was there for a conference. If I had a choice, Chicago has MANY comparable options in the area that I will likely try.

Reviews.Title: “tiny flaws but great overall”
Reviews.Author: TravelVic
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent five nights at the Affinia last week and, for the most part, very much enjoyed our stay. Our room, with two double beds, was very large and divided into two semi-levels. The bathroom and bar area were on a landing at main-door level and the beds were three steps down in sort of a sunken-living-room set-up. The beds and linens were clean and we had more pillows than anyone would ever want or need, though the down comforters were a teensy bit worn and discoloured. The bathroom was roomy and spotless, with ample towels, but there wasnâ€™t much counter space, so we used the desk outside its door as a place on which to keep our toiletries. The flat-screen TV in the room was wall-mounted and swiveled, which was handy, though we did notice that it occasionally lost reception quality if turned in one particular direction (likely due to a loose cable connection somewhere). The leather recliner was very comfortable and clean, and a nice touch. We had a great view south along St. Clair, and found the room to be fairly quiet. We did hear other guests in the hallway outside, as well as ambulance sirens occasionally, but never loud enough or long enough to cause excessive disruption. As other reviewers have noted, itâ€™s a bit of a shame that many basic amenities (e.g., local phone calls, internet) come with an additional charge. We were also disappointed that we were unable to use the mini-fridge in our room â€“ it was stocked full with beverages and, when we asked if it might be emptied so we could use it for our own snacks, we were told it *could* be emptied out... for a $50 fee. That seemed a smidge exorbitant, so we just moved things aside a little and had room to keep the occasional yogurt or bottle of water inside overnight. (We always ate or removed our own items in the morning, lest they be taken out by the mini-bar inventory-control clerks.) We found the staff to be consistently friendly and accommodating â€“ we were always greeted with a â€œgood morningâ€� or â€œhelloâ€� if we passed anyone coming or going from the hotel â€“ and any questions we had were always answered happily. We smelled cigarette smoke out in the hallway one evening (the entire hotel is non-smoking) and were pleasantly surprised at how thankful the guest services staffer was when we called down to let her know. We also used the complimentary (we were sure there would be a fee, but there wasnâ€™t!) service whereby guests can print out boarding passes before heading to the airport. We found it efficient, and the young woman at the front desk (I forgot to get her name) who assisted me was extremely helpful and patient despite the extended seat-selection process and printer snafus. Overall, as mentioned, our experience at the Affinia was a very good one. We've visited Chicago many times before but this was our first stay at this hotel and we look forward to staying again next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaliman91
Reviews.Content: We stay here for just one night on April 7th. Short and quick here. Hotel was clean, check-in was easy. We had a room on the top floor(28th) right next to the elevator. Never heard it and didnt have any issue with noise with the exception of some street noise. Had a few sirens and car horns that woke us up. Both were expected and not a huge issue to us. Was disappointed that the restaurant was closed.Were told they had a gas leak if some sort. Not only closed the restaurant but i guess there was no food prep aloud in the entire hotel. Strange that next door pizza place was open and serving. We went to have a drink at there rooftop bar which was small but nice. We asked if we could have food delivered to the bar and were told we couldnt. Understandable but with no option for food in the hotel we hoped they would make an exception. I will say the female bartender(shawn) wrote down a few options for a late night bite that will deliver to our room and that was appreciated. This was the only hiccup the rest of the stay was nice and we would choose the Affinia again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sjtt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. When we first arrived the rooms were very nicely decorated and seemed clean. One of the double beds seemed to be defective. It caved in the middle like a taco. We decided to give it a try but by the morning we realized she couldn't spend another night on the bed. When we went down to request another room in the morning they said that they were full and they could provide us with a cot at no extra charge. Really I didn't pay that money to sleep on a cot. I asked them to look at the bed to see if it could be fixed. We arrived back 3 hrs later and the front desk said they didn't know if it had fixed. When we went to the room it still was the same. Also the windows are paper thin so it felt like I was sleeping on the street because it was so loud. You could hear the dumpsters bring emptied at 4 am. Then there was the 7am wake up call I didn't request. When I told her that she said wrong number and hung up. There was a gas main break infront of the hotel so we had to wait 3 hours to get back in and then there was no heat or hot water till 7pm. The gas main break was at 9 am. When speaking with the staff they were less then helpful. When we were finally leaving they got us a taxi but took 5 dollars from the driver so she could have the fare SO TACKY! I will never stay here and I will tell everyone I know to NEVER stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia Does It Again”
Reviews.Author: JCskiier
Reviews.Content: Last year I stayed at the Affinia Shellburne in NYC. So when it was time to book a hotel in Chicago, I was happy to see the Affinia Chicago was available and in our price range. We had a wonderful time! The staff is super friendly and the location cannot be beat. They really go out of their way to make you feel more like a friend than a guest. We had a fantastic jr. suite with a wonderful view of the city. Everything was modern and clean. Plenty of room for the four of us - for once not one complaint from the children! The hotel is right next to Gino's East and a block from the center of Michigan Ave. My husband was miffed that we had to pay for internet in the room and the parking expense. However, as soon as we arrived the valet gave us a self-park option which saved $20 a day! Since we travel a lot, I'm familiar with all types of service and now 2 for 2 the Affinia hotels are TOPS in my book.

Reviews.Title: “lazy staff”
Reviews.Author: UkQuincy
Reviews.Content: I wrote an email to the sales & reservation team a week ago.........i'm still waiting for a response. All I wanted to do was book a suite for 2 nights but they failed to even reply with an offer. We have now booked another hotel who can be bothered to answer emails. Shame you missed out, coz we tip like rockerfellers!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: musicteachtravel
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly Staff...always nice and even greeted our little ones by name on our way in/out of the hotel. Location was perfect for everything we wanted, 1 block from magnificient mile, beside Ginos East and about a 10 minute walk to the Navy Pier Cons: Hotel is clean, but shows signs of wear. Blinds were broken in room and were eventually fixed. We left an item in the room upon check out and it wasnt recovered by housekeeping...which seems to be a pattern nationwide. Parking is $49.00 per day OUCH!! I would stay here again as its the perfect location for what our family wanted to do in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but kind of disappointed”
Reviews.Author: IsaFranc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and lovely staff! I am disappointed though, I booked the Navy Pier package from the hotel link on Navy Piers website. It states that a child's digital camera w/case, complimentary over night parking ($49.00) value, and Navy Pier savings book etc would be included. When I stated at check in that I had the Navy Pier package I was told parking was not included, and all I was given was a map of Navy Pier. No savings book or camera!! So I am disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: kasbc
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It's within walking distance to shopping, culture, food and metro stops. Our room at the hotel, however, was just so-so. The bathroom smelled musty, the lights on our headboard and the stopper in the sink didn't work, and the light on the nightstand on one side of the bed didn't work. In defense of the hotel, we didn't call and ask for a different room so very probably they would have moved us to a room where everything was in working order.

Reviews.Title: “The Affinia was a perfect match for us!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly7116
Reviews.Content: Took my 15 yr old son to Chicago for Spring Break. At check in, I explained the reason for our trip and since my son had never been to Chicago before, we were hoping for a room up high with a good view. The front desk person; Jeff told us that he did not have a dble room available with a good view but he would upgrade us to a better room with a great view at no additional charge. The room was perfect and definately had a great view! It was the beginning of a 4 day stay where great service was always demonstrated! The amenities and location were unbeatable. The suggestions for dinner by the concierge were great. I will definitely go back and suggest the Affinia to all my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: esthercbuenosaires
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, modern, clean and comfortable. The location couldnÂ´t be better. The atention is great. I highly recommend it. And the price is more than affordable and reasonable in relation to what you get-

Reviews.Title: “Better Places easy to find”
Reviews.Author: Rack18
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights over spring break in what was called a Jr Suite but resembled a wide hallway with a window at one end. Bad cheap furniture, carpet that stops short of reaching the wall, a TV that sticks out into the middle of the room and a window that whistled when the wind blew. BAD BAD experience. Find aother hotel plenty in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: hope2teach
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Affinia Chicago. The staff at this hotel was incredible! They were personable, attentive, and responsive to all requests. The room was larger than I expected with two double beds and a raised foyer area with a desk and a reclining chair. There are several complimentary "experience" packs you can request. We requested the yoga pack. It included stretching blocks, belt, yoga mat, 2 DVD's, weights, etc. This pack was brought to our room promptly. The location was great - 1 block from Water Tower Place on Michigan. This is definitely a hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sra-aami
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we've stayed at the Affinia and loved it. We booked it because it was dog friendly, even though our dog slept elsewhere. The room was upgraded to a larger suite and very comfortable with a view of the city. Staff kept coming in with our pillows and extras (that were on the menu when we booked the room) so we felt very pampered. The staff was friendly and the location was great. The price was very reasonable and they took off the cost of the dog when we mentioned that she didn't sleep there. Would love to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE, GREAT LOCATION AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JOSEORTIZER
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Chicago without any reference whatsover. We booked through Hotwire so we knew the Hotel existed once our credit card was charged. We couldn't have chosen a better deal. The hotel is ina great location 2 minute walking distance to the Magificent Mile which is a lot better because the MM can be very crowded and noisy so you get the best of both worlds. The Staff (I believe her name was Dora) gave us an upgrade when we told her we were celebrating our 5th anniversary. I have to be very honest about the sleep quality. The Hotel is located near the NWU Hospital so you will be hearing the Ambulances every once in a while. Truth is I got used to it the second night and it stoped bothering me. It payed up!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel! close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: mnb31199
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the affinia chicago in feb. 2011- rates normally 200+ a night, but we got this hotel for 94$ a night bc it was feb and it was an upgraded room- we clicked the option online when paying to upgrade for an extra $9 a night if an upgrade was available and boy did it pay off! we were updraged to a city view and much more sq footage! we loved this hotel! they treated us like celebrities..concierge was amazing and helped us with everything! the front desk staff found out we hadnt been to chicago and they drew us maps, recommened the best places to see, eat, drink and shop also offered to make any reservations for us! the hotel was super clean, up to date, modern with a great roof top bar and restaurant! ginos east pizza was right next door and was so yummy! quiet hotel, bathroom amenities were wonderful quality, etc. a plus too was the windows opened which we noticed is hard to come by in chicago! i loved it so much ive already booked it again for next month to take my husband back!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Pisoa
Reviews.Content: Very good location! We had booked a room with 1 double-bed on the Internet and were given a room with 2 beds: that's a surprise we particularly appreciated! The room as well as the bathroom were perfectly clean and well-decorated. Just one disadvantage : I had cold air coming from the window to my bed, and a rather noisy air-conditoning. But that's not a real problem as we went there to go sightseeing and we were so happy when back late in that beautiful place. A hotel I would advise to solo traveller too!

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: CanadaFoodie
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel , staff is extremely courteous and helpful. The doormen were very friendly and efficient. The location is central to the main shopping areas. The hotel had a homey yet polished feel to it. The rooms were spacious and the bed was quite comfortable ( I liked the pillow menu) . The bathroom was decorated in a funky style. The shower had good water pressure. The hotel had a mix of tourists, people in for business and patients from a nearby hospital. There was a wide range of ages. The gym was decent as well. Only complaint was the lack of free internet . I would definitely return to this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BandBCuties
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, clean place with most of the amenities you would find at a boutique hotel. The pillow menu was a nice touch but they did not need to deliver them separately (Do I tip a pillow guy?). The best thing about this hotel besides the cleanliness would be the location. You are located just a block away from Michigan Ave. and a couple of blocks away from the Hancock Building. There was a downside to this hotel. Unfortunately with the good location comes a ton of street noise. About ten sirens a night and a lot of honking from angry motorists. The installation of a double pane window would do wonders for the noise and the draftiness of the current window. Until that is done just request one of the pillows that has speakers inside and that should help.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: BeachSwimOne
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at! It was my first time in Chicago & I must say, the staff at the Affinia made it that much better. I had booked the hotel (2 rooms) for my friends & I, not really knowing the area or anything about the hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by Joel who helped us with our bags & valeting our car. It was so simple & easy, I was beyond surprised. And immediately we felt like we were greeted by a family member. Upon Check-In we were greeted by the staff at the front desk & it was the most effortless check in. The travel agency I had used in booking the hotel had not specified I needed a room with 2 beds, but that was no problem at all. They even tried to accommodate one of my more difficult travel companions in sticking us on the 8th floor (he's a bit superstitious). We were advised the 8th floor had window obstruction so with a little gentle persuasion my friend agreed to the 6th floor. The rooms are extremely spacious and comfortable. The round mirror in the bathroom may have been the best mirror in the world. Let's just say, you can't look bad, ever. Within the first night at the Affinia we were addressed by the staff every time we walked through the lobby. We even invited some of them for a drink (they all declined). That's how inviting and warm these people were. I'm not one to really praise hotel staff, but this stay was far beyond exceptional. They booked a ghost tour for us, suggested restaurants & bars, just went above and beyond what was necessary & I can't express how appreciative I am of that. The location is right off of Magnificent Mile. You take a few steps & you're in the center of a wonderful shopping district. Restaurants & other evening destinations are within walking distance. By the 3rd night of our stay, we were ready to make the Affinia our permanent residence. Unfortunately, reality sunk in & we had to leave. Though it was difficult to part with what may have been the best weekend ever, I know for a fact that if I ever go back to Chicago, the Affinia is my #1 hotel choice. Special thanks to Peter at the Front Desk & Joel at Valet. And all of the Affinia staff who made me & my group the happiest tourists in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: ebferris
Reviews.Content: Our stay during Thanksgiving week, 2010 was perfect in every way. Extremely courteous and helpful staff, very comfortable and spacious suite, first class restaurant and bar and wonderful location on Superior just behind Neiman-Marcus. We have recommended the Affinia to our friends and are anxious to plan another Chicago trip and another stay at the Affinia.

Reviews.Title: “Most attentive staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: vderickson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, very modern looking and our room was pretty cool. The best thing about this hotel though, is the staff. Everyone was so nice and helpful. I have never had a better customer service experience in my life. They treated us like we were the most important guests there. Would definitely go back. Only complaint... no free internet. In this day and age there's no reason for that!

Reviews.Title: “The Affinia is a relaxed comfortable hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: JosephMI
Reviews.Content: We live in Michigan and my wife is from IL so we often stay in the City on our way to or from the in-laws. We have stayed in almost every 4star hotel in the Michigan Ave. area and the Affinia is right up there at the top. The room was spacious and comfortable, kids were not frowned on and the staff was super nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Hopetotravelmore
Reviews.Content: My family (self/husband/11-year old) were in a room overlooking Superior Ave this past weekend. Regular guest room with 2 double beds. Great room! Room was not available when we check in 12:30pm, but concierge held our bags until we checked back later in the evening and held them again after we checked out. Extremely comfortable bed/bedding, only heard one ambulance (we expected a little noise in the city, and it was more quiet than we expected). Friendly staff. Fabulous location...Gino's is right next door (ask concierge for a "skip to the front of the line" pass), steps away from Magnificent Mile. No further off Mag Mile than The Peninsula. Easy location for catching a cab or bus. We got a great rate and would stay again. Appreciated the in-room coffee maker and fridge. Note for staff/management: Room 1502 needs to have the backsplash for the bathroom sink replaced as it is damaged & reception for ESPN was poor on the tv (a big problem for the hubby).

Reviews.Title: “Our magnificent stay at The Affinia Hotel Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: momandthree
Reviews.Content: I was required to take a class that was being offered at Northwestern Memorial Hospital. I debated as to whether I would commute for the two days, or stay downtown for the duration of the class. My mother was suffering from a case of winter blues. She suggested we stay downtown together if we could find a hotel that would allow her to bring her dog (Jack, a very gentlemanly Boston Terrier). We found just what we needed in The Affinia Chicago hotel. The hotel is within a block of where my class was located. The room was lovely and comfortable. Service was outstanding, if we called the desk for anything, our needs were met within minutes. The staff was friendly and professional. Everyone one greeted us by name each time we met them. Jack seemed particularly delighted to be acknowledged by everyone each time I walked him through the lobby. Our dinner at the hotel restaurant was excellent in all aspects, atmosphere, service and quality of food. I regret that I am terrible with names, but I would like to commend the entire hotel staff for being so friendly and helpful during our stay. I highly recommend The Affinia Hotel Chicago for business and leisure travel!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buttonwoodwriter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second time on business, having previously visited with my family. I was delighted to find I once again had a huge room with a great view; the front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful and room service was able to deliver me a sandwich at 10pm. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Gem”
Reviews.Author: RichSGeneva_IL
Reviews.Content: found out about this hotel on the Today Show, they were featured as special pricing if you booked on Black Friday, after Thanksgiving. Booked a room that day for trip into the city to see Les Mis. Hotel was neat, clean and extremely friendly. Decorating everywhere was very contemprary, but comfortable. The lobby didn't look like much, but the room was really nice. A step down from the foyer into the main area gave it a much more spacious feel. The businessman's desk was on the upper portion, away from the bed. The lower area featured a very comfortable club chair, as opposed to the stiff, upright, "dining room" chairs you usually see. And, the flat screen TV was on an extendable swivel wall mount, so it could be adjusted to view from anywhere. The restaurant seemed, from the menu, to be very ordinary. But, when we ate breakfast there (because of the 0 degree temperatures outdoors), it was anything but. Very good food, good presentation, and extraordinary taste. Also, don't miss the 29th floor bar/lounge. Great view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Sleek”
Reviews.Author: SF_egret
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. It was kind of like Virgin America if Virgin America was a hotel. I liked: my two-level room with up-close views of downtown Chicago skyscrapers; the cool orange foil wallpaper and big round glowing mirror in the bathroom and the fancy soaps and shampoos; having my own little makeup counter with a closeup mirror; the huge mirrors around the room and the comfy bed with the white duvet and silver lame headboard; the very informative information about what to do while in Chicago, and the 1/2 off deal we got at the Museum of Contemporary Art. The concierge was super-helpful and helped us with our every need. The location was great for conducting business downtown. The fitness room was large and super-clean and well-equipped. Wanted to go to the restaurant, but did not have time. Did not like: the little ottoman by my window had some big obvious stains on it. The windows were not double-paned--and not airtight! I had to blast the heat and close the insulated blinds to keep it warm enough,which did not seem very eco-friendly, although it was nice that one had the option of opening the windows. I did not like the extra charge for the wifi. Oh, yeah, and I was told to check out the rooftop bar, but found that it was closed when I went up there. Overall, however, this place was very affordable and fun and elegant. It is right by the Miracle Mile, so it is just hopping with high-end shoppers. It is also close to Northwestern Memorial Hospital and affiliated medical school.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be when stuck in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: justmeintexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Affinia on a weekend trip. The location was excellent; it couldn't get much better! The rooms were decent sized, and well taken care of. The original room we stayed in had a wonderful open view to the front, but the shade was broken and partially pulled down. We asked for another room, and we were relocated across the hall. The view in this room was of the Hancock Tower, but there were lots of nearby buildings, so I felt a bit claustrophobic. Our return flight was cancelled due to snow, and we had to stay another night. The front desk was very helpful, and gave us a great rate! This is a no-frills, clean and modern hotel. I highly recommend it- just on location alone. Oh, and I forgot to mention that it is right next door to Gino's East. Very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CoopJen
Reviews.Content: July 2006! My husband and I decided to visit Chicago for the first time to celebrate our 7th Wedding Anniversary. I found the Affinia Chicago hotel by doing several online searches and reading Tripp Advisor. We wanted to stay in a nice hotel that was within walking distance to "stuff". This hotel fit the bill. First off, it is a very quaint hotel with charm. We told them we were their celebrating our anniversary and they upgraded our room at no charge. The room was HUGE and the bed was super compfy! We really liked the little bar/resturant downstairs. It had real character and the food was good! We walked a lot but also took our car to places. We had the famous Chicago pizza and ate at the House of Blues. We saw the famous fountain (from married with children) and lots of other stuff. All in all a great time! One thing I wish we could have done was the Seguey Chicago. We saw groups of tolks on those machines all around the city. That looked like a fun tour for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on a busy schedule”
Reviews.Author: CoryChevalier
Reviews.Content: This is truly a wonderful hotel. I've stayed there several times on my interview trail and always a comfortable stay in a great hotel room with the best staff and attention to my needs than any other hotel I've been to this year. Thank you for the great stay, pillow selection, and exercise kits

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - great location, price and room”
Reviews.Author: mike1011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night. Great location, spacious and beautiful room. We enjoyed a drink on the rooftop bar and dinner at the C-house restaurant. The room price was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and stay”
Reviews.Author: MKEMike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Affinia for 3 nights. We used their website to book the trip, they had a pricing guarantee and an option to upgrade for $9 per night. We got a Junior Suite. The room was very good size and very clean. Bed was comfortable. Pros: location, location, location; just a block off Michigan Ave. Excellent concierge service especially from Joel. Cons: Ambulance sirens sound (located across from hospital and only 2 elevators serving our floor was slow a couple of times - nothing serious. A short cab ride to the Apollo theater where we saw Million Dollar Quartet - highly recommend. Also, visited a pub called Timothy O'Tooles a few blocks from the hotel, good food and a great place to watch the football games. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Washburns
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel near the Northwestern Hospital Complex. The rate looked so good for the area I was very concerned. I need not have worried. The hotel is spectacular and the location couldn't be better. The hotel is located within a block of the Prentice Women's hospital, and right next to Gino's East one of the best of the Chicago Pizza spots. It is also a block from the heart of Michigan Avenue. The room is large and recently redecorated. The housekeeping is extremely good. This is a city hotel. There is certainly some street noise. We were on the 19th floor and it was never objectionable. Might be an issue on the lower floors. The heating unit is above average in noise. The regular rooms looked to be small, we chose a suite for the extra room and for the small extra charge, consider it to be a good decision. The first floor restaurant is rated one of the better in the City. The Chef was one of the winners on the Top Chef TV show. Hotel guests get a 20% discount. Overall an outstanding value on an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: swim58
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in early January 2011. Opted for a suite and the difference is cost was a bargain for all of the space. I realized the room was extremely clean when my husband called me into the bathroom to show how spotless the corners of the room were....white tile no less. The front desk was attentive to our smallest requests. We visit downtown Chicago every January, and with so many hotels to choose from this was by far our favorite. Thank you Affinia! Tip: If you are on a budget and come by personal auto, you can save $8.00 per night parking yourself in the convenient public garage across the street

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tomf49
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. Great location and a very helpful staff. The doorman, Daniel, was especially helpful pointing out restaurants nearby. Our room was spacious, clean, and will decorated. We will be staying at the Affinia on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: autie11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate a significant anniversary. We were pleasantly surprised to find that we had been upgraded to an exec room with a lovely view. The location is wonderful for shopping. All the staff were unfailingly pleasant. The only issue we had was that the heating system is quite loud and it took a little while to get used to. The in-house restaurant is very good and it was very nice to go there and not have to brave the cold Jan winds. Will definitely recommend Affinia.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and fair value”
Reviews.Author: cklim49
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very convenient to the downtown shopping cord, and restaurants. Plus, a 24hrs Walgreen is just around the corner from the hotel. Best of all, we felt safe walking around the neighbour during the evening. The room we got was very clean and modern. However, the heater and air vent noise was a huge drawback; it was very loud and kept us awake certain point at night. Will I stay at Affinia Chicago hotel again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Ash_51108
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in one of Affinia's suites and was very impressed when we walked in! The pictures do this hotel no justice! Very spatious and clean. The layout of the room was impressive as well. Check in went very smoothly and all staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I did have one incident in my room involving my curlers blowing up in my face...sparks and all. I called managment and they sent an engineer and hotel manager up right away to investigate. It turned out that it was the curlers that were in its last leg and not the hotel's fault. They actually took 50 dollars off of that night's stay and they didn't have to do that at all! I do have to add that we used the online conceirge service and ordered rose pedals to be sent to our room. We received a confirmation email and everything but they never arrived and we were never charged. This incident was the only "con" about this hotel. Affinia is only a block away from the Magnificent Mile...perfect! I also like how it was a Walgreens right around the corner, very convenient. If you want to experience luxury with a trendy twist make sure you choose Affinia. I WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: ducacj
Reviews.Content: My mother came into town to see doctors at Northwestern Hospital and we looked for a hotel that was close. We were very impressed with Affinia. It was affordable, a great location for both the hospital and shopping. When she needed to be seen again in 2 days we opted to keep the room and stay in the city. Brought my two children in to stay with us and we enjoyed the stay. The only noise you do hear in road noise we never heard anything from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fun on N Michigan Ave, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisD
Reviews.Content: I really recommend the Affinia Hotel on Superior off of N Michigan Ave, in downtown Chicago. Clean and very nice and helpfull staff. Downtown shopping and fun is great. Location is near museums etc;.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service location and decor will bring me back here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been so accomodating and service oriented. Here on business for 4 days and they allowed early check in, late housekeeping service and even charged my I phone. I seek out boutique properties whenever I travel and the Affinia is simply delightful. I will certainly be back with my husband. only flaw is that they did not deliver the requested pillow and walking tour I requested on line.....

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: claudine88
Reviews.Content: the hotel by itself was Okay. Location is a plus. Clean and amiable staff. The only thing we did not like was how LOUD the heating system was. It woke me up each time the fan went on! Had we not have that problem there would no complain really. It is not very expensive hotel considering its location. I would recommend this hotel to my friends as long as they would be warned about the VERY noisy heating system...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff with good location just off Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: TouringLawyer
Reviews.Content: Booked at the Affinia since our usual hotel was unavailable. The hotel is a boutique style property (looks very much an older mid-level hotel that has been redecorated in a riff on the W chain). The room was fine for the price point with good bathroom amenities and a large LCD television with so-so reception although, as others have noted, the heating/AC system was hard to keep at a constant temperature, The staff, from the front desk to the bartenders at the roof top bar, are very friendly. The hotel does lack a dedicated terminal to print boarding passes (must be done at the front desk or, at a cost, at the business center--although, again, the front desk staff was very helpful). The hotel adjoins Neiman-Marcus a half a block from Michigan Avenue. The public spaces and elevators are functional rather than luxurious, but in keeping with the moderate price point. Depending on availability at our usual hotel (and the prevailing price at the Affinia). I'd likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia Chicago-The place to stay in the windy city!”
Reviews.Author: Mkohanski
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago on business at least bi-monthly. The Affinia is always my hotel of choice. The location is perfect, the rooms are spacious and modern, the roof top bar is an oasis, C-House Restaurant is fantastic, and most of all the staff is outstanding. The Bell Man welcomes me by name, the front desk is efficient and accomodating, the servers are terrific and everyone goes above and beyond to ensure I have an enjoyable stay. I reccommend this hotel with great enthuisiam. It truly is my home away from home in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Bad points outweigh the good points? or vice versa? still unsure....”
Reviews.Author: lisaequi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as its reviews and standards looked high and it was very central. The reason for our trip was a surprise for my husbands 40th birthday. On arrival to the hotel, we were pleasantly greeted and helped with our luggage then excited to reception. Now when we got there, and i realise this is more the fault of the travel agent, we were told we needed to leave a credit card as "security". I dont have a credit card. So they said i could leave cash to the amount of $50 a day. We came on this trip on a budget so tried to explain and ended up having to leave $100 at the front desk, This was still a hefty amount from our budget. The room was spotless and the service from the cleaning/room staff was impecable. (although i do reiterate the feelings of a fellow trip advisor about the sheets on the bed) Although we soon realised that we hadnt received our welcome pack (ipod walking tour) pillow selections etc. We also werent told about the bar, opening times of restaurant and bar, fitness centre etc so ended up just wandering and finding things ourselves. When it came to the end of our trip, i went to reception to see if they could help with our bookings for airport express and also our bookin in for flights. One of the staff (Mike im sure his name was) seemed to be slightly .........annoyed and put out by doing this. When he was on the phone to the express transport people he spoke as if i wasnt there and some sort of second class citizen "i have someone here who THINKS she has a booking, but she has no information so i dont know" and "well she says she has a booking but no references" He then got me a booking reference, (which i had explained i had on my ticket) I then left the desk as didn not want to put him out further with the whole flight booking thing to. I came back to the desk and had a VERY VERY NICE gentleman called Jeff who was more than helpful and went out of his way to be nice. This man deserves praise!!!! I then avoided the front desk when i saw Mike as i felt that he had belittled my and didnt not want that experience repeated. When it came to checking out - the lady on the desk said they would send someone to check the mini bar then refund out $100. fine i thought. Then i was told i was being charged just over $24 for a bottle of wine i hadnt drunk!!! we said we had used nothing at all and then they went a second time to inspect the room and FOUND the bottle of wine , makes you think what if someone doesnt check their bill? All in all, a good room, some very nice staff, some very not so nice staff. But purely because of the staff im unsure as if i would stay there again. The area is great, lots of great eating places, and jakes down the road is VERY worth a visit!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Off by Just Enough”
Reviews.Author: PAMinNY
Reviews.Content: For me, beds and bedding are important and at the Affinia the bedding was short. I mean literally short. I am just under 6' so not impressively tall but the sheets did not reach the end of the bed. They also use a practice I am unfond of, using a flat sheet for a fitted sheet. When untucking the top sheet the bottom sheet is also undone and before you know it you are sleeping directly on the matress. I don't like that. They advertise a rooftop bar. Good view but the place is shabby and the cocktails are strange and way overpriced for the venue. It could use a remodel of both the specialty drink menu an decor. By the way, what's with the metal coffee table in room 2806? Are you expecting people not to put their feet up? With the many choices in the area, they need to do a little better because it's the little things that keep me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: pinkypassat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of July on a 'girly' holiday for 4 nights. I thought this hotel was fantastic, rooms and bathrooms were large and spacious and very clean. Hotel was literally only a few steps away from the Magnificent mile for all the shopping! The beach and lake is about a 10 mins walk away. Although we did'nt have breakfast here there are plenty of cafes/restaurants around the block where you can get a lovely breakfast for a few dollars. If I was to visit Chicago again I would stay here..

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern looking, great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: SusanK88
Reviews.Content: Loved our room. Spacious & modern looking. Very big bathroom...loved the large, glassed-in shower. Great location, just off Michigan Avenue. Staff were friendly and helpful (especially Kristin B.). Room was always just the right temperature and beds were very comfy. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Affinia Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWithS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Affinia Chicago very much. It is in a terrific location, right off of North Michigan Ave and close to shopping and restaurants. It's also just a few blocks from Lake Michigan. Our junior suite was very spacious and well-appointed with a super-comfortable king bed. We really liked the roof-top bar for appetizers and wine. Room service breakfast was very good, too. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pillows”
Reviews.Author: annyong1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Upon check-in, we were greeted by friendly staff. Rooms were clean and modern, and relatively spacious for a downtown hotel. The pillow menu is a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: luvntravel20
Reviews.Content: The Affinia Hotel was a perfect hotel for a girls getaway! The location is ideal - near mag. mile shopping. The roof top bar is great as well. I would recommend to anyone and everyone! Thanks for the hospitality :)

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: John-PaulJones
Reviews.Content: My group and I took several rooms for the NeoCon convention this June. We were all pleased at the reasonable prices, the condition of the property and the friendliness of the staff. The Affinia gets first call anytime we return to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cjkWI
Reviews.Content: We stay here once every winter for a night getaway with the kids in the city. This hotel is outstanding. Great location, next to Gino's East and within walking distance to everything you want to do!! We love more every year and the kids really look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and professional”
Reviews.Author: CapnJake
Reviews.Content: My vocal group recently performed at the Pepsi Tall Ships Chicago 2010 event in August. While in town we stayed at this excellent hotel. We had a very professional and warm greeting, were given outstanding accommodations that were perfectly presented, immaculately clean and spoke clearly of how hip it is to stay in the heart of one of the best cities in the world. The upstairs bar was gorgeous, the restaurant was top-quality, the fitness room, while spartan, had everything the road warrior could need. Only the absence of a pool was noticed, but with all of the other things available to do it was hardly missed. I highly recommend the Affinia Chicago. (Note that using US Cellular the 411 directory service could not identify this hotel under any spelling of the name!)

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Visit”
Reviews.Author: JohnG03
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 50th Wedding Anniversity by returning to Chicago and staying at the Affinia. We were joined by our two sons and their families. Altogether we had three rooms and our experience was outstanding. Beautiful rooms, a superior staff, world class housekeeping, and a prime location make this hotel a must for visitors to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: cwlemon
Reviews.Content: On our recent stay we were completely surprised at the spacious, very clean and up-to-date rooms. The outstanding staff made our stay ease-filled and extremely pleasant. This is an excellent location for anyone visiting Chicago. We could not have asked for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kev5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and all you would expect from a 4* hotel.The hotel rooms were large and comfortable with a high standard of cleanliness. The service was friendly but not overwhelming and all requests met with no fuss. Great restaurant and bar facilities. fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gonna and gotta be honest”
Reviews.Author: Sluggo16
Reviews.Content: I read T.A. reviews alot when it comes to helping me make decisions about where I stay and that is how I chose Affinia. So, here we go....My wife, myself, and 5 others stayed from Oct. 11-15 for the Marathon. Affinia is nicely located less than a block off of Magnificent Mile. So good spot for shopping. Ginos East next door, and Corner Bakery not far away. Staff were pleasant but I was surprised by some of the staff at the front desk at how they didn't know the answers to some location questions that someone in that role needs to know. The bell staff were very friendly, and quite frankly more helpful; especially Joel who was very engaging and kindly remembered our name everytime he saw us. The amenities were just fine; the beds and pillows comfortable though not quiet, the bathrooms quite funky and very sizeable. There are some dissapointments however. Firstly, and no fault of the hotel is their location. One is temporary, the other not. The building next door is under construction, so nice and early each morning there was a great deal of noise. I didnt know that the legal time to begin was 6:30, 'cause thats when they started.....also if your room faces E. Superior you will be serenaded by ambulances all night long, especially weekends as the hospital is right at the corner. Big city life......Now the real dissapointment that did leave a bad taste in our mouth. On the weekend a couple of us went up to C-View, the rooftop bar for a night-cap. It was very lively. On Monday night I wanted to spend a little alone time up there for a late night cocktail and to enjoy the view with my wife. We got to the door to the patio and were immediately approached by a sever who told us that the patio was closed, that it closes at 11 p.m. (it was 11:06) and that they were just trying to clear things up. (it didnt seem like the other 7-8 people seated comfortably were going anywhere soon). We walked inside and were passed by another server who said hello and continued to walk by without asking us if we wanted a beverage. It was clear by all of the candles on the tables burnt (or blown out) that they were hoping to go home, and soon. While it didnt ruin the weekend thankfully, it would have been great end to have had a celebratory cocktail with my wife who ran the marathon the day before and enjoy a really nice view. Management really has to understand how something simple like a poor attitude and poor ambassadorship by staff can make a customer think of going elsewhere in the future. Overall a decent place to stay but I am certain there are better. Thanks for reading. Just so everyone knows, I could not recommend this hotel to a friend if their room faces E. Superior because of the ambulance racket.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Innvillas
Reviews.Content: We returned from our trip on 10/11/10. All of us loved this hotel. The staff was helpful with directions, cabs, service in general. Our rooms and the decor was on the money. Sharp!!!! We all would recommend this hotel to others. Great location. Jim, Nancy, Jim & Mary Ellen

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fizzengland
Reviews.Content: stayed for four nights a few weeks ago, reviews on trip adviser are correct, the location of this hotel cannot be beaten, a minuites walk from the Mag mile, centre of everything, so on all usefull bus routes to anywhere u need to go, frew mins walk from the EL, train, great food court 5 mins away, a contemp boutique hotel, well maintained, we were celebrating so we were upgraded to a suite, very nice, excellent housekeeping staff, lovely rooftop bar .When we were there the front of house staff were not the most welcoming but were acceptable, , we would have no hessitation in returning once again to the Affinia

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sabinesk
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time staying at Affinia in Chicago. The location was perfect, with Michigan Avenue just around the corner and so many restaurants in walking distance. It was our first night away from the kids since 2007, so we had very high expectations. The hotel looked great to us online and didn't disappoint when we were there. The design was modern and fresh, our room spacious and clean. It had a luxurious vibe to it, and I immediately felt that we had made the right choice. We started the night with a cocktail at their rooftop bar that provided a fabulous view of the city and got us into the mood for a fabulous date night. The beds were super comfortable and provided us with the much deserved and needed sleep. The only thing that disappointed was the shower, which didn't work properly. It took me 10 minutes to get it started: there was no water pressure in the beginning, but it eventually did work. All in all this was a minor issue within a wonderful stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: candj39
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure that this hotel would be great based on the photographs that I saw, however, it was simply wonderful. Friendly and hospitable staff, great rooms (one-bedroom suite), fabulous location, all contributed to a good value. My only peeve was that the only way to get ice was via room service. Maybe they could have put an ice machine every 5 floors or so? Other than that, our stay was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Buttonwoodwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August and couldn't have been more pleased. The room was spacious with a great view of the city, the staff was helpful, and the price very reasonable. The only issue was the wait for the elevator but one was out of order. And we were more than compensated by a free trolley ride to the pier It was my kids' favourite hotel ever

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: deedaoz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the end of September. The room was huge and very pleasantly decorated. The beds were unbelievably comfortable, I haven't slept so well in a hotel. I was on the 3rd floor and was a little worried about sirens with the hospital right next door. I'm a fairly light sleeper and I can honestly say, I hardly heard them at all. Although I didn't eat dinner in the C-View restaurant, I did have breakfast there twice and it was a very reasonably priced breakfast for a hotel of this standard. I was most impressed. Service was excellent - when I arrived there was no iron in my room. I requested one the next morning and by the time I returned from breakfast, there was an iron waiting for me. My only complaint is to echo what others have said about no free wifi. If it had been available, I probably would have eaten more breakfasts at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, roomy and clean suite, nice rooftop bar but no free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: sportsfanHerts_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a studio suite. It was a large room on the 28th floor with a good city view. The rooftop bar, C-view, was stylish and and comfortable. It was what we expected of a hotel charging these rates. The location was good, within easy reach of the magnificent mile and transport links. We would have expected free wifi as that seems to be fairly standard these days...but this hotel charged. We ended up using the free wfi in the watertower place shopping centre and the library/ tourist office instead.

Reviews.Title: “The frosting on the cake to our Chicago vacation”
Reviews.Author: platycodon
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location! I always felt safe walking around, even late at night, and the hotel is in the heart of the buzzing downtown area. Very short walk to the el and buses for anything not within walking distance, and cabs are everywhere. Took a cab most of the way back after a show at the United Center and it was only 10 bucks. Staff was all so friendly but it never seemed forced, honestly everyone in Chicago was wonderful! Nice to see this in a large city. The hotel felt very laid back, but modern and sophisticated at the same time. Large comfortable room. I would stay there again in a heartbeat if I ever go back to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Service & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LeighHolford
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio room and when checked in received an incredible view of the city from the 26th floor. The room was spacious, light and very clean. Waking up with the city views every morning was great and despite being so close to the centre of the city, the noise was not bad at all. The location is great as you' are only one block away from the Magnificent Mile and a number of good restaurants. The service from front of house staff and cleaning staff was excellent throughout and it felt that they were willing to accomodate any request. The restaurant on the ground floor looked very good and I think we will try this when we return. Additionally the C-View bar on the 29th floor was nice although we were lucky with some good weather. Generally, I thought it was a wonderful stay with great value for money and would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone who is interested in a trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary chic - great location - unbelievable value”
Reviews.Author: eroberton
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot with business and was pleasantly surprised by the huge contemporary rooms at the Affinia. Other colleagues who couldn't get into Affinia stayed at the Sofitel down the road and thought they had the better deal until they saw the rooms here - at a lower price! The location is key. It's right in the middle of town with Michigan Ave with all the major stores 1 block away. The apple store is 2 blocks away which was very handy. There is a small gym but with the lake 2 blocks away with it's amazing running/walking path, who needs a treadmill. The 'el' train are a short walk away also. The carpark opposite was extremely convenient. The room was set over two levels with the front door opening to an 'office' area with nice sized desk, chair, writing materials, desk lamp and phone - and enough power outlets to charge up the army of gadgets that follow me wherever I go. Thank you Affinia for putting them at desk height so I didn't have to scramble about on the floor by the bed! A very comfortable working experience. 3 steps down the room opened into a large space. One side had a 3 seater sofa, armchair and contemporary ottoman the left side - where I held meetings with 2-3 other colleagues over the duration of my stay. The room also had a 42" plasma TV that we could hook up to our laptops from the sofa. Staff were very friendly. Gave us great restaurant recommendations and helped with faxing documents with no fuss or charge. Check out was painless with the paperwork and final check mailed to me. Beds were wonderful, ordered a tempurpedic pillow from their 'pillow menu' which arrived in less than 3 mins. Breakfast was 1 min early and piping hot. Rooms had an iron/ironing board and hairdryer. Travel essentials for biz trips. A nice surprise was the ultra cool rooftop bar (that served great cocktails) with a view to die for. Try the fish taco bites - sashimi heaven! Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Several Floors of Heaven In Chi-Town”
Reviews.Author: Xes
Reviews.Content: I was surrounded by elegance and charm as the uniformed doorman opened my car door and I stepped out of my car, just one block off of The Magnificent Mile. But it was the four star+ rating that each and every staff member earnestly presented that made me know this was going to be a great place. The rooms were Retro-Elegant. Every corner was cleaned and polished. The beds were like floating on clouds, even though I weight 275 pounds. There is also a selection of pillows to choose from. Heat and AC controls worked exceptionally well. The TV was a high quality flat screen, easily adjusted to be seen while in bed or while in the seating area. The closets were lit as well as special lighting for the dressing table. The bath was fabulous beyond words. As it is said in the real estate business, location-location-location is the key!!! A smorgasbord of places to eat, places to shop, places to explore, places of entertainment, places with bird's-eye-views, and places just to sit and watch the enormous diversity of the natives and tourists.
