The in-house bar/saloon and restaurant are fabulous. You can tell that Affinia wants you to return.

Reviews.Title: “The best visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CHess66_10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Affinia Chicago in March 2010. It was an awesome stay. The Hotel was great and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was way more than expected, very modern, roomy and the most comfortable beds and pillows. The location was the best, right off Michigan Ave. and within walking distance to every place we wanted to go. We will be back, and have told our friends about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: LMYG1985
Reviews.Content: The Affinia Hotel was definitely a one of a kind experience. Modern decor, friendly service and a great restaurant not to mention walking distance to shopping. I recommend it to anyone! Its so diverse that you can have a great time with family or a romantic getaway for two.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: sassbo
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for Business and was booked by our vendor. What I lovely surprise! I loved the Affinia Chicago. Wonderful rooms, amazing location, and how about that rooftop bar! Highly Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - location and stay”
Reviews.Author: PS123BayArea
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Great location and stay - great service too

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zoetsa_
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Affinia for 3 nights during our visit to Chicago and I must say that we were not pleased! I initially chose stay at the Affinia because of the good reviews , price and the nice photos on their website. The pictures online make the rooms look bright, clean and fresh. In reality the room we stayed in was dingy and smelt musky and mouldy. The first night when I lifted the comforter to get into the bed I noticed a large stain on the bed sheet. On the last day there while bathing my kids in the bathtub I notice that the water was slightly green and I had to immediately take my kids out. The people working at the front desk were not very friendly which didn't help in the aura of this experience either. Also- the parking is Valet here and is $48 a day here plus tips so it is very costly. I wouldn't recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: antonia76
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the affinia chicago over labor day weekend, meeting up with extended family. i had heard good reviews from friends who've stayed here before. it is aesthetically attractive, but if you look closer, in our bathroom ttub/shower area where the soap dish usually is in the wall was totally duct taped! they said they were waiting for a replacement. also, the bathroom sink would not drain properly and the backsplash of the bathroom counter was cracked and there was water damage. i thought the room was "okay" very contemporary, which is nice, and the bed was comfortable, but felt the room could have been cleaned better, very dusty. also, a BIG thing was all the sirens at night - it's right next to a large medical center. also, they need to have coffee available in their lobby area. we got up at 6:45 one morning and went down to get coffee and the manager said that they were just getting into the kitchen to make it! most places have it ready at 6a.m. although the staff at the front desk was very nice and helpful, i don't think i'll be staying there again anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Lesslyn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, I wouldn't go so far as to say great, but it has value for the money spent. The room toiletries were said to be Aveda, and were not. Our shower didn't drain properly and the room air conditioning continually went from fuil blast to not on at all. The location was right in the centre of the Magnificent Mile, so that was convenient and easy to find. The staff were incredibly helpful and courteous. I did not mind my stay at the Affinia, but would probably choose a different hotel next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: coxy80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia for three nights in August. The Affinia is in a great location just round the corner from North Michigan Ave, where there are tons of shops, restarants. Very friendly check in with Andre, he was very informative & helpful. Rooms are huge! The bathroom is also, we were amazed which how much space we had. Rooms nicely decorated & even though there was a pillow menu we were both more than happy with the pillows we had. The only down sides to the room was the view. We had a view of the ally & the biffa bins which was a dissapointment, especially on the third night when they were emptied at about 3am! Also the air con even when switched off was noisy which meant we keept waking up. We couldn't hear anyone else in the others rooms though so it was well soundproofed in that way. Could hear sirens but not that loud but we do live near a main road so maybe we're just used to them. Lifts were a little slow but not a problem. Asked reception for a voucher to Gino's East a pizza place next door which had huge que & it meant that we could jump the que & have free breadsticks too. We also used the roof top bar which had great cocktails & a great view of the city. Overall we really liked the hotel if it wasn't for the noisy air con it would of got 5/5. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: VLLVBelgium
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed in the Affinia Chicago with my family. I chose the hotel because of the reviews I found on Trip Advisor so thanks to all those who reviewed the hotel before. I have to say we were very happy with the hotel. I had booked a room with 2 queen beds but when we arrived we decided to take the upgrade offered for $30 per day to a bigger room which was more like a mini-suite. The room size was good and we appreciated having the extra space. It is just a pity that our two teenage daughters then had to sleep on the sofa which converted into a bed. It was comfortable but it meant that we couldn't use the sofa. The main bed in the room was very comfortable. Concerning the pillow menu I have to say I wad disappointed. I had read lots about it but no-one ever asked us which pillows we would like to have. The pillows we received were fine and to be honest I was too busy out and about to worry about it too much but I thought given that the hotel promotes this they would have made more of an effort to check with us. The airco could do with being a bit quieter too. For me the best thing about this hotel is its location. It really worked for us especially when we needed to drop back with shopping bags. Gino's pizza restaurant nextdoor was also a bonus and I would recomment it. Also if you want a good breakfeast I would recomment the Westegg diner. Ask the receptionist for directions.

Reviews.Title: “great location in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: aerolosangeles
Reviews.Content: We loved the Affinia. We had such a great deal on the room, $140 a night, and it felt like a bargain. The rooms are comfortable and clean, and the location is fabulous. Just 1/2 a block from Michigan, enough to be quiet. Do be aware that parking is almost $50 a night, but you can definitely do without a car in this city. The Cview restaurant was terrific, interesting food, but also satisfying. One small snafu, the first night we were there they had a private party on the rooftop bar, which seems unfair to hotel patrons. That said, the rooftop bar is pretty awesome. The view is definitely in the skyscrapers, not the lake, but cool nonetheless. We go to Chicago frequently, and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chsmith
Reviews.Content: I flew into Chicago at the end of July for a one-night stay to attend a wedding. The bride had arranged for a discounted room block at the Affinia so after checking out the reviews on Tripadvisor I booked an upgraded room for $170. I got an email from the concierge a few days later with requests for personalizing the room (pillow type, toiletries, etc) and everything I requested was in the room when I arrived. The best thing about the Affinia is its great location near the Magnificent Mile. Check-in/out was easy, room service was tasty and prompt (and didn't break the bank). My room was large and clean with a desk, flat screen t.v., minibar, king bed and couch. One thing I didn't appreciate was that the Affinia charges for the use of their umbrellas. Considering how Chicago was having major rain and thunderstorms during my visit, I found the fee ridiculous. Why should I have to pay to use an umbrella that I'm going to return in one piece? I can see charging guests if they lose or break it but I hardly think that was going to happen on my run to and from the cab. Aside from that I would stay at the Affinia again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Traveller81
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, its in a great location to sight see, the people at the front desk are really helpful, and the room are spacious. The bar on the roof is definitely worth a visit, it has fantastic views of the city! Yes the lifts (elevators) are quite slow, but that's really not a huge deal. We love the pillow selection! The value for money is excellent and there is a lot around like the amazing shops or some great restuarants in walking distance. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a top notch hotel at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “INTIMATE AND FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: HELENYPOOH
Reviews.Content: I asked Priceline to pick a Chicago hotel for me. They had always done well by me before, usually giving me a Wyndham. But this time I was concerned, that I had never heard the name Affinia before. Well, Priceline did it again.....this is the friendliest hotel I 've ever been in. The entire staff, from the desk clerks to the cleaning ladies, were as kind and helpful as could be. Each night, as I returned from my day of touring activities, I would give an acccount to the night desk clerk, and he listened with great enthusiasim. Since I travel alone and have no one in the room to chat with, I greatly appreciated this. The hotel is ideally located....right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile ! Next door is Neiman-Marcus, and across the street is Tiffanys, Sak's Fifth Avenue, and Lord & Taylor. Ladies, does it get any better than this ?? The hotel does not have much in the way of amenities....no gift shop, no way to buy snacks & sundries, no pool, no ice machines on the floors. However, if you call room service, they will bring a bucket of ice within 10 minutes . And around the corner is a Waldgreens for any snack or sundry you may need. My room, # 708, was powerfully air conditioned, and the bed extremely comfortable. I highly recommend the Affinia for comfort and location

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, huge beds, bathroom = heaven.”
Reviews.Author: alohomora713
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose this hotel on a recommendation from my partner who found it on AerLingusHotels.com which was giving an amazing rate at the time. The hotel is located directly off Michigan Avenue on the wonderfully named Superior Street. The lobby is huge, high ceilings, marble floors, with attentive doorman and friendly welcoming front desk staff. The lady was very pleasant and chatty and gave us a lovely introduction to the hotel and the city. Our room was on the 6th floor and was very large for a basic twin room. Two huge King size beds with lots of comfortable cushions and pillows. There was an extensive pillow menu to choose from also, but the ones provided were excellent. One entire wall of the room was the window, looking out right down the city block with amazing views of the city's sky scrapers to the south. The room was always bright and clean and with all the space, it was a joy to relax in after a long day strolling around the city. The bathroom is undeniably the best I've ever had in a hotel room. Including staying in suites at 5 star European hotels. The room is long, with plenty of space and a huge, walk in shower, that was almost the size of a normal entire bathroom in most hotels. The washbasin and mirror are a design feature alone. A massive circular mirror with it's own light regulation feature ensures you're never blinded or pasty, as one appears in most fluorescent lit hotel bathrooms. Indeed, all the lights in the bathroom (including INSIDE the shower) can be regulated from dimmer switches at the door. There's plenty of closet space, the desk is large and useful, there's also two ottomans that are handy for sitting on or laying your belongings on. Nearby the hotel is a small corner breakfast place called Pierre Gourmet's. If anyone was staying at this hotel or in the area, I would implore them to eat here. It's an amazing place, sit down, table service, beautiful selection of breakfast foods, with a dearth of choice of breads. Don't expect to find many bars nearby, my friend and I looked each night within walking distance and found none. Other nice food recommendations are the Ralph Lauren Grill which is at the corner of 115 E Chicago Ave, they do an amazing steak sandwich and have amazingly chic and interesting clientÃ¨le. For an evening meal we found Avec (615 w. Randolph) from the Wallpaper Guide and would go back in a heartbeat. Beautiful tapas style food, always hard to get a table, but really worth the wait outside.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: VittorioFrigo
Reviews.Content: Affinia is perfectly situated, next to Chicago "golden mile". The room we got (706) is spacious and fully furnished. Beautiful bathroom. The Reception staff is very friendly and ery competent. The Bell Captain will find a taxi in 2 seconds. The adjacent "C" restaurant and the 29th floor lounge/bar are nice. What more? We'll go back next ime, and again and again! G. V. Frigo, Geneva, Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “The good points outweigh the bad.”
Reviews.Author: Mo_Caraher
Reviews.Content: For a boutique hotel in such a great location one expects to pay a little more than many other accommodation choices. This was our second stay at Affinia Chicago, so we knew pretty much what we were in store for and, again, we were prepared to pay a small premium for the greater level of service & comfort. We were delighted with everything on the first go-round, but we had a few less-than-sterling things occur on this trip. Good: Location -- within a chip shot of Michigan Ave, so right there in the thick of things yet away from the high traffic of the Magnificent Mile. The traffic on Superior St and St.Clair Ave is unusually high for narrow side streets but this was not a factor for us; we don't mind a little traffic noise but a light sleeper might struggle with that. Room Quality -- very good. Well appointed, reasonably fresh with nice furnishings. The washrooms are exceptional, actually. The bed & pillows are among the best I've had in any hotel. The TV was large (flat screen) and well positioned but I cannot speak for the picture quality or programming as we had it on for all of 2 minutes each morning to check the weather. Staff -- Generally good. The front desk staff are responsive & accommodating and the doormen are friendly enough (though it is still unclear to me why they have so many as they never seem to be doing very much). The not-so-good: Room Quality -- whilst the main part of the room was well maintained the window frames and blinds were filthy. The hotel was renovated within the last 3 or 4 years and I wonder if this area has been addressed since then. Also, the A/C or air exchanger ran constantly the entire time we were there. That, in itself, was not a problem, as the temperature was comfortable and I kind of like the "white noise" at night, but I was curious about it. I popped the cover off the unit to see what the settings were and found that the filter within was completely full of dust -- not healthy and not efficient, and this may explain why the unit ran all the time. Staff -- One small beef -- the woman who handled our check was perfectly fine and even did us the courtesy of ensuring that a friend who was meeting us there would be staying on the same floor as us...BUT she put us off a bit by aggressively pushing a variety of tours (river cruises, bus excursions, Segway tours...) and kept adding "mention my name". We were left with the impression that her prime concern here was ensuring that her "considerations" from the tour operators would continue. Maybe that was not the case AT ALL, but that's the vibe we got. One BIG beef -- after cleaning our room the housekeeper neglected to close the door to our room! Nothing was taken while the door was left ajar but the potential for disaster was obviously very high. So, after such a perfect stay back in 2009 we were a *little* disappointed with a couple of small things and one potentially ruinous thing. We would still consider staying there again but would be open to exploring other options, too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel just off Magnificent Mile. Staff very friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: MacAroniSenior
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Affinia 21st and 22nd July with my wife and two daughters (20 and 16). Our rooms were large and the bed in each room was at least Queen size. Rooms were spotless and bathrooms were very nice. Air con was great as temperature was very hot outside during our stay. Hotel is located just off (ca 100 yards from) Magnificent Mile, and beside "best pizza place" in Chicago - Gino's East. Ask at Reception for priority pass as queue (line) for "ordinary customers" can be up to 90 minutes. Staff were very friendly and helpful. One minor glitch - internet via television in bedroom didn't work - fee was refunded immediately with an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and accommodations for a stressful visit!”
Reviews.Author: marysia444
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Affinia while I was taking the Illinois Bar Exam -- an extremely stressful exam. The hotel was sensitive to all of my needs including the need for everything around me to be as quiet as possible to having my lunch ready and waiting in the room when I came for lunch break. It was great! Very clean, VERY comfortable beds, and overall great value. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay at it again when I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: tjschlen
Reviews.Content: From the first greeting that I had at the front desk to the opening of the my cab by the bellhop as I left, everyone was super nice and friendly. They really seemed to be very genuine about customer service. Plus - the rooms are a nice size with plenty of amenities - fridge and plenty of snacks and the rooftop bar is very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone. Very quiet as well.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Best Western Ocean View Resort Seaside Oregon
Reviews.Title: “Great View but AC Not Up to Par”
Reviews.Author: Owner53
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend of July 23-24, 2010. The room was a studio suite on the 28th floor. terrific view. Beds were a little hard but the real problem is the Air Conditioning Unit. two of the three nights the AC did not properly cool the room making for an uncomfortable night of sleep. The maintenance people responded to our call after the first night but night #1 and #3 were not good. Given it was quite warm in Chicago over that weekend however, the AC worked fine 1 of 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome accomodations and service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne3657
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous and is only half a block from the Magnificent Mile and in the center of everything!! It was very clean and the staff was amazing!! Our room on the 16th floor had a wonderful view and the decor and the amenities were awesome! The staff went above and beyond to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. They made us feel very special. We can't wait to visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Never agian!!I should have stayed at the Blackstone!!”
Reviews.Author: slawson4
Reviews.Content: Affinia e-mailed me 7 times telling me they were looking forward to my stay; once would have been fine.I can not have feather pillows because of an allergy, so I requested hypo-allergenic ones. All of my welcome e-mails said they would have the pillows there ready for me. When we arrived I had feather pillows! It took them 2 times in and out of my room to get me the correct pillows. ( I was trying to grab a quick nap before a long meeting) My room had dust every where! My vent in the bathrrom looked like it hadn't been wiped down for months! When filling out my travel expenses I called and asked how much was parking and was told $46. When I checked out it was $48. I explained I was told 46, she argued with me and I left very unhappy because of $4 bucks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ens982
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate on this hotel through Travelzoo and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were very clean and the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful, from the minute we arrived until we got our car from the valet to leave. There is a noise factor at night since its so close to northwestern hospital, but we have a little travel fan that helps with that. The only complaint I have, is that we called room service to see if they would bring us 2 wine glasses and they never came. We just used the glasses in the room, no big deal. location was great as well. Will definitely stay again! Oh and the roof top bar was really nice :)

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: nje3006
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as a party of 5, 2 adults, 3 teens in 2 rooms for 3 nights. The staff were so friendly at all times, everything was faultless during our stay. Lovely roof top bar although it gets very busy on a Saturday night. The hotel was in walking distance to plenty of great places to eat. Some of the poor reviews sound like a different hotel, don't know what that's about but our stay was lovely and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rotten Luck........Great Staff..........Good Friends”
Reviews.Author: SMKindall
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a wedding with friends. We booked the last part of our trip through 1800hotels.com. We arrived at the Affinia in late morning of the 18th of July, 2010. We were shocked to learn our rooms had been cancelled by 1800hotels.com. We had already prepaid for the rooms. Yikes! When the staff learned of our trouble they went above and beyond to help us find a solution to the problem.They even tried to find us a different hotel close to the area we wanted to be in. We ended up staying at the Affinia in one giant room with two king beds. The room was above our expectations. We did cut our vacation short because of the snafu but it had nothing to do with the treatment we received at the Affinia. The management of the Affinia should be proud of the staff we encountered during our stay at their place of business. We we would recommend this hotel and it's staff to anyone. Our Best to the Staff of the Affinia SMKindall

Reviews.Title: “The only reason this awful hotel didn't ruin our week-end was because we refused to let it”
Reviews.Author: dftraveler2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight at the Affinia. Prior reviews led us to believe this was a quality hotel; not true. Since it was a very special occasion, and also because we were only staying overnight, we didn't let the shabbiness and poor service of the hotel ruin our weekend. However, this would have qualified as one of the poorest hotel experiences. I've ever had. First, the smells: The linens and pillows on our bed smelled moldy and mildewy. The odors were not mild, and I found it pretty repulsive. I couldn't wait to jump out of bed in the morning, to get away from the odors. Hard to sleep and certainly didn't want to be in the bed any longer than absolutely necessary. I didn't discover how disgusting the bed smelled until around midnight when we got into bed. At that point, I chose not to contact housekeeping because (a) I was exhausted, and (b) I didn't want to upset my husband, who had fallen immediately to sleep after a long day of sightseeing. Also, the bathroom smelled like vinegar. Perhaps this is the cleaning agent used by Affinia, but the odor should have dissipated over the course of our stay and it never did. Incidentally, the bathroom floor tiles and wallpaper looked like they had seen better days; not a well-maintained property. Second, the elevators: If you stay above the first few floors, there are only two elevators that run from ground level to the rooftop c-view bar. With so many floors to service, and so many people going up to the c-view bar on a saturday, these elevators took forever to come, and were often full they did. Annoying. Also, on one occasion, there were several bottles (water and soda) left in the elevator; clearly, the maintenance crew doesn't inspect and clean the common areas frequently. Finally, and perhaps the most disappointing was the service when we arrived. First, when we booked, we asked for as quiet a room as possible. The hotel is located near Northwestern Memorial Hospital. But, its proximity to Michigan Ave., and the lack of accomodations elsewhere (due to the Transformers movie filming and a big international convention taking place the same week-end), led us to stay here anyway. At check-in, the clerk noted our request, and said our room was quiet room since it was not "next to the elevators." When we arrived at our room, we discovered that we were across from the elevators. Obviously, she was technically correct that we weren't next to the elevators, but it was still so close (15-20 feet) that we could hear the elevator noise. Also, since it was a special occasion, we asked if we could upgrade. The disingenuous, snarky, condescending clerk told us that checking in early was an upgrade. Clearly, the woman has not travelled enough to know that in many quality hotels, this is a matter of routine, not exception. Pretty awful experience all the way around. Other reviewers must have very low expectations. Can't explain any of the good reviews otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever staff”
Reviews.Author: justin_wong
Reviews.Content: The location is superb. Off the Mag Mile and beside the stuffed pizzas of Gino's East. The staff is the best and most professional I've ever encountered. Everyone clamours over to help with your query or requests. In particular, we've had the pleasure to deal at length with Dora, Chris, Kristina and Shannan from the front desk. We asked a general question about the Cubs, and the next thing you know, two were on the computers trying to see if tickets are available, what the weather will be like, how to get there etc. There was no pressure to buy anything of course. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LouthLady
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel to stay in very clean & lovely modern rooms. Great location right off Michigan Avenue, only 2 blocks for the Water Tower place shopping centre, 2 blocks from my fav restaurant in America The Grand Lux Cafe (600 North Michigan Avenue at Ontario above Ann Taylor), Gino's East pizza right next door, close to beach â€“ 4 blocks, John Hancock centre â€“ 3 blocks. Would definitely stay here again. The only slight downside was the sirens we could hear even at 5 floors up in room 511, the back of the hotel may not be as bad though. That said it was not that bad, we did not ask to be moved or anything. Word of warning watch out when crossing the roads, Chicago drivers pay no attention to the red lights & continue to drive even when the green man is giving way to to pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “Just an Alright hotel, nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Peanutfly
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Chicago and we decided to stay at the Affinia for the location. Which it has a perfect location near the lakefront, shopping, subway is only a couple blocks away, TONS of places to eat.... but the hotel itself was just so-so. Now, the way we travel is to not spend a ton of money on a hotel (we only sleep there anyway) but to still spend enough to have nice accommodations. The bathrooms were clean, and there is a nice roof top bar. The things I didn't like about the hotel was when we were checking in we were rushed and the girl behind the counter was pre-occupied and unfriendly. She never looked at us once. Then, upon checking out we were again rushed, and when we looked over our bill, it says we should have gotten complimentary breakfast tickets- which we never got on check in. When we asked a manager about this, she just shrugged her shoulders as if to say "too late now". Very frustrating. We are not difficult, snoty people, and some of these things may seem silly to be upset about, but when you spend decent money to stay in a hotel, you kinda hope things turn out perfect. Which they did not at this hotel. Would I stay here again? No. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? If they got it for $100 a night, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: nessa_traveler
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here the night before a scheduled surgery at Prentice Women's Hospital. This hotel is 2 doors down from the hospital. Couldn't have gotten any closer. Very nice inside. Very friendly front desk people. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Not huge but just the right amount of space. Bed comfortable for a hotel. Fitness center is very nice. Again not huge, but equipment is the same as at my gym at home. Location is terrific as you are steps away from Miracle Mile and Hancock Tower (highly recommend Hancock from a previous trip!!) Best surprise is the terrific location combined with a price that couldn't be beat. Most every other hotel this close to everything would be much more expensive. Definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bluebutton17
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprise by this hotel both by location and decor. Cool, hip, and reminded me of a nice Vegas/W hotel style hotel. It's really modern and you can tell the rooms just had a major face-lift. (They smell new) The rooms are decent size and are very clean. I travel quite a bit for work and fun and my only complaints about this hotel were the elevators to get to up to your room were VERY slow, sometimes taking up to 5 minutes. It's also located right next to Northwestern medical center so there are constant ambulance sirens up and down the street. Probably not the best for a perfect night sleep. Asides from that, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as Advertised-no surprises”
Reviews.Author: coffeechik
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Expedia with not much lead time and got a pretty good deal. I was surprised at the low cost in such an exclusive area! So when we got there and the area was good and safe, the hotel looked exactly as it did in the photos we were relieved. Sometimes you read reviews and wonder if the person actually stayed in the same place as you. The person who said the beds weren't great? The bed was the THE single best bed I have EVER slept on in a hotel and the pull out couch was actually not too bad either. The room had some outside noise but so would any hotel next to a hospital - there are plenty of other hotels in the area which would have the same problem. I always use earplugs in a hotel anyway. We did not hear a single sound from other rooms or the hall. And the decor somewhat up to date? - it was trendy and fantastic. And also, not sure about other rooms but MINE had a mini bar - they all are supposed to. For the most part I found this a great hotel especially for the price. However, we did not find it ideal when travelling with kids. There are no 1 bedroom suites so there is no privacy and the TV swivels both ways but still everyone had to hear the same stuff. The coffee maker in our room did not work so we went out for coffee as hotel coffee is never very good anyway. They did have all that overpriced food and drinks in the room to buy including wine, yet there was no corkscrew or wine glasses. That means you have to call down for them and everytime you do that of course it costs money. Of course not much, but really they should be provided. No microwave either. The hotel has no free breakfast or free wifi(it's like $10 per DAY!) - go to Starbucks. I found that charge really steep. Free breakfast is handy for kids and every meal in CHicago is expensive so anything free would help. We loved the fact that when we joked with the front desk person when they asked us if there was anything they could do and I said we'd like a line pass for the HUGE line up outside Ginos East next door we were given a pass card and basically walked right in at dinner time when there was an hour wait outside! The rooftop bar was much smaller than in looked on the website and although the ambiance was nice, the outside part was closed, and the music was not really loud enough nor interesting enough. The drink prices were astounding for what was basically a boring evening. The housekeeping staff was good and very accommodating when we needed a late room clean. The room was always very clean but we were often short a couple of pillows and a sheet. I do not know what the pillow menu thing is but I know it involved calling down and again another charge. Seemed a little deceptive to me - I thought they would have special pillows in the room. The thing that really upset me was the night before we were to leave I could not figure out the alarm so I called for an early wake up call. This call never came and we just barely made our flight. If there had been any problems on the way we would have missed our flight. All in all, based on the room, location and price I would stay here again if I did not have my kids -($15.95 - to watch one series of TV shows for 90 minutes that are free at home!) If you have kids I would recommend somewhere with more child-friendly ammenities. But, without them, it is very good.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend this excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife for 11 nights during June. We both thought the hotel was excellent. Great location near to the Magnificant mile, close to the lakefront, and also not far to walk downtown (Millenium Park etc). The staff from the front door men, receptionists, bar staf and house keeping were all excellent. Receptionist were particulalry helpful with a couple of queries we had during our stay. We had a basic room but it was large, had a large bathroom, good facilities / amenities and was kept clean by housekeeping. We overlooked the front of the hote and therefore there was some noise from the road outside (ambulances) but it wasn't very loud and it didn't disturb our sleep. Hotel also has restaurant (which we didn't actually try), a small but well equipped gym and an excellent roof top bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean! Loved the...”
Reviews.Author: bethcrn
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean! Loved the shower....very roomy! The staff were friendly and helpful....espically the "door man"...I can't remember his name but he always remembered ours...and made us feel welcome everytime we returned to the hotel. Great location for walking the magnificant mile or to catch the double decker bus tour...which was a great way to get around town!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Chicago Stay”
Reviews.Author: The-Eur0pean
Reviews.Content: The Affinia Chicago is a decent stay for a trip to Chicago although with a slight warning sign. Now the good was: 1. The service, the staff were always helpful and we were always greeted with a smile, whether from the porter opening the door, getting the cab, whether the receptionist answering all our questions etc. All good and friendly. 2. The rooms are quite large and roomy and reasonably up to date. 3. Good adjoining restaurant (C-House by Markus Samuellson), with good staff. 4. Nice rooftop bar. 5. Excellent location. Good neighboorhood, next to the magnificent mile, next to a good deep pan pizza place, close to the lake. For the bad: 1. The worst was the sleep. The beds are not the best to start with. Second, the location, as this is next to the Northwestern Medical Uni, there are a fair amount of Ambulances driving through the adjoining streets, and therefore you should be prepared to be woken up frequently. The soundproofing is bad as well. The windows are not double glazing and therefore you can hear the ambulances like if you were on the street and we were on the higher floors! The door out to the corridor is for some reason of some sort of wood that lets all sounds through as well. If there is someone talking in the corridor, you will hear their every word. If someone loud lives in the room across the hall, you can again hear their every word. So, sound is the biggest problem here and due to it, I did not have a lot of sleep, even after long days sightseeing in Chicago and falling into bed every night, I was not able to get a good nights rest. After arriving home after the weekend, I needed sleep! 2. Two slow elevators for most of the Hotel. With a roof top bar that is open to the public, you can have a lot of traffic at the elevators to get back to your room. Plus the elevators are super slow which doesn't help. 3. No minibar! I am used to hotels of the same status as the Affinia having a minibar in the room. Would have been nice with a little fridge to store our water etc. I find minibars in most hotels I stay at and find them super useful, but not here. They even have loads of space to put one, but none were to be found. At the end of the day, I thought our stay was good and the staff left me with an overall good impression of the place and I would therefore probably recommend this hotel, but, I would recommend it to people who can sleep through anything!

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYABLE STAY!”
Reviews.Author: TTUALUM06
Reviews.Content: Booked super early and got a steal for $120 a night plus tax for 4th of July wknd. Beds were a bit firm, but besides that... enjoyed every minute of our stay. They offer a pillow menu with a variety of pillows to choose from should you desire a memory foam pillow, etc. Hotel is less than 10 mins walk to the "L" for easy access to/from Wrigley field, and to/from Midway airport. Its right next door to Gino's East pizza.... highly recommend grabbing a pizza there! Roof top bar was great place to kick back and have a few drinks. Waitresses were a bit snooty towards some customers as we heard them complaining about the "type of customers" they were getting. But overall, it was a very enjoyable stay and will consider staying again! P.S. As mentioned in other trip advisor comments, the elevators can be a bit slow!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Terakita
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through expedia (packaged with a flight) for less than $90/night. What a bargain! The hotel is in a great location, rooms were a good size, the staff were amazing, and the food at C-House was delicious. ROOM: The room included an office space, living room, bathroom, safe, queen size bed, and a 32" LCD TV which swiveled. The room was very clean. Housekeeping never intruded and we had no problems with anything missing or being misplaced. The bar bridge is full stocked and there is a tray of candy/snacks for purchase. My only issue with the room would be the noise factor from sirens in the middle of the night. This is no fault of the hotel itself, but its proximity to the hospital made for some late night sirens to disturb your sleep. Other than that, everything was great. FOOD: We ate at both the C-House restaurant and the C-view rooftop patio. Only appetizers are served at the rooftop lounge, but they were very good. Highly recommend the cheese platter and meats assortment. C-House is the main level restaurant. We visited for a dinner and a breakfast and both meals were amazing. The service was good and we had nothing buy great food and drinks. LOCATION: The hotel is right beside Ginos Pizza, on Superior St and Michigan Ave. It is walking distance to all the shopping and about a 10 km walk to Navy Pier. If you plan on walking all day, I recommend considering a cab from the hotel to Navy Pier. It cost us roughly 8 dollars including tip, so it was well worth it for us in terms of time. The Peninsula, which is down the street from the Affinia, had two NBA players staying there during the long weekend. Dwayne Wade and Chris Bosh were there which was amazing! The food around the hotel is also very good. STAFF: The best part of our stay would have to be the service of the hotel staff. As soon as we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by the bell hop and guest services. Both were extremely helpful and pleasant to deal with. We arrived early so there were no rooms available, but we were checked in well before the standard 3pm check in time. (I think we got our room at 12pm) The hotel held our bags in locked storage until we were able to check in. The only issue we had here was that it took some time for us to get the luggage after we went to the room. I had to make a phone call to the front desk to check on the status of our bags, and they eventually came not long after. The bell hop, Danial, was very apologetic and he spent some time explaining the city, gave us some helpful tips, and even recommended a breakfast eatery. We were very pleased with his recommendation and his overall service; he also remembered our names to the end of our stay -- this holds a lot of weight with me in a service oriented position! The guest services were very helpful in terms of getting around the city and booking reservations for us in Chicago. Dora and Andre helped us select a nice place for dinner over the weekend and booked our reservations for us. The cleaning lady we met in our elevator was also very friendly. Great staff from our experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Scottraveller19
Reviews.Content: Travelled to the Affinia Chicago from Scotland. We found the hotel to be very clean, our room on arrival was upgraded to a suite which was on the 21st floor. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful throughout our stay as were the consierge staff at the front door. We found the hotel to be ideally sited, especially being next door to 'Ginos', and only short strolls to many restaurants. We tended to dine out most of the time so didnt spend much time in hotel restaurant. Cocktails on the roof terrace slightly expensive but to be expected. All in all, do not have anytyhing but praise for hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “A True Value and well worth the time AAA+++”
Reviews.Author: hotshooter1
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on orbitz looking for a medium priced 4 star hotel close to Northwestern Med and good shopping; and found an oasis in thie midst of the Big City. I just want the staff and management to know that I travel alot and feel the hotel is first class throughout and the restaurant is devine. I also loced C-View and the service. The rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable. Having stayed at a big name hotel on the mile before, I was so happy to have such silence from street noise, yet be so conviently located. Thank you Affinia for making my stay a great experience and I highly recommend this boutique hotel to anyone. Cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money and OUTRAGEOUS phone charges”
Reviews.Author: apope79
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was that the room furnishings and location are nice, but the cleanliness is questionable, the desk service abysmal, and the one long distance phone call I had to make (inside the US, 70 mins long) due to my cell phone breaking cost me $200!! You would think I had called the Moon! Overall I would visit the bar on the roof-top for a drink (somewhat expensive, but great view), and stay somewhere else. There's a lot of swank hotels in the area that are worth paying a tad more for or the same as the Affinia is asking. Try not to break your cell phone either. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeyBoynton
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Affinia over the past weekend. I booked my reservation through Priceline at 175 a night (a little pricey, but it seems like all the hotels where high for that weekend). Overall, I was happy with my stay. All the staff that I dealt with were very friendly. The bed was very comfortable and the location was great. I was a little disappointed that the house keeping didn't replace the soap bars with a new one, and they left a towel in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it December Loved it in June!”
Reviews.Author: xtagus
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to the Affinia. It did not disappoint. This time we could enjoy the outside rooftop bar. I love the bathroom with the art deco lighted mirror. Even though it is only a block off Michigan Ave., it is a very quiet hotel. Saw lot's of couples and families. The staff always goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. The beds are some of the most comfortable I have ever slept on away from home and the pillows are to die for. Great place if you are taking your little girl to American Girl Store or any of the other great shopping spots on North Michigan Ave. I won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back in a flash”
Reviews.Author: BKRMichigan
Reviews.Content: We go to Chicago every year and find that hotels are not always worth the price tag. So when we booked the Affinia for less than 100.00 per night, I didn't expect much. Most of the previous comments about noise and elevators are true but this is a very nice hotel. I loved the decorating and the amenities. The coffee was free but it should have been as it tasted terrible and was luke warm. A few little things like burnt out lights and a hair dryer that kept stopping did not deter us from a good review. I found the staff very accomodating and helpful. There is no concierge so it helps to know what you want but when we did ask staff, they usually had good suggestions for food, travel etc. It is also two blocks from the Chicago Visitors Center on Michigan where you can find answers to any questions. Good room, good folks, good price, good location, that says it all I think.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel close to Magnificent Mile shopping district in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: greggillard
Reviews.Content: This hotel received a perfect score because the overall value I received based on rate, room quality and great service. Please note, I was upgraded to a studio suite and have no idea what a standard room looks like. The hotel is right off Michigan Avenue in the area Magnificent Mile shopping district. It also directly next to Gino's East (pizza). The sleeping room was spacious, clean, updated with nice bed and flat screen tv and very comfortable. I recommend this hotel and suggest paying a little extra to get into a studio suite or suite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique, but a couple things to know”
Reviews.Author: Dharmabum87
Reviews.Content: The service here is terrific. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice. It was redone after Affinia took it over but is not a brand new building. That is apparent in various features of the hotel -- namely the 2 very slow elevators. The elevator problem is compounded by the fact that the hotel has a pretty cool rooftop bar but it is frequented by lots of folks outside the hotel. There is no card key function to prevent folks from getting off on any floor either. But the bigger problem is that the elevator is often going all the way up to the roof before coming down. The beds are great. They offer a pillow menu which I did not take advantage of but it looked interesting. The hotel restaurant's chef is one of the Top Chef Masters -- Samuelson. I didn't have a chance to eat there, however. But it was pretty uncrowded. Only other thing to be aware of is the location. It is right of Michigan ave which is good, but it's also right across from NW hospital. So beware of ambulance sirens and lots of street noise if you are on floor 10 or below.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: pharmgirlReedCity
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. I was afraid it would be too snobbish. The pictures I had seen online made me a bit leary, but the staff was really friendly and recognized us when we were coming and going. They were really helpful when we needed information about the area and what to do. The room was wonderful. It had an elegance and plush comfort that made it so nice to relax in. The location for our purpose was great. My mom had an appointment at the medical center a block away and then we went shopping on the Magnificent Mile. We walked everywhere we went. It was great to hand our car over to valet parking and not worry about it. We stayed 2 nights and that seemed to help the price, but I have paid the same amount for a room without half of the amenities and attractions this one had. I would love to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksweet93
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Affinia for 2 nights during a quick business trip. This is a nice boutique hotel with a great location. Ideally situated next to Northwestern Univ (the site of my conference), near the "Magnificent Mile" (North Michigan Ave) and all it's stores and restaurants, and close to major sites. The staff were very friendly. The only problem I had was the presence of small bugs in my room (more like oversized gnats). However, when I reported to the staff, they immediately moved me to another room which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansMmik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia hotel for 3 nights and the room was great and the staff was really nice. We were able to check in early and they kept our bags for us on the last day since we didn't leave until 4:00pm. The room was a little noisy but we located the sound machine and used it for the next two nights. The cleaning staff was a little too eager to get into the rooms to clean in the early morning but did a really good job. The location is really great we came and went through out the day. We walked to the Willis tower and then the John Hancock building. There is shopping all around. The redline is only three blocks away and we took that to the Cub's game and then to the Field museum. There are plenty of places to eat. You must try the West Egg for breakfast ask the front desk for direction. The bellmen recommended a breakfast place in the Pensula hotel except it was very expensive. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: paulib32
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! Very friendly staff, excellent location, and very clean, I mean who has ever heard of a pillow menu? I hadn't but it was quality! 29th bar with terrace! Only slight moan was car parking was extremely expensive, although not offered with or by the hotel unless you want vallett which was even more expensive, so either use cabs or trains. The hotel itsel is right in the middle of where you need to be at, the beach is 5 minutes away,and nightclub about the same, loads of shops and much more! Highly recommended!!! 100stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AName
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Affinia Hotel Chicago for four nights in April. Was happy with everything from check-in to departure and got a good rate by booking three months in advance. Concierge was very helpful. Was aware of the charge for coffee in room from Tripadviser so didnâ€™t avail of it. Room was good. Stepped into an area with tea/coffee/minibar and a working desk with access to the bathroom from here too. Down three steps to the two bed room. On the 26th floor so traffic noise not a problem and not much noise from other rooms either. We were happy with the hotel, no complaints. Very good location for sightseeing/shopping/dining. Would recommend to anyone and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: maz2827
Reviews.Content: I thought this was going to be a home run. Good, nice sized room, friendly people. But the noise level of the hotel, on two fronts, made it impossible for me to get a decent night's sleep. First, the hotel is right by Northwestern Memorial Hospital - every hotel in Streeterville has the ambulance siren issue. I think some hotels have soundproofed better than this one. It's loud and random. The second issue is the slamming doors. Each room has a door that closes slowly to a point, then slams shut, to make sure it closed. Unfortunately, the doors are thin and the hallways are very small (no chance for a room off the main hallway). This makes for an incredibly loud door slam, again random, like 1am and 4am when my neighbors rolled in. Also, the thin doors / small hallways allowed me to enjoy my neighbors' 5am party...fortunately, I was getting up at 6 anyway. So, sadly, I won't be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: tunsttravel
Reviews.Content: Trendy, boutique style hotel just off Magnificent Mile. If you are staying for a shopping or city break the location is perfect. We had a large room near the top of the building (28 Floors), although there are many floors in the hotel the lifts were usually adequate enough that you were not waiting too long. Room was very comfortable,clean and well decorated. Our only complaint would be that we were woken by housekeeping knocking on the door everyday between 7.30am and 8.30am which was a little earlier than we would have liked to have been woken on holiday, there was no 'do not disturb' sign in our room to display. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant which was very nice, but heard reports that the food was good. Fantastic location, very nice, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Affinia! Accomodation, Service, and Food Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: travellor2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Affinia April 29th - May 2nd 2010 and I made a point of writing this review to promote this hotel. The room was beautifully appointed and very spacious with the most comfortable bed and pillow menu. The bathroom was large and well designed. The beautiful light filled room that had a stunning view, a window that opens to provide fresh air and an individual heating /cooling system. The attention to detail at this hotel is a class act, with added "touches" eg. creatively designed postcards that hotel staff will mail! Perfect location, 1 block from the "Mag Mile" Lakeside running paths, all the sights are within walking distance. The outdoor lounge on the 29th floor is beautiful and a relaxing space to have a cocktail after a long day of walking! The restaurant was reviewed as one of the top places to eat in Chicago 2009. Hotel staff greeted you by name, were professional with a friendly manner. I will recommend and will look forward to returning to a stunning city and hotel! I have stayed in 4 & 5 Star hotels all over the world and this would be near the top of my list!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, friendly, helpul staff and good restaurant too”
Reviews.Author: scbiztraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Affnia on a biz trip. My suite was large, very clean, with a modern updated style that was very well done. The staff was so helpful - they gave me directions to various locations, cheerfully got my bags, a taxi, found my lost shoes, helped me mail out a package and the restaurant staff was very friendly and helpful with food and wine choices. I commend the staff for their cheerful attitudes and service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago for business or pleasure. The location was also very central.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - great location.”
Reviews.Author: melodicmartin
Reviews.Content: We had planned to stay at the Affinia Chicago for four nights in April. But then the Icelandic volcano erupted, and we ended up staying for nine nights! But we couldn't have chosen a better hotel (or city) to be stranded in. The Affinia is just steps away from the Magnificent Mile, and our room on the 25th floor looked across to Big John - the John Hancock Tower. The room was a good size, the bathroom was fine. There was no mirror in the main room, which was a bit odd. And the coffee machine never really worked that well. But the bed was superb - we chose buckwheat pillows - very nice to sleep on. The staff were superb - always courteous and helpful - and they didn't try rip us off when we had to stay extra nights because of the volcano. Regarding local restaurants, we weren't impressed with pizzas at Gino's East next door - but far nicer was The Indian Garden on E Ontario; and Ditka's (owned my Chicago Bears favourite, Mike Ditka).

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend - lot's of fun”
Reviews.Author: wisbo77
Reviews.Content: I got a junior suite and asked the front desk to change my room three times because I was by the elevator shaft. They were so nice about it because I changed back to the elevator shaft room because it had an awesome view, and honestly, noise wasn't a problem. The whole room was very spacious and the windows were huge! The rooftop bar is wonderful but, of course, a bit pricey. It's small w/ a loungy feel. The bathroom products were nice and everything had a hip, cool, vibe about it. Valet parking is expensive but there is a garage directly across the street. It's not that much cheaper and it's not in and out, so I would do valet next time. There is no pool - so keep that in mind for yourself or the kids. I had a great time and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great roof top bar”
Reviews.Author: nicbarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 30 seconds walk off the Magnificant Mile. The rooms were spotlessly clean and well decorated. All staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but decent staff is lacking...”
Reviews.Author: WiscTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Affinia for 4 days while vacationing with my boyfriend in Chicago. Location was great and the rooms were nice (except for the pair of shoes and jelly beans left in the closet by the previous guests). Now for a few negatives: the hotel is located across the street from a hospital so there are ambulances with sirens blaring all day and night, we received a wake-up call at 6 AM that we did not ask for so that ruined our "sleeping in" plans and a maid who was on her cell phone texting dropped off a robe we did not ask for then came back 5 minutes later and asked for it back! The staff was helpful when giving us directions or suggestions for places to go - they were however a little snooty and it seemed that they looked down on us as we were not all dressed up like some of the other guests. For that reason alone I do not think I would stay there again - I paid the same as everyone else to stay there so why treat me different?!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't find anything wrong...it was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: TheVacationAdvisors
Reviews.Content: For the full review and photos, please visit our site, TheVacationAdvisors. The hotel is located on a quiet street just steps away from Chicago's famous Magnificent Mile shopping district and restaurants. For the active traveler, the hotel is also within a short walk or jog to Chicago's amazing lakefront jogging path. The metro is also fairly close and can be reached within a 10-minute walk. The hotel and the rooms were spotless. From the moment we entered the shiny and sparkling hotel lobby, it was quite apparent that the hotel takes great pride in cleanliness. The staff is also well outfitted in professional and stylish uniforms. The rooms are large and spacious, with large comfortable beds and a separate sitting area. The bathrooms are also very spacious. The room has everything possible to make your stay comfortable, from comfortable bedding, a large flat screen LCD TV, mini bar, sitting area/work space, high speed internet access and so on. We also had a beautiful view of the surrounding buildings from the comfort of our bed. The rooms are decorated with electric decor in calming contemporary colours. We can't say anything negative about the rooms. Overall, we found the room very comfortable which was perfect to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. This hotel offers excellent value. We were not disappointed with our stay and can't find one negative thing to say about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Had the best time!”
Reviews.Author: bvil
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we chose this hotel to stay for our first visit to Chicago! The front desk was pleasant and helpful. We stayed in a studio suite and it was wonderful, clean and very spacious. My mother and sister stayed in a guest room and it was just the right size for two people. Our bed was surprisingly very comfortable and we slept like babies. I read of complaints of noise and such but being from NYC we felt right at home. The hotel is not even a full block from The Magnificent Mile which was full of great shopping and the bus stop. It was a 15 minute walk to Navy Pier which has so many activities to choose from. The parking garage is across the street which was very convenient but @ 40 bucks a day I wish we didn't have a car. We kept our car in the garage and either took a cab or public transportation to places. Cab fares can get costly so we bought an all day CTA pass @ Walgreens around the corner and that made our getting around the city very easy. The hotel is right next door to Ginos East and down the street from Giordanos, in my opinion, Giordanos had the better deep dish pizza. If you don't feel like leaving your room both will deliver to your room. All in all, we had a great time in Chicago and staying here made the experience that more awesome! We can not wait to revisit Chicago and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Sir Charges”
Reviews.Author: Buffed112859
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location, great, but it stops there. Upon check-in, I was informed I would have a queen bed. I asked for a king size bed, and I was told there would be a charge for going up to a king. GIVE ME A BREAK, a surcharge for going from a queen to a king. When I got up to the room, it was like a oven. I could not get the air to work and needed to call twice before getting service. Everything in the room had a charge associated to it, even down to the coffee, $1.00. Now what's up with that? I was very disappointed in the size of the bathroom. Very small. I have stayed there twice and with so many other options, I feel this will be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from check-in to check-out”
Reviews.Author: seatsale
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Affinia was perfect. At check-in the front desk person was great and throughout my stay, the staff were very helpful. The room was clean and well laid-out. Only two blocks from the Red Line. I would definitely stay here again. Kevin

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre & Cheap”
Reviews.Author: ManzoorMissouri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Chicago Hotel in March 2010 for 4 days. I reserved my room through Hotwire, so I couldn't choose my hotel. Anyway, I read all the TripAdvisor reviews before going and it's interesting that the hotel never took any action for the bad reviews. They still charge for coffee and this is what customers are saying over and over again. Hello management, listen to your customers! How would you feel if you come home and see a $2 charge on your credit card for in-room coffee? The reception desk staff didn't try to find another room for us and gave us a room with two tiny beds, even though the hotel wasn't completely booked. Had to pay $10.00 for Internet everyday and the hotel didn't have free WiFi even in the lobby area which most hotels now a days have. Overall, I got a very cheap feeling and didn't feel appreciated. On the positive side, the bellman, concierge and other front-line support staff (other than reception desk) were very friendly. The location is also quite nice. I think the managements view is hey we're doing OK, so why try to go to the next level by increasing our cost. I understand that, but I'm also not going to stay here next time, unless I get a super deal through on-line travel sites.

Reviews.Title: “Bring ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: Resmama
Reviews.Content: Bring ear plugs and you will be fine! It is noisy outside and the walls are paper thin, but apart from that it is fine. Good location, huge rooms, fine service, some extras like a yoga kit delivered to your room - and I paid 60 dollars per night through Expedia! That is good value! I

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but placement, not so, unless you like garbage truck sounds”
Reviews.Author: Beewacker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended the SAMA(Society of American Mosaic Artists) in Chicago and decided to stay in downtown Chicago. We arranged our stay at the Affinia Chicago because of the price and location. We live in the Western suburbs and thought driving and parking would be the same as the stay. We took the train in and arrived at the hotel at 11:00 and the room was ready. The room was large, butttttt!!!! the view was that of the loading dock with the garbage truck pickup. We paid for an upgrade and got a large dimly lit room with the sound of the garbage trucks. It wasn't all that bad, but unexpected. Affinia should only offer these rooms at a discount and not charge an upgrade fee. Affinia should also warn the customer at checkin that the room has absolutely no view and is located above the dock. I would not recommend this hotel because of this problem that really cannot be corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: smith6950
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago with my 6 year old daughter, her friend and mom for an American Girl weekend. The hotel is 2 blocks from the AG store, in the middle of Michigan Ave, and next right to Gino East Pizza (Excellent Chicago Style) - great location for what we were planning to do. The hotel was very clean, had very comfortable beds and was spacious compared to others I have stayed in Chicago. We had a freak accident at the hotel and the director/ staff went above and beyond to make our stay a positive experience. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “High level of noise”
Reviews.Author: lillyroseMI
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews that said that this was a beautiful hotel with an unfriendly staff. They were very accurate. The woman that checked us in upon arrival was very polite and one of the bellmen was also very friendly. They seemed to be the exception to the rule. Upon checking out, we approached the front desk, the employee looked up, said "Last name?" I told her and she said, "You're all set." and walked away. So much for, "How was your stay, etc." I had low expectations because of what I had read but I was surprised by how much they really didn't care. We had a room with two double beds. Upon waking up after getting in late, I realized that the sheets had not been changed from the previous occupants. I left a note for the housekeeper in the morning and they had been changed when we returned. The hotel is very nicely decorated in a contemporary style. Kind of like a low end W hotel. However, the door to our room had such a big gap that the light from the hallway kept us up. Kind of odd. The noise level is very high in this hotel from both inside and outside. We had bid on Priceline and ended up in this hotel. While the location is prime and we had received an excellent price, I wouldn't stay here again. We visit Chicago often and there are many other better choices in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: kells64
Reviews.Content: fab hotel, awsome location, georgous room, pity about the service. front desk staff mostly very unfriendly, didnt get the 'big american' welcome i expected! the worst was that i got my shirt laundered, it was lost, never got it back, very little in the way of an apology, eventually got $25 compensation which they very obviously didnt want to give me. great hotel, just dont expect a smile at the front desk and dont get anything laundered!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: steelrgirl2
Reviews.Content: Last year I found the Affinia accidentally when looking for hotels for a girls weekend. They were listed #1 on this site and I got a great rate so my friends tried it. Everyone loved it. I didn't stay with them though so I didn't feel I should review it. This year when looking I found an awesome deal and everyone wanted to stay again. We had such a good time! It's so centrally located. The rooms are HUGE and CLEAN. We had 4 studio suites and we all absolutely loved them. I loved having all that space. You walk in to a landing with a desk. Down 3 stairs you find the very comfortable living room with pull out bed, recliner, coffee table, huge ottoman, and bar. I love that the refrigerator ISN'T one of those that if you move something it charges you. So we could move things around to store our left over pizza from Gino's East right next door! The bathroom has a foiled orange wall covering and a cool circle fluorescent lighting. The bed had a great linens and the pillows were awesome. There's even a sound machine on the alarm clock! The only thing I can find wrong with this hotel is the slow/small elevators (request a lower floor room to help with wait) and the ambulances going to Northwestern across the street. I had no problem sleeping however either night. I requested the exercise package through the offered concierge and was so suprised to receive a yoga mag, several dvds, a dvd player, weights and stretching bands to use during my stay. It was delivered immediately after check in and maintenance was done hooking up the player as I arrived at the door. Service was wonderful. The front desk printed everyone's boarding passes with no problem. If we saw staff in the hallways, there was always a smile and a hello. Thanks Affinia for a great stay! We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but a sleepless night - big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: DPLesq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia because it was next to the hospital where our grand-daughter was about to be born. Lovely room and accommodations were spoiled by a miserable night's sleep. How could this be? The heating plant in the room cycled on about every 20 minutes and was about as loud as a truck when it went on. We sleep just fine but could not sleep through this intrusive noise. If you are planning to stay, plan on turning off your heater or maybe get some earplugs

Reviews.Title: “THE spot if your shopping downtown”
Reviews.Author: Armywife97
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 girlfriends stayed here for a weekend of shopping on Michigan Avenue. None of us had stayed here before. We were thrilled that we were a half a block off of Michigan. When we visited it was a wonderfully warm weekend. We were able to walk to Navy Pier which was about a mile away. The room was a nice size. We had a room with 2 double beds. The beds were comfortable and nice. The only real issue with room was that the hotel is 2 blocks from Northwestern Hospital and we heard the sirens all night both nights. This was a little distracting and did make hard for a few of us to sleep. We all loved the bathroom. It had a huge walk-in shower and was very clean. With 4 woman we had tons of makeup etc so it was nice for all of us to be able to spread out our stuff on the counter. The amenities were very nice. We didn't eat in the restaurant nor did we go to the bar so I can't say if those are any good. The only parking available was the in the ramp accross the street. We opted to leave our vehicle there all weekend and walk or take a taxi everywhere we went. The lobby was nice and we didn't really notice the elevator issues that some of the previous posters commented about. If I ever return to downtown Chicago, this will be my first choice for accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased...long winter weekend stay.”
Reviews.Author: TOMxxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Affinia for a 3 day weekend (I was on business, my wife on leisure) and we were very pleased with our stay. While not a 5-star property, they are trying to be one and doing a pretty good job. The hotel itself is clearly an older property but their renovations were very good and they did a nice job putting a modern twist on the property. Thanks to it being winter in Chicago, we had a suite at a crazy low price and were very pleased with the size and quality of the room. The staff, while not particularly impressive, were fine - not overtly friendly or helpful, just business as usual (save for overhearing a little at work gossip that the front desk staff should have saved for the break room). The bell staff/doormen, however, were friendly, helpful, and made us feel welcome each time we came in and out. Location wise - outstanding. Business at Northwestern? 2 minute walk. Shopping or dining on the Miracle Mile? 1/2 a block. $10 cab ride to the Field Museum or Aquarium or Soldier Field, $15 to the zoo (excellent), and walking distance to almost every shop or restaurant you can imagine (unless it is just too cold). We didn't try room service but the restaurant had a great looking menu...but treat yourself to Gino's deep dish pizza right next door...and then have dinner at Nacional 27 just a few blocks away - one of the best meals I've ever had anywhere...

Reviews.Title: “Had great stay at Affinia Chicago”
Reviews.Author: richardY
Reviews.Content: I checked in at the Affinia Hotel in Chicago shortly after dinner on Tuesday, I was greeted by very frendly staff from the valet service to front desk. You can tell people were happy at the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised when I got to my room. The room was very well decorated and well thought out. The furniture was in the right location and there was lots of space. Plus it was convenient with lots of power outlets The bedroom and washroom was very clean and I had a great sleep in their very comfortable bed. I was told by front desk i could choose from 6 different pillows, although i did not take advantage of this offer i thought what a great idea. Once in a while you come across hotels with great service, well thought out rooms in a perfect location (right off Magnificent Mile). When visiting Chicago again I will definitely try and stay at Affinia again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised - had a great wknd stay here”
Reviews.Author: chesterhouse3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a result of "name your price" on Priceline. Had not been famiiar with this hotel so looked it up & of course read the good & not-so-good reviews. Was pleasantly surprised to get an absolutely lovely room on the 17th floor with a great view of St. Clair Street. Started with wonderful staff greeting us from the doorman to the front desk clerk Erin. Room was very clean & bed was super comfortable just using the standard pillows although they even offer a large pillow menu. We had our son & daughter in law from Oak Park join us for dinner @ the C-House Restaurant on site and thought it was very good, not over priced for a downtown restaurant and we had a relaxing & enjoyable two hour dinner. Hotel offered fun, complimentary "experience kits" which I took advantage of one of them , opting for the walking kit & was fun to listen to the IPOD provided preloaded with walking tour information & even a pedometer to use.Only negative the whole wknd was the number of sirens at night probably from being next door to a hospital but the comfort of the bed made it easy to fall back asleep. Loved the proximity to Michigan Street, inexpensive cab ride (less than $10) from Union Station, and in general, great location if you love being downtown.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, Modern, Comfy Bed, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DocWagz
Reviews.Content: Great place. Was here for residency interviews at NWHospital. Got a deal for 129/night. Friendly staff, really cool spotless room and a super comfy bed. The plasma screen rotated so you could see it from everywhere in the room. Ask for the free wifi password so you don't have to pay. Would totally recommend this place. Could use a bigger lounge area in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: missmagic
Reviews.Content: We booked a great deal directly through the affinia website. The location on the Mile was fabulous, especially for those who love shopping! Comfortable bed, modern furnishings, large room. I asked for a hair dryer and it was delivered to my room within 5 minutes. Upon further searching, there was actually one in the living room drawer.. hotel did not comment or seem to mind my request at all. Can't wait to stay at another affinia property on our next vacation!

Reviews.Title: “The Affinia is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler-46
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Affinia in Chicago before leaving for a sunnier locale and then returning to a cold, snowy city the first of the year. I could not have had a more aesthetic room (if only it had a towel hook in the bath), better products or a nicer staff. Everyone is always helpful, friendly and accommodating whenever I stay there. The location of the hotel is right off of Michigan Avenue with lots of shopping, nearby restaurants and movie theaters. It is somewhat "hip," but in a contemporary, pleasing way. The room information, do not disturb signs and pillow menu is all very cleverly presented. I have not eaten at the on site restaurant but had appetizers and drinks at the rooftop bar. The food I had which was from the restaurant was very good although I don't find the menu at the downstairs very interesting. I hope that I might receive the great rates I've had in the past to be able to enjoy coming back to the Affinia.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations & was hassle free”
Reviews.Author: nicheguru
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The staff was friendly & helpful and the location is ideal. Everything was clean, comfortable, and it had all of the amenities we were looking for (and beyond). More importantly the staff went above and beyond for us. The night we arrived the heat was not working and they had one of their engineers come and fix it right away. He was friendly and even gave us several recommendations on what to do and where to go while simultaneously while working on the HVAC. We barely had our coats off by the time it was up & running. However, the most impressive display of service was the response to an unfortunate incident that happened to us while parked across the city (not anywhere near this hotel or their parking garage) at a late hour of the night. My car window was smashed and items were stolen. When we returned to the hotel after the incident they were more than helpful. They not only let us park the car in front of the hotel until we had spoken with the police, but also helped us to affix something temporary to the window (which was helpful for the single digit temperatures). They guided us to our car in the valet garage to assess the damage the next day and offered to let us extend our checkout time if necessary.
