What could have been a lot of added stress in an unfamiliar environment turned out to be a comfortable safe haven. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Hopefully others won't have the drama we did and won't ever witness this type of service, but if you do they'll be there to help you through it. Aside from the service, they have a great location right off of Michigan Avenue/Magnificent Mile for shopping and close to many restaurants/attractions (including Gino's East Pizzaria right next door - which has excellent Chicago-style pizza). Also, although we didn't end up using it, apparently "L" train passes are available within walking distance. Extra perks within the hotel include a rooftop dining area and our (2) double bed room had a hotel room safe, large walk-in shower w/ glass door, warm/clean bedding, LCD TV, room service (breakfast, etc.), fully stocked fridge/snacks in room (for a fee), nice bathroom amenities, and neat lighting fixtures/decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, just needs more elevators”
Reviews.Author: Munroisin
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great staff and service. Rooms recently redone, so everything is clean and nice. And they let you chose your own pillow type, which is a nice touch. Great rooftop bar. The hotel's restaurant, C-House, was great for entertaining clients. The servers were personable and knowledgeable, and the food was perfect. Hotel is close to all the good shopping. Cons: this hotel needs more elevators!! There was always a wait. Also, they charge for their in room coffee and tea, that was kinda lame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Position , Excellent Concierge”
Reviews.Author: HotLass
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with 3 friends or 4 nights. The hotel was clean and tidy, throughout. The Concierge Christopher was excellent and helped as with all our needs, gave us discount vouchers etc. Hotel was in excellent position. 3 blocks from John Hancok Building and more importantly The Cheesecake Factory , Bloomingdales 3 blocks away and the Water Tower Shopping Centre 2 blocks away. We went to the huge I Max cinema which is about ten minutes away. Cant wait to go back to Chicago and The Affinia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieCincinnati
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Affinia Chicago for a girls' weekend in early November. I booked 4 rooms on PriceLine and got an excellent rate. I called the hotel after making the reservations and let them know that we needed 2 beds in each room. I was told it would be noted on our reservation however could not be guaranteed. When we arrived in Chicago I was told that they were completely out of 2 bed rooms. It wasn't a huge deal but would have been more comfortable if we had a room with 2 queens instead of a queen and a pull out couch. Actually, the bed seemed more like a full than a queen. The room was very modern and nicely decorated. As we walked in there was a desk immediately in front of us and then you went down 2 steps into the actual room which had a pull out couch, an ottoman, TV and bed. The room was very clean however I can not give it the highest clean score because the ottoman was absolutely disgusting. It had stains all over it, even down the side where it looked like something had spilled. Since this was one of the first things we saw as we entered the room we were a little unsure what we got ourselves into. This was however an exception to everything else which was very clean. One drawback to this hotel is the high cost of every little thing. Internet access was I think $10 a day and you could access the Internet through the room TV however that was $10 for just a few hours. Even coffee and tea had a charge. The mini bar was very well stocked but we avoided using it because of the high cost. Parking is also outrageous - $48 per day! The view was also not very good...we were looking directly into an office building, but really that wasn't a big deal. The best thing about this hotel would have to be the location! It was convenient to EVERYTHING! It was unusually warm in Chicago that weekend so we walked everywhere and never had to use a cab. You can walk to all of the stores on the mag mile as well as Navy Pier and Millennium Park. There is a pizza place right next door that always had a huge line out the door. Ask the concierge for a pass and you can skip the entire line plus get free bread sticks! The staff were all very nice. The concierge was always happy to give advice and answer questions and on our last day when we wanted to do a few things after checkout they were very nice about storing our luggage for us at no charge until we were ready to leave. We ate at the hotel restaurant for breakfast. It was awful and expensive. I ordered a meal that came with eggs and bacon and my bacon looked like it came out of the refrigerator and onto my plate...so I asked if they could cook it longer and the waiter came back a few seconds later and the bacon looked exactly the same. I just took it and didn't eat it...a total waste of $14! I would recommend eating someplace else for breakfast...we didn't try this restaurant for any other meals. The rooftop bar is nice and had a great atmosphere. Because it was warm we were able to sit outside which was very nice. As for the elevators which a lot of people complain about, I did not find them a problem. We were on the 14th floor and never felt like we had to wait an exceptionally long time. If I am ever in Chicago again I would definitely stay at the Affinia and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in service.”
Reviews.Author: Familyaus
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to the US from Australia for a family reunion and found the Affinia to be more than exceptional. The Concierge were amazing. Christopher was the most helpful, enthusiastic and professional concierge we have ever met. All the concierge knew our names by the end of the first day (2 adults, 4 children aged 4,5,6,9) and greeted us with genuine enthusiasm. For Australians travelling to Chicago, this hotel reminded us of home, no 'fake' American service, genuine care! Rooms were big and extremely clean. Just wish there was a coin laundry nearby! Great pizza restaurants next door and within 1 block from the hotel. For Australians wanting a proper cup of coffee...there is a french bakery nearby that has great morning meals! Well Done Christopher and the boys at Concierge....thank you for making a long trip so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IAmDoraExplora
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on TA about this hotel, I was worried about the noise and elevators. I had absolutely no problem with either. We were on the 3rd floor facing the street, and I slept very soundly by the window. We stayed on weekdays though, so maybe weekends are not as good? Beds were very comfortable, and having a choice of pillows was nice. The staff was very helpful and curteous, and the room was spotless. I was expecting a small room (we booked with Hotwire for $99), but the room was huge, and we just had a standard one. The location was fantastic, too. We got one of the 'experience kits' but didn't have time to use it really (it was a nice plus anyway). Didn't try the bar or the restaurant. Overall a great stay in a very nice hotel. Very satisfied :)

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, nice place but beware of ambulance noise”
Reviews.Author: linner123
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice, clean and comfortable. Great pillows and comfortable bed. Roomy space, and the view (from 24th floor) was not bad. Extremely conveninet to Michigan Ave shopping and holiday parade which was reason we went to city. Decor is interesting, some odd combinations of colors, but didn't bother us at all. In fact, my daughter loved the shiny orange bathroom. Service was great - very pleasant stafft, Word of caution - if you are a light sleeper - the ambulances coming and going at nigh to the ER next door, will keep you awake. I did not sleep at all, but, ,my daughter had no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bumblemee
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before booking a hotel for our trip to Chicago and decided on Affinia. I LOVED the hotel! Great location..just steps away from the center of Magnificant Mile. It was a little noisy at night - but I can't complain because it was our choice to be in the middle of downtown, so a little noise is to be expected. I had requested early check-in and a room with a view. We got there at about noon and the room wasn't ready yet, but they were happy to store our luggage while we went back out for lunch and to check out the city. The room was wonderful...amazing views of the city.The bed was very comfortable. Room was clean. Hotel service was great! Rooftop bar is very nice. A friend of ours stayed at a bigger, fancier, hotel near the river and it was nice but I was still very happy with my decision to stay at Affinia. I will stay here again on my next visit. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “a great location”
Reviews.Author: cindyIndiana
Reviews.Content: the staff was very accomodating in getting our two rooms close and on the same floor. we ended up very high with a wonderful view from both rooms. we had a suite and the other couple a regular. both were outstanding in cleanliness and very comfortable. loved the bedding and linens. some noise from hospital ambulances but we were apparently high enough to not be a concern. room coffee should be free, not extra. mini bar had a nice selection of drinks as well as snacks etc. did lots of walking along michigan avenue and beyond. had drinks and appetizers in bar. none of the four of us liked either appetizer and we did not experience dinner there.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: jpsanpedro
Reviews.Content: Expectations are everything. As a reasonably priced hotel, Affinia Chicago is a good place to stay in a good location. But, as a very well regarded (on Tripadvisor, at least), premium property - with a luxury price tag - Affinia Chicago is underwhelming. Is it more like a Kimpton or more like a Four Seasons/Park Hyatt? Either way, it's not succeeding. If you want me to buy it as quirky, distinctive luxury, then I want the hotel staff to have personality and engage me. If the latter, then be excellent in all respects. - Hotel feels "converted" - much of the fit and finish elements throughout hotel aren't well integrated. - Elevators are extremely slow - seems like a small thing, but when you're on business and constantly rushing, it's aggravating and disappointing. - Touted programs - free toiletries upon demand, welcome kits upon demand - seemed like burdens to the staff. My one free toiletry took 45 min to show up (in the evening) and when I asked about welcome kit staff seemed like I needed to wake them up...and they never actually "offered." - Clock was set wrong in room. Again, not worst thing on earth, but just one more thing to deal with. - They charge $1 for coffee bag in room. Really? Hilton doesn't. Tacky. - As noted, staff wasn't excellent. No personality, not engaging, not into service. (Interestingly, restaurant C-bar was great and staff was fantastic there.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 3duckdave
Reviews.Content: We arrived early afternoon, tried to check in, but the room wasn't ready. No big deal, we were able to check our bags. I booked the room on Priceline, got a good deal, however i wasn't able to get the proper sleeping arrangements. I called the hotel, they informed me i would have to upgrade to a suite for another $100. I didn't do this until we checked in. If you want a roll-away cot you have to upgrade to a suite, and pay another $30 plus the upgrade charge. We didn't, we made do. The room was really nice, no complaints. Very modern decorations, nice flat screen tv centrally located in the room, it swiveled around so you can watch it from just about anywhere. The room was exceptionally clean. The view isn't bad from the room, you should definately head up the bar and check out the view from there. Drink prices at the bar where comparable to any place else in the city. Many people complained about the hosiptal noise, i didn't notice it at all. However Supieror is under construction, so maybe the ambulances are using a different route. I will admit the elevators are a bit slow and small. I wouldn't even consider trying to drive here and park. Rates start at $22 for an hour or less, we took the train into the city so we didn't have to worry about it thankfully. All in all a good hotel, definately a good place to stay if you are in town to shop the Magnificent Mile, good location for most things. The closest "EL" stop is a few blocks away, but there are plenty of taxis that hover around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In A Great City”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_Shopper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for business and had a terrific stay. The hotel offers an amazing location - - right out the door from the Magnificent Mile...which is right at your fingertips. Famous Gino's East is next door, Neiman's two doors away, Apple Store on the corner - oh, and the North Western University Hospital about a block away. That is the only drawback - the noise. I stayed on the 4th floor, facing the lovely hospital - and if you can suck up the noise-factor, it's fine. I think by the time I left, I was pretty used to it. Working in NYC, you would think it wouldn't bother me, but just keep the noise factor in mind if it's something that will bother you. It's pretty constant - 24/7. That said, the staff at the hotel is just so nice - - from the people at the front desk, the bellmen, restaurant staff -- they're all going out of their way for you. The room was very nice too! All very modern with great appointments. Large, modern bathroom with a great shower, (water pressure a little low - wonder if they are saving the planet), lots of mirrors everywhere and VERY clean. Internet was an additional charge per day. My king size bed was very comfy - helped me sleep and drown out the noise! So all in all, I would totally stay here again. I hear Priceline has some great deals too. I should only be so lucky! But - I'd pay full price to stay here again. It would be worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good but Loud”
Reviews.Author: NateMac13
Reviews.Content: The price is ok. The rooms are great. The bar and dining was good. The location is good and bad. It's right there where you can do a lot of things easily but it's also right by a hospital. We only stayed one night and weren't really in the hotel much and we still heard sirens about 10 times while in our room. Everything was good except for all the sirens! Oh and the huge spider that I killed on the window : / Overall I docked it a point on cleanliness just based on the spider and two points on location because the annoyance of the sirens. It's a nice place but I don't think I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: LM77WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Spent a 3 day Columbus Day weekend at the Affinia, Chicago and was very pleased. Our studio suite room was very modern, and well appointed. The bathroom was very cool looking. Everything was very clean (even the grout in the shower) and the sheets were ultra soft. We were on the 22nd floor and were pleasantly surprised that the elevators were not a problem at all. Maybe we timed it right and got lucky. Concierge recommended a great breakfast place (West End Egg) and the staff was super nice, helpful and friendly. Location was great. If you are going to eat next door at Gino's East Pizza, tell the concierge and he/she will give you a VIP ticket so you don't have to wait in line (for very long) and you will get free garlic breadsticks (thank you again Concierge). There was some street noise but nothing you don't hear in any city. When I go back I am definitely staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Peig_Sayers
Reviews.Content: I would probably give this hotel a 3.5 rating if possible. We got a very good deal so overall were pleased with the hotel. The location is fantastic for shopping and sight seeing. However, with the convenient location comes the noise. The sirens really are very loud in the middle of the night and this combined with jet lag makes sleeping difficult. The windows are single glazed which is unfortunate. The room was nice, spacious and clean. We had ordered special pillows etc but these never arrived, didn't bother to follow it up. Simple things missing from the room such as glasses for drinks from the mini bar. Used the fitness room a couple of times and were pleased with it. Machines are good, headphones and towels provided and everything seems quite new. We were on the 17th floor and didn't have any problems with the lifts. The hotel is a little odd though in that the furnishings are very modern but certain other elements such as the lifts and air conditioning are quite dated (obviously haven't been updated since the hotel changed hands). Had breakfast on two mornings, nice but quite expensive. Also ate dinner there one night and it was very nice. The C bar is lovely with great views. There is also a nice pub just across the road called The Elephant and Castle, food is good. Overall, I would stay again if the same rate was available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yanks50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia for 5 nights at the beginning of Aug 2009. We were meeting 2 groups of family members from different towns and requested to have rooms next to each other, which they were able to accommodate. We checked in, went to dinner and when we came back we realized the air conditioner was not working. We called the front desk (around 11:30pm) and someone came up right away and moved us one room down, which was a complete upgrade from the room we had before, no questions asked and we didn't have to switch back for the rest of the trip! The hotel is located in central Chicago, right off the magnificent mile. In walking distance to every sight seeing spot you can think of (some walks longer than others). It is also immediately next door to Traditional Chicago Deep Dish Pizza --- go early, no reservations on weekends. For the things not in walking distance (wrigley field, various restaurants) The Train was about 3 blocks walking distance. The staff was nice and even gave us recommendations to local bars (that were not expensive) The skytop bar is cool, but way over priced. Also the main elevator that goes to the higher floors is very slow. Housekeeping was great. Before you go, you can go online and request the type of pillow you want (down, ipod speaker, buckwheat, memory foam, firm) They also allow you to borrow (complimentary) and IPOD walking tour of Chicago We used the fitness center a couple days, very small but adequate...a couple elipticals (with TV attached), bikes, weight machines, water cooler... about the size of one hotel room. There is Duane Reed around the corner for snacks and beverages as well. All in all great deal (we booked through a different hotel website, not directly through the hotel and got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment! They Coined the Phrase”
Reviews.Author: allmosthome
Reviews.Content: Word to the wise.....when in Chicago do not stay at the Affinia....a high end boutique hotel, with, we found out, low end service. The first suite we were given had an air vent for the building right outside our fourth floor window that emitted a constant, droning sound. This would have prohibited a good night's sleep. So we requested a room change. We were offered one on the 28th floor, with a queen. Although we originally had reserved a king suite we were open to a queen, if that was all that was available. But when we made the move to the room we found the queen was barely a double. A great view of the of the city, but a double? Seriously, what's right about that? The third try appeared to be a winner, 28th floor...floor to ceiling windows, leather appointed living room, really nice..... we could finally kick off the shoes and stick around. But get this, have you ever seen a sign next to the coffee maker that says "Coffee $1.00/Tea $.50" ? I can't make this up, I'm not that creative! I have never seen that before... Nestea tea bags and a no-name coffee, topped off with foam cups. Sets a real tone here, doesn't it? Follow that up with a concierge who's total eatery knowledge must consist of Taco Bell. Thank goodness for cell phones and Andy's Jazz Club understanding...We were repeatedly assured that we would not need a reservation, but definitely found that not to be the case. An hour and a half later our lack of a reservation limited us to a table in the bar, added a $10.00 cover charge per person, and put a time limit on our stay. But that was only the beginning......the most memorable moment came at about 1:00 am. Are you ready?" My husband discovered a LEAK in the bathroom....directly ABOVE THE TOILET Yes, from an access panel in the ceiling. He was the lucky one to find it, or experience it, whatever the case may be. It's so much fun calling the desk at that time of night and having a maintenance guy in your room at 1:30 am. Did I mention the elevator wait averaged 5 minutes? So I guess making it up to the room by 1:25 am must have been a record. The employee mopped the water up around the toilet and sink with THE BATH MAT and HAND TOWELS, then left, assuring us he could fix the leak. Fifteen minutes later we received a phone call saying the leak had been fixed and they thought the leak had been from the restaurant ice machine on the floor above. Did I mention the wet bath mat and towels were left for us to clean up? For all this trouble, hassle, and down right creepiness and a total of $60.00 plus tax was taken off our bill. This was clearly a situation where our entire stay should have been comped. They could not have been counting on our return business and they were right. I

Reviews.Title: “A really nice clean and comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: conimarie
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a weekend to meet up with a IL friend for shipping. My friend was interested in going to the Magnificent Mile area so I chose the Affinia Hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. I took the hop on hop off bus which takes you all over and there is a pick up spot only a few blocks away. There is so much to do in Chicago, you need more than a long weekend to enjoy it all. I look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but didn't wow me.”
Reviews.Author: jstro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated his 40th birthday with a night's stay at the Affinia Chicago in a standard king room on the 18th floor. We got a decent rate for the room through AAA. It is rated as a 4-star, but I would only give it 3 - 3 1/2. The room felt old to me, with trendy furnishings and wallpaper added to try and make it better. It was very clean, but there was peeling paint on the baseboard and the windows were old. The furnishings were very nice though, especially the large flat screen TV. We liked the three steps down from the entryway to the bed and desk area, it made it less generic. Overall the room was fairly small. The rooms are not soundproof either. You could hear people talking in the hallway and the doors slam closed. Luckily there aren't many rooms on each floor, so we didn't hear the noises too often. The bathrooms were fairly nice, but the bright orange wallpaper was a bit much. The Aveda toiletries were nice though. The best and worst part of our stay was the location. You can't beat being one block from Water Tower if you're there to shop, it was great. The worst part of the location was being across the street from the emergency room at Northwestern Memorial Hospital. I was awakened several times by ambulance sirens. I am used to night noise and sirens because we live on a busy street in the city, but these sirens were definitely louder than I'm used to. The service was decent, but nothing special. We did ask to have special pillows from their pillow menu brought to our room. They were waiting when we got back from shopping. My husband likes the Swedish contour pillows, and I got the magnetic therapy pillow. It really wasn't great, pretty flat and hard. The overnight parking fee was a bit high, $48 for 24 hours. You do have in and out privileges though, so we were able to drive to dinner rather than taking cabs. We waited about 10 minutes for the valet to bring our car each time. Overall we had a nice time, but would probably try someplace else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hotel Staff was Extremely Helpful!”
Reviews.Author: 4HRoss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked our stay at the Affinia Chicago through Perfect Escapes. Not only did we get a great rate $169, but that got us upgraded to the Junior Suite(largest room) and included a full breakfast in the C-House restaurant and allowed us to check out of our room at 4pm. We did request to have a room on the upper floors, due to reviews that complained of street noise. We still heard the occasional siren from emergency vehicles though. Gino's East is directly next door and always had a line outside the building. We placed a carryout order and was there to pick it up fresh out of the oven in 45 minutes, walk it back to our room and we did enjoy the deep dish pie. We also went up and had cocktails at the C-View Lounge located on the 29th floor rooftop. Very classy and great views. The hotel staff was very helpful and acted on every request, they also have discount coupons and line passes to many local restaurants and clubs:) We had a great time on our first trip to Chicago and would not hesitate in booking our next stay with the Affinia Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location- close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: MidwesternM0ver
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to Chicago to enjoy a weekend in the city. We chose the Affinia because of the modern look and the location- and neither disappointed. The decor was beautifully streamlined and the rooms were simple and clean. Located on Superior St, the hotel is east of the Magnificent Mile and provides the perfect base for getting to Navy Pier, all the shops, and other areas of Chicago due to its close proximity to the Red Line Chicago stop. We were able to get to Chinatown in a matter of minutes from the hotel. In addition to the great location and atmosphere, the rooftop bar was very cozy and had delicious (if not a bit overpriced) drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and quiet weekend”
Reviews.Author: Scarletx7
Reviews.Content: The hotel decor was dated and not very attractive, but the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Staff was friendly and I would rate this hotel as average.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia review”
Reviews.Author: BVnLJ
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Chicago and my wifeâ€™s first. I took my wife on a surprise trip so she could experience Chicago. I picked this hotel from the ratings / feedback. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel. The staff was very pleasant and informative. They assisted us with tour information and even called and reserved seats for our boat tour. The hotel location is just off the Magnificent Mile near the Water Tower. The only reason we would not return to this hotel is so we could experience a different one. Comfort a plus, location a plus, staff double plus. The only negative was the construction going on next door. It really was not an issue; we were on the go most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but..........”
Reviews.Author: Traveller10081
Reviews.Content: The Affinia is a nice hotel with comfortable rooms but a terrible lift (elevator) system. Two go to floors 1 - 7 and two go to floors 1 - 20something. I was on floor 10 and had to wait ages every time I called the lift from which of course only two were suitable for my journey. When I left I had to carry my heavy case down to floor 7 where I had a choice of 4 lifts after waiting a long time for a lift to arrive at my floor. I have stayed there before but the problem has got no better; I don't know what is the answer but I don't think I;ll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Convenient and Amenity-Filled!”
Reviews.Author: christine3_17_77
Reviews.Content: This place was fabulous! Ideal location. The C-View Rooftop Lounge was decorated beautifully. Didn't eat there, but the menus sounded great at both C-View and C-House, and they served great unique drinks. The concierge was so helpful. "Experience Kits" are a great idea! The room was beautiful and well worth the money -- about the same as the Sheraton, which wasn't nearly as nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: terkim
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in good location, close to shops, entertainment, bars and transport links. What really stands out though is quality of service - Joel on front door, Erin on reception and Christopher the Concierge deserve special mentions - nothing too much trouble and always looking to go the extra mile in making you feel welcome. We wouldn't look at another hotel in Chicago now and can't wait to get back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zero2ero
Reviews.Content: Pros- All my experience at Affinia was very good. We were very pleased with the hotel employees, the room, the service, and the location. The staff had great smiles and friendly and very helpful. The location is right next to Mag Miles and Nave Pier, and Bus stop and Train station also a couple min away. Great location! Cons - There are only 2 elevators avail to higher floor (above 8th) in 24 story building. It took average 2-3 min waiting period. (and, it is a small, fit only 7-8 people max) C-bar and C-House (restaurent) were great. Not much a city view because it is surrouned by buildings, but still We loved the atmosphere. Overall, It was great stey. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel off Michigan”
Reviews.Author: TexasTvlr
Reviews.Content: The Affinia is a smaller hotel about 4 blocks north of the river off Michigan. So, great location for walking to river, downtown, the Lake, Gold Coast, Lincoln Park, etc. Very central which was really nice. Rooms are larger than one would expect and well appointed. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. We especially loved stopping at the end of a long day on the rooftop bar for an afternoon drink. The bar did make the elevator situation (very slow and small) a little annoying at times. We were on the 14th floor and the elevators were the only issue in that you had to wait a bit usually and sometimes it would be full and you'd have to wait for the next one. Floors 1 -7 have a different elevator bank that seemed much less crowded. We upgraded to a Suite for $40 a night and found the extra space well worth it. A few notes of other items: HIGHLY recommend Bobby's Bike Tours. We did a Chicago Neighborhood tour through the Gold Coast, Old Town, Streeterville and Lincoln Park. Was very fun and informative way to see the city. Did not like David Burkes Steakhouse. The hotel recommended this because we could not get into Gibsons. It was very expensive and steaks were not that great at all. We were very disappointed especially since it was a $300 dinner.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysonthemove22
Reviews.Content: The Affinia was a pleasant surprise. It was priced well, the room was quite large and the layout was unique. The bathroom and desk were on an upper level. The beds, tv and recliner just three steps down on a lower level. It worked really well for 4 people in the room. Only minor issue was that the tub didn't drain well (but we didn't complain about it). The hotel is in the heart of Michigan Avenue, yet it was easy to get to Lincoln Park, the White Sox game and Bucktown via the subway. The only time we took a cab was to get our luggage to/from the subway and it was only a $10 cab ride compared to a $40+ cab ride to/from O'Hare . Highly recommend the Affinia and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Location, room, bed, and staff were all great! Elevators & ambulance sirens...not so great.”
Reviews.Author: SCMike92673
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from four nights at the Affifina. Overall, we were very happy with our hotel choice. The staff was VERY helpful! The concierge, Marisol, was FANTASTIC! She helped us with any and everything we requested. Our room was very spacious and the bed was super comfortable. The hotel, and room, was very clean. Being one block off Michigan Ave. and right next to the famous Gino's East (pizza) was perfect! Now, for the not so great. The elevators require a lot of patience. During off hours the elevators are ok, but during busy hours you can stand and wait for 10 minutes. At one point, after a ten minute wait on the 24th floor, I took the stairs down 24 flights. The Affinia is located next to a hospital and sirens could be heard at all times of the day and into the evening (from inside our room). The sirens seemed to subside late, late in the evening (unless I was just sleeping so deeply in that comfortable bed). Keep in mind, most people are only in their rooms for an hour or so in the morning.......and then later in the evening (and sleeping of course). Overall, I'd give the Affinia a thumbs up and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Chicago Affinia”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaNyc
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at the Chicago Affinia and really enjoyed our stay. It's a half block off Michigan Ave. and just another couple the other way to the lake so the location was great. We had a view of the Hancock building out our wall to wall window which was an unexpected treat. The bed was comfy, the minibar was big enough that we could put in some of our own stuff and it had two comfy chairs so neither of us had to sit on the bed to relax. Service was good, the room was very clean and the "my concierge" option they offer was great. All the services I requested through it were delivered to our room about 10 minutes after we checked in (at 11AM and they gave us a room). If you are not familiar with Chicago they offer a pre-loaded ipod with walking tours and a deck of large cards with different walking tours mapped out. Those were very handy for us. Gym was very nice too and well equipped. They do not have a business center but the Concierge let us use her computer to check our email and print our boarding passes too. All in all a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no amenities”
Reviews.Author: mosrm
Reviews.Content: I will start with the negative aspects. There is $10 charge per 24 hour use of internet, the in-room coffee is $1 per packet, there is no business center (however I was able to print boarding passes at the front desk), we had a really strange experience in the hotel restaurant, the service in the roof top bar is lousy- had to beg someone to wait on us. Our room was on the 4th floor at the back of the hotel which faced north. Both mornings we were there I was awakened at 5am by a really loud truck that banged dumpsters around until about 7. Believe me, this was very loud and very annoying!! There was no where to get coffee early in the morning (except to use the $1 packets in the room). Now for the positive aspects. The location of this hotel is great, the rooms are spacious and nicely decorated, the beds are very comfortable, the bathrooms are spacious, the front desk staff was friendly and helpful for the most part. I got a great rate on this hotel so I consider the experience good overall, and the only way I will stay here again will be if I get another great rate. I really don't like to stay in hotels that have no amenities! I would recommend this hotel to a friend if they were able to get a great rate, and I would warn them about all of the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ArchitectureGal
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago but for a romantic getaway decided to stay at the Affinia. It was perfect! Everything was so hip and trendy and just beautiful. The rooftop deck was emaculate! I will definetly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathyq30
Reviews.Content: stayed here in may - absolutely loved it. lovely hotel and v central - just off michagan ave. you could walk to nearly everywhere you would need to from this hotel - all shops and tourist attractions. got a great deal through expedia and stayed in a suite so half of the room was like a living room with a couch and other half was the bedroom. loads of space. lovely big bathroom and dressing room too. never had breakfast there as our deal did not include it but ate in bar one nite and food was lovely. rooftop bar v nice too - we were lucky the weather was nice when we were there. also staff v friendly and helpful. was overcharged on our room bill as drinks someone else had had been put against our room number but this was just human error and once pointed out this was corrected immediately. would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great with a couple caveats”
Reviews.Author: purcfin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Chicago annually for the Air and Water Show. Due to increasing service problems at the Gold Coast hotel we used to utilize, we decided to try the Affinia. Generally, we were pleased with the level of service and detail at this hotel. As previously mentioned in a number of reviews, the two available elevators are insufficient in terms of speed and capacity to efficiently transport guests when the hotel is at higher occupancy. Therefore, if you are on a higher floor, don't want to use the stairs, and want to go in and out several times a day, plan on adding 10-20 minutes round trip, each trip, of elevator waiting time to your excursions. Also, the hotel is adjacent to Northwestern Hospital and even though our room was on the opposite side, siren noise was not well insulated and it may disturb light sleepers. For supplies, there is a well-stocked Dominicks grocery store several blocks directly south on Grand Avenue. For Wi-Fi, there are options available other than paying the for the in-house service. However, these problems would not dissuade us from considering returning to the Affinia next time.

Reviews.Title: “It was a Pleasure from the Very beginning!”
Reviews.Author: JennieIndy
Reviews.Content: My son and I decided to take a Memory Lane trip to Chicago - I grew up in the city and he wanted to see my old neighborhood. From the moment we pulled up to the Front Door the Affinia proved itself over and over to be the best hotel I have ever stayed. Joel (the Front Doorman) opened my door with a big grin and wished me a Good Evening! From that point on he remembered our names and gave us great tips and pointers about the area. The room was fantastic - the bed was the most comfortable I have even experienced - and the special pillow was a great touch. Other highlights of the trip - witnessing the Perfect Sox Game, dinner in Chinatown, visiting Holy Family church, and just walking along my breathtaking home town. My son is a United States soldier and is heading to Ft. Benning for additional training - I thank the Affinia for giving us more Mom/Son memories for us to cherish.

Reviews.Title: “The Affinia--Great rooms but some other inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: momma2twoboys
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to book my stay at the Affinia for a moms' weekend away. I read dozens of reviews before choosing this hotel, and I carefully made reservations through expedia for a room with 2 double beds. My first impression of the hotel was shot, when we walked in to check in. We were told by a front desk manager that no rooms with double beds were available. When I told her I reserved one through expedia, she said that expedia only reserves the number of beds, not the room type requested. She was going to assign us to a room with a king and a pullout--completely unacceptable with the hotel costs and not very fun for one mom's getaway. When I insisted that we get what I reserved and paid for and pulled out our itinerary with expedia showing a room with 2 double beds, she made several calls to housekeeping to check the status of rooms and finally found one for us. Once we got to our room, we were thrilled--beautiful, new, modern, comfortable, pretty, with a gorgeous view of the city. We loved the 4 soft pillows per bed, the sheets, and the reading lights on the headboard. The aveda toiletries were fun too. The down part--the 28 floor hotel only has 2 small elevators (6 people max) and everyone seemed frustrated by how long it would take to get up or down--even the hotel staff. The rooftop bar was fun, but expensive! My bailey's on ice was $14.50 before tip. ($10 for the bailey's, $3 for the rocks, and $1.50 for tax). Tip--don't pay for the continental breakfast. There's a great bakery just 2 blocks straigt out the hotel doors with wonderful food (anaheim scrambler, swiss oatmeal) at good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Honora
Reviews.Content: I was a little bit nervous about this hotel having read very mixed reviews on Tripadvisor but we got a great rate so I decided to go ahead and book anyway. This hotel was fantastic. It is less than a block away from the Magnificent Mile and within walking distance from pretty much every tourist attraction in the city. Slightly further away destinations are very well served by public transport which is readily available. We ate breakfast every morning in the Corner Bakery which is only a block away and has great food. The staff in the hotel were really friendly especially the bellmen in thier cool hats. Thanks Danny for all your help and good advice!!! The room was lovely, clean and quiet at night. Book this hotel if you are going to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique-style hotel with some plusses and a few minuses”
Reviews.Author: holidaybowl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Affinia Chicago in mid-June with a friend. We stayed at Affinia for three nights. Rooms: The rooms are good-sized, comparable to a 4/5 star chain hotel. In this respect, Affinia is better than your average boutique hotel. The room in includes a large tv and a good-sized writing desk. The bathroom is average sized, some might think it on the small side. It didn't bother me, but there isn't a large vanity for higher-maintenance travelers. Service: The front desk/concierge were always very friendly in greeting us when we walked through the lobby or asked for anything. The room included free Wi-Fi (ask at the front desk). We did get stuck in the elevator for about 15 minutes (apparently we aren't the first, reading other reviews). The staff were attentive and tried to deal with the situation as quickly as possible, but the elevators are small and obviously old. Being stuck in a small space with three other people was, at best, annoying. Location: The hotel is in what seemed to be a safe location. My friend (a young woman) and I felt safe walking around at night. It is within walking distance from two famous pizza places: Gino's East is next door and Giordano's is three short blocks away. Further away, there are some homeless hanging around the nearby Walgreen's, but nothing that made us feel unsafe. You will run into panhandlers, but that is true of pretty much any big U.S. city. The hotel is right by the Magnificent Mile (shopping), but far from the cultural sights. Of course, if you want to stay closer to the Art Institute/Millennium Park, you will pay more for it. One drawback is that the hotel is not really close to an El train stop on the Loop. So, if you want to get to the Art Institute or other neighborhoods via the Loop, it can be time consuming. It is close to the State St. Red line (which runs north/south), which you can take and then transfer to a line that runs the Loop. We found ourselves wasting a lot of time doing this, so it might be worth it to take a cab. Or, it is possible that we weren't savvy enough to figure out how to use the El efficiently. Restaurant/Bar: We didn't use the restaurant to order any food, nor did we go to the rooftop bar. Bottom Line: Given the relatively low price of this hotel, I think it is a good choice for couples, friends, or solo travelers. I wouldn't stay here for a special occasion (unless I were trying to save money), but it was perfect for a short trip to Chicago with a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ready for Prime Time”
Reviews.Author: MangoGT
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 4 (with 2 dogs) staying at the Affinia Chicago during a busy convention weekend--although we were not attending the expo. We had high expectations of this hotel based on the mostly positive TripAdvisor reviews and the services offered on the Affinia website. Check-In: We wanted to check in 1 hour early and called ahead to ask if the room would be ready. We were assured that it would and timed our day appropriately. Upon arriving, we learned (from a fairly rude front desk clerk) that we would need to pay $30 extra per adult per night for my brother and sister-in-law. This was shocking as we had confirmed 4 adults in our original reservation and requested amenities for 4 adults, but were never told that there would be an additional charge of $60/night. The front desk clerk added that our rate was already well below their nightly rate and this is their standard policy. I had booked my room directly on the Affinia website--not through a 3rd party--so I was surprised to hear that my rate was TOO low. I accepted the new charge but we weren't given a room. Instead, we were asked to wait until the room was ready--which we were warned would be up to an hour. After waiting for a while, we were told that it would be about 15 more minutes. We had some activities planned so we asked them to hold our luggage and call when the room would be ready. We never received a phone call--and the room wasn't ready until 3 hours later. Room: We booked a junior suite--which was supposedly two classes above a standard room. While the room was of decent size and contained two beds, it was not a suite by any standard. There was no separation between the two beds (it was one straight, long room). The furnishings were modern and the room was clean, but the overall layout was very awkward. Amenities: The Affinia website boasts all sorts of amenities that will be brought to your room upon arrival. Out of the 4 or 5 amenities that we requested (including a yoga kit and walking maps), I think we only received 2 "special" pillows. A note about the pillows: despite booking a junior suite for 4 adults, the hotel has a policy of allowing only 2 "special" pillows per room. Concierge: We are familiar with Chicago and already knew where we would be eating meals and spending our time. However, we did ask the concierge for directions to a location for a river cruise with the Chicago Architecture Foundation. The directions we received were entirely incorrect, and as a result, we missed our tour. Luckily, the CAF rebooked us on a later cruise. Very unprofessional for the Affinia Concierge to provide incorrect directions. Further, several times that we asked for our car it was over 30 minutes late, and on a couple of occasions, never called at all. Bell Service: The bell service was a source of a lot of humor, anxiety, and frustration for us. The first gentleman that greeted us was pleasant and tried to make conversation. He later greeted us again when he brought our luggage to the room--and asked the exact same questions. We learned that he was reading a script out of a notepad. The same gentleman also explained every single feature of the room to us, as if we had never stayed in a hotel--or used a telephone, closet, safe, minibar, bathtub, sink, etc. A quick note about the luggage: when we originally checked in we were told that we could retrieve our own luggage upon returning when the room was ready--but we found that it was fiercely guarded by the bell staff that firmly told us otherwise and essentially pushed us away. Overall, most of the staff came off as overbearing and creepy, although one fellow that spent most of his time outside did stand out as being genuinely pleasant. Conclusion: The location of this hotel and the modern rooms are very nice. However, there are several areas of service where the hotel is truly lacking. VIsitors that have stayed in true upscale hotels will surely notice this, but for the majority of people this place is fine. We will be back in downtown Chicago but we won't be back to the Affinia. If anyone reads all the way through this review we would recommend the Intercontinental, Fairmont, or any of the Kimpton Hotels instead for a reasonably priced luxury hotel. Final Note: I raised my concerns directly to Claudia Eggspuhler, the general manager. While she was kind about inviting me to sit and speak with her candidly, her response to my comments was essentially to agree with me and note that other visitors have voiced the same problems. She did not make me feel that my business was appreciated, nor did she genuinely seem interested in having us return. She offered a free breakfast if we come back, but I can afford breakfast. I just want better service. It appears that many of the issues that we observed with this hotel may stem from apathetic upper management, which is unfortunate for a property with so much potential.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: kimbaetiquette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a one week vacation at the Affinia on Superior Street after reading the positive reviews on this site. We were so happy that we did. From the time we exited our taxi to the time we entered to leave, we were treated like special guests. The room was modern, clean and its duplex design made it feel larger than it was. Even though there was no pool, and my husband is a pool junkie, he has declared that he would not go anywhere else on future visits to Chicago. The beach is within walking distance. Our first room was noisy because of garbage collectors. We complained and were immediately moved and upgraded with apologies. The location is two buildings removed from the Magnificient Mile, so it is accessible to everything without the need for a car. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who cares about personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: CarmelJ0
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I were at the Affinia for the 2009 Taste of Chicago, and our stay was absolutely wonderful! The hotel has a great location. It is a block away from Michigan Avenue, so the shops, movie theater, and restaurants are all nearby. The hotel provides a free trolley to and from Navy Pier on the weekends, but even Navy Pier is about a 10-minute walk from the hotel. The rooms are clean and the use of space is very functional. The C-View bar/lounge on the top floor makes for a nice place to hangout during the social hour, or in the evening for a nightcap. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. Overall, it is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PenToronto
Reviews.Content: The suite we had was perfect. Bed really comfy and you get to choose from 5 or 6 different pillows. Half block to Magnificent Mile. Parking was high but so is everything in the area. Victor, one of the bellman was a real hoot and made us feel very welcome. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel - except broken elevator”
Reviews.Author: babystepstraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Affinia Chicago and absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms were very modern, it did feel like a suite. The bed area was set a few steps down from the refrigerator and bathroom - everything was very clean and comfortable. The concierge helped us with finding restaurants and sights and the bartender at the rooftop restaurant recommended an awesome blues club. The location is good, we are walkers, so we had no problem taking our time to walk around the city. The only problem in the area that we encountered was that we arrived late on a Friday night - around 11pm - and it took us quite a while to find a restaurant in the area that was open and still serving dinner (not just bar food). Many of the restaurants in the immediate area were shutting down, which was a surprise to us since we're used to restaurants being open quite late. We did manage to find a place, though, that was open 'till 4am, but the owner informed us that he believes he is one of two restaurants open that late in the area. Our only complaint within the hotel itself was that only half the elevators were working which meant that we had to wait quite a while to go up and down to our room on the 23rd floor. This also meant that when the elevators did come, they were uncomfortably packed and definitely often above the posted capacity, which made me a little nervous. We would definitely return to Affinia Chicago based on our experience, however it is more expensive then we usually pay - but we were able to find it "on sale" on some discount websites.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place! Make this your first choice!”
Reviews.Author: mjboone
Reviews.Content: Great location and the service was perfect! We had a junior suite which was huge- 2 king beds plus hug bath and sitting area... ask for this room! Christopher, the conceige, was so helpful and friendly;.. he called me by name everytime we came into the lobby. Such a special feeling in this place... they also have a lovely bar on the rooftop. It's small, and just beautiful. Danielle was a server the evening we were there and she made us feel right at home. I have nothing but great things to say about this place. Parking is expensive at 48 / day, but you could self park and walk down to hotel about 3 blocks away. for about half the price.. We opted to stay in hotel parking as it was easier.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room - great Chicago location!”
Reviews.Author: kcroadtripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two hotels in Chicago to get two different experiences during the week. The doorman and bellman were so very nice and personable. Always greeted by name. Our reservation was for a king room by default, and they were very nice about switching us to a double to accommodate our family. The 22nd floor room faced south and had an awesome view of the city. I loved the studio feel with the elevated walk-in with desk, well-stocked mini-bar and red foiled bathroom- very cool - great Aveda bath products . Take two steps down into the room with a great recliner. The beds were very comfortable. Small but well equipped workout room. My only complaint was a very slow elevator. Management was very understanding about a personal situation which required early checkout. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location, Hate the parking”
Reviews.Author: evonut
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location near north Michigan Ave, Aveda products, comfy bed, friendly bellman Cons: tiny elevators, metallic orange wallpaper in the bathroom, $48 parking, $9.50/day internet Tips: We parked for $25/day about three blocks away at a public parking lot located on the corner of State Street and Illinois St, diagonally across from the Courtyard Marriott. It was a warm & balmy day in Chicago so we didn't mind the walk. Also, Walgreens 24hrs was around the corner--you can pick up snacks and water for a fraction of Affinia's prices.

Reviews.Title: “I Thought My Standard Room was a Suite!”
Reviews.Author: LovesMexicoLancPa
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel on our way home after a train vacation. The service was exceptional. The room was amazing. I had a good rate and thought I must have been upgraded to a suite only to find out that it was a "standard room!" I never had a standard room with a living room, bedroom, separate office area, sitting room outside bathroom. The customer service was superb from check in to check out. I have never sampled this brand before, but will make it my first choice after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy very much our stay”
Reviews.Author: blimele
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel--staff very polite and helpful! Concierge very helpful in arranging side trips and restaurant recommendations. We loved the hotel and our room that was immaculate and extremely comfortable. Best Location close to a lot of great restaurants and easy to get around town.. Overall, we would like to come back to this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Lewisburg04
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after the reviews we found here, and we got a great price through Orbitz. We stayed for five nights during the first week of June. It was the perfect location for our stay in Chicago. It was very close to lots of great shopping. We loved the friendly staff, especially the doorman who we chatted with everyday. We broke the chain on our window shade in our room on our first day, and the engineer was in our room within twenty minutes and fixed the problem very quickly. We learned that the rooftop bar is the highest open-air patio in the city! It also had great views! We read the reviews about the slow elevators before we went, so we were prepared for the waiting. We were on the tenth floor, so we ran down the stairs several times to the 7th floor where we could catch the quicker elevators that services the lower floors. We will return to the Affinia on our next trip to Chicago, and we would love to visit one of the New York locations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for any chciago visitor!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsrock26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! The staff was so friendly and helpful and they could meet your every need. The concierge was incredible, too. There was absolutley nothing he didn't know about the city. He really contributed to our visit to chicago! The room was perfected in sanitation, design, and comfort. The beds are cozy and big, with a nice, soft matress, and the room has a very intresting contemporary design. And the room was SPOTLESS! The maid NEVER missed a spot! Never had service like that! While you're there, you are waling distance of the Magnificent mile, Water Tower Place, the Chicago Tribune Building, and the Chicago River. You're gonna have to use public transit to get to many of the other attractions though. Its about a 10 minute cab ride to any of them. Couple flaws - If you don't like elevators, request a low floor. The building was an office building, and the elevators aren't meant to work in a hotel. The elevators can get really crowded. They're small too. Another thing is that this hotel is across the street from a hospital. Sirens scream a lot around there. But overall, I LOVE THIS PLACE! Only hotel I would ever stay at in the windy city! WILL STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain boutique hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: Chicago has a lot of hotel choices with reasonable prices. We prefer boutique hotels and Chicago has a lot of them as well. We picked Affinia because of its location near the lakeshore where we wanted to go for morning runs and the price was unbeatable. About six weeks before our trip, the hotel website was offering a special rate. We booked and prepaid for a junior suite averaging $186 per night. The hotel is located just off the Magnificent Mile so was a great location for shopping. A short walk south on Michigan Avenue will take you across the Chicago River to Millennium and Grant Park where we also wanted to go. And with the proximity to the lakeshore pathway, the location for us was ideal. The hotel has a number of extra amenities including C Restaurant, a 29th floor roof top bar, in room spa services and a fitness center. We had a lunch and a breakfast at the restaurant and enjoyed a nice meal and pleasant service each time. The roof top bar on the 29th floor provided a good view all the way to Millennium Park and over the rooftops of nearby buildings on Michigan Avenue while sipping on a drink and soaking in a bit of sunshine. We did not try out the spa services or fitness center. The room itself was very comfortable. Lots of room with a spacious sitting area and a flat screen tv which could be swung around to face either the bed or the sitting areas. The bathroom, like most boutique hotels, was stylish but small. A vanity area helped ease bathroom congestion. The hotel offers a pillow menu of six different types of pillows. I tried the Swedish memory pillow which offered extra neck support and supposedly eased tension. Hard to tell since I was on vacation and tension was not a concern. The hotel also offers experience kits. I took the stay fit one with a yoga mat, work out DVDs, etc. but did not use it much since we were running each morning. They also offer a walking tour kit and a picnic kit. The room has a coffee maker and coffee free of charge. We did not sample from the mini bar nor use room service dining. We wanted ice and wine glasses had to request that each afternoon but delivery was very prompt. Housekeeping kept the room clean. We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful and could not fault the service at all. When we arrived, they gave us city maps and directions. They printed out our board passing at the front desk the day before we were to leave. The doormen were always very welcoming. The one negative aspect was the noise from building construction next door. The single pane windows did not reduce the noise level by much, so it was noticeable each morning. If you want to sleep in late, which we did not, you may not want to stay at this hotel. Another minor annoyance was the elevator. One of the two elevators servicing floors 8 - 29 was being repaired leaving only one elevator and often some rather tedious waiting and then getting on a crowded elevator car. The other elevator is supposed to be repaired by the end of June 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off Michigan Ave!”
Reviews.Author: Travelkidd
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Affinia Hotel May 14-18, 2009 through the hotelâ€™s website for $115-135 USD/night for a studio suite, after seeing it on travelticker. Our very spacious suite included a double bed, fully stocked mini-bar, large flat panel TV, wireless internet (extra fee of $10/24hrs), coffee supplies as well as a couch and chair â€“ easily large enough for entertaining or relaxing. Location â€“ the hotel is perfectly situated on a side street about one block west of Michigan Avenue and a multitude of restaurants and shopping. Hotel â€“ the hotel itself is modern, classy and inviting and includes a rooftop lounge/bar area with great views of the city. There is a restaurant located within the hotel which has an excellent brunch menu and outdoor seating. The hotel also has many free services including toiletries, guide books with iPods containing walking tours, and pillow selection. Customer Service â€“ the staff is very friendly and helpful â€“ from the front desk to the doormen. Chicago: I would recommend 2 items to consider when visiting Chicago. 1) The city offers a free service which matches you with a guide who will give you a walking tour of a section of the city of your choice. The guides are very knowledgeable and you get to see places you probably wouldnâ€™t. I highly recommend it: http://www.chicagogreeter.com 2) the second is to eat at Japanois on W Chicago Ave. Eat upstairs then head down to their river-side lounge area for drinks. A couple minor issues noted: the elevators are very slow to the upper floors and paying for wireless internet access is awful as this is included from most hotels. In sum, if youâ€™re looking for great value, great location, friendly staff, and a modern hotel, book at Affinia Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Impressive As We Hoped--Luke Warm”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: I spent nearly a week at the Affinia while on business. I chose the hotel because of the reviews I read in this forum. I typically stay at the large hotel chains. We arrived at about 8pm and the bell/doorman working was absolutely wonderful. He was there throughout our stay, new our names, greeted us like family, and was the brightest spot of our stay. When checking in we found no soap, shampoo, or other ammenities. Light bulbs were missing-the lamps were in poor shape and hanging by a thread, etc. Just lots of very small but irritating problems. We never had a thorough job cleaning in our 6 days...the night housekeeping staff came up every night with things forgotten by the day cleaners. We were on the 7th floor but if you are above that good luck. On two occasions we tried to make it up to the roof-top bar and gave up after 15 minutes of waiting on an elevator. It is shameful how long some folks waited to get to and from their rooms. Many guests would take the one elevator to 7 and walk the rest of the way. We found the hotel front desk staff bored and marginally interested in any of our questions or issues. Sure we got done what we needed to but there was no real interest. I have no idea what expectations the other reviewers have of a hotel but this place is really luke warm, at best. The hotel restaurant is a farce. It is totally pretentious for no good reason. The food is way over-priced as are the drinks...$13 for a house specialty that really isn't special. All in all it is equal to the likes of an Embassy Suites without the free breakfast. For the price there are way better places in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “My first Trip Advisor recommended quasi-miss. Nice but not impressive.”
Reviews.Author: Bedub247
Reviews.Content: I am beginning to think boutique hotel means "small rooms." I'll trade some trendiness for larger, more comortable rooms and some double or triple-paned windows. My wife was in town to take the bar exam, and noise at night was a concern. The desk said we were on the quiet side, yikes. The rooms were clean; the staff was a hit (doorman) and a miss (desk staff). We did enjoy the bar at the top, but did not eat at the restaurant. All in all, I'm just thinking Chicago has better to offer than this hotel. You won't be disappointed if you stay here, but if you're expecting the 4th-ranked hotel in Chicago (per TA) you will be a little disappointed. Location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad word to say about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: L0V3T0TRAV3L
Reviews.Content: Booked 5 nights at the Affinia Chicago from 22nd May following the good reviews on Trip Advisor and can honestly say that it lived up to it's reputation. We booked the hotel in November, and from the outset we received updates from the concierge via email to keep us informed of what our options were for pre-booking room amenities, such as the pillow menu and bath robes, and tours etc. Nearing the time of the booking, we received a further update to anticipate out arrival. We had a small query with the room charge, which we contacted the hotel about â€“ we were amazed at how efficiently and quickly they sorted it out. When we arrived at the hotel, the fantastic service continued. The staff were just wonderful; attentive, helpful and professional. We had requested a quiet room, high up, with a view and with a double bed and had all of these requests met. The room was on the 26th floor with great views. It was large, well equipped, nicely decorated and maintained and had a very comfortable super king bed (the choice of pillowâ€™s was a nice touch). The hotel restaurant had some of the best food we had ever tasted (breakfast and dinner). The location is right on the corner of the magnificent mile and is perfect for walking to anywhere within the main area of Chicago town. It's also right next door to a great pizza restaurant - Gino's East. We've visited many places across the globe, but the combination of a great hotel, really friendly people, delicious food and a wonderful city made this one of the best city breaks that we've ever had. We can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for the price....”
Reviews.Author: sulley73
Reviews.Content: Found an outstanding rate for a studio suite on hotels.com. The room itself was nice, with modern furnishings but the bed and bathroom should have been larger. All studio suites have queen size beds, and the bathroom for such a large room was tiny. Cons: Windows need soundproofing, studio suites only have queen size beds, doors do not have a do not disturb/housekeeping placard to place outside the door, did not have or offer nightly turn down service. Pros: Location of hotel is fantastic, room was pretty and spacious, rooftop bar, rooms are clean and housekeeping staff is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, and location.”
Reviews.Author: rick_austin
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you are visiting Chicago. It's just one block east of the Magnificent Mile and is in the heart of downtown. Overall service was great. Only thing to be aware of and this really doesn't fall on the hotel is that it is also right across the street from a hospital ,so a couple of nights the sirens woke us up in the middle of the night. So if you are a light sleeper might bring ear plugs if not enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: missdanielle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Hotel for our honeymoon. The room was very nice and we have a great view of the John Hancock building. Christoper, part of the hotel staff, was wonderful with giving us directions and helping us get a cab. The location was great also. Right around the corner from the Water Tower. The cons of the hotel was some of the staff. Since we were staying here for our honeymoon, I would of thought they would of done something a little special for us. They did not. Not even a bottle of champage. I was even told when I booked the room that something special would be done for us. So it was alittle disappointing. The restuarants close very early in the hotel. The bar at the top of the hotel is very nice, but small. Overall, I would stay here again. The room was cozy and room service was great. You can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EleanorJoel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Hotel, Chicago for the Memorial Day weekend over 4 nights. The hotel itself is a very modern but comfortable place to stay. We stayed in a standard room facing towards the John Hancock building, you did have the option to upgrade to a better view and slightly larger room for an extra $30/night, but we chose not to, as we like to explore the cities we travel to, rather than view them from our hotel room! Affinia Hotel is located on Superior Street, and is only 100m from the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Avenue), which is brilliant. It is also right next door to Gino's Pizza, which is reputed to being one of the best Chicago Pizza Houses, we went there for a late dinner after checking into the hotel without having to wait and had a fantastic meal. The hotel is about 1/2 a mile from the lake and another 1/2 a mile or so to the Navy Pier, so it's ideally located. The only downside to its location is it's right in the middle of several hospitals, one of which has an emergency section, which means Ambulance sirens ring out consistently throughout the day and night, otherwise the rooms are pretty quiet. One of the best things about the Affinia Hotel, was the Pillow Menu - you can choose from 6 different types of pillows! which was fantastic for both of us, as we don't like the standard feather down pillows that eventually turn into a thin wad of fabric by the morning. The staff at the Affinia Hotel are friendly, polite and very courteous. The hotel has a good restaurant called C-House which although we did not dine at, the menu looked extensive and very appetizing. They also have an awesome 29th Floor Rooftop Bar (C-View) which serves a fantastic array of cocktails. Overall, we very much enjoyed our trip to Chicago, primarily due to the wonderful hotel we stayed at which allowed us to take relaxing breaks between our hectic exploring sessions and get a good nights sleep before starting all over again!

Reviews.Title: “If only all business travel could meet these standards”
Reviews.Author: girlpez
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and quite frankly, my expectations were starting to reach new lows. I usually always choose W Hotels just for the consistency (of average hotels). The Affinia in Chicago has raised my expectations and W Hotels are going to suffer in comparison. This hotel is one of the cleanest I have stayed at in some time. Service was impeccable. Friendly front-desk staff and the extra towels I ordered arrived literally within minutes. The gym has new equipment with plenty of space. And such a fun vibe - without dark hallways and loud music. I have to thank the other reviewers - their reviews led me to the Affinia and I was so pleased. My new "Chicago Hotel". It will even lead me to try the Manhattan hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Liz92
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from 30th April - 7th May in a Junior Suite. The location and the room were excellent. The staff in the hotel were very helpful an courteous. Our room was on the 24th floor overlooking the front of the hotel and right in the corner. The hotel was one block from Michigan Avenue and two blocks from a Corner Bakery where you could get breakfast and there was a pizza place right next door. There was some noise ( sirens ) at night but you soon got used to that. A small downside was the amount of time you had to wait for the lift ( there was only one working to the upper floors ). The longest wait was on our last day and my husband had a 15 minutes wait for the lift to arrive. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Chicago, and this one is definitely tops. The service is impeccable, from the greeting at the front desk, to the doormen each time we came or left, couldn't ask for better. We got a fabulous rate on Expedia, and I chose to upgrade to a suite when we checked in. The suite was stunning. Flat screen, wall mounted plasma tv, dressing table outside of bathroom so my friend and I could easily get ready at the same time, very hip decor, Aveda toiletries, everything was wonderful. One block off Michigan makes the location perfect for a weekend of shopping, dining, going out. I would definitely stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTraveler2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Affinia Hotel in early May with a few friends and was very impressed. I picked the hotel because of it's location and good reviews on TripAdvisor, however, it still managed to exceed my expectations. We had rooms on the 28th floor and didn't experience any of the noise issues noted by some earlier reviewers. In fact, we never heard a peep from either outside or within the hotel. I found the room size to be very comfortable, not huge, but entirely normal for a hotel room (as opposed to a suite). The view from our room (2803) was quite impressive, looking out over the city, however, another friend stayed on the other side of the hall, facing I'm guessing the alley, and her room was a little darker since the view was blocked by nearby buildings. One of my friends was impressed by the Aveda products in the bathroom, the other with the pillow menu. I was just happy to find that the hotel was quiet and that the beds were comfortable. Might seem like low expectations, but I am always shocked at how many hotels have uncomfortable beds, since one would assume that providing a good nights sleep is really a hotel's primary purpose. One negative note, elevator service was very slow since only one was in working order. Otherwise, we were quite pleased and I would definitely stay at the Affinia again on future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Can't review Affinia because they switched me to another hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: oodiks
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend directly (not through any agency) with Affinia several weeks before arriving in Chicago for a weekend of birthday and anniversary celebration. I took advantage of Affinia's $149/night special and was required to pay with my credit card immediately in order to get this rate, and it was non-refundable as explained clearly by Affinia's reservation desk. A couple days before our arrival, an email comes in , saying that I've been switched to The James, a sister property of the Affinia.I wrote back, saying that I did not want or like this and that the amenities at the James were not as luxurious as the Affinia and that the James is rated around #12 on tripadvisor and the Affinia #4. There was a VERY quick response to my reply, but the answer was that I had no choice in the matter, and nothing was offered as compensation. I believed that I had no choice but to stay at the James, because, as I had mentioned, payment was due upon booking and was non-refundable.Being without choice , my wife and I did what anyone without a choice would do, we stayed at the James. ( I will leave a review for the James as well.) Upon checkout at the James, I was handed a bill for $149 for 2 nights plus taxes. There was a tremendous amount of confusion , as I told the James staff that I was already paid-up and they insisted that I still had a bill. I refused to pay until they checked with the Affinia. What happened was that Affinia had refunded my money to my card and they DID NOT tell me and they did not tell the James staff . I could have stayed elsewhere than the James (and I would have) but my transfer email from the Affinia nor their response to my complaint in any way shape or form indicted that my money had been refunded and I was no longer obliged to take the $149/night deal. I am left with a bait-and -switch feeling, booking at particular hotel and being switched late in the game to a lesser hotel.I also feel that it should have been explained to me that I was not obliged to stay at the second hotel, but this was not done because it is my believe that they did not want to lose the booking. Chicago is a great city , I will be there again for business and pleasure, but I'm very reluctant to deal with the Affinia again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent friendly service! beautiful spacious room!!!”
Reviews.Author: happy_travels04
Reviews.Content: From the front door on, the service is impeccable - the concierge is excellent!! Super friendly staff, ready to accommodate every room need - the stay was amazing, super relaxing - the best place to have a girls trip!

Reviews.Title: “Can't review since they moved me to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsgdds
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room here since I was going as part of a group meeting- I usually stay elsewhere in Chicago. I made the reservation via phone and was greeted with emails each week about any special requests I may have. Three nights before I was to arrive, I received an email telling me they were oversold and would relocate me to a different hotel. When I called, NO ONE could explain or help me.
