I spent an hour being told to call back the following day. I spoke with the Director of Operations the next day who apologized and offered to upgrade me to a suite (which I had reserved originally). I travel extensively for business and leisure and I have never had such poor communication with a "luxury" hotel. I would expect it from a hotel that charges 1/3 the price. Oh, by the way, I am staying at the Ritz Carlton for less than I was going to pay to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, absolutely recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: HPLNC
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, hotel feel is classic and crisp! I would highly recommend this hotel - you can't beat it. Found a wonderful rate online, which sweetened the deal. Linens were awesome and the rooms were spacious and tastefully arranged. We had two rooms that were connecting, which was just what we needed for our trip. The staff was so very nice and accommodating from the moment we arrived until we left for the airport home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Very highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: dublin80
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, lovely hotel, staff very friendly and professional. Beautiful bar on the top floor.. Would really highly recommend this especially if you want to do some shopping, its less than 1 minute walk from Saks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sjohnso6
Reviews.Content: I had a large, roomy, clean 2 bed room with a large bathroom, big minibar snack assortment and was tucked away nicely in the corner so that there was no hall noise. Customer Service here was absolutely incredible, from the doorman to the front desk, to the gentleman who delivered my toothpaste to my room when I requested it. Sure, you get a little outside noise, but it is a big city, that is not unusual! I really enjoyed my stay here and strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: SussexVoyager
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Affinia over Easter, very good rate available through Expedia. For the money the accomodation was first-rate - we had a spacious, comfortable suite furnished to a high standard. The hotel staff were efficient and friendly. Our only criticism concerns the noise of the heating, a thermostatically-controlled fan that cuts in with quite a rush. It was unseasonably cold during our stay - below freezing overnight and not much above during the day - and the windows in the room were not a good fit and let in the cold air, so the heating had to work quite hard to maintain the room temperature. The Affinia's energy bills must be enormous. A candidate for double glazing?

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: djjeffo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is top notch. Friendly and helpful doesn't even describe the staff from the minute we walked in to the minute we left. Our room was spectacular. Spacious room with a great view and less than a block off of Michigan Ave. You'll read other reviews that the elevators are limited due to maintenance and its true. However, if you have a little patience, it no big deal. My only complaint is the lack of free internet. $9.95 to check my e-mails and look up a few things is not worth it. But then again...I was there to spend time with my wife and see Chicago, not surf the net. We did not try the restaurant or lounge but breakfast from room service was good. I'm not sure what was in the hashbrowns, but they rocked. The in-room signature massages really capped off the trip. There is no doubt we will be back to the Affinia many more times. My highest compliment goes out to the entire staff, from the doorman to the front desk to the housekeepers. Everyone was very friendly and wanted to know what else they could do for us. Thank you Affinia.

Reviews.Title: “Much to recommend if you are on a high floor”
Reviews.Author: Shantam
Reviews.Content: We found much to recommend about this hotel; for first time visitors to Chicago the position was ideal , steps away from the Magnificent Mile and close to bus routes and the El.We had a studio room which was large but with a surprisingly tiny bathroom and closet. As others have mentioned one of the lifts is out of action which was a bit of a pain. We didn't realise this was scheduled. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our major complaint was noise. We were on the 9th floor and at the rear, outside was a large heating or a/c unit which was very noisy - it was like trying to sleep on an aeroplane; if you can book a room on a high floor or else take industrial strength earplugs with you. Breakfast was prohibitively expensive so we ate outside; one block away is an Elephant and Castle which had very sweet service and one block further along was a Corner Bakery which served very acceptable breakfasts at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with unfortunate circumstances”
Reviews.Author: UptownNOLA
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and I stayed here based on other customer's reviews on TripAdvisor. It has a great location, right in the middle of everything. Walking distance to attractions, bus line and the "L." Great fitness center. However... All the elevators are being replaced one at a time (each taking 2 months) and the only elevator available for floors 8+ has a mind of its own. We stopped on floors with nobody there, we were stuck for a minute between two floors, was brought back down to the looby, and back to the 8th floor before we got off at the correct floor. The hotel was nice enough to upgrade us to a suite on a floor that was accesible through the freight elevator. We waited until friday night to go to the C-Lounge at the top floor (one of the reasons I picked the hotel), but because of the elevator, the bar was closed and we never got to see it. Our first room was great, very clean, but the drain in the shower got clogged twice. The engineer, Jeff, was very helpful and gave us lots of advice. The suite we were moved to was excellent, but the garbage trucks and other alarms outside went off all hours of the night and made it difficult to sleep. Also, for the price of the room, you should get free wi-fi, but you have to pay $9.95 a day for it. Aside from the elevator problems and noises outside, I would give it 5 stars. The hotel was very helpful and immediately took care of any problems. Unfortunetly there were so many problems in so few days.

Reviews.Title: “I would have given it a 4 rating except for...”
Reviews.Author: CdelP
Reviews.Content: The people were very friendly, rooms were comfortable, clean and of modern European style. The location is very good. I would have given it a 4 rating but for the following: 1. Close to a busy hospital (ambulance sirens at odd hours of the night). 2. One of the elevators was not working when I checked in on a Sat until I left on a Tues. Had to use the freight elevator both times. 3. Had a smoke alarm battery beep at 2 a.m. (just as I was falling back to sleep after an ambulance siren woke me up). The front desk did not have replacement batteries but she did come up to remove the unit so I could get some sleep. I would recommend this place if you are not a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary customer service, but that's really about it.”
Reviews.Author: jennann429
Reviews.Content: Several pros and cons about my stay at the Affinia. PROS: - Customer service is outstanding! Front desk staff, doormen, housekeeping, even random employees met in the elevators... all extremely friendly and helpful. - Comfortable bed with lots of pillow options, from buckwheat to 'sound' pillows with built-in iPod speakers! I tried the memory foam, which took some time to get used to, but it was fun to try. - Very clean and seemingly well maintained (with one exception... see cons). Cleaning crew came through at a good time in mid-morning and did a good job, and also seemed to abide by the towel-reuse program. - Good geographic location, one block from Michigan Ave, with a Corner Bakery, Gino's Pizza, and Elephant & Castle within a very short distance. CONS: - Elevators are being worked on, and only ONE is in service at a time right now. Anticipated completion is May '09 I believe. However, the desk staff did mention that if ever we needed immediate service, all we had to do was ask and we would be taken to the freight elevator. The wait for the elevator was, at times, up to 5 minutes but I don't believe it exceeded that. - Price point was high next to comparable hotels nearby. (My trip was covered by my employer, otherwise I would not have been able to afford the rate.) - The corner rooms have a two-level design, with a small flight of 3 stairs dividing the upper from the lower. Neither level had a lot of space to store my suitcase; I wound up blocking the mini-bar, which also partially blocked the bathroom door. The extra-large ottoman/bench on the lower level may have been an alternative place, however I didn't want to wrestle my suitcase on the stairs. - THE NOISE. The windows are single-pane and not soundproof at all, and to the east of the hotel is a construction site, complete with jackhammers and trucks beeping during the day. In addition, there is a fire station within 2 blocks. CFD truck sirens seem abnormally loud at 3 a.m.! The walls were well-insulated though; only once was I disturbed by my neighbor and again the windows were to blame for that. - The lighting. There is one overhead light by the entrance, one in the closet which I couldn't find the switch for, a nice pair of lighted mirrors in the bath; but the lights in the main room were inadequate to me. There are two table lamps and one floor lamp, and also 'reading lights' on the headboard which were LED's. I didn't like the amount of light these provided, and besides the headboard lights they were kind of inconvenient to reach. One more overhead light would have been nice. - Lastly, there were no instructions for the wi-fi connection in the guest book. I had to guess which network to use and hope I was using the right one... I believe it is Wayport, which is $9.99 per 24-hour period. I did not eat in the restaurant however my colleague did, and told me it was VERY overpriced ($7 for a plain bowl of oatmeal?!); he also got room service one night and told me it was a mistake as well... not just overpriced but poor selection and not good food either. I mostly enjoyed my stay, however I cannot say I would recommend the Affinia to a friend mainly due to the price and the excessive outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “You will LOVE this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Irreverentgrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Streeterville neighborhood in the heart of Chicago. The staff is great and the rooms are awesome. You can even pick what kind of pillow you would like!! You will love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAVJAV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice. The bed was super comfy and the decor was nice. There is a nice bar on the top of the hotel. The location is excellent. You can walk everywhere and it's right next to pizza. They allow pets for free. The doormen were very freindly and remembered our names and our dogs' names. The only downside is that parking is ridiculously expensive (around $40/day).

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant & very impressive”
Reviews.Author: groundblizzard
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here with our daughter and son-in-law and had originally planned to stay at a different hotel, but due to a communication mix-up, we reserved rooms here. We thought about switching, but after reading reviews and knowing the location, we decided to keep the reservations. It was a wise decision. From the moment we arrived and turned our car over to the valet, which is a big step in trust for me, to the next day when they brought it around to load, everything went very well. We had reserved the room under a vacation special, so I have no complaints about the price. I'm not sure how often the special will be duplicated, but no other hotel within range could touch it. The rooms were stylish and with enough space that we didn't trip over each other. the same was true with our daughter's room. Everything was clean and available, as it should be. We had drinks at the rooftop lounge and enjoyed the view of the city from above at night. It was a bit cold, but it was worth it. The lounge is a bit small and a portable heater of some type would have been nice, but I'll attribute both to zoning restrictions. Either way, it's worth checking out. Michigan Ave is just around the corner from the hotel and the restaurants, bistros and cafes are within walking distance. Shopping is equally dangerously close as well if that's your main mission. The staff was fantastic and very friendly. Daniel suggested a very good coffee shop that also had fantastic croissants and pannes chocolate as well. Everyone was on their best behavior and treated us very well. I intend to visit them again and look forward to it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask for More”
Reviews.Author: amateurhistorian
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Affinia. It would be hard to say what we loved the most -- the spotless room with it's breathtaking views of Chicago...the super-comfy beds and amazingly quiet nights...the terrific location, steps away from the Magnificent Mile...the gracious staff that bent over backwards to be sure every detail of our stay was perfect...the rooftop bar, so beautiful at sunset...or the jaw-dropping special rate we lucked into on the Affinia website! All in all, one of the best hotel stays ever (and I travel a lot!). Special thanks to Marisol at the front desk who answered our endless questions with insight, humor, and professionalism. I'm already planning my next (extended!) visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Fitzy2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all - great location, friendly and reliable staff, lovely big modern and very clean rooms, a top class gym, and a roof-top bar! It's right beside the magnificent mile and in a lovely area of Chicago - everything is close by. The John Hancock building is only around the corner - be sure to go to the bar on the top floor and enjoy the panoramic view of the city, don't bother with the viewing centre! I would highly recommend this hotel and we certainly will be staying here again. One piece of advice - we booked it on the hotels website but a friend of mine booked it on hotels.com - he got the junior suite for cheaper than we had paid for the ordinary room!

Reviews.Title: “Quasi-elegance with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: duke_of_omnium
Reviews.Content: Get on the doorman's good side (which is neither difficult nor expensive), and he'll take excellent care of you. A hotel without a lot of the "Grand Hotel" amenities (such as a gift shop or beauty parlor), they do try to smother you with personal service, and give you little touches like wonderful bathrobes for your stay, and luxury toiletries. The rooms are a little small, but that's typical in the big city. There are only two elevators in each bank, with each bank serving a different set of floors. Within easy walking distance of The Magnificent Mile and Water Tower Place, and longer walking distance of Navy Pier; a block from Michigan Avenue with all the buses and cabs you could want. All rooms are non-smoking, and warn of a $200 cleaning fee if you engage in the filthy habit (I didn't test them). When I was there, they were building an adjunct to the hospital next door, but there was only a vacant (and ugly) lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great People, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RayandShy
Reviews.Content: We found a good deal (about $100/night) for the double bed guest room, which I believe is their cheapest room. The two beds were nice and comfortable, but there was not much room, which wasn't a problem since we weren't there except to sleep. The service was wonderful - we were treated respectfully and the staff was quick to offer recommendations about where to eat and shop. The first night we were too tired to leave the room, and ordered room service from the in-house restaurant and were quite impressed - the prices for lunch and dinner were actually fairly reasonable. Breakfast (which we did not order) seemed overpriced. We used the valet service which was pricey but stress-free. Our room had a well stocked mini bar with snacks and a nice view of downtown. Gino's East next door was awesome. I was prepared after reading other reviews for the lack of bath tub - but after being in high heels nearly all day, I would have appreciated a place to soak my feet! There was also a cold draft from the window, but we were able to adjust the heat enough to make the room quite comfortable. We stayed during the week, so I didn't expect it to be very noisy, but we did hear a lot of garbage trucks and sirens. Nothing from within the hotel itself though. Overall, we were very pleased with the room, the service, and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ralphIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a fab hotel. Rooms were spacious, funky and so clean, beds were huge and pillows were cool. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Would definitly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I had in mind...”
Reviews.Author: huskr11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia the Friday night before Christmas. The hotel was exactly what I was looking for: great location, trendy/stylish yet comfortable room, helpful staff, and a great view. And the Affinia delivered. I would highly recommend this hotel, plus its a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs beautifully”
Reviews.Author: MissFiona
Reviews.Content: We tried out the Affinia for Valentine's Day and were very pleased. Our room for just 144/night was a suite. The rooms were modern, clean, stylish, full of light. The lobby staff was exceptionally pleasant and helpful, really nice. We had cocktails at C-View (small but beautiful) and dinner at C-House, and again, the staff was great...gracious without a trace of snobbery. The fish and chips were wonderful, gourmet quality, and did not shame the Carneros Estate champagne. The complimentary amuse bouche plates were the treat they should be. Nit-picks: Room lacked stirring sticks for coffee; real cream (mini-moo) would have been appreciated rather than dry creamer; enough coffee to make two cups each would have been nicer; and the elevators were slow, for which the management apologized beforehand. The location was perfect. The room quiet and comfy. All things considered, a great place to stay in Chicago, where you could easily pay $100 more for the very same (high) quality.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: miller11178
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Affinia for the weekend with 3 other couples. All I can say is the staff are phenomenal!!! 2 of the couples stayed in a studio suite, while 2 of the couples stayed in a standard king room. All of the rooms had plenty of space. The suites provided our group a nice area to gather in before going out. The standard rooms were plenty big for Chicago hotel rooms. Ironically the suites had smaller bathrooms and dressing areas than the standard rooms. Absolutely try the pillow menu. Lobby is smallish, but nice with marble desks and flooring, only 2 elevators if you are above 7th floor (29 floors total). The hotel is not good if you have kids, as there is no pool and only a smallish gym area. We did have 2 issues with the hotel. First, we were on our way to our rooms after check-in and the elevator broke down with us in it. The elevator was fixed immediately after we called to the front desk and the staff did nothing but continue to ask if everyone felt okay and was anyone uncomfortable. Upon fixing the elevator the staff offered to comp our drinks at their bar that evening. Second, One of our couples was in a room that had an unexplained "rattle". The staff not only moved their room, but upgraded them to a suite without even asking. Despite these 2 hiccups in mechanical issues, they more than made up for it with customer service. I don't know what Steven's position in the hotel was, but after meeting him once at check-in, I was in the hotel with him and he remembered my name and where I was from. Asked if everything was okay and apologized for the elevator incident. Also the concierge's were awesome with recommendations and ideas. The bellmen were outstanding with taxi's and luggage.

Reviews.Title: “so nice to shop and find everything steps away!”
Reviews.Author: nesanesa
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and I arrived pretty early from our flight and check in wasn't unitl 3, but the staff was so accomadating and had a room for us to unpack and get comfortable right away. when we finally make it back down we asked how to get to a couple of spots that were in proximity and the concierge was very helpful and knowledgeble and gave us coupons too! The next day I had knocked down a wine glass in our room and immediately they sent someone from housekeeping to clean it up immediately. while they were there i decided to see if my boyfriend was feeling any better because he fell earlier that day because he missed the stairs in our room (the only bad part) and banged his toe so it was all black and swollen, the staff offered to bring him ice and even brought him a pain spray and anitbiotic. they were so nice!! our trip was mainly to experience this extremely cold and windy city and get away of course my bf needed it. and affinia was comforting and perfect

Reviews.Title: “Mini-Vacation”
Reviews.Author: amio2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Affinia for one night on a Saturday. I had an excellent experience at the hotel. The lobby was spacious and welcoming. The front desk staff were competent and helpful. We worked with the concierge who was diligent and knowlegable. Doormen and porters were very helpful as well. The room was large and comfy. The furniture was of low quality but did not take away from the ambience. The bed was comfortable and we enjoyed the custom ordered pillows. The hotel was quiet and we slept very well. We had a drink at the "rooftop" bar. The drink was quite expensive byt very delicious. The bar and restaurant were elegant. I did not try their food. The room was on special ($109)which made the stay even better!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Affinia - Would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: OhioArtsygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Affinia hotel for 2 nights during the weekend after Christmas and I can't say how much I enjoyed my stay. The first impression of the hotel is one of chic and modern glamour. The front-desk staff were very friendly and our check-in went completely smoothly. We had requested a view room at a low level and they accepted our request with no problems. The front desk staff continued to be very friendly as we came and went from the hotel, saying "have a great afternoon", "do you need a umbrella?" since it was raining, etc...They were always very prompt at retrieving our car from the hotel parking valet as well (which unfortunately ran up our total bill significantly). There was a garage right across the street, but because of the weather, it was more convenient to valet it. The rooms were immaculately clean and well-appointed. There was an abundance of lamps and Aveda products in the bathroom, which was huge! I want to transport this bathroom into my home, it was so luxurious. Very comfortable bed, with an interesting headboard and built in reading lamps, and even a pillow menu to choose from. I decided to give the buckwheat pillow a try, pretty comfy! Maid service was a little later than usual, but we were out for the most of the day, and returned to our room clean later that afternoon. The one reason I truly love this hotel is the location. If you are looking for a boutique hotel experience and are on a budget, this is the place. It is right absolutely in the heart of all of the Mag Mile shopping. I would say that this hotel is THE hotel for a girlfriend getaway if all you want to do is shop-till-you-drop :) Ginos East is right next door, which my boyfriend could not have been more excited about. We also stopped by the breakfast cafe Pierot Gourmet, just down the street on Surperior and had a lovely, huge breakfast (a bit on the expensive side though since it is attached to a luxury hotel) Did not eat at the hotel at all, the steak restaurant looked pretty empty, but this could be becuase Chicago is fairly empty in the winter because of the weather. And that goes to show to travel during the off-season. This place is an absolute 10! I would absolutely stay here again the next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great florida to winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: parttimetraveler77
Reviews.Content: Wanted a romantic getaway with someone I only been talking to never met. And I thought the Affinia would be great from the other reviews on tripadvisor and it was. Good location, for shopping which i was dragged all over to. Good eats, and though the slush n snow bitter cold. It was enjoyable. You can walk to lakeshore drive enjoy the view of the lake. I did this twice in the mornings, even though the Affinia has a great fitness center. We opted for public transit and even though cold it was easy buses at least one block in all directions can take you directly to ALL the museums. And also shopping on michigan av as well as state street which not only more shopping but theatre district. I missed patti labelle by not finding out who was going to be at the Chicago. All this is one bus ride away. The train was station was a little further the red line. Accessible by one bus again but you have to walk to Chicago ave which is around the block across from the walgreens. Which be careful has a lot of panhandlers. The housekeeping staff was great, doormen and front desk as expected. HERE is a PARKING tip there lot is as others said $48.00 and you certainly can find better price within a one block radius there are many garages. But, here is what i did I parked further up the street toward the lake but on superior which the hotel is on just past N. Fairbanks (2 blocks from affinia). Its off street meter parking if its weekend it's free. if its weekday you can't park free till 6pm and have to move the car by 9am when the off street is no longer free. it's safer because the hospital area has there own police that patrol the area's in cars. But as this is chicago still don't leave anything visible inside the car take what you can hide the rest. There are a couple of garages that offer early bird parking in by 9am out by 7pm and it cost $16.00. This was the garage one block over from the affinia just walk out the affinia door south on N st clair one block turn right on E. Huron the garage is 150 E. huron. barely block n half. its valet parking. It worked out great because we usually were moving before 9am anyway and were back close enough in the area to take the car out before 7pm. and back out on city transit its fast. Hope this helps if your budget minded. I truly enjoyed my stay at the affinia the noise from the hospital was not that loud or bad I'm from New Orleans use to noise. Had a good view 10th floor. And it was a hit with my lady, and yes we hit it off really well. We think of this as our little spot to visit and will return, next time try the horse carriage rides. One thing they need a real working business center.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia hits a home run”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrierMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a holiday weekend for some sightseeing and shopping. I usually avoid trendy boutique properties as their service (either for personal or business travel) fails to match the surroundings. Well, the Affinia is real surprise-a beautiful property, perfectly located, with superior service. Our junior suite was enormous, well-stocked, with an excellent bathroom and flat screen TV. The hotel has a nice fitness center, a fine restaurant (that served us in 35 minutes so we could attend a last minute performance), and a small rooftop bar and terrace. The service could not have been better, and from everyone--front desk, concierge, housekeeping, maintenance. I now have a new favorite in Chicago, and look forward to checking out the Affinia properties in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: MethodTravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just enjoyed a 3-day weekend in Chicago at the Affinia. We took the South Shore train to Millennium Park Station, then paid about 5 bucks for a cab to the hotel. The weather for the first 2 days was very cold, snowy, and SLUSHY so Affinia's location was perfect for us. More than enough things to do within a 5 block radius. We didn't get in until around 11 at night for the first night, and the desk staff recommended Timothy O'Tooles for a good place to have some drinks and good late-night food. It was just what we needed. The staff was always very nice and helpful. The doormen were first-class and very friendly. They would even do jumping jacks in the middle of the street to hail you a cab! Much better than those annoying whistles if you ask me. (I image it kept them warmer too). Our room was very nice, but the view was nothing to write home about. It was a view of a few office buildings and down below was a few garbage bins. On the flip side, we did only pay $109 a night on the weekend. So we were quite happy with the room anyhow. The roof-top bar, the c-view, was very cool. Amazing views but very expensive drinks. I believe my wifes cocktail was 13 dollars. Also, we could not go out on the deck because there was over a foot of snow there. But it was very cozy, sheik, and fun for a quick drink before dinner at the c-house which connects to the lobby. We loved the c-house. Very talented chef who has designed some very sophisticated dishes. I loved the beet salad and fish tacos. My wife liked the tuna with pinenuts. The Watertower Place is about a 10 minute walk and there are great shops all along the way. You could easily spend a whole day there, and the food court is the best one I have ever seen at a mall hands down. We will definitely go back to Affinia on our next trip to Chicago. Very friendly and accommodating staff, nice decor all around, and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for Affinia”
Reviews.Author: TxGrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on NYE & enjoyed every minute. Clean, modern room - very spacious. Aveda bath products. Friendly, very accommodating staff. Comfortable beds. Love the fact that you can make special requests for pillows, rooms, views, etc. - all of ours were honored. (Go to the hotel website to customize your stay.) We had a great view & even a partial view of the NYE fireworks over the lake! Valet parking is $48/day, but you can park yourself in the garage across the street for $38/day. Hotel is next to a hospital, so if you're a light sleeper bring ear plugs! Only one fully operating elevator, but staff was extremely helpful in finding alternate elevators to get you up or down. Our only complaint was the clock radio which had background noise when trying to play an iPod - we asked for a different radio & the second one they brought had same problem. Otherwise, nothing to complain about - we'd go back in a heartbeat! (Oh yeah, great location one block off Michigan Ave. Also a Gino's Pizza right next door.)

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: Brunette-traveller
Reviews.Content: Myself & my partner arrived on Dec 27 and right from the start the staff in the Affinia couldn't be more helpful. As soon as we arrived we felt at home. Location is excellent, just off Magnificent Mile, ideal for everyone - shopping, sightseeing, restaurants - walking distance to everything. Can't recommend the Affinia enough. Definitley worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Center for a Chicago Stay”
Reviews.Author: jsm21c
Reviews.Content: We had an exceptional stay. Great rate through hotel website. The Location is in on Superior St, 1 block from the Water Tower - Central Mag. Mile! Apple fans note the store is around the corner. We have never had better service and we were amazed at the thoughtful well designed rooms and hotel facilities including C-View and the C-House. It was are best rated eating experience, the pastry chef should apply for TOP CHEF!!! We so enjoyed the meal we had our 1st night that we purchased the exception deserts as gifts twice more during our stay to share our "find" with our friends and family. My brother with return with a few of the friends from the APPLE store as will my sister-in-law with her friends from Northwestern. I personally loved the workout package, it's a great touch! The service rep was so thoughtful in instructing me with the directions for the DVD player. Your desk staff was wonderful and helped answer every question and made sure we were stocked with ice. My 85 year old Mother enjoyed the modern design and was amazing by the service we received during our stay, I am in my 50s. This is a hotel for every age group. I hope to enjoy a stay in one of your New York hotels when I return to Connecticut. Thank you all for a wonderful stay! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “We'll Definitely Be Back!!”
Reviews.Author: 3Goldilocks
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here on a modeling job business trip with another mom and daughter. The girls were modeling for American Girl Doll at their store location only a few blocks away. This place was excellent in every way! The location is perfect for walking to all the nearby shops on Mag Mile. The staff is absolutely friendly and attentive. The room was nice, very clean, and modern. The view out the window was amazing. There's a great pizzeria restaurant called Gino's East right next to our hotel too! The beds were absolutely lush! The pillows were plush, the bedsheets were crisp and clean (no old musty bedspreads!!) and nicely tucked in, we slept like babies!! We even got to take a peek at the rooftop lounge. It was closed but the staff were so gracious as to open it up for us, so we can take a few pictures of the amazing view. Thanks to everyone there for making this such a memorable stay for us. We will definitely be back and this time with more of our American Girl group of friends!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Otoh
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great--the comfort level, the unique and modern furnishings and decor, the lush bedding, the overall cleanliness, the friendly, interested, and helpful staff, the location.....It was a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: erictcow
Reviews.Content: I can't say much more about this hotel, that hasn't already been said. My wife and I were both looking forward to styaing in the Affinia after reading so many good reviews on this site, and we were not dissapointed. The location is first class, the staff are very, very friendly and helpful. Will we stay here again when we visit Chicago in the future - without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel of my life”
Reviews.Author: workinlady
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best boutique hotels that Chicago has to offer. In the very best location on the Magnificent mile, shoppers paradise, and a few blocks up from the lake and the river walk, it is greatly placed for all travellers. the rooms are very nice and modern, though do not stay on the very top floors the heating units are old and do not work as I found out, but they moved me to suite for my inconvenience and paid for my room service. The friendly staff was unparallel to any staff I had delt with at any hotel before it. The Affina chicago is the best hotel I have ever stayed it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: RabbiWebster
Reviews.Content: Affinia is a great hotel. The staff are very eager to please, the location is extraordinarily convenient, and the rooms are kept clean. We had no problems with any of the typical shortcomings, such as small bathrooms, noise, malfunctioning electronics, slow elevators, etc. Our stay was superb.

Reviews.Title: “great visit”
Reviews.Author: Tupelo1941
Reviews.Content: ..had a very pleasant 3 night stay at the Affinia. The room was quite nice, well appointed and comfortable. The staff was exceptionally nice and extremely helpful. They seemed content just to chit chat with us in the lobby--they were knowledgeable about the area and were genuinely interested in making our whole experience special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Affinia”
Reviews.Author: T78
Reviews.Content: Booked the Affinia after reading reviews on this website and it exceeded my expectations. Great location, just off Michigan Avenue. Fab view of the avenue opposite the hotel from our room. Room was quiet, we were on the 6th floor and didn't find any traffic noise. We had a fabulous room with 2 king beds, which were the most comfortable ever. Room was really big with loads of space, as was bathroom. Aveda products in the bathroom were a nice added extra. Staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Christopher and Daniel. Christopher arranged a day trip to an outlet mall and also tickets for dirty dancing, where we had great seats. Overall loved the Affinia and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: johnco84
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for a weeks stay in the Affinia in Chicago on expedia in October and it was a bargain for the hotel and service we got. Superb location just off Magnificent Mile and a couple of blocks away from Water Tower Place. The staff were professional, friendly and always eager to help. We had booked a junior suite and were very impressed - large desk and office chair, spacious living area with comfortable couch and recliner chair, large flat screen TV that could rotate to be watched either in the living area or from the comfort of the large bed. The bathroom wasn't huge but there was an extra make up area with small illuminated mirror just beside it. Shower was excellent pressure etc. Room was spotless and cleaned perfectly every day. Mini bar and fridge was well stocked and had snacks etc if you wanted to add them to your bill. Paper dropped off at your door every morning. Lifts were clean and prompt. We didn't make much use of all the hotel facilities as we wanted to get out and about to enjoy the city but the bar looked cosy and inviting. The staff were most helpful with the doormen in particular always ready to hail a cab,supply an umbrella and have a friendly word. A great hotel in a perfect location (especially for shopping) with a friendly and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay, but we would have liked it more without some of the hassles!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaW
Reviews.Content: We booked a Saturday night stay for the Mag Mile Lights Fest...got a *great* rate thru Travel Ticker. The location could not have been more perfect as we could see Water Tower Place from our room., so we were about a half block from Michigan Avenue. We booked a regular room, not a suite, so we had the setup where you walk down a few stairs after entering the room to the area where the bed is. The bed had the "pillow menu" which I thought was a quaint touch, and the bathroom had the metallic orange wallpaper, which ummm..no.. The bathroom and mini-bar are at the top of the stairs. Our room had a king sized bed and a recliner chair in it. We were happy & surprised that we were able to get into our room late in the morning, well before the offical check in time. We had also prerequested the "walking tour" kit and it was delivered shortly after we checked in. We also received a phone call from the desk to ask how everything was, which I thought was a nice touch. The room felt a little cold to me, though, so we cranked up the heat and headed off for our day's adventure. When we got back to the room...hours later...it was still freezing, so we called the desk and they said they would send someone up to check it out. We headed off to the rooftop bar for a drink. It was very pleasant,, as it is on the top floor of the hotel, and you get an excellent view of the city all lit up at night. It would be even better during the summer months, as it was just a bit too cold to actually sit outside, so we just stayed indoors. When we headed back down to our room, the maintenance guy was still there working on the heat, and the room was *still* cold. He told us that the heating system in our room was deifnitely not working & offered to relocate us to the room right next door. He said that our heat should *probably* start working soon, but that the room next door had heat NOW, and the room next door had all of the same amenities as our room did, and he would help us move our luggage to the next door room. We did peak into the room before we moved everything and it did look the same and it did feel warmer. It was something of a hassle to move all of our stuff, but we went ahead and moved it. Only after we were in the new room did we realize that the room was not identical to the first one. First of all, it was at the end of the hall, so the second room was quite a bit smaller than the first one we had. Also, the comfortable reclining chair that my husband just loved sitting in was not in the second room. (There was just a small ottoman, sorry not the same). The work desk was about half the size of the one in our first room. We were rather disappointed, as after walking around the city all day, that recliner chair had looked quite comfortable. We saw the maintenance guy in the hall and asked if the heat was now okay in our first room, and he said that it was, and we decided to haul all of our things back to the first room. I was told that the heat was going to work all night, and I had to believe that it would. Thankfully, we didn't have a lot of stuff to move. And even better, the heat actually did work all night. We also had quite a bit of noise from people running up and down the halls during the night-- I know that the hotel can't do much about that, but just an FYI for light sleepers. Also, there is some kind of construction going on right next door to the hotel, which is quite loud. Overall, the location of the hotel is great, and some of the amenities are very nice, too. However, you do expect that the heat in your hotel room will work, especially in Chicago in November! Also, I would have really liked if the hotel offered some kind of complimentary breakfast, even a continental breakfast would have been greatly appreciated. (There was a coffee maker in the room, but it was kind of odd, as it only brewed one cup of coffee at at ime?). I did fill out the hotel survey and got a very nice letter from the hotel management rep, but again, heat is just something you expect to come standard, not to have to pay extra to get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Enkadtaw
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with exceptional service. I stayed a week on a business trip and enjoyed it thoroughly. The location is fantastic, the rooms are very well laid out and roomy. You also get a choice of five different pillows, which I thought was a very nice touch. I chose the Ipod pillow which had a connection built in to hook directly to your mp3 player. I also ate in the hotel restaraunt and it was very tasty and nicely presented. There is also a pizza place right next door to the hotel, Gino's East, which was also very good. The location is just off Michigan Avenue on the corner of the Disney Store which was also a plus to pick up those last minute gifts for my little ones. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great price!!”
Reviews.Author: charlestoncharm
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel after seeing its high rating on tripadvisor and finding a great rate on the hotel website. i think we paid $130/night (and that was friday, sat, sun.) which was an excellent deal for this area. the hotel is one block from the famed michigan avenue. right next door is a great pizza place, gino's east. and a couple blocks away, we found a thai restaurant, dao, the was good. don't rent a car! you can walk everywhere from the affinia or take a cab for longer distances. we took the el (subway) from midway and it was very easy. and this was our first trip to chicago. we had to walk a couple blocks to the hotel but it saved us a $50 cab ride. everyone says not to pay to go the top of the john hancock bldg (it's $15/pp). apparently there is a restaurant on a top floor you can go to for the price of a drink/meal. we thought it was worth it as they have a free headset tour that tells a lot about chicago history and points out landmarks we would not have seen otherwise. my only complaint about the hotel is that our room was right by the housekeeping closet and there was a lot of slamming doors early in the morning. probably could have requested a different room but didn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Affinia”
Reviews.Author: dickandjackie
Reviews.Content: We booked this great little boutique hotel thru Travel Zoo at a very reasonable price. It was rated at the time the number 2 hotel in Chicago. The Affinia lived up to the ratings. The decor was very modern and simplistic . I have never stayed in a hotel that had real HD TV. The location was great - just one block east of Michigan Avenue in the high rent district. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: H908
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently for four nights while I was in town for a conference. We absolutely loved the hotel. I booked a junior suite because Expedia was having a great deal. Very roomy, clean, and comfortable beds. Great view of the John Hancock building. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location, a block off of Michigan Avenue, is excellent. We ate a half-block away at Coco Pazzo Cafe, and would highly recommend it. We also liked Bistro 110, which is a couple of blocks away. For something convenient and casual, Gino's East is right next door. Although temperatures were a little cold when we were there, we hung out a little at the outdoor rooftop bar, which is nice. Drinks are overpriced, but that's a big city hotel bar for you. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Tree_and_Me
Reviews.Content: The Affinia is virtually the perfect hotel for a visit to Chicago. My wife and I stayed in an upgraded suite. Very large room, that is modern and has all the little touches. The staff was extremely helpful and professional. The location is excellent. The price is a good value for what you get. We simply couldn't find anything to criticize. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Taniquan
Reviews.Content: This is an easy 4 star hotel in an ideal location a hundred yards off Michigan avenue and close to everything. Bottom line is that everything was as advertised and I had no disappointments. My room was spacious, had a step bed area, and a huge pictures window with a great view of the city. Plus a side window could be opened if you wanted fresh air. I would stay there again in an heartbeat. I did not eat in the hotel restaurant but two blocks from the hotel is the Rosebud Restaurant which has to be one of the finest Italian restaurants in the nation. It is low key, causal and great food, large portions, and very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Well Kept Secret/ Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: nrzermd
Reviews.Content: We had an Excellent Stay. The service was very attentive and genuine. The staff very helpful and always polite. Rooms were well thought out and appointed. Menu limited but well done. Would highly recommend. This is the best value in this area of Chicago. NZ

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelure27
Reviews.Content: Pros: modern decor location, location, location wonderful shower great free gym Cons: charge for wi-fi bathroom light too dim for makeup application

Reviews.Title: “loved the Affinia”
Reviews.Author: travel5612
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed on an upper level floor in a standard room. Very comfortable with great linens. The room had a separate area with a desk and a bar (including a coffee maker). We managed to book this room for $205 a night and it was well worth it. Front desk and bellmen were friendly and helpful. The location was also a plus. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “You Will Love This Sparkling Gem”
Reviews.Author: TraceeT
Reviews.Content: We needed a bolt hole while attending a sick relative being treated at Northwestern Univ. Hospital. This hotel offered a special rate for that situation...althought they didn't need a special rate...they already ARE VERY SPECIAL. The staff could teach a course in good public relations...helpful, compassionate and patient. Modern and updated lobby and rooms...sparkling clean rooms and baths. The comfy cloud-like beds, COLD A/C, and thoughtful recliner facing the large flat screen TV gave proof to the idea that these people really think and care about their client's comfort. The cozy rooftop bar was icing on the cake. It really shows what a group of motivated thoughtful hotel professionals can do. This is a small gem in a big city!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsdietz
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms were great and very clean. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a wonderful experience. One block off the mile. Beautiful bar with a great view. Go if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: ilive4sun
Reviews.Content: We got an outstanding rate by signing up for the hotels' website newsletter. Affinia has a great location just off Michigan Avenue near the Water Tower. Beware however: parking is expensive in the Gold Coast....$48/night. Right from the start, Victor greeted us and made us feel welcome. Check-in was easy and our room was gorgeous. However, it was a handicapped acessible room and I wanted a tub, so one call to the front desk and we had another room. All rooms have been renovated and they are beautiful, comfortable and well appointed. The rooftop bar is a must-do. The outside patio has heaters and candles, a high table for big groups and little groupings of chairs and sofas to get comfy on and enjoy the views. We didn't sit inside the bar area. Pedro and Quentin were excellent bellmen, and Christopher (concierge) was very helpful. As we left, we shook Victor's hand (he's always there!) and told him we've found our new Chicago hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to better”
Reviews.Author: Thisisus
Reviews.Content: We booked via â€œlastminute.comâ€� but would have obtained a far better price booking direct with the hotel. When we arrived we received a free upgrade which was great. When Affinia say the rooms have been refurbished they mean it. It was absolutely great and had the wow factor to it. We will not list all that was in the room except to say that every possible need was catered for. There was no expense spared when it came to the dÃ©cor or presentation. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The location was great as it is off the main roads but only 100 yards from whatâ€™s going on. A good local breakfast and evening pub food could be found at the Elephant & Castle one block away. Another place you must try for breakfast is the famous West Egg CafÃ© a few blocks away. Another suggestion for evening meal (particularly if it is raining) is The Original Ginoâ€™s just next door to the hotel and do go and try The Cheesecake by the Water Tower, great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: a2diaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is def. the best place to stay in Chicago. It is conveniently located to Mag Mile, subway, hop on/off tour, and many other locations. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are exceptional. Unfortunately we didn't have a great view. Our hotel was facing buildings, regardless the room was very clean and comfortable. The gym has top of the line machines w/ tv and ipod connections. The rooftop bar is a great place to lounge around when you don't feel like leaving the hotel for drinks. It has a great view of the city. The staff is the best, especially the bell boys. They remembered our name after our first meeting and called us by our names all week!! I have previously stayed at the Affinia in NY and we were so impressed by their ammenities and staff that we knew we would have a pleasant stay in Chicago. However, Affinia Chicago exceed even our expectations!!

Reviews.Title: “The Affinia is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: winnerManitoba
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded out expectations. We had a room on the 21st floor and the couple we traveled with had the room directly below us on the 20th floor. This way it afforded us the identical views... The suites were sizable, very clean and well outfitted. The location of the hotel is outstanding, situated on the 1st block off of the Michigan Ave/Magnificient Mile. As written in another review, the concierge, Christopher Rodriguez was more than helpful. He is a very approachable & pleasant young man. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose Affinia”
Reviews.Author: bmrmora
Reviews.Content: We were in 2 different rooms during our stay. One was a double, with 2 double beds. The room was smallish, but really cool. The beds are a few steps down from the desk/fridge area. Wonderful bedding/pillows/toiletries. Had a large window with a nice view. The second room was a double king room that was huge (750 sf) with a 2 story window. Plenty of room to entertain. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly, everyone from the front desk, conceierge, doormen to the cleaning and maintenance staff. They also have a lovely outdoor patio bar on the 29th floor, where you can just manage to see the lake. I can't imagine even considering staying elsewhere next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Should be rated a 4-5 star hotel. Pure quality!”
Reviews.Author: SafetyFirst
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel, it was pure high quality service....from the doormen, to the front desk check-in, to the concerierge. Christopher Miele was even able to get us OPRAH tickets! He made our stay one of our best hotel stays ever. Victor the doorman was very nice and helpful too....and so was Marisol another concierge. This is really not a 31/2 star hotel, but rather a 4-4.5 star hotel. Highly recommended and great service. An awesome hotel. I will only stay here when I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The best holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: stephaniedublin
Reviews.Content: Fifteen of us travelled from Ireland and had the greatest pleasure of staying at the Affinia! The best hotel in Chicago without a doubt! Irish people are known for our friendliness and hospitality but we have major competion here! What a fabulous bunch of people and if i can, i will mention names, victor, daniel, erin, christopher, joel, they made our stay so unbelievable! Thanks in particular to victor who put up with our midnight antics, that is finding our keys etc, the Affinia should open a hotel in Ireland, we need a great hotel like it! PLease let us know if you do as we're all in the business!! Nicest staff you will meet, if you ever visit Ireland we work in a restaurant called the oar house in howth co dublin. Come visit xxxx Ps Victor you made our holiday love to yaxxx

Reviews.Title: “4 for 2”
Reviews.Author: DashingCalgary
Reviews.Content: 4 star quality for a 2 star price. The room was great. Some funky boutique decor, very comfortable bed & pillow(s), enough room but a bit on the small side. Got a great price off of Expedia. Most other options of similar quality were about double the price. Any services like checking in & out and storing our luggage were first class. So I'm rating my experience a 5 because the value puts this Above Average hotel into the Excellent category.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: aoel
Reviews.Content: The room was large and clean, the bed was huge with a great and free choice of pillows. There was a coffee machine that we could use with no extra charge including a choice of decaf. The staff was polite and efficient. The hotel is perfectly located. The bathroom was good but lacked space to store our toiletries. Although the renovation process of the hotel was over, there were noisy streetworks just at the foot of the hotel and since there were no doubleglazed windows it was a bit annoying to be woken up at 8:00. We would recommend to ask for a room on the highest level possible. The heating/ vent. /cooling unit in the room was very loud but we didn't need to use it because the outside temperatures were perfect. The only possibility to have breakfast in the hotel is via the room service which is extremely expensive. But there are nice cafÃ©s in the area, such as Gherardelli's.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Affinia!”
Reviews.Author: mwander123
Reviews.Content: Went away with my wife without the kids for a long weekend in July. Felt very well treated from the moment we stepped in. Since this was our first trip to Chicago, the Concierge had great suggestions on where to eat, what to do, etc. The room was magnificent - the renovation of the hotel was complete. Rom had big bed with comfortable pillows (and many others to choose from), also large bathroom to get ready. As other posts have mentioned, lighting could be a little better, but we did not have any issues. Visited the gym, found the equipment new and very nice, about 3 treadmills, 2 elliptical machines and a small free weight area - everything that we needed! The hotel is located 1/2 block off the Maginificent Mile, but found the area much more quiet than staying on the Magnificent Mile. All in all, a great experience, we cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not great”
Reviews.Author: eteyemd
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a pretty good experience at the Affinia. The staff was very friendly during our stay. The room was clean and very nice. We did have more issues than I expected, however. Our coffee maker didn't work and the drain in the shower/tub also didn't work which resulted in water pooling in the tub during showers. They also use low flow shower heads which is pretty funny because they have a "massage" setting that when you try to use it the water has such low flow it barely trickles out of the shower head. My biggest issue was finding a charge for the lounge located on the top floor on my bill at checkout time. We never did have time to visit the lounge (unfortunately) and when I explained this to them they actually acted like this was somehow my fault. This got me to wondering how often this "mistake" occurs at this hotel. The location is great but they stick you for about $50 a day for parking. Overall, not bad but I'm not sure its worthy of all the praise I've been reading from other reviews. I've stayed at "lower-level" hotels and had equally good experiences for lower rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rubyshopaholic
Reviews.Content: The recently remodeled Affina was amazing - from the 6 choice pillow menu to the stocked "pantry and refrigerator" to the brand name bathroom ammenities. Within walking distance to just about everything you could possibly need, the Affina is a great hotel. The staff was pleasant and seemed to enjoy their jobs. Having never stayed in downtown Chicago before, the Affina over and above exceeded our expectations. Although our trip to Chicago was only for one night, we will consider staying at the Affina again for a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: theresa277
Reviews.Content: This hotel was PERFECT for our girls getaway. The decor is fun & refreshing. Loved the roof top bar. Every staff member was friendly & always smiling. The location is perfect for Michigan Ave shopping, the beach, dinner and night life. It was a mile or two from Millenium Station. The concierge recommended a couple places to hang out after dinner and added our names to the guest list (Iâ€™m sure they do it all the time but still a nice gesture).

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Kunda Park
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Affinia, and I will try not to repeat info contained in other reviews. It is a great location, great staff who were mostly 30somethings, and refreshingly helpful and cheerful and know the value and meaning of customer service. We had a junior suite, it is quite roomy, funky decor. It was right beside the elevators, but you couldn't hear them or much else in the room except for traffic noise. Strangely, you could hear people talking, water running, etc. when you were in the bathroom, it was coming through the air vent. Due to the street noise factor mentioned by another reviewer, we asked for a high floor and were in 2201. Even up that high, you did get traffic noise, sirens at night. I am a light sleeper so always have ear plugs, which I used the first night (a Saturday). After that, I didn't need them, either it was much quieter the other nights or I was already used to the ambient noise. I would definitely stay here again on a return trip. They offer 3 "kits" to their guest, absolutely free, one is a Sports Kit, one a BYOB Kit and one a Walking Tour kit. The Walking Tour kit comes complete with IPod loaded with various walking tours and printed materials to guide you as well. We didn't have time to actually use the kit, but did listen to parts of the IPod tours, and they sounded fantastic. So be sure to check that kit out if you have time. The only negatives is the exorbitant parking rates (we did valet at $44 per night, to self-park up the street was $40 per night so may as well use valet). I thought Boston was bad at $25 per night. And there are no ice machines on the floors, so you have to order ice all the time from the front desk, meaning you have to tip someone every time you want ice. But the service was prompt and extremely polite and professional in all cases. Tips about Chicago-- we did Giordano's on Rush for our Chicago-style pizza experience, 2 blocks from hotel, and huge line-ups every night. They told us 1.5 hour wait when we arrived, and to pre-order our pizza after 40 minutes, which we did. We ended up getting our table in an hour, and the pizza was worth the wait. The Greek salad was unremarkable. Don't bother with the Elephant & Castle on St. Clair, one block form hotel. Inferior food and terrible service. Any Corner Bakery is great for a light breakfast, they have lunches as well but didn't try them. Fabulous Swiss oatmeal (like Birka's muesli if you know what that is) and blueberry muffins and good coffee. We walked all the way to and from The Greek Islands on Halsted, it is much further than it looked on the map! Greek food, short wait for a table, mousaka was good, as was a baked pasta (kind of Greek lasagna). Not a must do unless you are really into Greek food. For full breakfast if you feel like the trek north, try Kitsch 'n River North at the corner of Chicago and Larrabee. Reasonable prices, good home cooking, and funky 50s decor. For our one special dinner out, we splurged and went to Rosebud Steakhouse on Walton, 4 blocks north of hotel, as recommended by the Affinia concierge. It didn't disappoint. Great food, although expensive, wonderful service. The gumbo (soup of the day) was to die for. And the bread pudding was pretty amazing too. If you want to do the Architectural river cruise, book it through the Chicago History Museum web-site. Their tour is guided by an actual architect, is 1/2 hour longer that the other tours and you get free Starbucks coffee, cookies, muffins and cold beverages throughout. If you plan on doing anything that would appeal to families, try to be there when it first opens. Like the Shedd Aquarium -- we were there at 1 p.m. and left after an hour -- way too many people to enjoy the exhibits. We did Navy Pier right at 10 a.m. when it opened, almost nobody there. By 11 a.m., scads of busses arrive full of kids and tourists. If you want to get around within the city, get yourself a CTA system map that shows all the bus routes. The bus is much more convenient and efficient than the subway unless you're heading to the burbs, like for Frank Lloyd Wright, Wrigley Field, etc. Get yourself a Visitors Pass, it's great value, and you can pre-order it on-line, or pick up at various places around the city -- it tells you on the CTA system map. The Free Trolley system sounds good in principle -- people were jammed in like sardines every time we saw one, use your pass on the CTA for a much more comfortable and air-conditioned ride. The Wrigley Field tour is great, much better and twice as long as the one at Fenway. FLW home and studio was also great, if you're into him. Robie House was disappointing because it is under renovation and you don't get to see a lot of the inside. That isn't mentioned on the web-site, of course. Overall, Chicago is a beautiful city, flowers and greenery everywhere, clean, clean, clean. And the Affinia is a great base from which to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: rosco101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a fantastic location literally 150m off the magnificent mile. The foyer is simple but spotless and exudes a wonderful lemon fresh smell eveytime you walk in. The rooms although slightly small are furnished to a high spec and the hotel gym has everthing you could ask for. Unfortunately there is one seriously big problem, when they refurbished this hotel it would apear to me that they never changed the windows and the street noise is horrific. One expects a few sirens in a big city but this hotel is situated on the same street as a hospital and you have the constant sounds of sirens throughout the night. When we first arrived in the room I actually thought the window was opened and we knew immediately that we would have problems with it. After the first night we went to a local Wallgreens, bought wax ear plugs that mould to your ears and that certainly helped although they do take a bit of getting used to at first and certainly not what you expect when staying in an hotel. One other thing that has not been mentioned is that directly next door to the hotel is currently a construction site, to be fair the only problem here is once again when the trucks back up you can clearly hear the beeping from the reversing lights. Although noise is a problem if your happy to wear a set of ear plugs this is a lovely hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service!”
Reviews.Author: eblkcat
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel when it was the Fitzpatrick, and for everyone who was patiently awaiting the complete renovation when it became Affinia - man, was it worth it!!! The service of the staff is still outstanding, very accomodating and friendly. (See Marisol for special requests!) The rooms are lovely, and the beds are heavenly! The rooftop bar is great - especially on those balmy summer nights; however, the lobby bar is nice too. WIth the perfect location, it's just an all-around fabulous hotel to stay in. (Skip the pizza joint next door - the long lines suggest the pizza must be out of this world - but it's not - there is much better pizza to be had in Chicago!)

Reviews.Title: “Great escape at Affinia”
Reviews.Author: jencron
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago for 4 days with no children, for some relaxation. We had a very enjoyable stay at the Affinia. All the renovations were complete, except the rooftop bar which was opening the evening of the day we left. The hotel has a very streamlined and clean look. The workout room was very nice. We stayed in a regular guest room, it is perfect for the person who is going to be exploring the city and not hanging out in your room. If you plan to spend a lot of time relaxing in your room, you may want to step up to a suite. Some people complained about the ambulances at night, but I think this is an issue in any large city. I didn't notice them once I fell asleep. Great Place, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jollybobs
Reviews.Content: We understand this hotel has undergone a recent refurbishment and it shows. Everywhere was clean, fresh and modern - the suite we stayed in was immaculate and we loved the revolving TV for viewing in bed or seating area. They have just opened a roof bar/terrace which is great for views over drinks. The location is perfect, however what makes the hotel great for us is the staff. Without exception they were all friendly and helpful without being insincere. A special mention to two people, the concierge Chris - who was a mine of information on where to eat and drink- and the doorman Victor whose warm personality and humour lifted the whole experience. They are both an absolute credit to the hotel and worth looking out for if you go. The only downside was that our suite was next to the lift/elevator which although not too intrusive was noticeable, especially a night ,and maybe some investment could be made in better soundproofing? It's our sixth visit to Chicago and this is easily the best experience we've had and was also good value.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia was fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Louie74
Reviews.Content: The Affinia was a great experience! From the time we walked in the door we felt welcome, all the staff was very friendly and helpful (probably because they live in such a beautiful city). We never walked through the lobby without being acknowledged by someone just saying hello or wishing us a good day. The doormen were always cheerful and a great source of good recommendations throughout the city. We had a great room considering we got it for quite a steal on Orbitz. I wasn't expecting such a large comfortable room with a great view of the Hancock Building and such a fun decor. From the front desk to the maid service, everything (and every one) was top notch!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Affinia”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravlerz
Reviews.Content: We had a complicated last minute need for a hotel - and found the Affinia available. The staff was very friendly and the room was exceptional. A good value for Chicago. I would recommend the hotel for business or tourist travel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Better Than Others Close By”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Affinia for two nights. As others have mentioned, the attitude and service of the Affinia staff are superlative. I pulled up in a taxi, and the concierge came out to open the cab door with a big "Welcome" to me. The hotel also has doormen, so I was impressed that the concierge did that. The check-in process was very pleasant and quick -- the person at the desk chatted with me for a while about the recent changes to the hotel. I had booked a junior suite; when I got to the room I realized that it bordered on the elevator shaft -- which is something I usually avoid in hotels. In trying to get my room changed, the staff told me that all junior suites are located next to the elevators. They offered to switch me to a different type of room, but I decided to give it a try and found that I could not hear the elevators at all while in the room. The room had a full-size bed, which was fine for one person but might be a squeeze with two trying to sleep there. There was a also a sleeper sofa in the room. The mattress was extremely comfortable. The beds are equipped with feather pillows, but there is also a choice of several other types of pillows if one wants them. These are mentioned in a card that was on the bed when I arrived. The bed had two small focused reading lights attached to it, along with two bedside lamps. One of the reading lights was missing its bulb. I reported it to the front desk the next morning, but this was never replaced during the next day I was there. One of the telephones in the room didn't work when I arrived. It was a cordless phone, and the other one in the room had a cord. I reported the broken phone at the desk the next morning, and that was fixed by the time I came back to the room in the afternoon. The decor in the room was excellent, and of course brand new. The only thing that didn't suit my taste was the orange foil wallpaper covering the bathroom walls. Paired with the round light that was backlighting the mirror, there were odd shadows thrown around when trying to look in the mirror. And, that was the only light in the room. Fortunately, for putting on makeup there was a little sitting area right outside the bathroom that had a small ceiling light and a lighted mirror. So, it all worked out well. The closet had a sensor light that came on most of the times when the door was opened. There was no light switch for it. I found that it turned off at odd times, if I was standing too still in front of it. And it didn't always come on when the door opened. It may have been defective, but I didn't report it. In the closet I found a white terry bathrobe, which is always a nice touch in a hotel room. It was very much appreciated. Others have mentioned the large flat-screen TV that swivels to face the bed or the seating areas in the room. This was one of the best features in the room. Unfortunately, the Channel button on the remote would stick a little when trying to move from one channel to another -- it wasn't a major problem, but I thought it was odd to find this defect in a recently-renovated hotel with such a new television in it. One more thing: the coffee maker had one-cup pods that would go into a cup. This is not my favorite way to have coffee, but it worked out fine. The main problem was that one of the provided cups was filthy one morning. Otherwise, all went well. There was a fully-stocked refrigerator with beverages, and a tray with chips and nuts on it in the room. Prices were posted. I did not try any of them. For those who have problems with stairs, there were three steps in the room. When first entering at the top level, there was a reading desk with telephone and lamp. Then one needed to go down three steps to get into the room itself. Not very many steps, but it might bother some people. One caveat for some, and it is beyond the hotel's control: There is a big construction project currently beginning right next to the hotel, directly to the east. There is going to be a new children's hospital built there as part of the Northwestern hospital system. I heard a little noise once during the day, but it doesn't appear that the construction project is really going very far yet. I expect in the next couple of years there might be a lot more noise next door. But, this shouldn't be a problem on evenings, nights, or weekends -- so for most visits I think it will be fine. And yes, there are ambulance noises related to the large hospital complex a block away. These did not really bother me at all, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - will great when refurb complete”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghScotsman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Affinia Chicago for 5 nights over Memorial Day weekend. Great Stay, hotel lobby refurb complete although they are still doing work on the signage out front whilst we were there and restaurant not fully open until June (just breakfast for now - didnt try as there are loads of good places to go nearby) Great Location, steps away from Michigan Ave and the shops, nearby to lots of great places for breakfast, dinner etc and we had great food everywhere we went. The room was great - only purchased a normal guest room but appeared to have been upgraded to a studio suite with great Queen size (UK King - 5ft wide) bed which was so comfortable - we slept great - and also a living room area with a big sofa which was also a pull out double bed. Room was immaculate - cleaned every day to high standard, everything was new, bed was fantastic, bathroom (with tub) was compact - european style and the aveda toiletries and the towelling robes a nice touch. Agree with other reviewers that the staff were warm and friendly and extremely helpful - they really are and will provide good recommendations on restaurants, bars, taxis. Only thing of a couple of negatives 1 water pressure in the shower could have been bit higher. 2 the windows are single glazed so there is some streetnoise but we actually slept really well. It wasnt loud enough to wake us up. 3 The lobbies on our floor was really hot but the aircon in the room worked great. Its a shame we couldnt try the restaurant or the rooftop bar as they are not scheduled to be complete until June - pity - Im sure it would have topped off a great stay. This will be a stunning boutique style hotel when the refurb is fully complete. Would return to the city and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for young couples!!! Loved Affinia”
Reviews.Author: Car0lyne
Reviews.Content: We booked the Affinia for a 2 night stay during Memorial Day Weekend. We couldn't have been happier with the perfect location...just 1 block from the magnificent mile and endless shopping possibilities. Renovations are still going on outside, so we missed the valet parking when we arrived due to trucks outside; however, there is a quite new parking garage right across the street which costs the same as valet parking. The room was beautifully decorated in contemporary design. The bathroom was super clean and new. The bed was delightfully comfortable the bed lights were convenient. My only 3 concerns about the Affinia were the following: 1. We went to a concert at United Center on Friday night and left the window in the room cracked for air. Upon returning, the room was filled with mosquitos due to no screens on the windows. I went the front desk who assigned us another room (quite nice, but got slightly mouthy with me even though it was the hotel problem not to have any screens.) When we arrived in the second room, there were mosquitos all along the window and on the ceiling also. The window was closed. Due to being in the early morning hours and frustrated we just spent 10 minutes killing them. I'm assuming this is an ongoing problem in the rooms and not necessarily because of me leaving the window open. We had no problems after that with the mosquitos...but the hotel definitely needs to invest in pest control of some sort of in purchasing screens so the guests can open up the windows especially in the warmer months. 2. The bar area/restaurant was not ready yet. The hotel on Expedia posted they have free cocktails everynight; however, there was no food or drinks anywhere in the lobby. Alot of other hotels have adjacent places to eat/drink, but with Affinia we had to go out to other places. Not that it is horrible, but not as convenient as listed. 3. The flatscreen tv was wonderful, especially how it swiveled. The tv is set up so you cannot change to any aux channels. If you bring a video game system or dvd player, you will not be able to hook up to the tv. Overall, the staff was great with directions, suggestions, and advice. Rooms were comfortable with chic/modern. Location definitely makes this hotel one I will return to without looking at other hotels. Once the renovation is complete, it will definitely appear like a 4.5 star hotel. Would definitely recommend for young couples; you will be so close to shopping, food, and bars.
