And the lake is only about 3 blocks on the other side! Other recommendations for Chicago: Garretts popcorn and Niketown-2 blocks down from Superior. Ethels Chocolate Lounge-inside Nordstrom mall, great $20 chocolate fondue for 2!!!! Chicago Pizza Grinder-you'll have to drive down clark st to get there, but pest pizza and mediterranean bread ever, worth the long wait

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, will be back”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in May 2008 in a studio room. I paid $169 per night + tax (booked on travezoo) and all I have to say is that was a bargain! The room was huge with a small sofa/living area and separate king bed. The flat screen TV was also huge and could be turned to face the bed or the sofa which was great. The room was brand new as they have recently refurbished. There was also a separate office area with a large desk and free wifi internet. To top off the large room they had a very nice funky bathroom with bath and shower as well as a separate vanity area in a mini hallway with a very large mirror and separate plus and a great lighting...perfect for putting on makeup and doing your hair. The hotel itself was located next door to Ginos pizza (Which is great too) and only 2 mins walk from Michigan Avenue shopping, including Bloomingdales and the Water Tower shopping centre with Macys. A few minutes walk away is the John Hancock building, again with shops and great views from the restaurant on the 95th floor (It's free if you go up for a meal or drinks, else you pay $12 for the view). Dinner is buffet, which was lovely and reasonably priced at $18 + tax and service + drink. Must sees - go to Millennium Park (15-20 mins walk), State Street shopping, Navy Pier and make sure you go to the visitors centre as you can get a free greeter service (a local person who shows you around including a one day travel card worth $5). The visitors centre is based 77 E. Randolph, Chicago, IL 60602 (at the corner of Randolph St. and Michigan Ave). PS - remember to pick up a discount card for Bloomingdales (11% off) and Macys (11% off) from there respective customer service/visitor centres inside the store)

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Fun and Clean---loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tsquared417
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my 3 kids (ages 7,6 and 2) and husband and we loved it! The decor throughout is very funky but tasteful. The room was super clean. The beds are comfortable---love the pillow choices! My kids loved the sunken room with the stairs---entertaining when you're 2! The staff was friendly and efficient. Also a great location---not a long walk to anywhere on Michigan Avenue or the Navy Pier. We would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Nate31
Reviews.Content: It's in a perfect location, just a 2 blocks from Hancock Tower and very close to Rush street. The rooms are huge and has a 5 star look to it. Very accomdating and curtious staff. Stayed here for 5 days and felt very safe taking walk in the neighbourhood at night. I know they charge for internet in the room but I was be able to access a free wireless netowork from my room.

Reviews.Title: “A work in progress -- can't wait to see the end result”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly727
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. From the location, to the modern upscale room, to the friendly, accommodating staff. The lobby was still undergoing construction while we were there but the room was nice, the beds were great and the bathroom was beautiful. I liked the location, too. Close enough to the Mag Mile, but on a quiet street. This hotel is still getting organized. There was plaster and grout in our shower but it was eventually cleaned up. The lobby had water and snacks every evening. During the week, they have coffee and muffins too. The concierge provided us with excellent restaurant recommendations. I would go back there to stay in a heartbeat. We got this room at a steal on Travelzoo ($99, including parking, which we didn't need).

Reviews.Title: “Can't put my finger on it”
Reviews.Author: DumbDog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Chicago for 5 nights. I booked a junior suite through the AAA website way back in November. We weren't paying a cut rate by any means so I was surprised by the room. It was like a galley kitchen, long and narrow. Yes there were two TV's, a couch, coffee table, bed, and a large bathroom. But the layout was so long and narrow as to be awkward. The room itself was spotless, kept clean each day. Yet this is sadly about all the positive I can say about the Affinia. We were on the 4th floor overlooking the alley and every weekday morning around 0430 hours the garbage trucks started and kept up for 2 hours. So 3 of the 5 mornings we were awakened by the racket. Taking a look at the windows themselves it's obvious they weren't updated in the recent renovation. Single paned, no noise reduction, and most important our window frames were filthy with mold. We weren't told until 3 days into our stay that the breakfast room was open, despite a letter in our room from the manager saying the breakfast wasn't available yet. Small disconnect in communication there. Location is great, just off the Magnificent Mile, yet on our next trip to Chicago (and we loved the city) we won't return to the Affinia.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia turned out to be a nice choice...”
Reviews.Author: Arturas
Reviews.Content: I love to stay in the modern design hotels and since my favourite hotel in Chicago was fully booked after many doubts I booked this hotel. I went there without any expectations, just with a thought of having a bed under the roof. This stay turned out to be a lovely one. I liked almost finished lobby of the hotel and the staff of the hotel were incredibly welcoming. So, that was a nice start. Check in very friendly and smooth. I must say I am not a lover of modern classic/posch style which I think discribes the style of the Affinia. But somehow I did like the styte of the rooms in Affinia. It felt homey. Bathroom was huge ( I asked for walk in shower). Aveda products was a plus. I loved the bed and slept very good in it. The locations is great too.Magnificient mile is just on the corner. Like someone mentioned before, there is one thing I can't understand why the internet/wifi is charged service at Affinia? I loved my stay at Affinia but for my next stay I will go back to my favourite hotel which offers internet free of charge. Sometimes, these little details and not big lines of the hotel that counts when making final decision choosing hotel.But I will definately check the hotel. Maybe they will change their policy on the internet...I am not the only one who finds it strange after all... Beside this, I do really recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great People”
Reviews.Author: SimpleWeeble
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Affinia Chicago in March for a convention. We heard that the hotel had undergone a renovation and read great reviews. Unfamiliar with Chicago, we trusted the reviews, crossed our fingers and hoped for the best. We were not let down. Upon arrival, the lobby was still undergoing renovations and preparing for the opening of their restaurant. Our room was ready, so check in was smooth and easy. There are complimentary bottles of water and snacks for you at the front desk...great after a 10 hour flight or a long day of walking around the city. Daniel, the bellman, helped with our bags and gave us a brief rundown of places to go. Such a great guy, it was southern hospitality at it's best. The room we booked was a Jr. Suite and it was fabulous!! (take a look at photos) The layout was great and it was nice to be able to spread out and lounge. The Affinia has some cool services. They offer several pillow options to choose from, walking tours to download, exercise videos for the room, etc. All of the toiletries in the room are from Aveda. I'm a huge couch potato at home, so I appreciated the flat screen that could swivel to face the bed or the couch. Location off the Magnificent Mile was terrific. One block off the mile, the hotel is located behind Neiman Marcus. Around the corner was a 24-hour Walgreens. If you are visiting for a conference at McCormick Place the Affinia does not have a shuttle service but don't worry, there are several hotels next to the Affinia that you can catch. The hotel was very quiet and elevators were fast. Very clean, with comfy beds, water pressure in bath is perfect . I recommend the Jr. Suite; it's spacious enough that I could sleep without being bothered while my husband worked on his laptop. We were sad to leave at the end of the week but needed to get back home for Easter...but our plans changed. There was a freak snowstorm that hit on Friday and our flight back home was cancelled! We couldn't get back home until the night of Easter Sunday! I immediately got on the phone at the airport and called the Affinia. Spoke with Milton, the Front Desk Manager. He was so helpful and friendly during that stressful moment. He was able to get us checked back into another suite with an even better rate! When we got there, the staff was great to us and were so sorry that we wouldn't be able to get home for Easter. Thank you so much to everyone there. We fell in love with Chicago and will return during the summer. The city is beautiful, so much to do and see, but most of all the people were so wonderful. We will return to the Affinia and highly recommend it to others if they are looking for a hotel in this terrific city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lettyger
Reviews.Content: As others have said, once all the construction works are completed I suspect that the prices this hotel can (legitimately) charge will put it out of our price range. Which will be a pity because it is an excellent hotel, & the location couldn't be better. The room was very spacious, with separate sitting & study areas & a nice bathroom. Only 3 minor points: downstairs they were serving a free basic breakfast (coffee & pastries), but we only knew of it on our last morning - nobody had mentioned this; the cost of internet - $9.99 - is a bit dear especially when lots of motels now offer it free; there was only powered milk in the rooms, which wasn't that nice. But none of these really spolied a really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pooter0216
Reviews.Content: I like the Affinia....a lot. The location is PERFECT! but i have to admit, it was the staff that sold it. We arrived at about 11am on Sunday, so the rooms were not available. So they stored our luggage while we had lunch. When we returned at about 1pm there were two available. I have to admit I am a very picky person when it comes to where I lay my head. The staff was wonderful. They took me to both rooms to see which one I wanted, which i thought was great. We ended up going with a third one on the 11th floor. I wanted a king bed instead of a queen. The roomshave a real minimalist feel. Kind of funky and retro. We got a huge room where there were steps leading to the bed. One drawer and a flat screen tv with a couple of lamps, oh and a desk. We lost out on the brand new shower in our room, which i was really bummed about. It is not a luxury suite, but it is really nice. Very clean which I am very picky about. I didn't have the constant need to scratch when I was there. There was some paint chipping on the wall right over the sink. I told the front desk and they said they are going to fix it. Everything is new here. Yes there is still construction and the restaurant is not done, but there are so many places to eat right outside the hotel, that you don't miss it. Again the staff was perfect. They greeted us with a smile and every wish was their command. If we needed directions, reservations, water or phone numbers, they were more than willing to help us. Loved em! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: tstrayer76
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, modern hotel. Everything is brand new since they just renovated. Beautiful, large bathroom, nice and comfy beds. I would definitely recommend this to a friend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NanaCathy
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone who sent in reviews; it really helped me in choosing this hotel. As others have recently noted, the hotel remodel is incomplete but once done, it will be a terrific hotel. The staff was very nice, the rooms immaculate and cheery, and the bathroom had really nice Aveda products. The shower was wonderful, too! Thank you, Affinia Hotel, for making my girls getaway weekend really special.

Reviews.Title: “Super Affinia”
Reviews.Author: luckiest1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a one night stay at the super lovely Affinia in Chicago. From the moment we arrived, the hotel was a true joy. The construction is still happening as mentioned below, but it absolutely did not affect our stay. The room was beautiful. We booked through the Travelzoo promotion so we got a great rate, and they even upgraded us to a suite! The nicest part of our stay was the staff. Graham, Marisol, Pedro, Christine and the parking valet (who's name I can't recall) were all extremely helpful, very nice and a real pleasure to do business with! Believe it all, it is all true! The location is Great too! I deffinately will recommend this hotel to friend and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: babina8
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in March through Travelzoo like so many other reviewers. Because of the great deal, we were a little wary about the state of the hotel during construction. That wariness turned out to be completely unnecessary! The entrance to the hotel IS a mess - there is scaffolding, uneven sidewalks, mud, wet paint in the lobby, etc., but this really didn't make any difference to my husband or me. The only annoying thing about the construction was that we were forced to use two separate sets of slooow elevators every time we went to our room. Otherwise, the price and the newly remodeled rooms were definitely worth the cost of walking through a little construction in the entrance. The rooms are all updated with a very clean and stylish feel to them. We stayed in the studio suite, which was very spacious and very comfortable. The flat panel TV that swivels around from bedroom to living room definitely kept my husband entertained for a while. The view from our room - on the 19th floor I think - was a great view right down a street that runs parallel to Mich Ave. The fact that the restaurant and bar aren't open made no difference to us whatsoever. There are tons of restaurants extremely close nearby, and if you want room service, they provide all the rooms with a menu from a delivery service for area restaurants. Also, the lobby was always stocked with complimentary bottles of water and snacks. The location cannot be beat - it is about a block away from Michigan Ave, and about 1/2 a block to Neiman-Marcus and Sak's. It's literally right in the middle of everything. Also, every single employee of the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. We are not the typical guests because we were in town visiting several friends, and often visit Chicago, so we didn't need as many recommendations about getting to Navy Pier, etc., but if you do need that information, they are very knowledgeable and willing to offer tips. We loved our stay so much that I convinced my sister to book the hotel a few weeks later, and she also was extremely satisfied. Once the new restaurant and rooftop bar are opened, this hotel is going to be one of the best deals in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A short but sweet visit”
Reviews.Author: freetoroam
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a two night stay at the Affinia Chicago and our visit was delightful. Thanks to tripadvisor reviews we were prepared for the major construction work on the facade and entrance..it was a mess. And the hotel restaurant and bar remain incomplete and unavailable. Even parts of the lobby had "wet paint" stickers. All these things could have made for a disappointing stay. Not so!! Although we arrived very early in the day our suite was ready along with a most warm and gracious greeting from the front desk staff. After just a few minutes we felt like we were "at home." The suite on the 25th floor, with a fab view along a wall of windows, was sparkling fresh and clean. The bathroom lighting was outstanding and led to my bride of nearly 50 years saying that it made her look younger...she was right! Everything in and about the room was "like-new" and very stylish. As a visitor we appreciated the very convenient location just a few steps from the Magnificient Mile and all of its ambiance. Thanks to a dedicated and gracious staff, a fantastic location, and chic decorating elements, this hotel can and will be our future hotel of choice in Chicago. The stay was short..but sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more satisfied”
Reviews.Author: LHR7
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking my 3 night stay at the Affinia Chicago, I was a little hesitant about the Affinia, so I did my research to make sure that my Incredibly low rate that I found on Travel Zoo was not too good to be true. I could not have been more pleasantly surprised!! The guest rooms have just been re-done to look modern, chic and pristine. The rooms and bathrooms are VERY spacious and comfortable!! The staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating, better service then I have experienced in any 5 star hotel I have stayed at in the past. The location is in the middle of Michigan ave. and the major downtown attractions, perfect for first timers to Chicago (like myself). Every request was fulfilled and every expectation surpassed!! Although this chic, urban, boutique hotel does not include resort style amenities (and yes the lobby is still under construction) I didn't even notice these shortcomings because I was so impressed with the rooms, service and PERFECT location!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Affinia”
Reviews.Author: Minnetonkamom
Reviews.Content: Recently my daughter and I stayed for a week at the Affinia in Chicago. I booked it after reading the glowing reviews and I was not disappointed! The location is excellent, close to Michigan Ave and only a few blocks to the subway station. The room was lovely. Tastefully decorated and very comfortable. We even had a recliner in our living area! The TV was a flatscreen and could be swiveled so we could see it from the bed or the living area, very clever. We really appreciated the makeup station outside the bathroom, it even came equipped with a makeup mirror, nice touch. The beds were comfortable and housekeeping was perfect. They changed our sheets every day and we had no problem getting enough towels! The hotel staff was exceptionally friendly. Every single one made us feel welcome and important. They even helped us navigate the CTA by printing us routes to our destination. One very big plus was that there are not a lot of rooms on each floor so it is nice and quiet. I felt as if I was the only one staying here despite the fact that the lobby was busy and I knew differently. Construction. I have to admit that the lobby construction did not inconvenience me in the slightest. That being said, I do have some suggestions to how it might have been better presented. I would have temporarily painted the area out side the elevators going to the lobby. The walls looked dingy and unimpressive; not at all compatible with the rooms. I would also have installed temporary baseboards to give the hotel a more polished look, even if just for a short time. Also, I would never have posted signs on computer paper, writen in marker and affixed to the walls with tape; it looked tacky. Instead, I would have custom made temporary signs to indicate directions to the lobby. These signs are inexpensive, easy to obtain, and they would have looked much more professional than the hand made signage. Finally, I would suggest that doors be shut to unfinished areas. It looked shabby to walk by. If I wasn't a guest, and was taking a quick peek, I would not be inclined to book a room. Finally, I have some suggestions regarding the lack of restaurant and the no weclome drink which was promised. It is completely understandable that give the construction, the hotel could not offer its daily breakfast spread. I do feel that some attempt should have been made to counteract that inconvenience. Muffins and juice somewhere? Also, a welcome 1/2 bottle of wine would be nice with a letter apologizing for any inconvenience. The in room information is old and refers to a now non-existant pool. I would update that information AS SOON as the rooms were completed. I would not have allowed the rooms to be used until everything in the room was finished. I come from the hospitality field and the preceeding comments are details I would have made to make the experience even better than it already was! By all means though, stay at the Affinia. It was a great experience and I will return here again, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “In love with Affinia”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel93Ohio
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending the weekend at the Affinia Chicago. It is in the middle of renovation but you wouldn't know it when you are in your room. The staff was excellent, very helpful in giving us suggestions for eating and any other entertainment. They never seemed bothered to answer our questions. The beds were the most comfortable Ive ever slept in. The room was spotless and had a unique retro decor. I highly recomend staying here, you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Chi_town
Reviews.Content: Got in on the Travelzoo promotion for this hotel. We are Chicagoansâ€™ and thought it would be fun to play tourist for the weekend; I could not have picked a better hotel. I agree with other reviews that once this hotel completes it renovation it will be the little gem off of the Mag Mile. I have never met a friendlier staff at a hotel. I noticed they ask each patron the purpose of their stay upon check in and then make suggestions accordingly. Our only request, was to get a room on an upper floor with a "view". We arrived before the scheduled check in so Annie (reception) took my cell phone number and called me within and hour with availability. Boy did she deliver! We were upgraded to a Jr. Suite, at no additional charge, on the 25th floor facing south. FYI this building only has windows facing north and south as they are in the middle of an east/west street. Thus your best views will be "in the front" facing south. No restaurant or bar in the building yet, but hardly something to complain about; so many choices within a block. Those who complain about this hotel, even while under construction, are crazy! Good job Affinia and welcome to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel as is. Will be brilliant when completed.”
Reviews.Author: pickles1107
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia on March 18th - 20th, 2008. At the time of booking the Hotel, I requested a queen/queen room on a high floor. We arrived at about 10:45 AM, and a room was already ready. The room they gave us was on the 4th floor ( out of about 22 ) or so. I'm not sure if they had people staying in the upper floors because of the construction, but I have a suspicion that had we checked in at the regular time, a room matching our preferences may have been given to us. If true, it would have been nice to give us the option to check in early or leave our bags and come back in a few hours when a higher room was available. However, this is of no consequence as our room was lovely. Had we asked to be moved, we probably would have been accommodated anyways. We had a queen/queen room along the front side of the hotel facing south, and we had a great view straight down St. Clair street. Our room did not have the steps down into the living area like so many reviews on this site talk about, which was a little disappointing, but the view made up for it. I'm not sure if only suites have the dual level rooms or what, but don't get your hopes up like I did and expect this, because not every room has this feature. The room decor was contemporary with the dark floors and furniture contrasting with the white linens and walls with orange and green bed accents. It had nice 32" (?) LCD flat screen TV, as well as a reading chair, a desk with another rolling chair, and a separate cabinet with a mini fridge. The small window on the far left actually cranked open, which we enjoyed. However, we noticed that the window frames and caulk were definitely not part of the renovation as they were slightly disgusting. The bathroom was stunning! The red wallpaper was crazy, and there was a HUGE walk-in shower. The mirror with the circle of light surrounding was cool as well. Inside were Aveda products (which housekeeping did not restock for day 2) and a pair of dimming lights: one above the shower and one in the toilet area. In the closet was a couple of robes, an iron and board, and a safe, all of which we did not use. There was also an automatic motion sensor light that turned on when you walked past and the doors were closed, which was a neat feature. The staff was very friendly and helpful, but I don't feel like they lived up to the reputation from previous reviews. We had to carry our own bags up to our room because the doorman / bellman completely overlooked us as we arrived. Both doormen were pleasant, but neither greeted us by name like in other reviews. One did hail a cab for us with his whistle on the way out, which we got a kick out of. I don't think the bellman talked to us once our entire stay. The front desk was helpful, and one gentleman even printed a March Madness bracket off for me, but sometimes when we came back in, they wouldn't even say hello. For the last part of our trip, we stayed at the Hotel Monaco, and our experiences with the staff there offered a stark contrast. Not to say that the Affinia crew was bad because they were great, but they just didn't go that extra mile. This is something they should strive towards. One thing I must comment on is the pillow menu. Try the sound pillow, which connects to an MP3 player to softly lull you to sleep. We also tried the magnetic pillow, which I did not enjoy. We knew about the ongoing construction going into our stay, and for the price we paid, it was definitely NOT an issue. We also appreciated the refreshments available in the lobby for the guest as an apology for the efforts. The hotel will be a real gem when completed.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: Indiana_Robert
Reviews.Content: We connected to Affinia Chicago thorugh a city websight. The deal was fair for a downtown hotel on the main drag with an attractiion included. There was information out there that the hotel was being overhauled although we did not pay much attention to that. They are currently under major construction. They will be a little late of their projections in the finish date. I must say that the staff tried very hard to make our stay comfortable under very difficult circumstances. The room was complete and was good. It had a very nice bathroom. The main lobbie and all hotel amenities are totally unfinished drywall with no food, drink, or rest room opportunities. The construction guys did their best to limit activity and noise to after 9:00am. I think this will be a good one once they are done. As of the end of May, they have a way yet to go.

Reviews.Title: “A great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgwhite
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel excellent. The bar and restaurant are being done up at the moment which is the only downside. However its location is excellent, staff are pleasant and helpful, rooms are large and have fridge, iron, dressing gowns and wide screen tv and more. A very enjoyable experience

Reviews.Title: “One of my worst hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: Jamie1234
Reviews.Content: Be very suspicious of the glowing reviews you get on these websites (phonies). Trust me, this place is under construction --- big time. How can anyone rate this as the best hotel he/she has ever been, when it has no restaurant, there are wet paint signs, there is scaffolding above the entrance, cracked sidewalks to navigate to get in (careful in heels, ladies!). Not even a vending machine to get a bottle of water. Oh, did I mentioned that from 1:15 am through 7:00 am there is construction going on, drills, pounding. I didn't sleep a wink. I'm NOT kidding. I got charged for a movie I didn't order. They were nice enough to comp my stay (I think). My stay was for business, so maybe its a great area for shopping, bars. But otherwise . . . On the bright side, the rooms seemed clean. People were nice. Maybe when it's done the hotel will be really nice. But for now, how can I rate this place other than terrible. My fixtures shook because of the pounding. Come on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Only to Get Bettwe After Renovations”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierboy2
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend paying a lot of money to stay there right now. I got a $129 travelzoo promo that included free valet parking and felt I got a great deal. There is no restaurant, no bar, no room service, no lobby even, no ice, no mini bar and lots of construction. However, the rooms are great (totally renovated), clean, new and comfortable. I got a 2 King room with a huge bathroom. Beds were very comfortable. Located next door to Gino's East and Nieman Marcus off of Michigan Avenue. Friendly staff. Good experience. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Affinia!”
Reviews.Author: Wahoowa_ND
Reviews.Content: After celebrating our engagement back at the Affinia 50 in NYC, we were pleased to have been just as happy with the Affinia 50. We received the travelzoo.com discount so only paid $90 for a stunning room on the 23rd floor with a view of the John Hancock Tower. Being a designer, I appreciated all the colorful details to the rooms plus the beds are incredible. We made a point to come back early just for nap, even though we were in Chicago! I additionally like the split level room layout of our king bed unit, making it spacious for the floor to ceiling height. Cons because of renovation: The elevator stopped on every floor on our decent. The reception staff apologized since they are working on it. The bar, gym and lounge wasn't available yet but should be complete by the end of March. Some pros: the reception actually read our online request for a room with a view and gave us a free upgrade on our already discounted unit to the king bed. Second, we got in via train at 9am but they let us check in that early for the same rate! This is exactly why we were thrilled to stay there and always want to return to the Affinia brand.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: goldhardt
Reviews.Content: We visited for my 40th birthday. We had never been to Chicago so was not sure where to stay. Found the deal on this hotel from Travelzoo. Great rate, staff was awesome, very helpful and nice, location was great. Enjoyed our stay but still like NYC better. Great, great hotel. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: gotonodj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia in February and had a wonderful stay! My daughter was interviewing at Northwestern University, just a block away, so location was my first priority. We fell in love with the hotel--don't know if we'll be able to afford to stay here once the renovations are complete, so I'm glad that we chose it for this trip. The staff is wonderful. They were always friendly and concerned that we had everything we needed. If you had any questions, they were always helpful. The front lobby was still under construction, but no worries. They supplied bottled water and snacks because the restaurant is not yet finished. We didn't have to change elevators, as others mentioned, so that part of the renovation must be done. The room was terrific. When I booked it, I was told it was a junior suite--it was huge! An "office area" with a desk was located just inside the door. A few steps down from that was a large sitting area, with a couch, chair, refrigerator that was hidden inside a cabinet and a large tv that was swivelled so that you could either turn it towards the sitting area or the bed area. The king bed was soooo inviting and comfortable, with lamps on either side of the headboard. You could order several different kinds of pillows, including magnetic pillows and ones that would hook up to your i-Pod so that you could listen to music through your pillow. The couch pulled out for sleeping, but my daughter and I camped out on the king-sized bed since my husband couldn't make the trip with us. Therefore, I can't vouch for the comfort of the pull-out couch. The bathroom was small, but very comfortable. And the room just off the bathroom contained a lighted magnifying mirror. There was an ironing board and iron in the closet, along with a hair dryer and bathrobes. The closet also contained a safe. Every room was spotless. Our room was located next to the elevator, and you could hear it when you were in the bathroom. But we weren't bothered by it during the night. In fact, it was very quiet in the room we stayed in. We didn't hear any others coming or going. But the best part of the room were the windows, which ran along the entire wall of the room! We looked out onto N. St. Clair Street from the 21st floor. It was beautiful at night. The hotel is just a block from Michigan Avenue and an easy walk to lots of places to eat and shop. My daughter went to the Elephant and Castle Pub for a drink one night, so I was surprised when the hotel gave us a voucher to go there for breakfast. The menu was small, but the food was good. And I'll be back there for a drink the next time I'm in town. All in all, we had a great stay. My daughter loved the hotel and I know that she'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff, Amazing Room!”
Reviews.Author: bean3
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from March 7th to 9th to celebrate her birthday! This is hands down the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. Ever. The room was huge. We had a Studio Suite that came equiped with a huge flat screen TV, a fridge, a safe, upper level desk area, a couch and ottoman. There was plenty of lighting, even cute little reading lamps on each side of the headboard. Our bed was so comfortable, I didn't want to get up and go out in the cold! The hotel is still under going construction, but all of the rooms have been completed. The lobby area is under major construction and consist of a reception desk only. So basically, the only place you can hang out at in the Hotel right now is your room, but what an amazing room it is. The very best thing about staying at The Affinia is the staff. Everyone bent over backwards to make sure we had a great visit. They greeted us by name and asked if we needed anything everytime they saw us. We asked for ice, (there is no vending right now) and it was literally in our room in 2 minutes. The young lady at the front desk, whom we saw everyday, was extremely sweet and helpful. ( I wish I could remember her name. I do remember she said her last name is hard to pronounce) A really great guy at the front desk, helped me with our boarding passes, and by request told my daughter and I the ending of a pay -per -view movie we had fallen asleep during the night before!! Do not hesitate to book here! Thanks Affinia staff , we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - But some issues with our stay”
Reviews.Author: adavici
Reviews.Content: We knew the hotel was under a serious renniovation going in, so we expected the construction mess and noise. It was only a minor detraction - the lobby was torn up and the elveators were under maintenance requiring guests to transfer to a different elevator if they were going higher than the 7th floor. The great discount was worth the construction hassle. We requested a room on a high floor when we reserved and again when we checked in and were told no guests were staying above the eighth floor. This was puzzling and bothersome as all week we saw people staying on the 12th, 19th and 25th floors - and ended up on the 10th floor ourselves. Our first room was on the 8th floor - a Studio Suite looking out at the Hancock building and a couple other skyscrapers. There was a section of roof right outside our window with gigantic generators that were unsightly...but seemed quiet enough at the time so we didn't worry too much about it. There was a construction office directly next to us which we also weren't too concerned about. The room was cold and after blasting the heat all night never warmed up. The thermostat said 75 but it was no warmer than the mid 60s. Our room was also lacking a refrigerator and the remote control didn't work. After waking up freezing the next morning to the sound of a 7am buzz saw from the construction office next door, we asked if we could move to another room. We ended up a couple doors down where we had the pleasure of a refrigerator and heat. This room was very similar but the added ammenities helped - even tho there was no view whatsoever this time - excpet the same generators we were facing last time without the hancock. We were happy...until we took an afternoon nap. Unfortunately...the generator outside our window kicked on as we laid down and was very loud to the point ear plugs and pillows over the head wouldn't deafen it. So we moved again...to the 10th floor. Finally, we had heat, a fridge, a remote, and quiet. The hotel uses a 3rd party internet provider that was a pain to get set up. After paying i lost my connection and couldn't get it back and had to call the 1 800 number. After the first night it worked perfectly for the next 3. They also use a 3rd party valet (with geno's?) and when we checked out it took nearly a half hour to get our car. The parking was free with the promotion...but it still took forever. So that was somewhat of a nightmare...we travel a lot and rarely switch rooms, and have never switched twice. There is a reason we request high floors and had we been put on a higher floor initially our stay would have probably been perfect. On to the positives... With the exception of the "8th floor" debacle, The desk staff and bellmen at the Affinia are top notch. They could not have been friendlier and more accommodationg. They were understanding throughout our moves and apologetic. The bellmen were friendly and prompt. I can't say enough about the staff. Secondly, the rooms themselves are really great. The studio suites are big and comfortable. Very modern ammenities and fixtures, very clean and spacious. We were very comfortable and satisfied with the room itself. Finally...the location is perfect. If you're looking for the Michigan Ave experience, the Affinia is perfect. So, in the end we just wish we could have been on a higher floor like we requested and still don't understand the double standard. The hotel and staff is really great and the rooms are wonderful. We would consider giving them another chance....despite all the problems...hopefully under better conditions!

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: LouisvilleWildcatfan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in just about every nice Hotel near Michigan Avenue, the Four Seasons, The Ritz, The Park Hyatt, The Peninsula, etc We thought we would be adventurous after reading the reviews of the Affinia I loved the location of this hotel It is less than a block to Michigan Avenue and next to Gino's East. The room (we had a suite) was quite large, with a "work" area after you enter, then steps to a large area with a pull-out couch, a chair, refrigerator, and large flat screen tv.. As you step past this you move into the bedroom area with a large king-size bed (the mattress was VERY comfortable). I loved the Aveda products in the bath (though the wallpaper was a bit "too much fuscia" for me. There is no restaurant yet. It will be nice to have that and room service. The lobby was a mess, but we were only there to walk through to the room. The only problem we saw (though not a big deal) was that we had to wait on the elevators everytime. For the price, this was an incredible deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: travelinggurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia Chicago over New Years Weekend checking in on December 29th and leaving on January 1st. This was my 2nd trip to Chicago and DH's 1st. We just loved the hotel. You must try some of their specialty pillows- magnetic was my favorite. We were higher up, can't remember what floor in a newly renovated room. The room was kind of small, but worked fine for the two of us. It would have been tight if there was another couple. Location was great! Chicago is SO SPREAD OUT so no hotel is central to everything. From this hotel we walked Magnificent Mile and to Navy Pier (although the outside stuff was closed- Winter Wonderland was operating inside). We took the bus down to Soldier Field, the Field Museum, and the Aquarium. Missed the Planetarium on this trip. Took a cab down to the Natural Science Museum. All food options were still closed due to renovations, but other than that we the workers didn't affect us. Staff was great and gave us some really wonderful restraurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “more ups than downs”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: First, because of the renovations being done here there are some awesome deals available for this hotel. We took advantage of Travelzoo's $99 with free parking. With parking running about $50 at most hotels in Chicago, this deal is amazing. We upgraded to a junior suite. The room was huge, with lots of windows, lots of bathroom space to get ready, a fridge and business area with desk. The TV is conveniently located in the middle of the room and can be turned either towards the couch or bed. The bathroom amenities were very nice Aveda products, and soft, plush towels. But, there were some definite negatives, if you go here expecting perfection, you will be disappointed. For one our furnace never worked properly, the room was freezing!! We called down, and they explained how to restart the furnace. Well, it was pretty obvious why it was not working, it was absolutely disgusting!! I do not think the filter has been changed in this century. Waking up freezing during the night to restart a furnace is in no way a plus. This hotel is also located next door to Northwestern hospital. The constant ambulance noise even on the 14 th floor, when not waking me up, had me dreaming I was in lots of accidents. Also, if you are on any floor above 7, which just about everyone is, means changing elevators. Hopefully after renovations this will change. If you find a good deal on this property, go for it. Just don't expect perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: INDIANFLO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Affinia Chicago for 3 days and 2 nights. This was my first visit to chicago and my experience at this hotel made me want to return as soon as possible. Talk about what you see is what you get. After reviewing the pictures on the hotels website, i decided to book this hotel. I was a bit nervous when i found out the hotel was still under construction, and because i've stayed at hotels before and they were nothing like what was advertised. I hoped the rooms looked as good as they did on the internet...They were even better. The bathroom was very big and the room was clean and fresh, i did not want to leave my room. The bed is huge and not to mention comfortable. My husband could not stop talking about the swedish memory pillows that we requested. The staff is very friendly and they try to meet your needs the best way they can. I got everything i requested. I got my kingsize bed, a room with a view, high floor..It was just AWESOME....I am already planning my next visit for the summer and there is no question about where i will be staying.. The Affinia..

Reviews.Title: “Give them a shot, you won't be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: kar323
Reviews.Content: PAMPERED! My husband and I have travelled for 20 years worldwide for business and pleasure. This place, hands down, was the best hotel in 20 years. Large Rooms. Clean Carpets! (When is the last time you could wear your white socks in your hotel room?) Comfortable Beds! Quiet Elevators. No problem hearing your neighbors or their children through paper thin walls. Not even in the bathroom! Gorgeous Views! And the staff, they can't do enough for you. They carry your bags, fetch things for you, hail your cabs, recommend the ideal place to eat, or visit... Pedro and Daniel knew our names and took care of us all weekend. Graham at the front desk addressed us by name and sent up fresh ice when we came back all weary from a busy day out. They entertained our kids and held our baby as we piled into and out of cabs with luggage and bags... I can't even scratch the surface of how wonderful this place really is! They are a hotel that wants an opportunity to show you how much they have changed. Give them a chance. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: poloboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2/15 - 16 and had a wonderful stay. Staff is very friendly, especially Daniel. Had a Junior Suite that was very comfortable and very eclectic. Room was so comfortable we never felt guilty spending a few extra hours relaxing after many hours of touring Chicago. Loved it so much, several friends and business associates have now made reservations to stay over the next several weeks. Hope the rates don't climb too high after renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way!!”
Reviews.Author: msrbley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia through the Travelzoo deal ($99/night + free parking) and couldn't have been more impressed. The lobby was gorgeous (maybe a little small but who cares - it's the lobby). The staff was gracious, polite and accomodating. The doorman offered to get us a cab and sincerely asked us about our adventures. The desk staff offered to find us reservations or directions. We were pampered! The room exceeded our expectations. We even loved the "white noise" options on the alarm clock. Being next door to a medical center we worried the sirens might disrupt our sleep but the white noise completely canceled out any street noise. While room service would have been nice, we didn't miss it at all with Gino's next door, wonderful dining on Michigan Avenue just steps away and Walgreens around the corner, we had everything we needed. The location was especially convenient. The hotel was in between wonderful shopping on Michigan Avenue, Water Tower Place, the 900 Shops and the John Hancock Tower. We were in love with this hotel and hope we can afford to stay there when the construction is complete in March (speaking of construction, we barely even noticed it). Even parking is convenient. We had free parking through Travelzoo (which saved us about $40/night) but there is a parking ramp across the street. This hotel made our first Valentine's together special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location, Great All Around Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexMuskegon_MI
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews written about this hotel and most were good, but they really did not do the hotel justice. Affinia is a wonderful hotel. Yes they do have construction going on and the lobby is small but the staff and the quality of the rooms more than made up for that. We had a group of 14 stay Feb.8-10th with all diffrent styles of rooms thru the travelzoo special. Some had the standard rooms which just have a shower( but a huge walk in shower) or the studio suite which was just as big and spacious as the junior suite which both had a bath tub in place of the walk in shower. All the rooms were great, very clean and comfortable. The hotel have no resturant but across the street in chicago place there is a Mcdonalds & a food court. A short distance away is a nice sit down breakfast place call West-Egg, very good food. Walgreens is right around the corner. This hotel is, at the most, 300 feet from michigan ave. Chicago Place, "900" the shopping store and Macy's, Disney store, on and on and on, are all at your foot stool if you stay here. Wonderful location. The staff was GREAT our group had ages from 9yrs. to 80yrs. and they were all catered to like they were the only ones at the hotel everyone felt welcome and special, it was awsome. One of the persons in our group wanted a handicap room, which we thought was going to be on the ground floor but it was not, so he was upset at first, but when he saw his room and experienced the stay he was happy and already is making plans to return in May. The only draw back is the elevator system its sort of crazzy, you have to use two diffrent elevators to get to certain floors, that was weird.

Reviews.Title: “Nervous at first, but WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: cabbage_head
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Travel Zoo for a quick weekend get away with our two boys and were a little nervous because we saw that it was going through a rennovation. But the price was hard to pass on ($99/night) and it had free parking (normally $40/day), so we bit the bullett. WOW! What a pleasant surprise. From the staff, to our room, to the location. Everything overshot our expectations. We paid the extra $20 to upgrade to a suite and it was worth it. The room was spacious and decorated contemporary, yet very comfortable. My wife loved the Aveda bath products and our boys enjoyed the view and the extra room. I worry that once the renovation is completed in March, we will not be able to afford staying here, but I am glad we had the opportunity and encourage anyone else to take advantage of the reduced rate now while it is still going on.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: number1baseballmom
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Affinia Chicago, we were impressed! Staff was WONDERFUL and so helpful. We arrived at about 2:00pm and were able to check in immediately. Being that we are visitors to the Windy City, we asked the staff if they could recommend a restaurant that would serve us well, give us great food and allow us to make it to our show (Wicked) on time (8:00pm). The staff gave a few recommendations and offered to call the restaurant in order to make reservations for us. Being that it was a Saturday night, we weren't too sure we could get in. Well, they did it! We had our reservations for the Capital Grill and were even comped an appetizer! WOW! The staff was always great to us... greeting us as we came and went, making suggestions of restaurants (which were all fabulous), arranging for transportation and keeping our bags safe after we checked out so that we could shop without being loaded with our bags. GREAT SERVICE!! I have read a few reviewers who complain about the fact that there is no restaurant right now - since they are renovating..... With all the great restaurants within blocks, there really is no need to worry about the fact that there is no restaurant on site. The rooms are simply MARVELOUS! They are beautiful and tastefully decorated! The beds are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in and our pillows were great too! Robe in the room... Aveda bath products..... Fridge in the room (to keep your free bottled water cold in)...... what more could you ask for? I would highly recommend this to anyone! The only problem? We were only there for one night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: chgo56
Reviews.Content: Recently completed a one (1) night stay at the Affinia Chicago Hotel and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Chicago for either business or pleasure. Though, if you are coming for pleasure and are looking for a hotel with a pool, etc. this isn't the property for you - though if you travel here in the summer months, Oak Street Beach is walking distance from the Hotel. However, if you are looking for a great place to stay, that is convenient to Chicago's dining, shopping and entertainment venues the Affinia Chicago would be a perfect choice. The rooms are modern in design and furnishings and the bathrooms are large and have Aveda amenities. At the present time, the hotel doesn't offer room service from an in-house restaurant (which will be open soon) but does have a comprehensive listing of restaurants that are part of CEO Delivers, so that if you don't want to leave the room, you can a meal delivered to you from some of Chicago's best restaurants. Overall the Affinia Chicago is an excellent hotel in a city full of great properties and I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Call this a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: ffa1986
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Affinia on 17 January, looking forward to the warm snug bar we have been used to when we stayed at the hotel (when it was the Fitzpatrick) on several occasions before. We were dismayed on arrival to find that the extent of the renovations being carried out meant there was: a) no bar; and b) no restaurant or food facilities. The room did not even have a mini bar, so there was no food available and the only drink available was a complimentary botle of mineral water in reception. This is not, by anyone's definition, a hotel. I question whether the "hotel" should be open when its facilites are so bare and so much work is being carried on. The rooms have been nicely redecorated but the appearance of the hotel is very much a mixed bag, with smart alongside shabby. The room's air conditioning is very noisy - too noisy to have on at night (which meant that the inside of the window was frozen over in the morning!). Part of our problem was we had booked through a web-site, hotelsrus.com. That web-site entry stated incorrectly that the hotel had a bar. The hotel point out that their own web-site does accurately reflect the situation. So we were stuffed. Affinia, to cap it all off, decided only to refund us only 1 of the 2 unused nights, even though we had made our complaint at a very early stage. We checked out after just one night, and moved to the InterContinental, to enjoy the normal facilities one would associate with a hotel. A most unsatisfactory situation, all in all. Guests will undoubtedly have a better time when the hotel facilities reopen later in 2008. Anyone planning to stay at the Affinia before then should recognise that the only facility consists of their room, and is advised to check with the hotel directly to see what facilities are, or are not, on offer. But I for one won't be going anywhere near the Affinia Chicago, or any Affinia hotel, again. And I'll be very wary when booking through a 3rd-party web-site, as clearly the information can be very inaccurate (and there is no recompense or help when things go wrong).

Reviews.Title: “Where "At Your Service" is more than a slogan!”
Reviews.Author: Myinspiration
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we arrived (at 6 a.m. and after a long COLD evening of travel), we were greeted and treated like royalty from the desk manager, Milton, and staff. We three couples booked the "Adventure" on Travelzoo and were not sure what to expect from a Hotel that was under renovation. Let me tell you that the rooms, comfort of the beds, decor, snacks, attention to detail in directions, suggestions for resturants, shopping and area attractions, anything and everything that we asked of the staff, was all FIRST CLASS! The preformance of 'Wicked' and Devon's seafood resturant were supreme! I was amazed how the staff remembered our names and welcomed us back after each outing. We can hardly wait to return to the 'family' at the Affinia! Milton made our visit extremely Memorable! Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Overly Impressed”
Reviews.Author: KLHNYC
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Affinia this past wkend in Chicago. We wanted to stay in a boutique hotel and stayed at the W Lakeshore this past November....We were all so impressed w/ the decor, service (free snacks and water at the front desk - free food always a plus for us), size of the room and huge bathroom. We loved the style of the rooms and all of us were just overly impressed. I guess we just weren't expecting it to be as cool as it was. Besides that, the location is great. right off of Michigan Ave near Neimans and Saks. There is also a Walgreens and Starbucks super close. We all will for sure stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, highly reccommend”
Reviews.Author: Sweetnsassy3604
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted a weekend away from the kids and family and living in Michigan, Chicago is a great get away. I found this great rate on Travelzoo and thought it was too good of a deal to pass up. I was so impressed. The staff was amazing. They were all so friendly and helpful. The rooms were great. Even though it was freezing cold that weekend we enjoyed our stay. I enjoyed it so much I will be back in March, I have already booked the room. Thanks to everyone at the Affinia... you rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: euroky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chicago Affinia Dec 10 thru Dec 12 and was very impressed with the staff, the room, and the location. Close to shopping and the pizza place next door was great. Of course, there were many other restaraunts nearby as well. I had a little trouble figuring out the heat, but it was fine once I learned how to set it. They were working on the hotel, so we got a great rate. But the work never bothered us. The room was great, with the walk-in shower in the spacious bathroom a wonderful surprise. I would definately stay here again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Affinia”
Reviews.Author: naffam4
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel. We were fortunate enough to get the Travelzoo rate of $99/night which included free parking! They upgraded us to a junior suite which was beautiful! The staff went out of their way to make sure everything went well during out stay. Can't say enough good things about this hotel . . . and I am picky about my hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BaydeNoc
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of a great rate offered through Travelzoo and was not disappointed. Some renovation is taking place at the entrance and lobby, and the restaurant is presently closed. The hotel is only one block off the Magic Mile (Michigan Ave), and there is a public parking garage across the street ($36/day)should you decide not to use the hotel's valet parking ($40/day). There are no ice or vending machines on the floors, but the hotel will deliver ice to your room. The rooms were excellent, with great beds and linens, flat screen tv', and a refrigerator. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel will loan out several free packages to help you enjoy your stay in Chicago. We took the waking tour package, which had 50 seperate walking tours detailed, along with apppropriate maps and a pedometer. Would definetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, can I say location!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: soleglo
Reviews.Content: As a Chicago resident, who visits the WinterWonderfest every year, I thought it would be nice to stay overnight in the area after leaving Navy Pier. The location of the Affinia is perfect! 1/2 block off Michigan Avenue and I only had to walk a couple of blocks to catch the free Navy Pier shuttle. The room was sufficient for myself and two 12 yr olds, especially since they were able to hook up their video game to the tv. The doormen, made us feel quite welcome, remembering our names immediately. One even suggested other stores in additional to the usual Niketown visit for the boys. Everything is within walking distance, shopping, dining, movies, bowling, you name it. My only complaint was the heat is dry and I had trouble sleeping. Would I go back?? In a heartbeat, cant wait to see the renovated lounge, restaurant, and rooftop lounge. Oops almost forgot, the elevators are a tad on the slow side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not great”
Reviews.Author: londonwpr
Reviews.Content: We got an amazing deal ($99/night included parking) to stay at the Affinia in December of 2007. While the hotel was very nice and clean, I don't think it's a 4-star hotel. The staff was very accomodating and extremely friendly and the rooms were nice. The bed was quite comfortable. Overall, our stay was pleasant, but I wouldn't pay 4-star prices to stay at the Affinia. My only complaints are that housekeeping started knocking on doors at 8AM and the doors to the guest rooms don't do a very good job at keeping out hallway sound. Also, the door on the bathroom has frosted glass, and if someone from your party needs to use the restroom in the middle of the night, the light from the bathroom fills the rest of the guest room. Overall, our stay at the Affinia was enjoyable. I'd stay there again if the price was right. If you're looking for a 4-star hotel in a similar location, I'd stay at the James before the Affinia.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia shines through the dust......”
Reviews.Author: cheapcheap
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Affinia December 29-30, 2007. We were a little apprehensive as we approched the hotel as the outside is boarded up for renovation. Once we stepped inside though, it was great. Granted the lobby is not finished, but the staff was excellent and check in was a breeze. We were also extremely pleased with the the room. Queen size bed, flat screen TV, couch, seperate desk area. The bed and pillows were sooooooo comfortable! The only downsides were that we did not receive a refresh of a bathmat and shampoo for our second night, and the hallways were, I swear, 100 degrees which made waiting for the elevator in our winter coats almost unbearable (We were on the 16th floor). The free bottled water and snacks at the front desk were a nice touch and the Bellman was very, very nice. We wanted to try Gino's for pizza (right next door) but there was always a line outside. I'm not sure if Gino's offered any "priority seating" for Affinia's guests.....I should have asked. We will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value/Quality Combination in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: StuphMan
Reviews.Content: Off for a (short) romantic getaway to beautiful downtown Chicago this holiday season, I was hopeful for a reasonably-priced hotel in the heart of it all... boy, did I hit the jackpot! Booking on AAA for three weeknights (Dec. 26th - 29th) secured a room for a mere $108 per night (plus applicable taxes). Given the location and quality of the hotel, I was flabbergasted at my good fortune. The Affinia is located on Superior and St. Clair, a half block east of the Magnificent Mile, two blocks south of Water Tower Place and the Hancock Center, and approximately 4 and a half blocks from the red line subway stop at Chicago station (making trips from O'Hare -blue line - or Midway - orange line - very reasonable via public transportation. You can even order CTA passes ahead of time via the internet!). The Affinia staff is always ready and willing to help you secure ground transportation if you need a taxi or information regarding airport shuttle services (not directly provided by the hotel, but they can point you in the right direction). The staff bends over backwards to be welcoming and helpful. To illustrate further: One morning we decided to do a subway/Metra train combination to reach the Science and Industry Museum instead of the #10 bus (probably would have been more convenient, but I digress...) I did not have a Metra schedule with me and in the interest of getting away from work had not brought my laptop on the trip. The desk clerk (in the newly remodeled lobby - just completed during our stay!) pulled up a Metra schedule online and assisted us in catching the right train. Wonderful! Although the renovation is ongoing (the restaurant is next), it did not interfere with our stay. The rooms are all completed and an obvious upgrade in decor is evident. The bed is extraordinarily comfortable, and you can customize your pillow selection simply by calling hotel services. Flat screen LCD TV, fridge, digital combo safe, etc. in our room. Complimentary Aveda products in the bathroom and guest robes in the closet. Four-star amenities at a three-star price. The only issues we experienced... batteries in the remote control died (how picky am I??) - issue was fixed in less than 5 minutes after a call to the front desk. No mirror outside of the bathroom was a minor inconvenience. Also, the room renovation was a bit too evident behind one of the wall panels (the oldest and dirtiest Trane furnace ever made) and a loose panel under the sink in the bathroom. That being said (and again, I'm almost sorry to be that picky), this was the BEST hotel experience I've had in years and was within walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do in the River North / Mag. Mile area (Pops Jazz Club, the Signature Room, etc.) Only disappointment in the immediate area was Gino's East (right next door). Skip it during peak hours (definitely not worth waiting around the corner for). Call ahead and get the deep dish experience in your room - I think you'll be glad you did. Enjoy YOUR Chicago experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, some small issues”
Reviews.Author: cousinmoze
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a very enjoyable 1 night stay at the Affinia. I definitely agree with other recent reviews: great location, friendly staff, great promo deal from web with free parking, and nice renovated rooms. I really liked the renovated room with the modern decor and large wall mounted LCD HDTV. The lobby and restaurant were under construction as expected. I am not sure what they will look like when finished, but the lobby and entrance are very small and need to be updated. There were a few minor housekeeping issues that could be improved. When we arrived, there was leftover food in the refridgerator, no shampoo, and only 1/4 of a roll of toilet paper (they did promptly bring us the necessary items when we asked). The hallway was also a bit messy and needed to be vacuumed. The maid knocked on our door the next morning at 8:50 for cleaning even though we were scheduled to leave that day? We put a "do not disturb" sign on door and went out shopping before the 12:00 noon checkout and returned to find the maid had already cleaned the room before we checked out. I suspect this is also what happened when we arrived. Even with these minor housekeeping issues I would stay here again, especially with the promo deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJG2007
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Affinia Chicago for 3 nights (December 18 - 21, 2007). We loved it - The rooms were recently renovated, had very comfortable beds with quality linens, a new bathroom, bathrobes and high quality soap, shampoo and other amenities. The location is fantastic - very close to Michigan Avenue and the shopping district. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We especially appreciated the help we received from Kathleen & Ashley in planning our walking tours. While the hotel's lobby was currently under renovation, it had no impact on our stay - we didn't hear any construction noise from our room. Having a finished lobby is not important to us - we are either in the room or "out and about". The hotel offered complimentary bottled water and snacks to guests...a nice touch. I strongly recommend the Affinia Chicago - we hope to return again next year for our annual holiday trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Affinia”
Reviews.Author: elcee2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Affinia. Although the hotel is still undergoing renovation and there is no restuarant/bar amenity, there are so many other pluses about this place that make it a stand out. First, all the staff were very accommodating, second the location is outstanding, and third the room with luxurious bedding made it difficult to get out of bed. We were told that by April a seafood restaurant will be ready--I am sure it too will pay attention to details. We can't wait to return! Also want to comment on restaurant reviews I read at this site--Quartino's was right on. If you love tuna tartare/poke/sushi we did taste tests and enjoyed those appetizers at Bandera, Catch 35 and Roys.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: chicagosuz
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find such a gem at an awesome price just 1/2 block east of the Mag Mile (Michigan Avenue), 3 blocks east of Holy Name Cathedral, 2 blocks from the Historic Water Tower park! The lobby, entrance way and elevators are still under construction, but the staff was amazing and our room was completed and it was beautiful-modern design, incredible bed and a great view, which because of the ice build-up we weren't able to enjoy...but the room was tasty warm! A great doorman gave us the name of a nice little place where we could grab a bowl of homemade soup on a freezing day...the SoupBox! The hotel is right next door to Gino's East! We will definitely return...and soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great remodel, Great room. lobby still being renovated”
Reviews.Author: travelmutt1
Reviews.Content: The Affinia Chicago hotel is located one block off the Mag Mile, next to Neiman Marcus, a block away from Tiffany's. GREAT location for shopping and site seeing. Close to Hancock building. Check out the city views from the bar atop Hancock. Ladies, visit the restroom of bar for Fab views of city! The hotel is currently being renovated from the Fitzpatrick. At the time of our stay (begin of Dec 2007) there was no room service, no restaurant/bar, fitness center. This was not a problem for us as we were staying for the weekend to take advantage of the city not the hotel food, bar etc. All guest rooms are finished. We had a Junior Suite that was HUGE for a hotel room. Separate desk area, sitting area, bedroom area, makeup/dressing area and bathroom. Very tasteful decor and very clean. Don't be discouraged by the streetside appearance of hotel and the lobby appearance. These areas are still under construction. We were not at all bothered by any construction noise. Our room was on the 20th floor with nice view of city. Gino's East Pizza right next door has GREAT Chicago style pizza. The hotel is a great deal (booked on internet travel site) in a great location. Easy to get to from Midway taking 2 trains. Would highly recommend checking out this hotel if planning a visit to Chicago. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome on a Cold weekend”
Reviews.Author: JoeG796
Reviews.Content: Just a block off Michigan Ave & around the corner from Water Tower Place, Affinia is a great find in the heart of Chicago's Magnificent Mile. Although not complete at the time of our stay (no restaurant, no bar yet), there was no obvious evidence of construction. Our room was charming with a small desk/work area on the same level as the bathroom and a sunken bed room with a fabulous view of the city to the south. Other conveniences included wi-fi, big flat-screen TV, fridge, etc. The staff was courteous and attentive and we never had to wait for our car from the valet. Lliterally next door to Neiman-Marcus and the stores on Michigan Ave., one can easily walk to a variety of shopping & fine dinning. And we got it all at a great promotional rate by booking through Travelzoo.com. Winter travel can be unpredictable to say the least. Although there were several inches of snow outside, we were comfy cozy at Affinia. We can't wait until the hotel is completed for our next visit. JoeG Ballwin, MO

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Affinia Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sweetnana
Reviews.Content: Affinia Chicago is the best of the best. The rooms are in mint condition and the beds are awsome. The best selection of pillows that we have ever had at a hotel. The LCD television was awsome as you could watch it from any place in the room. The rooms are very large in size. We thought we had been upgraded, but they said that was the standard room. The employees are the most caring and wonderful people that I have ever met at a hotel. You are truly more than just a guest. Victor (doorman) is your friend from the minute he greets you while he is opening the door for you. What an awsome person. He really cares about each and every person and always remembers your name after first meeting you. You are truly a blessing for the hotel. Way to go Victor !!! Daniel and Pedro are also doorman always friendly and ready to tell you great places to go eat. Great job guys. Next is Milton the night manager. He wants to do all he can to make sure your stay is the best. He goes up and above the call of duty. He makes sure you have had a great day and if you didn't well he will make it better for you. He truly cares about each and every guest that enters the Affinia. You are a friend and not just another person. You are so awsome Milton. Kathleen the concierge is equally as good. The last minute we asked her if she could get us tickets to see Jersey Boys and she got them at an excellent price. Thanks !!! Now for general manager Tom Brady. He actually took time to introduce his self to us. Gave us a mini tour of what the new front lobby looks like. He runs one awsome hotel and it shows in the hotel and the staff. Yes there is some construction going on for the new facelift, but we never heard any noise. If you stay here you will not regret. This is a five star hotel and they have it down to perfection. Love the Affinia Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyRoller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing significant renovations but this has not stopped me from visiting on a regular basis. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. The location of this hotel is excellent and the accommodations are superior. Give this place a try if you want a pleasent, first class stay in one of the hottest parts of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Affinia”
Reviews.Author: Summer05
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the Affinia and were very pleased with our stay. We used the $99 Travelzoo deal, which included parking (a $40 value). I doublt if I'll ever see a deal like that again in as nice a hotel as the Affinia with such a great location. We had a room with 2 doubles. It wasn't the Jr. Suite, but was very large, as was the bathroom. Everything was new, clean, and we had excellent maid service. I had asked for a higher floor, but we had room 301, which is right above the lobby. They said we could switch, but I decided to try it, as it would be easy to get in and out of, with no elevator delays. It was actually right across from the elevator and we NEVER heard the elevator! The view was great and only heard a litle hammering on Friday morning at 8:30. I would gladly stay in this room again! Staff was very friendly and courteous. THANK YOU TO GRAHAM at the front desk who always spoke to us by name when we came or left. Yes, the lobby is just a hallway with the checkin window right now, but for $99/night-who cares!! The location was PERFECT for shopping and we will definitely be back! Summer

Reviews.Title: “very trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: lel7176
Reviews.Content: The only thing preventing this review from being excellent is the construction. Although I did not hear any of it while in my room, the "lobby" is tiny and there is no room service. Otherwise, this was an excellent hotel. The rooms are large with a comfortable bed and large bathroom. The decor is very modern. The room was clean and the staff at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. Once the construction is done, i think this will be an outstanding hotel all-around.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: dignan0111
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Affinia Chicago became one of the highlights of our trip to Chicago. The staff were exceptionally professional, friendly, comfortably interactive, and made us feel like we were special guests. We brought our six-year-old boy with us, and the staff always remembered his name, asked him about his adventures, and had water and snacks available on our departures and returns. Our room was on the 25th floor looking south, and at night the view was mesmerizing. The room was unusual in that the entry, desk, bathroom and bar area were 3 steps above the sleeping area. It sounds strange, but ended up being a very elegant space because of it. The condition of the room was great, the bedding was luxurious to feel and aesthetically crisp. There was a brand new large flat screen television, but with the view we had out the window, we tended to to keep it turned off. The location of the Affinia could hardly be better for those wanting to stay downtown north of the river. We were 1 1/2 block from Water Tower Place, and had every convenience surrounding us. We were fortunate in that we had found a terrific rate online (I was afraid that we wouldn't be able to stay right downtown without spending a fortune.) I thought I had been very intrepid in my online sleuthing, but afterward realized that a link to the same offer was being advertized on the Affinia's own reservations web-page! For what we got, it was an absolute steal. I had paid over 30% more to stay at a different nearby hotel the night before where the room was depressing, and the staff did not make us feel comfortable. The hotel is currently under remodel, so the interim 'lobby' is a bit tight, and their restaurant and gym are not yet opened. Those are the only caveats, and little ones at that. We would love to return once the hotel is complete. If it even equals our recent experience, we will be thrilled once again.

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Milorad
Reviews.Content: The great rate and location brought this hotel to my attention. I made reservations for three couples (we were celebrating my sister-in-laws B-day). The staff couldn't have been more accommodating - someone forgot shaving cream, we needed ice, we needed directions, we needed recommmendations, we got it all! We knew the hotel was under rennovation, it didn't matter because the rooms were complete and places to eat, drink & shop are just around the corner. We all look forward to coming back when rennovations are complete if not sooner. Sonja from Crown Point, IN

Reviews.Title: “Nice location...unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: wanderer9999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Affinia Chicago. We were pleased to find that it was located just a block from the Magnificent Mile. When I originally looked at their website the pictures were beautiful and the rooms looked great. We found an inexpensive rate online and decided to go for it. I did understand that the hotel was under renovation, however, I was not prepared for what we saw when we arrived. The lobby (if you can call it that) is dismal and cramped and you must squeeze past the desk to get to the elevator. The hotel staff leaves much to be desired. They seemed to lack the confidence to even give directions or answer a simple question.
