We asked them about restaurants, directions, sight-seeing...basically the typical things you would assume the "consierge" would be able to help you with...but to no avail. We were answered with a "deer in headlights" look. One of the bellman (whom I won't name) was actually a little creepy. When I checked into the hotel he wouldn't get out of the room. He brought the bags in one by one, very slowly. He stayed for about 15 minutes talking to me about nonsense and asking me personal questions. It was very uncomfortable. While we were there for the weekend the elevator went out twice and no one seemed to know what to do or who to call. Luckily we were only on the 4th floor. The stairwell, however, looked like something in a horror film...filty, with grafitti and nasty drawings. There was a letter in the room that apologized for the construction and assured us that it would strictly be from 8am-4:30 pm, however, you can here the sound of hammers and power tools bright and early at 7 am...maybe 6:45 am if you're lucky. When we were ready to check out, the staff almost charged us with another family's room & charged our room & parking to the wrong credit card. Overall, the experience was lackluster. Cheap room...good location; terrible , unprofessional staff with bad attitudes and minimal qualifications. Thumbs down. On a positive note (ha!), Gino's East, the restaurant next door has fantastic pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: MacieS
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed at the Affinia Chicago on business just because of the reduced price during their remodel. The rooms look great, the price was the best I've seen in Chicago in ages, and the staff was very friendly. The man at the door even remembered my name on our second day. There was some construction noise in the morning, but nothing too early or too major. Very comfortable beds and Aveda bath products, which I love. Great deal for such a great location on the Magnificent Mile. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sops
Reviews.Content: Just back from a few day in Chicago and stayed at the Affinnia. what can I say. Hotel is in a perfrect location, 200m off the mag mile and close to everything. Hotel is under renovation at the moment but dont let this put you off as it does not enterfier with your stay at all. Room was on the 21st floor, large room with 2 of the most comfortable beds you could ever have, Rooms have just been done up. Bathroom very large for an american hotel, with fresh towel every day, and loads of them at that. Aveda products in the bathroom, you would only every see this in a 5 star hotel. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and if your are going to New York, stay in their sister hotel the affinnia Manhattan, great location again and the service is as good as Chicago. PS, need to get something to eat, go to the Ginos next door for good pizza and for other recommodations ask Daniel, he is excellent at his job.

Reviews.Title: “great shopping weekend”
Reviews.Author: toolshop
Reviews.Content: My daughter and 2 girls from work and myself just returned from a weekend shopping trip to Chicago. We stayed at the Affinia and we absolutely loved it!!! The room was massive with a huge bathroom with huge shower and beautiful modern fixtures!! The carpet was new and all of the bedding was new and very comfortable. The staff was fantastic!! They went above and beyond in every way!! Our rooms were ready when our bus arrived at 10:30 am Sat. It was so nice to take our bags to our room get refreshed a bit from the bus ride and then take off to the Miracle Mile just a block away!! We could shop and then bring our bags back to the room and shop some more. It is a very convenient location. I think the room renovation are done but they are still working on the front of the building so there is some congestion in the lobby at times but not a problem. We never had to wait on an elevator. They let our travel agent stay in her room until we left Sun. night at 5pm so we all were able to hang out in there for an hour before our bus arrived to take us home. We just couldn't have asked for better service and thanks to all at the Affinia for making it a great weekend getaway for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SweetpeaIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Staff were exceptionally friendly & helpful. Especially Daniel. He always remembered our names, which is a nice touch. We knew before we went that the construction work is still ongoing, but that didnt put us off, & it shouldn't put anyone off. There are plenty of excellent restraunts & breakfast places in close proximity, Rooms are extremely spacious & clean. Its a very reasonably priced hotel, which has a fantastic location. We had 1 bad experience with plumbing in the middle of the night, but we were compensated accordingly when paying the bill. Overall, despite the disruption on one of the nights, i cant fault this place

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: AimlessJ
Reviews.Content: We were a little weary of the hotel because of the renovation but the location and price we couldnt resist. We stayed at the W - lakeshore last time and I'll take the Affinia over the W anyday. Excellent customer service, beautiful rooms (& toddler friendly), perfect location (20 steps from Michigan Ave), and to top it off, it's next door to Gino's East. Best pizza in town

Reviews.Title: “good room, bad EVERYTHING else”
Reviews.Author: OKHawk
Reviews.Content: We were encouraged to stay at the Affinia as part of a group in town for a Chicago wedding. We booked our rooms 6 months in advance, with the promise of a brand-new, full service hotel in a great locaiton in Chicago. The lobby was non-existant (under construction). The front desk staff was incredibly rude and unhelpful. The hallways and elevators are small, cramped and uncomfortable. The rooms are great - great beds, great television set. NO ROOM SERVICE - the kitchen is under construction. The bottom line is that during our stay, this was NOT a full-service hotel and should not have charged what they did. We were totally disappointed, hope it will improve, but vow to never stay there and will recommend to anyone to check out one of Chicago's truly amazing hotels. It is not worth the risk with this unproven dress rehearsal.

Reviews.Title: “My new GoTo spot in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart F
Reviews.Content: I had trouble with a last minute room in Chicago when one of my colleagues suggested the Affinia based on his experiences in New York. They were under renovation, but it did not bother me one bit. I stayed in a renovated room and I like what they've done with the new decor. Bathrooms are smallish, but worked well for one person. Room was surprisingly large. Elevators and Hallways are a little tight, but expected in an old building being remodeled. Lack of restaurant or bar did not bother me as there are plenty of hotspots nearby to frequent. I got a deal, probably because of the renovations, but would stay here in the future for a little more money if I have the chance. I also plan on staying here with the wife when we take a pleasure trip to Chicago for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bev042660
Reviews.Content: Agree with poster below. Cramped lobby, but staff was excellent. Who cares about the lobby when the staff is so friendly? Daniel has been called a God...he was just so excellent. :) Very friendly, and talkative. Even remembered our names every time he saw us! The other bellhop with his was very friendly and helpful,too. All the desk staff went out of their way to meet our needs. Room was nice and comfortable. I slept on the sofa bed (my sisters got the real bed and loved it!)...not bad at all for a sofa bed. Heard sirens all night long every night, but I still slept great. Pillows too firm for our tastes, but they will soon have a pillow menu that will take care of that problem.There was some noise in the mornings...not sure if it was housekeeping cleaning or construction crew, but it was after 8 so I guess we needed to wake up anyway. :) Bottled water and snacks were a very nice perk in the lobby. Extremely clean room. Bathroom was immaculate. Extremely convenient. Highly recommend. Oh, they are expecting the hotel renovation to be complete by end of December, then they will work on restaurant, which is supposed to be killer.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkharts9
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable experience at this hotel the weekend of September 21st, 2007. We'd never been to Chicago before and we wanted a hotel that was right in the middle of the action. The Affinia's location is FANTASTIC! Right off Michigan Ave. (the Magnificent Mile as they call it) and within walking distance to so many things. We walked the majority of our trip and only took cabs late at night or to locations that were far away from where we stayed. They are doing construction at the Affinia which affects the look of the hotel on the outside as well as the lobby area (it is crammed right now) but other than that, the construction was NO bother. We never heard or saw anything. Our room had just been renovated and it was really cute. The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable!! We slept peacefully. The rooms are clean and have all the basics, including a mini fridge at no extra charge. The staff was fantastic. All of the bell hops (forgive me if that's not the right term!) were extremely friendly and helpful. They gave us directions, restaurant recommendations and were always around to hold the door for us and hail us a cab. The women who ran the front desk were just as lovely. They made all of our reservations for us, helped us find a boat tour, called places to get info and pricing, etc. They were always very eager to help and I thoroughly enjoyed talking to everyone who works at this hotel. I won't even get started on rating Chicago - it is an AMAZING city. A million things to do and it's just gorgeous! I highly recommend walking along lake Michigan in the early morning (weather permitting) as it's just beautiful. My sister and I got up at 6am just to go walking and watch the sunrise, it is only 2 blocks from the Affinia! All in all, the hotel was great. It was expensive but all hotels in that area of Chicago are. I'm sure once the renovations are finished, it will be just perfect. I highly recommend! Must sees in Chicago: The Art Institute, Millenium Park, Second City comedy club, Kingston Mines jazz club and definitely take a boat tour!! It is so much fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Comfort #1”
Reviews.Author: MichiganGloria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is AWESOME! My husband and I stayed at this hotel with 3 other couples to go the the Tigers/Sox game and do some shopping. Daniel (the doorman) is like a GOD! Not only did he immediately meet us at our cars, quickly unload all of our luggage and get us checked into our rooms he was extremely friendly and polite. He took the time to ask what we were doing in town and to make numerous suggestions that fit our itinerary. We took some of his suggestions and he was RIGHT ON! The man needs a GOLD STAR! I had a chance to speak with him while waiting for friends and he had nothing but praise for his employer (our hotel) and that was refreshing. All the staff seemed to REALLY like their jobs and that is not the norm these days! The hotel is under construction but the staff goes out of their way to accomodate you during this time. The rooms were recently remodeled and fantastic. The beds and pillows were to DIE for and there was a large flat screen TV that was easy to see from both beds. I have never had a better experience at a hotel (especially in a big city). The staff should be commended for a wonderful job. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone going to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “this will soon be a great hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: estragon
Reviews.Content: Normally, I'd start by writing about the room, but I want to say first that the staff at the Affinia are fantastic -- easily the friendliest, most helpful hotel employees I've ever encountered in a major city. I stayed for a week, and everyone -- front-desk staff, concierge, bell staff, parking valets -- was superb. The room? We stayed in a newly renovated junior suite, which was spacious and beautifully furnished: comfortable bed, good work space with ergonomic office chair, great couch, widescreen flat-panel TV that swivels easily to face the bed or the couch area, fridge (there is complimentary bottled water at the front desk), etc. I'd give is 9/10. The bathroom was a good size, with Aveda products and lots of counter space. BUT... Wireless internet is a ridiculous $12.95 a day from Wayport Internet, which provides absolutely no flexibility in pricing. Given that many hotels offer free wireless, and that there are cheaper pay-as-you-go providers out there (eg T-Mobile), this is completely unacceptable. I was fortunate to be able to pick up a free signal in my 15th-floor room -- so don't pay until you're sure there's no alternative. AND AN EVEN BIGGER BUT... The hotel is under renovation. Like the previous reviewer, we were shocked to come back to our room one evening to find that the water had been turned off for the night. My colleague who was staying on another floor was woken up at some ridiculous hour by construction noise outside his window. The temporary lobby is so cramped, it sometimes feels like a bus shelter at rush hour. I'm sure the Affinia will be very nice when it's finished, but for now, they should be offering their customers some perks to make up for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but will be better”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights we never heard any construction noise. The room was great we ask for a high room and got the 20th floor looking over several other buildings. The night view was a great city scape. The location was right in the heart of downtown. There was not much of a lobby but I am sure when they get done it will be nice. Great breakfast two blocks away at the Corner Bakery

Reviews.Title: “WOW - The Affinia Rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: JRae1203
Reviews.Content: WOW! I booked 2 rooms on Priceline and got the Affinia. This was easily the best hotel experience I have ever had. The employees were awesome. The front desk associates were happy to give us directions and make dinner reservations for us. They were friendly, helpful, and actually seemed happy to be working there! Due to construction, they didn't have a restaurant or vending, so they had free bottled water and snacks at the front desk. We were not disrupted by any of the construction that was taking place. The location was perfect! It was just steps from the Michigan Ave shopping. The beds were amazing! So comfortable! Thanks Affinia for a great weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaJones79
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about staying at this hotel after some of the reviews that were written on here but was more than pleasantly surprised when we got there. Yes there was rennovations going on but these did not affect our stay at all and we were given an apology when we arrived regarding the work that was going on. The doormen were attentive and knew our name, we were recommended where to go for breakfast and what to see around the city. There was free water and snacks provided as the restaurant was not opened. The rooms were superb, comfortable and spacious suite, clean and well presented. Yes there is the hospital near by so we heard ambulances through the night but you hear this in any city and a good pair of ear plugs soon resolved that problem. The location was awesome and meant that we were able to pretty much walk anywhere. Like others, I'm hoping that the price doesn't shoot up too much when the renovations are complete as I'd love to stay here again. Would highly highly recommned!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beds super comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jasjam12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a 3 day weekend over Labor day weekend. We were shown to our room on the 12th floor and shortly thereafter, given a call to see how we liked our room. There was a desk blocking one of the closet doors from opening which we thought sort of odd as they had just remodeled (maybe they will rethink the size of desk for that room?) Also I had asked for a room with a view, but the view was not all that great from this room. We were promptly moved to another room on the 14th floor with a better view (facing Superior St.) and full access to the closet. We soon found out the air conditioning was not working and the safe would not open. An engineer promptly came to fix both those problems and we had no more incidents the rest of the stay. The staff were very friendly and willing to help with reservations to restaurants or tours or shows. They didn't seem to have a separate concierge....the person that checked you in and out also helped with all of that. They had free bottled water and snacks available at the checkin desk. I must mention only one elevator was working and it was quite hot in the hallways and in the elevator(due to renovations being done I'm told). I was a little worried I might freak out if the elevator got stuck with a full load of people on it and the heat in there, but that never happened. The beds were super comfortable, but I am used to a softer pillow. I had read about the pillow menu and asked about trying a different pillow, but that is not available yet. We heard lots of sirens from the room and may have had a problem sleeping, but my husband had gotten a box fan from someone when the air conditioning wasn't working and we used that to drown out the outside noise which worked quite well. The bathroom was very clean and okay. It had a makeup mirror on a little counter, but no chair to sit in to be at the level to use it. Pretty much a standard bathroom, nothing fancy. The hotel renovations are not expected to be done until sometime in February 2008. I expect it will be better then and all the elevators should be working. Although I question some of the remodeling and how long it will stay nice. In our room we noticed a crooked plug in the bathroom and loose faucet handle in the shower. The caulking showed some wear for it being brand new. Surely hope not alot of stuff is being "jimmy-rigged". Overall, we were very comfortable and I am pretty picky about having nice surroundings on vacation. The maid did a fantastic job of cleaning the room and left us wine glasses for us to have a glass of wine. I must mention in our room upon entry there was a huge beautiful mirror on the wall and another huge long mirror on another wall (mirrors do help make a place feel roomier). Upon checkout, the doorman hailed us a cab ( I think he had to go to Michigan Ave. to get one....) The cabbie was supposed to take us to Union Station to catch the Amtrak train home, but dropped us off 3 blocks away which we didn't realize until we were standing there with our luggage. We had to walk 3 blocks hauling all of our luggage with us. The look on my husband's face was not good.....we were both breathing hard and sweating by time we got there. So if going to Union Station, make sure your great Chicago cabbie has you in front of Union Station on the right side to enter to your train before you let him go. The last time we left Chicago from the Talbott hotel we had our two grandkids with us. The cabbie dropped us off at Union station upon which an Amtrak porter was waiting to take us and all of our bags straight to our train. That was wonderful! Overall the stay was comfortable and the price was good. I would probably stay again, maybe after the renovations are complete and all of the elevators are working again. There were wedding parties there that were not happy at all about the elevator situation. It was during that time that we were waiting a long time as well. The elevator would finally get there and it would be full, meanwhile waiting in the hallway was HOT.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Kodachromette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my birthday weekend. Didn't realize there would be construction, but it didn't matter as the sound wasn't obtrusive and the rooms themselves seemed to have thick walls - very quiet!. The room was spacious and comfortable and the staff was probably the friendliest and most helpful I've ever encountered. Fantastic location, right off Michigan Avenue, near Water Tower Place. Definitely would stay again. They're re-doing the former Benihana restaurant next door, so there should be a nice restaurant in the future. In the meantime, there's lots of choices for dining nearby. T ry Rosebud on Rush (about 2 blocks away) for a wonderful Italian dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay despite the renovations”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaPlain
Reviews.Content: Book through travelocity. Not sure what we paid for the room for our three nights (July 19-22) given that it was combined with an airline ticket but believe we paid about $200 night (which includes taxes). Though I was offered free snacks and bottled water in lobby, I arrived to find the guest elevators not working. Had to be escorted around back through alley and through two freight elevators to our room. Opened door to renovated room with one king bed and was really impressed by the room. View was of E. Superior St. We were on 11th floor. Everything new in room--plasma TV, etc. Really impressive--especially for $200 night in a great location (right off Michigan Ave in Magnificent Mile near the Water Tower). Great Aveda products restocked daily by maid in bathroom. There was a fridge for our use as well in the room. Also a Clock/radio/CD player (though housekeeping should check daily to make sure alarms are turned off for next guests). Front desk staff was great throughout. Small complaints: Could hear loud people in hall way (small surprise--expected that the renovation would have addressed wall/door soundproofing) Of the renovations, only heard 5 minutes of drilling on Friday morning. There was no fan in the bathroom. Their website doesn't have directions for taking public transportation to/from the airport. I e-mailed their GM--Tom Brady--who has responded to complaints here on Trip Advisor, However, he never responded to my e-mail sent in advance of my trip. I am leaving the best for last: The bellman Daniel. He was always around to offer assistance such as a cab. On the day of check out, we left our bags with Daniel and told him that we would be returning "around 3:00-3:15 p.m." to get our bags and take a taxi to O'Hare. We arrived at hotel at 3:15 to find our bags already in the trunk of a taxi that was waiting for us.to take us to the airport. Its one the reasons why we would not hesitate to return (though I expect the rates to jump significantly given location and quality)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lawson49
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late June while the hotel was undergoing renovations in some of the public rooms. The staff were excellent and the suite was very comfortable,quiet and had a view over East Superior street. There was one occasion when work started early but when I mentioned this the workmen were stopped and it didn't happen again. This hotel is in a prime location for shops, restaurants and the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: srrmsu
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Affinia Hotel in downtown Chicago, and had a great experience. Everything we asked for was accomodated. We requested early check-in, and late check-out. There were free snacks and water available in the Lobby at all times. The staff was always so friendly and helpful and wanted to bend over backwards to help us out with anything we requested. We had an older room on the 27th floor, but it was still very nice. They advised that the hotel is under construction and is being remodeled, but we never heard any construction noise. The best part about this hotel was the location, a block off of Michigan Avenue. I had no complaints and would definitely go back. Unfortunately I think the great rate we got was due to the construction and will probably increase once this construction is finished. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Critical Skeptic Turned Affinia Believer”
Reviews.Author: oohby
Reviews.Content: I was SOOOO hoping this is the type of review I could write!!! Thanks to the staff at the Affinia, I can give them FIVE STARS. We stayed just this past weekend, Friday June 8-10. Checklist: Early check in request: accommodated Late check out: accommodated Two rooms close together: accommodated Store luggage after check out: accommodated Information about area attractions: accommodated Extra service to room: accommodated speedily Friendliness of all staff: accommodated ***** From the time the Affinia was assigned to us by Priceline, I had been nervous -- not because I knew anything of the Affinia personally but quite the contrary -- I'd never been to the Chicago or the older hotel being renovated; tripadvisor.com reviews; etc. No facility is going to be perfect regardless of whether it is newly-built, newly-renovated, well maintained -- nothing is going to be 100% perfect. While the newly-renovated rooms assigned to my party (two rooms) were well appointed, very nicely done (in my opinion) and the bed was so comfortable, I simply did not want to get up, what makes a stay perfect is the friendliness and willingness of a staff who will treat each and every patron as if they are happy to see you; happy to assist in any way possible, and the little touches that don't seem to be important but sure are noticed when done for you. My sister, niece, her two children and my step-daughter to be certainly experienced the exquisite care of the Affinia staff. From the bell staff , front office staff, and chef to the general manager, we couldn't have been treated better! After having mentioning the fact that we were going to be in Chicago to celebrate the birthdays of our three young girls at the American Girl Place, the Affinia staff went ABOVE and BEYOND to make sure our girls were treat especially well -- and even their dolls. They were so happy, and you know how that affects us adults!! Quentin, especially, and Daniel the bell staff treated us well, and remembered the girls' names; front desk staff were very helpful; Mr. Foley (front office manager) introduced himself upon check in. Chef Bell went over the top with her tasty design -- so much so, the girls wanted to save them and take them home, they were so pretty! The housekeeping staff with beds turned down, water at our bedsides -- touches that go a long way after a long day of being out on the town. My room was perfectly comfortable regarding air conditioning, while my nieceâ€™s room set at the same temp was quite a bit warmer -- maintenance came in, fixed the problem, and we were left a message to that effect and if there were any problems, to please let the front desk know. Could there still be improvements? Sure â€“ the normal stuff: more water pressure for the shower, vents in bathroom so not so steam -- one light not working on headboard lamp (which are very nice, by the way) ... but these things will be noted, fixed, improved, Iâ€™m sure. While attention to outward appearances, maintenance and cleanliness of the facility are important to any property, more important than whether a mirror is at a proper height, the decor is not current or quality toiletries are supplied (all of which were not an issue at the Affinia as far as I could tell) are staff courteousness, attentiveness, eagerness -- these things are definitely present at the Affinia. MOST IMPORTANTLY: This shows that reviews are read, guests' comments are taken seriously and the Affinia is striving to take into consideration the needs as well as the desires of its guests. As long as it continues to care what guests are saying and staff are making us feel at home, I am sold on the Affinia! It is close to everything you want to experience while in Chicago, just one block east of Michigan Avenue (Magnificent Mile). When I'm in Chicago again, I'll be back to stay at the Affinia. My Advice: Book a stay at the Affinia if you find yourself heading to Chicago. If you've been reading past tripadvisor.com reviews, I know you will be overwhelmingly surprised by the changes taking place -- not just in the facilities themselves, but the transformation of the staff (at least based on past reviews). Thanks to all of the Staff at the AFFINIA CHICAGO for making our stay one that makes us ready to visit Chicago again soon!! Judy T.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Experience”
Reviews.Author: totallytravel
Reviews.Content: Despite the negative reviews of this hotel, I would absolutely stay there again - even if the construction didn't get completed. Everyone was pleasant and helpful - the front desk and luggage handling. The room we had, on the 27th floor, smelled fresh, had a great view, and was clean and spacious. Yes, it was old and needed updating - that's what the hotel is in the process of doing. We did not hear any construction noise at all. The beds were some of the most comfortable we have ever slept in. There were snacks and water at the front desk every day - for free. Plenty of great places to eat nearby; we don't use room service anyway. Gino's East, right next door, had terrible service - we left after 15 minutes without getting waited on. Stick with West Egg, the Corner Bakery, and the Elephant pub. This hotel has the greatest location, too. Just off Michigan Avenue, so it's quiet yet so close to everything! I travel for pleasure at least once a month and only stay at top-notch places. Don't hesitate to stay at the Affinia. You won't regret your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: gobob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend and were very happy with every aspect of our stay, despite some of the reviews we had read prior to the trip. I had read a New York Times article a few months ago about the Affinia chain's management making personal responses to negative comments, and it seems as if they have made several adjustments as a result of the comments here. The door staff were exceedingly nice and conversational, and the front desk personnel were equally accomodating. They offered us water and snacks at check-in, and kept the courtesy baskets stocked full of each throughout the weekend. Although no renovated rooms were available for the weekend, there was also no sign of construction during our stay and our "non-renovated" room was actually very nice. The bathroom was clean and large, and the bed was quite comfortable. Drawbacks were the slow elevators and the loud air conditioners. However, the price, cleanliness, location (one block off Mich. Ave.; three blocks to the State Streer Red Line) and staff make this a great value.

Reviews.Title: “A pathetic excuse for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: HOTELIE81
Reviews.Content: Setting expectations is everything. I made a res on Expedia for a hotel with a pretty good brand and a great location, for $264 how bad could it be? Really bad. The listing on Expedia failed to mention that the hotel is under renovation and that there is no f&b...When I was so informed at check in I was told that there was a big collection of menus in the room from nearby spots that would deliver. There were two dog eared pizza menus but no matter, lots of nice places nearby. Did I mention that they are coring concrete in the building? This is what God's own root canal sounds like, but they stopped by 5pm so no worries. In the morning it was pouring rain, even at the humblest Quality Inn the good folks have a tray of pastries and a thermos of coffee. Not here, and although they are within blocks of more shops selling umbrellas than anywhere else in the civilized world (Michigan Avenue) there was not a single umbrella available for a guest to walk up the street to the Red Roof to grab a cup of coffee. What else? It took three calls to Wayport to get the internet working, the mirror in the bathroom is way too low for six footers. I booked (and paid for) a studio suite and they put me iin a regular room. The television cannot be comfortably viewed from the bed. But the worst thing is they don't care. There is just an utter disregard for customer service. The valet parker was nice but for $40 I guess he should be. I should have slept in the car! If management is reading this and wants to make sure this is not a fake, my name is Mark E. and I stayed on April 24. You can figure out how to get in touch with me if you like.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: NDReece
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I have stayed at other Affinia properties and always had a pleasant experience. When I saw that the Fitzpatrick was being converted to an Affinia I was excited, as we often travel to Chicago, our former home. While I don't remember the specific dates I do know that it was sometime in January. We were in town for the weekend and thought we would give the Affinia a try. Great location! After checking into our suite we noticed that the heat wasn't working. In fact, cold air was being blown out. When we left to go shopping I notified the front desk of the problem. They said that it would be fixed right away. Fast forward 2.5 hours. I came back from shopping and went up to my room, only to find that the "heater" was still blowing cold air. I went down to the front desk and was told that it would be fixed right away. The front desk appeared put out by my request. I killed some time in the Irish bar in the basement (which is great) and went up to the room an hour later. The heat was finally fixed. The next morning I was awaken by the sound of dripping in the bathroom. I went to check and noticed that the ceiling was leaking. Our entire counter was soaked, along with all of our towels and toiletries. I called down and they had someone come up to fix the problem. At the time of checkout there were no apologies for the inconveniences that we had to deal with. If I weren't a laid back person I probably would have been pretty upset. Later I sent an email to the management just to let them know of our dissatisfaction. I received a response several days later saying, essentially, sorry. I am not sure what I expected, but I guess I was hoping for more. I have no intention of returning to the Affinia, which is a shame because I had good experiences with the chain previously.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not what it's been in the past”
Reviews.Author: thej
Reviews.Content: This property was formerly the Fitzpatrick. I've been staying at this hotel for years. It has always been my favorite Chicago hotel through its various name changes. The only reason I would stay at other hotels would have been because this hotel was booked. Now, in fairness, the hotel is undergoing construction/upgrading. But all that work is being done in areas other than the lobby and guestrooms. I stayed one night, April 11. The reception staff was pleasant, but the doormen were apathetic and uninterested. In fact, I was not even sure they were hotel employees by their attitude or attire. I did not see them greet anyone. I did not see them rushing to help with luggage or cabs. Of course, I didn't see many other guests when I was there. I would not say anyone went out of their way to make me feel welcome. There was NO food service in the hotel. Even the pub/lounge was closed. I saw very few other guests and almost felt like I had the hotel to myself. My room, though large, and with the same decor as the last time I was there at the Fitzpatrick, was a little worse for the wear. It is as if the guestrooms have been let slide a little while attention is elsewhere in the project. On the positive side, Gino's East Pizza has returned to their former location next to the hotel. Yay! The hotel is steps away from the best part of Michigan Avenue. I'm hopeful that once the "dust has settled" this will once again be just a fabulous place to stay. UNTIL then, be advised your experience may be a little unusual.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: firsedge
Reviews.Content: Booked this at $105 per night (for suite) with Travelzoo offer. Stayed two nights. Great location. They are in the middle of doing a lot of renovation and the plans look good when it will be finished. Were on the 24th floor so above the major work so no noise heard. Suite was nicely decorated. Bathroom is Tiny and the light switches were in the hall which was a nuicance as had to remember to turn them on before going in. Bedroom is off the "lounge" but it is not a separate room so no door. Staff were pleasant and helpful, especially the doormen, always welcoming. This is now a 100% no smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: iremor
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Affinia for 9 nights and we were upgraded to a suite. very spacious with great bathroom and amazingly comfortable bed. Only downside was drink facilities were a perculator, two cups and 2 old packets of coffee. Hotel is undergoing a major refit but we were not disturbed by this at all, and I was in early a couple of afternoons. There are no food or bar facilities at the moment due to refit but would recommend the corner bakery two blocks down St Clair Street right opposite the front entrance of hotel and also a great Italian restaurant a further block down for an evening meal. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and I would love to stay at the Affinia again. But suspect it will be much more expensive when the refit is finished in the autumn. In a great location for shops on Michigan Ave and Hancock tower. Also many buses run along Michigan Avenue and I travelled to all the tourist sites on Chicago buses from there. Great city.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, very good... with some very bad.”
Reviews.Author: LexxC
Reviews.Content: I will start out by saying that for the most part, the staff was excellent. I traveled with my father who is in a wheelchair and his caregiver. While we couldn't get rooms right next to eachother, (partially because the room across from his room was one of the penthouse suites,) they were able to put me in a room that was just one floor beneath. To make up for us not having rooms next to eachother, they gave me what I have to think is one of the best views you can find in downtown Chicago. You can see all the way down to Prudential II, not to mention the lovely buildings in the immediate area. I'll start with my room: the bed was unbelieveable, one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in in my life. There was a nice reading light in the massively vaulted ceiling above the bed with controls just next to the bed. The bathroom was fantastic. Beautiful granite counters with nice fixtures and a lovely hanging wall mirror. Aveda products. The shower, however, was my favorite part. It was HUGE, great pressure - really, really a pleasure. The brookstone cd player/stereo system was a nice touch. Now for the "handicapped accessible" room: While the handicapped accessible room itself was rather nice and the bathroom was very convenient and nicely decorated, getting to it was very difficult. There is, apparently, only one handicapped accessible room in the entire hotel. It's not placed very well, either. It's on the penthouse floor of the building, and in order to reach pretty much all the suites on the floor from the normal elevator, you must climb STAIRS. I don't know who the genius was who thought "hey, why don't we put the handicapped accessible room there?" But it doesnt seem like a very good move to me. So, in order for wheelchair bound guests to reach the room, they must go up the normal elevator to the seventh floor, walk through the kitchen and take the FREIGHT/ROOM SERVICE/GARBAGE elevator up to the room! I might mention that this elevator is.. well.. disgusting, worn down and smells horrible, and the elevator moves very, very slowly. Also, when garbage is being loaded, the staff has a tendancy to stop the elevator on whatever floor they're loading/unloading onto, so at bad times, it can take AGES for the elevator to come. Again, the room was nice, but the way to get to the room is probably the worst design for a disabled person POSSIBLE. Now, despite that, the staff, the fact that the rooms were so comfortable and the excellent location actually made the stay rather nice. Until a couple weeks later. My major warning about this hotel: DO NOT TRUST THE VALET!!! A few weeks after my stay at the affinia, I recieved a $90 parking ticket in the mail from the night I checked in, about an hour after I had given my car to the valet. Apparently, it had been parked in a taxi stand in front of the merchantile exchange, which is pretty much nowhere near the hotel. What the valet was doing with my car parking it in a taxi stand a ways away from the hotel, I do not know. The valet prices alone are already pretty outrageous, and then a $90 ticket on top of it? Come on. I've tried to contact the hotel's manager numerous times since I recieved that ticket and have recieved absolutely no response whatsoever. Unfortunately, it seems like the front office is nowhere as competent as the desk, room service and cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for First Time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: msu17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a studio suite at the Affinia through TravelZoo for only $105 a night. Given the great deal, we were impressed with the overall quality of this hotel. The lobby is nice as is the pub down the stairs. It is obvious, however, that the hotel is just a little aged. While our room was spacious and comfortable, the bathroom was too small and there was a little wear on the wallpaper. The carpet was a little thin also. The view was nice and we weren't bothered by the noise from the 23rd floor. We loved the courtesy and efficiency of the staff. The bellman remembered our names throughout our stay and he was quick to offer advice about places to visit. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it, but the hotel should be much better after the renovations that are planned over the next year. The location was great - next door to Gino's East Pizza and Neiman Marcus - very close to the Mag Mile. We would return only if we found a discount similar to the TravelZoo deal. Otherwise we would probably look elsewhere for a different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tldrn93
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel. Very clean rooms and the beds were very comfortable! Very luxurious bedding and towels. The entire staff was always very friendly and helpful. Great location. Less than a block to the Magnificent Mile, 3 blocks to the Hancock tower and Water Tower place. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: Hollyberry78
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, about a block from Michigan Ave. and two blocks from Water Tower Place and John Hancock Tower. Beautiful hotel, felt very luxurious and high-class for being a moderate priced hotel. Staff was excellent -- friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Affordable, the best of both worlds!”
Reviews.Author: leepoffaith
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Affinia during the weekend of January 12th and January 13th. This was a very wonderful hotel. The front desk staff was wonderful and always curtious and polite. Just about everytime I either left the hotel or came into the hotel the front desk called me by name and even remembered where I was coming from!! This may be a bit different then the experience others had, but I stayed in the Penthouse Suite. It was quite nice and had everything one would need for a great stay. As you can see from the pictures I had a private balcony, livingroom, very large bathroom with both soaking tub and 2 person shower and a nice sized bedroom with king sized bed. The views were breathtaking and I purposly left all the blinds open at night so I could sleep under the city lights. Now, don't get me wrong, some of the furnishings were a bit outdated and not brand new, but I really didn't care much about that. The service and location make up for that easily! And that brings me to my next point about this hotel. The LOCATION! You are one block off of Michigan ave right next to Nordstrom. It is a short walk to Water Tower Place and the Chicago River. This hotel was everything I expected and more! If you are thinking whether or not to stay at this hotel I would highly advise you trying it out. Let me point out one thing though. This isn't a super fancy dancy hotel, but you aren't paying through the nose for a room either. If you are going downtown and want to stay off the strip for a reasonable price, this hotel is for you! The service will be great and the room will suit your needs fine.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Bad and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: World_Hiker_Dallas
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the excellent Affinia chain in NY, I had very high expectations. When I saw the Trip Advisor rating, I immediately booked. What a huge disappointment: -- The quality Simmons pillow top mattress is covered with very cheap, foam pillows -- the kind they sell in the store for $4. You cannot sleep on these -- The windows are so thin, you can hear the buzzing from walk/don't walk sign on Superior below. -- The walls are so thin that when my neighbor smoked, I was awaken around midnight, my room engulfed in smoke odor. A call downstairs yielded no results -- There are nice furnishings but many are chipped showing bare wood; the desk chair was full of loose threads -- The water flow is very weak, but the towels are nice -- There are unpainted floorboards, the kind you find in Day's Inn -- They charge for internet service The tiny lobby has materials and pictures of what the hotel will eventually look like. The sign outside is also a banner. Having stayed all over the U.S., you are better off at Red Roof -- this is really an embarassment for the Affinia chain. Wait until they complete the renovations in 2008. I did supply this feedback at my checkout and the front desk apologized by shaking my hand. Good heart, but the problems are not fixable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: WITravelerAppleton
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel so far in Chicago. The room was spacious and inviting. There was plenty of seating and the "canopy" over the bed made it very cozy. There was actually a refrigerator that you could use (no mini-bar) which is exceedingly rare. To top it off, they provide Aveda products! I paid only $89/night, so that just made our experience even better. I like to stay in all different places in Chicago, but I'll probably keep coming back here now.

Reviews.Title: “Affinia, a Gem...”
Reviews.Author: lordhavemercy
Reviews.Content: ...I'm at the Affinia right now, using their excellent Wi-Fi service. Lovely room on the 18th floor, with a view of the Sears' Tower. We have a Jr. Suite. Our accommodations are on 2 levels-entering into a small foyer which overlooks the Living Room area-2 steps down. Queen-size sleeper sofa (very comfortable, soft sheets/blankets) The entire suite is very roomy with 2 closets and a "storage-area" off the foyer. The King bed is wonderfully cushy with silky-soft sheets. From the bedroom you look up to the coffee bar/refrigerator area and into the generously sized bathroom. Aveda products are provided as a courtesy. We have found the staff the be very courteous and helpful. Right next door to the Affinia, is the Benihana restaurant. Across the street is Gino's East and just down the block is the Rosebud, on Rush. Excellent shopping location with Neiman Marcus right next door..... Tiffany's just down the street. I believe that we will be back....!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Affinia was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: teenage_trip_planner
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, wonderful rooms, great beds, prime location. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs work, homeless near, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Indyonthemove
Reviews.Content: I've been here for 4 days. Great location right off of miracle mile, near all major hotels, best shopping and theatres. Rooms very large. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful, and respond immediately. Problems: there frequently are homeless people (even during daylight) on Superior between St. Clair and Michigan Avenue (the main route you walk for or all activities, and just about everything is in walking distance from here). At night, the street on the north side of Superior is dark, and it usually smells strongly of several unpleasant odors. The street people do not approach you, although they may stare as you go by. Usually 2 or more along the way, where they sleep on the window sills of Neiman Marcus. I would not think a woman would feel safe by herself. (I am from a large city and do not have a street people phobia.) There are homeless up and down Michigan Street, but this is different as it's a lonely stretch and no open business is along either side of the street. The entire hotel needs a lot of cosmetic work, and apparently will soon undergo a major renovation. For now, expect two extremely small, warm, slow elevators with long waits serving 17 floors and warm, cramped hallways! All the walls throughout the hotel need painting, and the wallpaper is peeling in places. In the room, several electrical outlets were hanging out of the connection, the carpets were stained, the bathrooms needed new grout (some mold visible), the TV is very small (16 Inch?) and the windows very, very dirty. You won't get your room serviced unless you ask for it, sometimes more than once. The "pub " downstairs is run down, dark and kind of creepy. Food and room service are very expensive, as is parking ($34/day public and $38/day valet). On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable, there was ample comfortable furniture in the sitting area, plenty of space and a decent view as the hotels spans St. Clair street toward the north and south. You can see a sliver of Lake Michigan. Pool small, but clean. All in all, it was clean and quiet and provides lots of space for sitting around in the room, but I think it is overpriced, and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth your visit”
Reviews.Author: Sailguy
Reviews.Content: As many have stated, the location is ideal for shopping along Chicago's Magnificent Mile on Michigan Avenue. Pool on the roof, while amusingly small, has great views, was clean and easily accessible. The hotel has a European feel in that it's compact, yet highly functional. Lobby elevators are tiny and didn't seem to run fast enough so waiting with large bags and then cramming yourself into them was, at times, annoying. We booked our reservation the same day and ended up with a suite and it was clean with ample room. We wanted a no smoking floor, but booking so late didn't have the option. However, it wasn't that bad with no real appreciable smell in the room. A/C worked well--it was close to a 100 degrees when we checked in, though, there was a minor leak from it that had soiled the carpet. The suite was so large it didn't really matter to us that much, to be honest. Room service was fast, food was great and person was courteous. All in all, recommended for its great location to all the sites and attractions of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Dont' bother reserving a room”
Reviews.Author: EchoParkGal
Reviews.Content: I am a long-time fan of Affinia New York hotels. I wanted to try their new Chicago property. After reading the mostly positive reviews, I booked a junior suite for $389. I asked for a guarantee that I would be put into a renovated room as the description of the unrenovated rooms sounded terrible. The main reservation line could not accomodate the request, but put me through to the Chicago office. I was greeted -- then put on hold for almost 15-minutes. I gave up. I tried to go through the main reservation line again and was told that there was no way I could guarantee a renovated room. They put me through (again) to Chicago. The Chicago person repeated that they cannot guarantee a renovated room. Bad marks for treating a loyal guest so shabbily, for the poor phone service, and for the attempt to charge almost $400 for a sub-standard room. I am re-thinking staying at their New York faciities based upon this experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay with One Exception”
Reviews.Author: ohzonejoe
Reviews.Content: Our company hosted a business meeting at the Affinia, requiring participant to stay there. While its an older hotel, the room was comfortable, clean and quiet. Lighting was adequate. Every staff member I spoke to was friendly and helpful. The only drawback was that there was no internet service unless you wanted to use the room phone for dial-up. Not even a business center. The front desk directed me to an internet cafe about 4 blocks south. If you don't mind that one thing, its a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Affinia for six nights in early May. It is ideally located just a block away from N Michigan. Easy walking distance to sights, restaurants and shopping. Our room (a queen deluxe suite) was clean and very well maintained - not a stain, tear or flaking paint in evidence anywhere! There are only 8 rooms on each floor so it was very quiet as there is not much corridor traffic. The between-room soundproofing was excellent - we never heard our neoghbours. The elevators are quiet, we were close to them and never heard a thing. The room was large with a queen bed, a sofa(bed), an arm chair, coffee table, table & chairs, 3 phones and 2 TVs. There is a small fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom while not particularly large was clean, well laid out and had a decent shower. Room service was quick and the food very good. There are no ice machines but room service bring the ice up very quickly which was fine. The staff were very helpful and friendly, particularly Daniel the doorman. Fitzers, the Irish bar in the basement, sells a decent pint of Guinness :-) We had only one problem, it was quite a large problem and was the first thing that happened to us when we arrived - not a good introduction. They tried to put us in a standard room rather than the king suite that we booked 4 months previously. The assistant manager was very apologetic and managed to get us in a queen suite instead as all the kings were taken. He arranged for a free breakfast for us and a reduction in the rate. He was unable to explain it other than it was a mistake) but did his best to correct it. On the whole you get value for money, a quiet stay, a decent room and helpful staff so I would recommend the Affinia - if you book online I would phone/email them direct just before you go just to make sure that everything is okay. I would have given them 5 stars if it weren't for the initial room problem. In the future the hotel will apparently be undergoing refurbishment to bring it into line with the Affinia brand so that might be worth checking up on as well!

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Fitzpatrick!”
Reviews.Author: sunwise
Reviews.Content: I was at the Fitzpatrick for only one night in March 2006 on business, but I wished I could've stayed longer (and I wish my husband was with me)! Everything about the hotel was fantastic. The staff was wonderful--while checking in they bumped me up to a suite to keep me in a non-smoking room. That was an unexpected surprise, and I did appreciate it. The room was beautiful, spacious, and very clean. The bed and pillows were soft and comfortable, and I got a better night's sleep than I normally get in hotels. There was a TV in both the living room and bedroom, and there was also a very nice radio in the living room. No street noise or hallway noise bothered me, even though I was right by the elevator. And the bathroom was beautiful, although a bit small. (However, I saw my friend's room--which was a regular room--and her bathroom was much larger due to the different layout of the room.) Another nice thing for a rainy night in Chicago--they provided umbrellas in each room for the guests to use! The location of this hotel is also hard to beat. We were about a block off of Michigan Avenue, and a couple of blocks from the lake. Also walking distance to Navy Pier. A red line L station is about 4 blocks away--I used the L to get me to O'Hare when I had to leave. Lots of great retaurants and shopping in the area--I wish I could've stayed longer to experience it all. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, but hopefully not for only one night and hopefully not by myself!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fitzpatrick”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a father/daughter weekend (teen concert at the Aragon Ballroom). I expected a fair deal based on TripAdvisor reviews I had read. What I got was an excellent deal: for $134 per night I received friendly, competent service; a comfortable room (carpets were worn but not threadbare like some of the reviews made it seem); great location on the Magnificent Mile; and a terrific pub downstairs -- what pubs are supposed to be: a place for families to enjoy warm company, good hearty food, and for the adults, delicious beer. My only issue was during the first night there, a bunch of 20-somethings arrived in their room next door to mine at 4:30 AM and were very obnoxious, but the hotel staff quieted them within 10 minutes of my complaint call. I'll eagerly book another stay at the Hotel Fitzpatrick next time I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: celticmoon
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Chicago staying 5 nights at the Fitzpatrick Hotel. I have pros and cons regarding our stay. Cons - dirty grey caulking around the tub and floor area around the toilets. The king suite had a dirty grey looking carpet, but I think it is supposed to be beige, anyway dirty beige. They try to decorate the lobby now with Christmas decorations which is fine, but overall small and starting to look tired. I always bring lysol wipes to wipe down door knobs, taps, toilet handle, phones etc. (If you watch Dateline at all, you will understand why you should do this when staying at hotels). The wipes came up grey. The bathroom door had many fingerprints on it, and the closet door had something spilled down it and was left to dry on its own. I went downstairs to the bar to buy bottled water, as the bar fridge is completely empty...nothing, and the charge was $6.00 for 1 small bottle of sparkling water and a regular bottle of mineral water. We were too tired to go somewhere else as it was late. Pros - location, great staff, nice pub type bar downstairs, comfortable bed and OK breakfasts. The breakfast could have more fresh cut up fruit, but this is minor. Staff helpful arranging private car for us on one of our outings. Terrific restaurant Tru just down the street, short walk. I see there will be construction going on, right beside the hotel during the next few months, so I would enquire about this before booking.

Reviews.Title: “What a depressing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Metatron
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights last week. The hotel is just screaming out for refurbishment. The suites are currently being sold to investors here in Ireland and perhaps the money generated from the sales will go towards a good clean up. The carpets in the reception area and our room were threadbare, badly stained and very, very shabby. The comforter on the bed had definitly seen better days - I would even question letting my dogs sleep on it. There were suspect stains and 'crusty' attachments in places - Awful! The room itself was very dark - although it was only a junior suite located at the back of the hotel. The windows were absolutely filthy. We found the room to be very depressing and it reminded us of a shabby country house of the 'olde Ireland' era of about 50 years ago - shabby, crumpled & best forgotten. No doubt from the other reviews many disagree but this was our experience. We had booked the hotel because we had held our wedding reception in Fitzpatricks Castle Hotel in Dublin a number of years ago - however this branch of the hotel was a very sad disappointment in comparison. On the plus side the location was excellent, the bathroom was small but clean and the towels were nice. The bar was also nicely decorated and had a nice atmosphere. Personally I can only say that I would not stay in this Hotel again, even if the room was for free.

Reviews.Title: “Had to make a fuss to get the correct rooms”
Reviews.Author: AJMGlasgowScotland
Reviews.Content: Despite paying for 2 non-smoking rooms in advance they had sold our rooms and only gave us non-smoking rooms when we made a fuss. Avoid room 2807 it is beside some kind of generator. The looby looks rather tired. Otherwise excellent location, friendly staff and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service at the Fitzpatrick”
Reviews.Author: lktraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Fitzpatrick Hotel while attending a weekend conference. I found the room spacious and soothingly decorated and the room service quick and pleasant. Little touches of Irish hospitality infused throughout the hotel are especially sweet (like a direct dial button to Aer Lingus on the phone). What really put the hotel above average, though, was the level of service and feeling of welcome that I received from all the staff. I received a personal note of welcome, a box of truffles, free tea and coffee delivered to me just for the asking and every staff member that I came across said hello and welcome and asked how my stay was going. I felt more like a guest in someone's home or a bed and breakfast than a guest in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago is My Kind of Town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were just in Chicago this past weekend and what a wonderful time did we have in the city as well as at the Fitzpatrick Hotel. The hotel was recommended by a friend of mine and boy was he right about the hotel. Not your typical hotel room with its canopy bedding and European flare to the spacious room. My wife just loved the hotel and the children loved to hear the Irish accents. Location is very ideal if you are looking to stay close the Michigan Avenue. As I received the recommendation to stay at the Fitzpatrick, I am doing the same to all of you who read this review!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I stayed four days at the Fitzpatrick in August. We arrived at the hotel on Friday at noon, and were taken straight to our room, despite the posted 4:00 check-in. The staff was very friendly and answered all of our questions about transportation, activities and shopping. The hotel location is perfect! You are right off the Magnificent Mile, across the street and around the corner from American Girl Place, and right next door to the hotel is a fantastic pizza place. We could even see the fireworks show at the Navy Pier from our hotel window. We felt safe the entire time and didn't return to our hotel until after dark a couple of nights. No problems at all. Our room was beautiful and spacious. There are robes and slippers for your personal use during your stay. The bedroom and living room are divided by a "bookshelf" wall (no door), with t.v.s on both sides. We were on the 28th floor (the 29th floor is the pool and meeting rooms), therefore our room had an elevated ceiling, which made it feel even more spacious. I would highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not set me on fire, service was ok some times a little slow. I have stayed in better hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a much-needed vacation to Chicago. We stayed at the Fitzpatrick Hotel and overall had a good experience there. Three of the great things about this hotel include location, comfort and service. This hotel is located one block off the Mag Mile and is right in the center of the shopping district, convenient access to both ends is within walking distance. The room was spacious and comfortable, bed was a dream. I honestly don't think I've ever had a better night's sleep in a hotel. No noises from other rooms so it must be well insulated. The hotel staff was ready and able to meet our needs, beginning with the bell hops-great guys! Very helpful. The down side of our stay would involve 2 things. We are American and weren't familiar with the Irish way. We ordered room service one morning and found some kind of white pepper served, which tasted wierd to us. Also, how can you not have grape or strawberry jam? Orange marmelade and raspberry jam might be okay for adults, but not my kids!! The other issue was the way the room was set up. We selected a Queen suite. The virtual tour online is somewhat deceiving. On the web it looks as though the bedroom area is separate from the living room, but beware, it is all one room. If you want any privacy, don't go that route. I saw someone else's post on Trip Advisor, but took the virtual tour and thought that person was just picky. Believe me, she was right! The TV just swivels from one area to the other, so you're all there in the same room. We made do, but it would have been nice to have some privacy. Overall, we had a good experience at the Fitzpatrick. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a recent vacation to Chicago, we stayed at the Fitzpatrick Hotel. After bringing the family down to Chicago for the past 4 years, we were looking for something different and boy did we do just that. Besides the wonderful location this hotel has such nice rooms to offer! My wife was taken back by the decor of the rooms and how spacious they are. We walked to all of our favorite stores and restaurants and did not need to drive at all. My only concern would be the cost to valet park the car. But as the front desk agent advised us; it is not the hotel that controls the rates. Once again we had a wonderful trip to Chicago and thanks to Trip Advisor, we were able to undiscover a new hotel for us to use!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and spacious!”
Reviews.Author: keeper0430
Reviews.Content: Most hotel rooms in cities that I travel are very cramped. I had heard and read good things about the Fitzpatrick, so I jumped at a good online deal. I ended up staying in a queen suite for two nights and it was very nice. Clean, very quiet and lots of room. Actually, more room than I certainly needed, but was a very refreshing change! Beds were very comfortable. I guess the only things to note (and I wouldn't call them negatives) was the lack of AC in the elevators (was 93 degrees this past weekend) and the bathrooms are a little small. However, if you know this going into it (and I had read other reviews, so I did) this shouldn't affect your overall stay in the least bit. The staff was pleasant and, overall, the stay was great! I would definnitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for your Chicago Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I too enjoy the reviews from Tripadvisor as I plan vacations to new destination. I again used this site in the planning of our trip to Chicago for the 4th of July. I must say, that one of the main reasons that I booked this hotel was because It was number six on the list. After visiting the hotel... Im not sure how it got such a good rating.... I would classify this hotel as a solid 3 1/2 star. The lobby was very small and unimpressive. I had reserved a room with a King bed.... but upon arrival, was forced into one with a queen bed. No big deal. The room had A/C but it was limited in how low you could turn it down. I like it cold, so I had to removed the restrictive device. No problem... The room was VERY large. The bed was comfy. and the bathroom was small... But all in all, it was very confortable. The location is outstanding!!!! It is in a great spot, one block from North Michigan Ave. You can walk to many attractions, catch a quick cab or jump on the subway a few blocks away. It is a great spot for shopping or hitting the bars on Rush Street. I would stay here again. I think that if I was traveling with a family the extra room would be perfect. Never intracted with staff so I have no comments....

Reviews.Title: “Great American Girl Package”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter for a girl's weekend at the Fitzpatrick. We loved our "princess suite" complete with doll bed, doll bathrobe, doll slippers, and doll hairwrap. The staff was excellent and took good care of us. I would stay here again on my next trip to Chicago...with or without the doll!

Reviews.Title: “Fitzpatrick could be much better”
Reviews.Author: purplegirl
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed in the outward appearance of the hotel. The picture on the website made it appear more grand. The lobby was unremarkable and the furniture had seen much much better days. There were two people only at the small front desk and they seeemed rather stressed as the phones were ringing non-stop. The room was huge, undoutedly must be one of the largest rooms in Downtown. I liked the layout. You opened the door into a waiting/foyer area, then stepped down into the living area. To the right was the bedroom and then bathroom and then another area to do whatever. The living room was spartanly furnished -- however it had its own smaLL television housed in a display unit. The carpet was worn -- apparently from too much cleaning, which in itself is not too much of bad thing. The spread had two cigarette burns in it, yuck. For such a huge room, the bathroom is rather small and not modern. All in all, with updating and an eclectic infusion, these rooms could become one of the best in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Chicagos best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: DublinDublinDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fitzpatrick hotel in June of this year. We got a very warm Irish welcome when we arrived which lasted throughout our entire stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a good mix of Irish and American staff which was great. The hotels rooms are larger than what one would expect for a downtown hotel in the heart of the city which was a pleasant surprise. Fitzers bar in the basement was excellent - the food is great and the craic is mighty!! The hotel is within minutes walk of all the major shopping streets, restaurants, tourist destinations etc. I would highly recommend the Fitzpatrick hotel to both the leisure and business customer!

Reviews.Title: “Low Key Boutique Style”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTraveler43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fitzpatrick for two nights in a one bedroom suite. Our daughter slept on the sleeper sofa. Despite a few disappointments, we enjoyed the low key atmopshere and the location. It was great to avoid the crowds and traffic found near the larger hotels. This hotel is easy to reach by car (valet parking!), but everything is within walking distance after that. There are good restaurants in the neighborhood (see below), including down St. Clair street a classic diner for breakfast or a bakery cafe with lots of outdoor seating. The room was quiet, spacious and comfortable and the bed excellent, but the bathroom was extremely cramped and average in appearance. There was no other vanity area set up, although there was plenty of room in the suite for one. The decor was tired looking, with scuff marks on the walls, a few stains on the carpet and missing floor trim pieces. It was sufficiently clean. This hotel is used by the British Airways flight attendants and pilots. The staff is friendly (mostly Irish) and well-trained, but always expect a wait at the front desk. The elevator is small and the hallways narrow, which gives it the "boutique" feel. Someone left a glass of pop with several cigarette butts swimming in it on the table in the hallway (gross), and it was never removed by housekeeping during our stay. The pub in the basement is great, with a classy but warm and inviting atmosphere. There are outdoor tables available as well, although it was too hot to enjoy them. We left some clothes behind in a dresser by mistake and had difficulty getting the hotel staff to retrieve them. Eventually they did, but we had to pay the return postage. We had to leave the hotel before 6 am, when the bell staff starts their shift. We almost couldn't get our car out of the valet, and we had to bring the baggage cart upstairs ourselves to get the luggage on our own, because the other front desk person was delivering room bills. Overall these were minor inconveniences, and we would consider staying there again. There's a fantastic "authentic" syle Italian restaurant down the street at St. Clair and Grand called Volare. If you stay at the Fitzpatrick, check it our for lunch or dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Glad to have stayed at the Fitzpatrick”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fitzpatrick Hotel in Chicago and my stay was great!! My husband was on business and I got to shop all day long and I could have not asked for a better location to be in. The hotel is wonderful and I fell in love with the canopied bed and window treatments. I will be sure to put the request in with my husband so that we can come back and visit the next time Chicago calls. I would highly recommend this hotel to all and I can assure you that you will leave with the same great feeling that we both had!!!

Reviews.Title: “A warm Irish Welcome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel takes the concept of a warm Irish welcome to a new level! The hotel is located steps from Michigan avenue and provides a five star, yet personal service to all customers. Having being recommended by two previous visitors I was more than impressed on arrival. I found the staff to be helpful and have a good knowledge of Chicago from restuarants, tourist attractions, stores, outlets etc. The rooms are very spacious and are immaculate. Fitzers bar is typically Irish with a full Irish menu too! I would highly recommend the Fitzpatrick hotel to all types of visitors to Chicago and look forward to visiting it again soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “They should be proud !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was stunned to read the recent review of The Fitzpatrick. My husband and I have been staying there for the last couple of years on a regular basis and just returned from a 2 night stay over Memorial Weekend. The rooms are large, spacious and the beds amazingly comfortable. We have met many Irish staff at the hotel and they are always friendly and courteous (My ancestors came from Ireland and I always enjoy my stay at The Fitzpatrick). Obviously if you want a hotel that's totally Irish then you'll have to go to Ireland. There are lovely Celtic prints in the rooms, a beautiful Irish pub off the lobby and little Irish story books in the nightstands etc. It is these subtle little touches that give the hotel a nice Irish flavor. We also met a few Irish people in Fitzers pub on both Friday and Saturday nights who were visiting Chicago from Ireland. My husband and I love this hotel, as do many of our friends who have stayed there over the past few years. It has a great location and is also good value for money. We will continuue to recommend it whenever we can.

Reviews.Title: “They should be embarassed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a shambles-furniture literally falling apart and a staff that is both rude and uninformed, nevermind the lack of security and the absence of the so-called amenities. The "fitness center" is an oversized closet! We were appalled during our stay! Truly anticipated "warm, Irish hospitality" and short of a barman, no one was Irish, warm or hospitable! Manager was unresponsive to our needs and front desk attendent was incredibly rude when we made a simple request. Her manager (?) refused to come out of the office when she called to ask them to speak with us. Room was pretty at first glance but when dresser drawers fell out and the major construction of the hospital next door began at 7:30am it is not the kind of experience anyone could tolerate. To call this a Red Roof Inn would be an insult to RRI! The manager that finally called us back was soooo fake and insincere that we would have prefered no call at all. The only thing they have going for them is the location but its not worth the trade-off.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: KenCarol
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice size, with a comfortable queen bed. When we got to the room the chain on the toilet tank was broken, so I called the front desk, and the maintenance person showed up within 5 minutes and had it fixed. The hotel staff were very friendly and courteous. The elevators were quick and large, which is a change from some of the older downtown hotels. I'd heard some of the hotels had very small rooms and rude staff for the same price we'd paid, and we heard those complaints from some friends who were in town for a wedding. I stayed at this hotel because of the positive reviews on tripadvisor.com and wasn't disappointed. The Joey Buona's restuarant next door to the hotel has good food and a nice staff. We didn't try the hotel's restaurant, only because there were so many other restaurants in the area. The hotel is 1 block from Michigan Ave. and a 3 block walk to the Hancock Tower, and was safe. If you need WiFi access the service is $13/day from Waypoint, and was very reliable and fast. This hotel is 4 blocks from the Chicago Red Line CTA stop, walk 1 block south from Chicago to Superior, then 3 blocks east. It was a 1 hour from O'Hare to the hotel on the CTA, take the Blue line from O'Hare and change at Washington to the Red line to teh Chicago stop. Spending $1.75 was better than the $35 cab ride between the airport and downtown. I'd highly recommend this hotel for your next downtown stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it is cracked up to be!”
Reviews.Author: Kildimo7
Reviews.Content: Living in an Irish community in Chicago I had big expectations of the Fitzpatrick. I was told and read that there would be "irish hospitality" and a superior hotel. First off when we got there not only did they give us the wrong room, but the door lock was out of order. The food was fair and the appearance was not what I thought it would be. I expected to see Irish or Irish American employees working at the reception desk and throughout the hotel. The only "pale face" that I saw was the bartender, everyone else was a minority. One of the employees told me that there are only 6 or 7 irish workers in the entire hotel for the past 3 years. The accomodations were neutral/average, nothing special. Funny enough, a week later at the St. Pat's Parade in Chicago.....there was the Fitzpatrick Hotel marching in the parade ..... However, the hotel did not have their regular employees doing the marching that day.
