Instead they had irish friends walking in the parde, therefore given the impression that "irish hospitality" is at the hotel. Not having irish employees is not necesarily a big deal, it is just that they appear to mislead their potential customers into something that it is not!!! Some people who may never make it to a real irish hotel in Ireland, may think that the Fitz is the next best thing, IT ISN'T.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at the Fitzpatrick!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a cozy, charming, wonderful hotel. The location cannot be beat ... right off Michigan Avenue and not even 5 minutes walk to Water Tower Place. The winter rates are great, especially if you get a suite. The suite is split-level and huge -- perfect for families. Even the regular rooms are larger than what you'd normally find in a big city. The rooms and all public areas feature a traditional Irish/English decor and are immaculate. Every employee I encountered was extremely friendly. The hotel restaurant offers an outstanding Irish breakfast. There is even a cool Irish pub on the lower level that draws a great crowd almost every night and often features live Irish music. The menu offers a good selection of Irish specialties and the food is superb. There's also a great selection of ales on tap. I highly recommend this hotel and pub!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fitzpatrick”
Reviews.Author: swenfennell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent one night at the Fitzpatrick and were sorry we couldn't have stayed longer. What a wonderful location that is so close to everything in downtown Chicago! We booked off the hotel website and got a fantastic rate of $109 a night. When we checked in and went up to the room we realized we must have been bumped up to a suite - which was lovely and spacious. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved to Fitzpatrick”
Reviews.Author: Shootyc01
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews onTripAdvisor, my husband & I booked one night at the Fitzpatrick. It was a welcoming sight after a long flight from Barcelona Spain. I would categorize this hotel as "boutique". The staff was friendly and welcoming, the room was spacious, clean and updated. The bed was unbelievably comfortable! The hotel is located close to shopping and restaurants. Because of our long flight we decided to eat next door at Joey Buona's Pizza.....a great meal with huge portions. We would like to go back to the Fitzpatrick for a longer stay. If you are looking for comfort, a good location and great accomodations, the Fitzpatrick is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay away”
Reviews.Author: 6tareg
Reviews.Content: I know everyone has their opinions, as it should be but the two recent "bad" reviews had titles that sounded like this place was just horrendous. When you read the summaries they had two complaints: rude staff and stains...two observations that would not make me warn others in capital letters to STAY AWAY. You would think there were rats nesting in the pillows. We had an unbelievable experience here, the suite was a gem and the staff was both accommodating and cheerful. (Loved the cozy pub and the bartender). Three of us stayed there and our hotel experiences combined would rival any world traveler. I, and my companions would without a doubt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Come see for yourself!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot imagine what caused the dismal review posted last week. I have never encountered such a cheerful, pleasant staff as at the Fitzpatrick Hotel! This was my third stay there and, as always, was most enjoyable. The hotel offers world class suites in a welcoming and warm atmosphere. The food in Fitzer's is surprisingly good and the decor is authentic Irish! (and, after a long flight in from the West Coast, the beds are always something to look forward to). I recall the old saying.. "..you can't please all the people all the time" .. This may be true but the Fitzpatrick Chicago Hotel comes very very close!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel...got a suite with king bed. Everything was excellent. We will stay at this hotel from now on. We Loved the Fitzer's Pub downstairs!! Beds were AWESOME! Suites were definitely nice...could tell that the suites were simply 2 rooms put together( with the one separating wall out ) so I could tell that even the regular standard rooms were adequate in size. Anyone that gave this a bad review--I don't get it. I've stayed at numerous luxury hotels and this one did not disappoint. Oh, and I read that one reviewer said there were spiders....no living creatures in our room except us! Wonderful stay! Location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away...!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bugaboophil
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel. Front Desk staff was rude and unhelpful. Our "so-called' suite was nothing special with old non descript furniture and the bathroom was the size of a post stamp. The air conditionning is so old that you either freeze to death or end up in sauna-like conditions. The only good thing about this place is its location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Fitzpatrick's!”
Reviews.Author: Sam1606son
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband treated ourselves to a long-haul shopping trip to Chicago last November 18th for 3 nights. We were very pleased with Fitzpatrick's Hotel, we found the staff to be very friendly, Fitzers bar was lovely with a nice, warm atmosphere and good food. The beds were the most comfortable we've EVER slept in, I normally can't wait to get back to my bed at home after a hotel stay but it was the opposite on this trip! Location wise, it's perfect too. One small criticism - I thought our bedroom carpet could do with either a carpet-shampoo clean or else replaced as it was stained and a little scruffy looking. All in all, a great hotel and if we ever go back to Chicago we'll definitely book Fitzpatrick's again.

Reviews.Title: “Fitz is a beautiful, exceptional hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fitzpatrick Hotel in Chicago for our anniversary last fall, based on the recommendation of some friends who loved it. We are from the Chicago suburbs but wanted a long weekend in the city, and preferred a hotel with a convenient location just a walk away from the restaurants and the shopping. The Fitz gave us excellent, friendly service from a very accomodating staff. Our room was clean, very beautifully decorated and so cozy. The beds were exceptionally comfortable with pillow mattresses, and the general atmosphere was lovely. We loved all the extra touches the Fitz offered, such as the lush robes and even umbrellas, which came in handy one of the days! We also tried the pub for lunch and were served delicious food from a very attentive waiter. We had one of our best hotel stays there and a very memorable weekend. We were very grateful to our friends for suggesting it, and would highly suggest a stay there to anyone who's looking for a wonderful, unique hotel. I know we're planning to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value -- Best location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay in alot of hotels and never become "attached" to any one in particular - until I stayed at the Fitzpatrick. Very welcoming, friendly staff and wonderful rooms! The location is the best hotel value you will find in Chicago! Right of the Mag Mile and within a block of the best shopping in the country! If you want to feel as though you come "home" to your hotel room - stay at the Fitzpatrick!

Reviews.Title: “The fabulous Fitzpatrick”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in central Chicago over the past few years, but from now on it will be The Fitzpatrick every time. Friendly, intimate and amazing rooms (they're huge). From the bellman right through to the bar and dining staff, everyone was courteous, friendly, helpful and polite. I felt that the employees were truly pleased to assist and appreciated my business. Also - the location is absolutely perfect in the heart of Michigan Ave. THANK YOU FITZPATRICKS !!! I"LL BE BACK AGAIN SOON !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fitzpatrick Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While I have always loved traveling to the wonderful city of Chicago, I have never enjoyed a visit more then the past weekend when I had the pleasure of staying at the Fitzpatrick! Though I had never heard of the Fitzpatrick before, I am now convinced this is Chicago's best kept secret.. The staff was wonderful, informative and welcoming. Special thanks to the front door and bell staff for the enthusiastic welcome each time we entered the front doors. I believe they only have about 140 rooms, small and intimate by Chicago standards. And boy, does that become apparent by the personal service you receive from every member of the staff. The rooms are lovely and offer every amenity needed for a weekend visit. (The canopy over our bed made us feel like royalty!) We were disappointed to find out we had arrived a week before the holiday festivites kicked off, better planning next year... We will definatley return to the Fitzpatrick Hotel (and also check out their hotels in New York as well). Bravo to all the staff... Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 3 nights. It was centrally located in downtown Chicago. The staff was warm & friendly. I had a long trip & the front desk made sure my room was ready when I checked it. The price was very affordable for a business person. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Fitzpatrick!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! This was my first time staying at the Fitzpatrick and I loved it! From now on this is my hotel of choice when I travel to Chicago. The staff was warm and welcoming, they went above and beyond in making you feel at home. The rooms were beautiful, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The room was great for someone like me traveling on business and in need of space and amenities. I loved the pub, Fitzers, great food and atmosphere. I highly recommend staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel! wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hootie44
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a long weekend with my sister in law . We were celebrating her birthday in Chicago and picked the Fitzpatrick Hotel because of reviews. We were so thrilled from the moment we set foot in the lobby until we walked into the beautiful cozy room. Whenever we needed anything it arrived in minutes. Joel the doorman, was adorable and it was such a pleasure to arrive back at "home" and be greeted and asked how our day went. The rooms were so comfortable and the beds!!!...the beds were the best I've EVER slept in from any hotel coast to coast! We really felt as if we were a guest in someone's home. Thank you Fitzpatrick. I will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Fitzpatrick is in a perfect location. The staff were friendly and quite helpful. I would stay in this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, big lovely rooms, great location just off Magnificent Mile.”
Reviews.Author: vounez
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in Chicago, fell in Love with this beautiful City. Try the Altwood Cafe in the Loop, lovely Lunch and Decor. The B.L.U.E.S. Club in Halsted N. Live Blues every night, fantastic Place, oldest Bluesclub in the City.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Fitzpatrick was easy to find and the location was very good. The room was nice, clean, comfortable, and the lobby was managed by young Irish kids who were friendly and fun. The location was very close to the walk/riding path along the lakes as well as just a block down the street from the very restaurant we wanted to have dinner at that night! We brought our bikes and wanted to do some riding early on Sunday morning. There was no problem - they got our car up and even helped us get our bikes together and got us some water for the ride. Our stay was pleasant and we'd definitely go back again. However, I'd recommend the breakfast at the outside bar on the lakeside path rather than the breakfast at the hotel, tho the hotel breakfast was fine. We just like being outside better! Our stay was the last weekend in June, 2004.

Reviews.Title: “Fitz is Ok, but some problems.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the Fitz based on the positive reviews I read here. Overall, I was happy with the experience, but there were a few problems. First, the room was nice and generally clean, but, it was loaded with spiders. If you turned on the lights at night, spiders would scurry to hide. Also, the refrigerator did not work. Next, the pool was filthy and was ice-cold. Oh well. Lastly, the valet parkers are thieves. They stole a rader detector and DVD player out of my car. These could have been stolen by no one else. That cost me $500.00. Keep these things in mind when booking your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for your visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Theholidayplanners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fitzpatrick at the end of August after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed. Only drawback was the intial room we were allocated on the top floor was subject to a loud droning noise coming from somewhere, we stayed there for one night and asked for a move which was arranged without problems. The room was clean and the bed very comfy. The hotel also provided an emergency razor, toothbrush etc until a missing case was delivered. The bar area was pleasant and all the staff took an interest in doing a good job from the Reception staff to the bell boy and breakfast supervisor. The location is excellent, we were able to travel by CTA train and bus from the airport and found the hotel quite easily, the visitor pass for the public transport is well worth buying, you get to travel around with the locals and see the real Chicago. We found the Fitzpatrick to be a great base to visit the city. (A recommendatin if you are visiting the city do take a trip to Howl at the Moon one night, great musical entertainment). If we went back to Chicago we would stay at the Fitzpatrick again.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we expected”
Reviews.Author: mhigbeem
Reviews.Content: We also chose to stay at the Fitzpatrick Chicago Hotel because of good reviews on tripadvisor.com. At such an expensive rate, we really expected a top-notch hotel. I booked the room directly through the Fitzpatrick and specifically requested an early check-in at 1pm. We arrived at 11am and were told there wouldn't be a room available until 3pm. Suggestion: don't offer early check-in if you can't supply it. They allow Brittish Airways Crews rooms before paying customers. Our room wasn't dirty, as some other reviews have stated. The bed appeared nice until we tried to sleep that night. In a 4 1/2 star hotel, you expect fitted sheets on the mattress - no such luck at the Fitzpatrick. For sleeping, you have a sheet and a flimsy blanket. If you want a quiet room, don't stay here. We heard doors slamming through all hours of the night, along with sirens from the street 27 floors below us. The pool was cold and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in 5 years. We returned to our room the second day after housekeeping had been there to find our remote control was gone, as was our Robe. The robe is provided for your stay, however, if you take it, they charge you $75! I mentioned it when we checked out, and was told that we wouldn't be charged for it, but I won't be surprised if we are. Overall: it was too expensive. We probably could have had a more enjoyable stay at a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ironic -- as I went online to post this, I read the 8.26 review by a Seattle guest. My sister and I had much the same experience last week. After extensive online research of Chicago hotels, we chose the Fitzpatrick based on the very positive TripAdvisor comments. I have no idea how this place receives a 4-star rating. The carpeting was dirty and stained, as were the bedspreads and bedskirts. The closet door and nightstand were missing handles. The toilet did not flush properly ... the pool was small and dirty. As I checked under the bed to be sure we weren't leaving anything, I noticed the metal bed frame was broken. And the list goes on and on ... I have stayed at many hotels and would expect some of this at a less expensive place, but certainly not from such a highly rated place. We had our children with us and we so wanted to look forward to a nice room in the evenings, but as we stood in the rain at Navy Pier we didn't look forward to returning to the Fitzpatrick. As we passed other hotels we would say 'we could have been there'. Sad that it had such a negative affect on our vacation. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fitzpatrick as a result of all of the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor and to avoid the normal corporate hotel. Good location but the room was dirty, and not just from the last housekeeping. It was dingy: a place where you needed the slippers they provided. And this was a suite. Also, the refrigerator was caked with ice and didn't work. Furthermore, because my travel agent had mixed up the dates I was to travel, I showed up a day late. The hotel said it wasn't a problem and that I wouldn't be charged for the no-show the night before. I had my travel desk verify this with the hotel management the same day. Then the Fitzpatrick charged me for both nights and refused to reverse the charges after many attempts to resolve. Neither I nor my corporate travel desk will use the Fitzpatrick again. Two dots only because it's in a good location and because the lobby was clean. I'm generally easy to please and slow to complain but this was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted to return the favor because we selected the Fitzpatrick based on the other reviews we read on this site. I'm happy to say that our expectations were met. Great bed, very clean, great location. (The small rooftop pool wasn't very inviting so don't base your choice to stay here for the pool.) I wanted to add that we had drinks and a pizza next door on the Joey B's roof and that even added to our pleasant experience here. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at the Fitzpatrick last week and from start to finish we had an absolutely wonderful time. Chicago is a fabulous city and the Fitzpatrick was an excellent choice for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy bed”
Reviews.Author: garratys
Reviews.Content: The most fantastic mattress I have ever slept upon. Did not want to get up - ever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our four days at the Fitzpatrick were so nice. The pillowtop mattress was as comfortable as ours at home. The bathroom was a good size. The best part was the location. The hotel is just a block off of the Magnificient Mile with free trolleys stopping right down the street. The Hancock tower and the Visitor's Center are also within just a few blocks. We spent one evening watching the stars come out on the roof by the pool. I can't wait to go back. Everyone working for the hotel was friendly and helpful. This hotel was a great value for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Top Rating Well Deserved for the Fitz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor and contributors, we had a wonderful Chicago stay in July 2004 at the Fitzpatrick. Other reviews were correct, so I won't reiterate the extensive praise. We'd dispute the "cramped bathroom" complaint: it's not palatial, but certainly big enough and nicely appointed. A king suite on the 20th floor was so quiet we thought we were the only guests in the hotel. Our north-facing (back side) window revealed the upper 2/3 of the John Hancock building 3 blocks away, plus a glimpse of the lake 2 blocks east. In-room coffee service is typical; small fridge chilled our refreshments nicely. Fitzpatrick's value seems far better than other 4-star downtown hotels: $169 from Travelocity, and the hotel declined to charge the $30 per additional person for our teenagers (it would still be a bargain). We liked breakfast at the Water Tower Center (2nd floor food court) two blocks north: full hot selection, fresh sticky buns in the pan, greatest strawberries, about $6 each, quick-easy-good. The Fitz is closer to the lake shore than any hotel we saw. Reach the boardwalk (across Lake Shore Drive) via pedestrian underpass near Chicago St. (1 block north). Navy Pier, and the next underpass, is a 15 minute walk south, passing a little beach. You can get a 24-hour CTA pass for $5, covering buses and trains (2-3 blocks from the hotel), even the blue line from O'Hare. CTA service is great, except for #10 bus to Museum of Science and Industry, which has limited service (20-30 minutes between buses).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dusker
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Fitzpatrick in early June 2004 for my birthday-great hotel! Location provides easy walking to Navy Pier, Marshall Field, Michigan Avenue & John Hancock. Room seemed spacious even though its only about 300 sq ft. Lots of room in bathroom; comfortable bed; very quiet, upscale hotel. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 very enjoyable days staying at this super hotel, in a great location in the heart of wonderful Chicago. Our suite was attractive, spacious and very comfortable - with views of the John Hancock Tower - just a couple of blocks away. My husband particularly appreciated the twin TVs! The staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. My only minor ciriticism is that the electric wiring needs looking at. Half the lamps in our room did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Well satisfied with the Fitzpatrick”
Reviews.Author: Le_Dap
Reviews.Content: The Fitzpatrick is a very good hotel in a very good location. It deserves most of the accolades showered upon it by other reviewers. We stayed for five nights with friends in two one-bedroom suites on the eighth floor. We were slightly disappointed with our room compared to theirs. Ours was at the back of the hotel looking onto some quite noisy extractor fans and the carpet was somewhat soiled in places. The remote keyboard for internet access didn't work because the batteries were flat and the CD player wouldn't function. In contrast, our friends had a better view from the front of the hotel, more sensibly placed furniture and cleaner carpets. On the plus side, our bed was one of the most comfortable we have slept in, reception staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet was excellent, Fitzers pub in the basement was comfortable and served tasty pub grub, and the location near the John Hancock building would be difficult to beat (dinner on the 95th floor of the Hancock was excellent but pricey and nearby Spiaggia served the best G&Ts of our US tour). We loved Chicago and would certainly return to the Fitzpatrick if and when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “If Only All Hotels Were Like This !”
Reviews.Author: shark3132
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at a Suite in the Fitzpatrick for one week at the start of May. From the moment we arrived in the foyer of the Hotel we knew we had made the right choice. (Based on research through trip advisor). The Suite itself had "wow" factor,the minute you opened the door. It was clean, fresh, quiet, well appointed and spacious beyond our expectations. We even had a direct view of the Hancock building and a bit of lake Michigan. The staff were genuinely friendly,helpful and attentive and any faults(very minor) were dealt with immediately and without quibble. Breakfast at the hotel was plentiful and good value. The location was perfect for us,near the water tower and at the top end of Michigan Avenue where you could wander around quite safely night and day. My wife and I are experienced travellers and travel regularly to North America where we consider the hotels to be far superior to those in the U.K - But without a doubt this is the best we've stayed In and only wish it were the benchmark for all hotels. My only regret !, I didn't take home the complementary bath robe and slippers you find in the room when you arrive? On the day we left May 7th,the roof top pool was being prepared for its grand summer opening.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Convenient, Regal, E”
Reviews.Author: robhafer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fitzpatrick Chicago Hotel over Easter weekend and had a terrific time. My wife and I are very demanding consumers and this was one of our best hotel experiences yet. We paid $109/nt plus taxes through Travelocity for room 1502 (the smallest room type).Here's what we liked: - Room design (unique layout with steps leading to the bed area, great intimate lighting) - Location (near the midpoint of the Magnificent Mile - the premium Chicago shopping district with a good italian restaurant and Benihana's downstairs) - Room view (all the rooms on the south side face down N St. Clair St, giving you a view 6 blocks long) - Full breakfast offered pancackes, sausages, scrambled eggs, muffins, danish, bacon, fresh fruit, cereals, coffee/tea, OJ, bagels, yogurt in a civilized dining room for $9.95/person (for cheaper options go to the McD's at the Chicago Place food court at the corner) - Other great things; staff, furnishings, window/bed treatments, bed linens, 3 internet jacks plus free MSNBC access via the LodgeNet TV, and a mini fridge that you can actually use.Slight room for improvement: - Bed was a little soft for my back (they use thick pillow-top mattresses, maybe I'm not used to this) - TV was a little small (19"?) - No Vending machines (go to the bar downstairs or around the corner to Walgreens) - Valet parking is $32/day with in/out privs (you can self-park for less at 3 places on Chicago Ave for $20-26/day)FYI...Chicago tourist highlights: - The Chicago Architectural Foundation walking tours (http://www.architecture.org/) - The Hancock Observatory (94th floor, definitely splurge for the audio tour, for a cheaper experience order a drink at the lounge on 96) - The Marshall Fields flagship store (an amazing renovation, you could spend a whole day here, free audio tours)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Central Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Wideeyedandlegless
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and have never failed to be anything but delighted. Great Bar (draught Stella and Guinness) which was being upgraded at the end of March when I was last there, good food, lovely staff, large clean rooms, comfortable beds, spot on location for the Golden Mile, Joey's Pizzas next door are fantastic. Ignore any bad reviews you read about this hotel as the authors must either have been very unlucky or impossible to please. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Didn't go wrong with Fitzpatrick”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fitzpatrick in August 2003 when we took my 11 y/o daughter for a weekend at American Girl Place. We were very pleased upon registration to find the lobby full of airline pilots and stewards checking in for their lay over stays. Always a good sign you picked the right place. We loved it!! Great location for magnificent mile shopping and close walking distance to American Girl Place. Clean, friendly staff, and great beds. Will definately stay here again. PS: the itallian restaurant next door was very good with generous portions. Area felt safe for a woman and child.

Reviews.Title: “great bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the room.The sunken living room and separate bedroom made for a spacious feel,but the mattress was the best one we had slept on anywhere, ever!! I can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal for a Great Stay!! I LOVE the Fitz~”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just adore this hotel! It's like a second home to me, and since my first stay, I am frankly afraid to book with another hotel downtown. The service, the suites (I have only stayed in suites), and the extras.. such as the cd player,robes... were all great. It's the only hotel I know of that has not only a reasonably-priced, but also delicious room service menu, as well as the menus in the restaurants... including a good breakfast buffet. The only complaints I have ever had are... 1) A very small wading pool, 2) Ice delivery verses machines on every floor, and 3) small bathrooms in the suites. Although there could be improvements, I suspect that these lesser features add up to the great price. If you look, the Fitz has the largest, most elegantly understated, comfortable, and fair priced suites on Michigan Ave. I know I will never stay elsewhere in downtown Chicago. Thanks, Fitz!

Reviews.Title: “Discovered the real Chicago”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attend numerous seminars together. Without a doubt, the Fitzpatrick has been our most enjoyable trip yet. Being able to walk out the door, and sample all the great sights, and food in the area is a real treat. We will be back soon !!!

Reviews.Title: “When Irish Eyes are Smiling”
Reviews.Author: PST77
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) have stayed in a couple of different hotels in Chicago on our three trips there. Most recently we spent 4 nights in the Chicago Fitzpatrick in July 2003. The room was enormous, very comfortable, very clean and the air conditioning worked! The room was actually a small suite with a fridge and wet bar, two TV's, a CD player, trouser press, bathrobes and even an umbrella. The bathroom was really nicely appointed and spotless. Position of the hotel is in our opinion perfect for a tourist visiting Chicago and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. We booked through Expedia which worked perfectly, but the same rates were also available through their own website fitzpatrickhotels.com. Our flight to Chicago was delayed by storms and by the time we arrived at the hotel we were tired, hungry and fed up. To find such a beautiful suite waiting for us and to be welcomed by such pleasant reception staff was just what we needed. We love Chicago, will definitely be back and will definitely be staying at the Fitzpatrick.
